text: Apple's new credit card will begin a preview roll out today and will become available to all iPhone owners in the US later this month. A random selection of people who have signed up for the Apple Card will be notified today, and they will be able to apply for the card. The Apple Card will offer a number of benefits including 2 percent cash back on all purchases made with Apple Pay, 3 percent cash back on purchases from Apple and select other retailers, no fees, low interest rates, and access to Apple's customer service team. It will also feature virtual and physical titanium cards that can be used anywhere Mastercard is accepted. Additionally, customers will be able to view their spending activity, receive personalized recommendations, manage their payments, and more through the Apple Wallet app.

Project Lightspeed is a fully self-contained live streaming server. It allows you to deploy your own sub-second latency live streaming platform. The repository contains instructions for installing and deploying the Lightspeed server, as well as how to connect your live streaming applications.

Open source code has been essential for China's rapidly growing tech sector. GitHub has been a large part of this growth, but its future in China is uncertain. Many fear that China may clamp down on the platform and restrict access, as it has done with other tech platforms such as Google and Facebook. However, there is a growing movement in China to embrace open source code and promote collaboration between developers. Many Chinese companies are investing in open source projects and encouraging their employees to contribute to them. This has made GitHub a powerful tool for collaboration and learning in China, and its future remains uncertain but promising.

Ant Group's world record-setting initial public offering has been suspended. Its controller, executive chairman, and CEO were summoned and interviewed by regulators in China. The company later reported significant issues with its corporate governance and financial disclosure.

A Tesla Model S owner is suing the company because his Tesla crashed into a Ford Fiesta in the next lane "suddenly, and without any warning" at 80mph when he was driving in autopilot mode. This case is currently under investigation, and no ruling has been made as of yet. However, this potential legal action raises important questions about the safety of Tesla's Autopilot system and whether it can be trusted to safely operate a vehicle at high speeds. As this case moves forward, we may see more information about the specifics of the incident and how exactly the Autopilot failed in this situation. It is also possible that this could lead to further scrutiny of Tesla's Autopilot system and potentially new regulations to ensure its safe operation.

Xiaomi has launched a pair of smart glasses. The Xiaomi Smart Glasses weigh 51 grams and feature a MicroLED display built into the right lenses, a 5-megapixel camera, a quad-core processor, 1GB of RAM and 8GB of storage. The glasses are powered by a 520mAh battery that is said to last up to 5 hours on a single charge. The Xiaomi Smart Glasses also have Bluetooth connectivity and can be paired with a smartphone for better control and features. Additionally, the glasses come with facial recognition and voice recognition technology.

Many dog breeds are about appearance, but plenty of others are devoted to specific tasks. A team of US-based researchers conducted a study on around 18,000 dogs to study dog breeds. The list of dog breeds studied by the research team include: Labrador Retriever German Shepherd Golden Retriever Beagle Bulldog Rottweiler Chihuahua Boxer Poodle Bloodhound Yorkshire Terrier French Bulldog Australian Shepherd Shih Tzu Dachshund Pug Siberian Husky Great Dane Cocker Spaniel

SpaceX has posted a job for a'Resort Development Manager' to be based out of Brownsville, a town near its Boca Chica test and development site. The company is looking to hire a manager to lead the development and programming of an adjacent resort. The successful candidate will be responsible for overseeing all aspects of the resort project, including working with local, state and federal agencies, researching and executing land acquisition opportunities, managing design and construction teams, managing budgets, and leading marketing initiatives.

A Bay Area-based startup called Perfect Day has created a lab-grown ice cream that uses whey protein from genetically modified yeast. While there are plenty of dairy-free ice cream alternatives on the market, Perfect Day's product is unique in that it has the same taste and texture of traditional ice cream but is made without any animal products. The company is working on creating a variety of flavors and hopes to make their ice cream available to consumers sometime in 2020. Perfect Day's scientific breakthrough could revolutionize the ice cream industry. By leveraging genetic engineering, they have been able to create a product that is both vegan and tastes like traditional ice cream. This could be a game changer for those who are vegan or lactose intolerant, as well as those who are looking for healthier options without sacrificing flavor. Not only is this product more environmentally friendly than other dairy-based alternatives, but it also offers the potential to reduce the suffering of animals used in traditional dairy farming.

GW Ori is a star system 1,300 light years away from Earth. It has three stars and is surrounded by a massive disk of dust and gas. The disk is believed to be the birthplace of planets. The stars in the system are a white dwarf, an orange dwarf and a red dwarf. The white dwarf is the most massive star and has a mass of 0.6 solar masses. The orange dwarf has a mass of 0.3 solar masses and the red dwarf has a mass of 0.1 solar masses. The disk has been studied by astronomers using the Hubble Space Telescope and other ground-based telescopes. Studies have shown that there are numerous small dust particles and gas clumps within the disk which could be the precursors to forming planets. The system is also known for producing spectacular light shows due to the interaction of the stars and their respective accretion disks.

A team of scientists launched a box containing four types of bacteria and fungus into the stratosphere to expose them to several hours of Mars-like conditions. The experiment found that the bacteria and fungus that were exposed to the extreme environment of the stratosphere were able to survive. The scientists concluded that these organisms could potentially survive on Mars in similar conditions.

Playwright is a Node library that automates Chromium, Firefox, and Webkit. It enables cross-browser web automation that is ever-green, capable, reliable, and fast. Playwright is supported on all platforms. Playwright is designed to make automating web browsers easier and more reliable. It works with both modern and legacy browsers, including Chromium-based browsers such as Google Chrome and Microsoft Edge, Firefox, and WebKit-based browsers such as Safari. Playwright provides an API that lets developers write scripts to automate browser activities, such as navigating to a website, filling out forms, clicking links, taking screenshots, and more. Playwright also offers features like automatic waiting for page loads, auto-scrolling, and automatic viewport resizing.

zx allows you to write Bash scripts using JavaScript. It provides wrappers around childprocess, escapes arguments, and gives sensible defaults. zx can import from other scripts, pass environment variables, and more.

Uniqlo cut 90 of the workforce in one of its Tokyo warehouses, and replaced them with robots. Now the warehouse operates 24 hours a day. Robots are able to unload , sort and scan items with greater accuracy and efficiency than humans. Uniqlo has also reduced the amount of time it takes to get products to customers, leading to improved customer satisfaction.

Democratic candidate Andrew Yang plans to use a 3D hologram in his campaign for the presidency. The use of technology will highlight his message that times have changed and that the economy needs to be modernized and kept up with the times. He also plans to use his hologram to interact with potential supporters and voters in a more personal and engaging way.

NYC Mesh is a group run entirely by volunteers to provide affordable and reliable internet to residents in New York City. Customers can pay whatever they like for the service, and connect to a high-speed wireless network. The group helps residents set up their own networks by providing educational resources, equipment and technical support. NYC Mesh also offers a shared bandwidth model so that all users of the network can access reliable, fast speeds. To ensure quality, the group tests all equipment before it is installed and monitors the performance of its networks.

The Mission Extension Vehicle-2 (MEV-2) recently latched onto an old communications satellite while in orbit. The mission is Northrop Grumman's second successful docking of an object in space. MEV-2 launched on October 29th, 2020 and docked with a satellite called Intelsat 10-02 on January 27th, 2021. The MEV-2 is designed to extend the life of aging satellites by providing them with additional fuel, power, and maneuvering capabilities. This will help to keep these satellites operational for longer than they otherwise would have been. Additionally, it may provide cost savings to satellite operators who would otherwise need to launch a new satellite to replace an aging one. The MEV-2 is part of a larger mission called Mission Extension Services which will eventually include more vehicles like MEV-1 and MEV-3. The goal of this program is to extend the lives of satellites beyond their original design lifetime.

Dev Tips is sort of a cool novelty newsletter for programmers, it gives a developer tip once a week in the form of a gif. Usually they're pretty short handy tips, and it's a fun way to stay in the loop with the latest tech and trends.

This site hosts an interactive in-browser neural network. Users can tweak the individual components of the neural network to visualize how it works. The interactive neural network includes a visual representation of neurons, weights, and a data set. It also provides an interactive dashboard that allows users to adjust the neurons, weights, and data set. The dashboard also provides metrics such as accuracy, loss, and other parameters. Users can then use these metrics to debug their neural networks. In addition, this site provides educational resources such as tutorials, articles, and videos about neural networks. These resources help users gain a better understanding of neural networks and how to create more efficient models.

When animations in CSS conflict, only one of them will occur. The Web Animations API allows developers to mix up animation behavior using the composite option. This article discusses how to use the composite option to ensure that all animations run smoothly.

A bug in Tesla's Autopilot driving program would sometimes pull cars towards lane dividers in specific spots on a Reddit user's commute. Despite reporting the issue to Tesla many times, no action was taken. Tesla should take the appropriate measures to investigate and fix this bug as soon as possible, as it poses a serious safety hazard to drivers. The company should also contact the Reddit user and any other customers who have reported similar incidents to ensure they are aware of the issue and can take proper precautions while driving. Additionally, Tesla should implement a better system for reporting such bugs so that they are addressed in a timely manner.

This site provides a library of fonts for coding. It has a live preview for all fonts with code samples. Users can change themes and language for the preview, and can download the fonts for use in their own projects. The library is also searchable, allowing users to quickly find the font they are looking for. The site also offers tutorials and resources for using fonts in coding projects.

Scientists have been prohibited from keeping human embryos alive in their labs for more than 14 days for the last few decades to avoid ethical issues that might be raised . This has been a standard set by the National Institutes of Health (NIH). All NIH-funded research involving human embryos must adhere to this policy and not allow any embryos to survive beyond 14 days. Additionally, NIH researchers are prohibited from introducing any genetic modifications into fertilized human eggs or embryos that would be passed down to future generations.

This is a free course provided by fast.ai, taught by Jeremy Howard (Kaggle's 1 competitor 2 years running). The goal is to provide a crash course in machine learning for coders, so that you can quickly get up to speed and start making your own projects. The course covers topics such as supervised learning, unsupervised learning, deep learning and reinforcement learning. It also includes lessons on practical applications, such as object detection and natural language processing. You will learn how to build models using Python and the Keras library, as well as how to use popular open-source datasets. Along the way, you'll gain insight into best practices for model development, deployment and management. Upon completion of this course, you should be able to confidently apply machine learning techniques to solve real-world problems.

Grafana Mimir provides long-term storage for Prometheus, a systems and service monitoring system. It features massive scalability, a global view of metrics, cheap and durable metric storage, high availability, and more. By storing metrics in Mimir, users can take advantage of various data analysis and visualization tools such as Grafana to monitor their systems. Grafana is a powerful open source analytics platform used to visualize and analyze data from various sources. It enables users to quickly create meaningful dashboards that can be shared across team members or with the public. Grafana also provides an API for automating dashboard creation and management.

Amazon has recently come under fire as it was discovered that it previously allowed vendors the ability to bid for an Amazon's Choice badge by lowering prices and spending more on advertising, although Amazon has since banned this practice.[185] Amazon has recently come under fire for allowing vendors to bid for an Amazon's Choice badge by lowering prices and spending more on advertising. This practice was discovered and then subsequently banned by Amazon in response to the criticism it received. The move marked a major shift in Amazon's policy of allowing vendors to manipulate its algorithms. However, some argue that banning this practice may lead to higher costs for consumers as companies look for alternative ways to compete.

Apple is planning on spending over 1 billion on video content this year for its upcoming video streaming service. They currently have 24 shows in production and development. This content is expected to be available when the service launches in 2019, and will include a mix of original content and third-party partnerships. Apple's goal with their video streaming service is to provide a unique viewing experience that can compete with other platforms such as Netflix and Hulu.

Increasing your rate as a developer will not only make you happier, you'll also produce better work. This document contains a high-level outline of a book on how to improve your rate as a developer. Table of Contents 1. Introduction .............................................................................................................................................. 2 2. Understanding the Value You Bring to the Table ............................................................................. 3 3. Building Your Network and Reputation ............................................................................................. 6 4. Negotiating Your Rate ......................................................................................................................... 9 5. Strategies for Increasing Your Rates ............................................................................................... 12 6. Conclusion ........................................................................................................................................... 15 7. Resources ............................................................................................................................................ 16 Introduction Are you a developer looking to increase your hourly rate? Are you unsure of your value in the market and how to put a price on it? This book will help you understand the value of your skills and services, build your network and reputation, and learn how to negotiate and increase your rate. With the advice in this book, you'll be able to get the rates you deserve and find greater job satisfaction. Understanding the Value You Bring to the Table The first step to increasing your rate is understanding the value that you bring to the table. In this section, we'll discuss how to identify your unique skillset and how to price those skills accordingly. We'll also explore how to use market research to determine the going rate for developers in your area. Building Your Network and Reputation The next step to increasing your rate is building your network and reputation. In this section, we'll discuss strategies for networking, such as attending conferences, joining online communities, and leveraging social media. We'll also cover how to use your existing projects and experience to demonstrate your value to prospective employers. Negotiating Your Rate Once you have an understanding of the value of your services and a robust network of contacts, it's time to start negotiating your rate. In this section, we'll discuss how to prepare for salary negotiations and effective communication strategies to maximize your success. We'll also review common negotiation tactics to help you stand firm and get the best possible deal. Strategies for Increasing Your Rates In this section, we'll go over several strategies for increasing your rate. We'll look at how to differentiate yourself in the marketplace, how to raise your rates without alienating clients, and how to leverage promotions and bonuses to boost your income. Conclusion By following the advice in this book, you should have a better understanding of your value in the market and how to increase your rate accordingly. You'll also have a greater appreciation for the power of networking and the importance of having a plan when negotiating your rate. Resources This section will provide additional resources for further exploration. We'll cover books, websites, and other sources related to developing your skills, increasing your rate, and improving your overall career.

Google Cloud Print will be shutting down at the end of 2020. It launched in 2010 as a way to make printers more accessible for Chrome OS, but Google believes that it has lost its usefulness with the development of cloud-based printing solutions. Google recommends that Cloud Print users switch to a third-party solution such as PrinterLogic or PaperCut. Google will continue to support Cloud Print until its shutdown date.

Google is close to finalizing a deal to buy or lease a 1.3 million square foot office building in the West Village. The space is large enough to allow Google to expand its New York City workforce by more than 7,000 people. Google has not officially confirmed the deal, but sources close to the company say it is likely to close soon. The building, located at 111 Eighth Avenue, is currently owned by Tishman Speyer, an American real estate firm. Google has reportedly been in negotiations with Tishman since last summer. If the deal goes through, it would be one of the largest property transactions in New York history. The space could potentially house up to 14,000 Googlers and allow for further expansion in the future. It would also give Google a foothold in the West Village, a rapidly developing neighborhood that is home to several tech companies such as Square and Etsy. The potential deal has been met with some opposition from local residents and politicians who are concerned about the influx of tech workers, traffic, and overcrowding. Google has responded to these concerns by pledging to work with the community on initiatives to help ease congestion and improve local infrastructure. Google's potential purchase or lease of the 111 Eighth Avenue building would be a major step forward in the company's plans to expand its presence in New York City. It would give them an enormous amount of office space in a desirable location and help them accommodate their growing workforce.

Apple announced new developer tools at WWDC this week, including Object Capture, Xcode Cloud, in-app events and custom pages, and updates to Swift. Object Capture allows developers to create 3D objects by capturing real-world objects and uploading them to Xcode. Xcode Cloud enables developers to build, test, and deploy their apps in the cloud. In-app events and custom pages allow developers to create custom experiences for users within their apps. Lastly, updates to Swift allow developers to write more expressive code and take advantage of new features like string interpolation, property wrappers, and module stability.

Microsoft's Edge for Mac is now officially supported and is available for preview by Mac users. Mac keyboard shortcuts will be supported, and users will be able to switch tabs and access the settings menu with ease. Microsoft Edge for Mac also supports extensions, allowing users to customize their browsing experience. Microsoft Edge for Mac is available on the Mac App Store. To install it, users just need to search for "Edge" in the App Store or follow the link provided by Microsoft. Once installed, users can sign in with their Microsoft account and sync their data across devices. The browser will be regularly updated with new features and security updates.

Distrobox creates fully mutable containers in environments where the file system is immutable or where the user doesn't have privileges to modify the host. Distrobox can be used to run tools like Ansible, Puppet, Chef, etc. It also allows for creating micro-services and applications in a secure and isolated environment.

TLDR is partnering with Portal to help you on your next job search!Just upload your resume and get connected to companies like Stripe, Discord, Coinbase, and more. If a recruiter likes your profile and skills, you'll get an invitation to apply! Get started now and start your job search with TLDR and Portal.

Ahrefs, a company that crawls more than 8 billion web pages every 24 hours for its SEO toolset, has invested 60 million into building its own search engine called Yep. Yep is an AI-powered search engine that uses natural language processing (NLP) technology to help users find relevant information quickly and accurately. It has a sophisticated algorithm that understands the context of queries better than traditional search engines and can provide more accurate results. The company claims that Yep can answer questions faster than Google and other search engines. In addition, it has tools to detect fake news and malicious content. Ahrefs created Yep to provide its customers with an integrated solution for website optimization, marketing, and research. With the help of Yep, Ahrefs users can easily search for topics related to their industry, track competitors' activity, and discover new opportunities. Ahrefs also plans to make Yep available to the public in the near future, which will give people an alternative to using traditional search engines. The company hopes that Yep will eventually become a major player in the search engine market, providing a better experience for users around the world.

Ethermint is a Proof-of-Stake blockchain that is fully compatible and interoperable with Ethereum. It features Web3 and EVM compatibility, high throughput via Tendermint Core, horizontal scalability through IBC, and fast finality. It is designed to enable the development of highly-scalable, secure and cost-effective blockchain applications.

Overstock CEO Patrick Byrne has resigned from the company as of August 22. Shares rose 17 percent after the news was released, finishing up at 8.3 percent at the end of the day. Byrne issued a statement saying he was resigning to "dedicate his energies to other interests" and that he had "no plans other than to retire and spend more time with family." He also said he was grateful for the opportunity to lead Overstock and thanked the company's employees, customers, and shareholders. Overstock CFO Greg Iverson has been appointed as interim CEO.

Facebook and Snopes had been in talks to work together to create a fact-checking program for the Facebook platform, but Snopes has decided to cancel the partnership. The team decided that while they had initially been interested in the project, they ultimately felt their resources would be better utilized elsewhere. The decision was made after careful consideration of all options and potential outcomes. Snopes' decision to cancel its partnership with Facebook was likely motivated by a number of factors. First, Snopes may have felt that its resources were being spread too thin, and that it would be more effective for them to focus on their own platforms and initiatives. Additionally, Snopes may have also been concerned about potential conflicts of interest arising from working with a platform as large and influential as Facebook. Finally, there may have also been concerns surrounding the privacy and security of user data shared between the two companies.

Amazon revealed its latest delivery drone design at the re:MARS conference. The drone is about the size of a go-cart, can fly up to 15 miles, and deliver packages up to five pounds. The drone has multiple rotors and is powered by batteries for a quiet flight. It also has sensors that can detect obstacles in the air or on the ground, allowing it to avoid collisions. Amazon's new delivery drone is part of their plan to expand their delivery capabilities and make package delivery faster and more efficient. The drone is designed to fly autonomously, meaning it can fly without a person controlling it. It is equipped with advanced navigation technology that allows it to choose the best route to its destination, while avoiding any obstacles along the way. Amazon has said that they are planning to launch the drone in select markets later this year.

Kevin Systrom and Mike Krieger, the cofounders of Instagram, have resigned and plan to leave the company. No reason is given in the article, but it is noted that Jan Koum and Mark Zuckerberg, Facebook's CEO, have been supportive of the decision. It is speculated that the two founders wanted more independence from parent company Facebook, and were seeking to reclaim some of their autonomy over Instagram.

This article follows the story of Amazon as it developed from a bookseller into a company that sells everything. It describes Amazon's design process and how Jeff Bezos' decisions affects the company's overall success. The article also looks at Amazon's competitive advantages, its customer service and delivery options, and some of the criticisms that have been leveled against it. Additionally, it discusses how Amazon is responding to these criticisms and how it is expanding into new markets.

Uber has launched Uber Direct and Uber Connect, two trial programs to help people get groceries, medications, and basic supplies. Direct brings items from stores to people's homes, while Connect lets people send items to family and friends. Uber has said it will be working with local retailers to expand its offerings in the near future.

Metamaterials are materials made up of components that combine to create properties that are relatively independent of the properties of the original materials. Metasurfaces are flat structures that can manipulate the properties of light waves, such as polarization, phase, and amplitude. Metamaterials are used in various applications, from telecommunications to medical imaging. They can also be used to create invisibility cloaks, acoustic levitation, and other optical devices.

Software developers have discovered references to a new Apple operating system, realityOS, in App Store upload logs and GitHub repositories. Apple has been known to be working on a mixed reality platform, so it's likely that realityOS is the new operating system. The references found in App Store upload logs and GitHub repositories are likely part of a larger effort from Apple to create their new realityOS. It is likely that Apple has been working on this operating system for some time now, and the references indicate that it is well into the development process. While there is no official word from Apple about realityOS, the evidence suggests that it is in the works and could be released soon.
