StyleGAN2 is a style-based GAN architecture for data-driven unconditional generative image modeling. It improves on image quality, and it also makes it possible to reliably detect if an image is generated or not. StyleGAN2 is a progressive growing GAN (PG-GAN) architecture, which means that the generator and discriminator networks are trained incrementally by adding new layers in each training stage. It also uses a multi-scale structure, where the generator progressively increases its resolution output. This allows for better control over the generation process and results in higher quality images. StyleGAN2 improves on image quality by introducing an adaptive instance normalization (AdaIN) layer, which can be used to inject style information into the generated images. The AdaIN layer is able to take existing features from the training data set and apply them to the generated image, making it more realistic. Additionally, StyleGAN2 uses a noise mixing layer which takes two inputs - one from a fixed noise vector and the other from a variable noise vector - and combines the two to create a more diverse set of images. StyleGAN2 also introduces a feature known as a "class embedding," which enables the model to learn a representation of the data set that can be used to detect if an image is real or fake. This helps to improve the reliability of the generative models.

Virgin appears to have changed its mind on how it plans to build its Hyperloop since its tests at the end of last year. The company recently released new designs for its Hyperloop pods, and it appears that they will now be built out of aluminum instead of steel. The new design is also much sleeker than the bulky steel model. The company has also said that the pods will have onboard batteries to power them, and that they will be able to travel at speeds of up to 670 mph. The redesigned pods are expected to be ready for testing by the end of 2020.

An egg fossil was discovered in Antarctica in 2011. It was 11 inches long and 7 inches wide. Researchers have determined that the egg came from a massive aquatic reptile, possibly a mosasaur, that lived in the oceans of Antarctica during the Cretaceous period. The egg is the first of its kind to have been found in Antarctica, and it is believed to be over 70 million years old.

Uber has launched a new option that allows passengers to communicate their preferences to drivers before they are picked up. Uber Comfort costs around 20 to 40 percent more than a regular UberX ride, and it allows riders to select their preferred temperature, music, and seating arrangements. Riders can also leave notes for the driver about any other specific requests they may have. This feature is available in most major cities in the US.

Uber is allowing its customers to see what ratings they have received from drivers. Customers will be able to see their ratings in the app's new privacy menu. Uber uses a 1-5 star rating system for customers and drivers, with 1 being the lowest and 5 being the highest. Customers will be able to view their average rating from all of their trips. Uber has also said that it will not allow drivers to see customer ratings in order to protect customer privacy.

Falcon is a free, open-source SQL editor with inline data visualization. It works without an internet connection. Falcon supports connecting to RedShift, MySQL, PostgreSQL, IBM DB2, Impala, MS SQL, Oracle, and Apache Hive. It is available for both Mac and PC. Falcon provides a visual environment to explore data, as well as an editor to compose SQL queries. The visual environment helps users quickly understand the structure of their tables and relationships between them. Data can be viewed in a variety of formats including tables, charts, and maps. Falcon also allows users to save queries, share them with others, and export the results of their queries into CSV, HTML, or PNG files. All in all, Falcon is a powerful tool for data exploration and analysis.

The FBI claims that it has seen hacking attempts on US groups researching vaccines, treatments, and testing for the coronavirus. It issued a public service announcement on Wednesday that healthcare, pharmaceutical, and research organizations must take steps to protect their networks from cyberattacks. The FBI said it has seen malicious actors attempting to gain access to US-based networks related to these activities in order to steal information or disrupt operations. The agency warned that hackers may try to exploit the increased demand for medical supplies as well as the possibility of financial gain by targeting organizations working on treatments and vaccines. The FBI said it is working with healthcare providers, technology companies, and other federal partners to identify, disrupt, and prosecute malicious actors.

Toronto's City Council will soon hold a vote on whether to allow Sidewalk Labs to privatize much of the city's lakeshore to create a'smart city' owned by Alphabet. Sidewalk Labs has proposed a 12-acre development that would include housing, offices, retail outlets, and a data-driven infrastructure. City Council will consider the potential benefits of the proposal, as well as its potential impact on the city's residents, businesses, and environment. The vote is important for Toronto because it could be a significant step towards creating a new kind of urban centre. If approved, Sidewalk Labs would have access to millions of dollars in investment and data that could help to create a more efficient and ecologically friendly city. However, the proposal has raised many questions about privacy, surveillance, and how the data collected by Sidewalk Labs would be used. City Council must consider all of these issues before voting on the proposal.

Substrate is a free modular blockchain framework. It features p2p networking, consensus algorithms, cryptographic libraries, a smart contract platform, and more. Documentation, tutorials, and links to community resources are available to help developers get started. Substrate also includes several built-in development tools, such as a block explorer and console.

Audius is a music streaming platform based on the Ethereum and Solana blockchains. It was founded in 2018 and is now the largest decentralized consumer blockchain application, with over 100,000 monthly active users and more than 1 million unique tracks. Audius enables artists to monetize their music through subscription plans, pay-per-stream, or even tokenized ownership models. Listeners can discover and stream music from independent artists around the world, without any middleman or third-party intermediary. The platform also features an open API for developers to build applications on top of the platform.

Flexsearch is a high-performance REST based full-text searching library. It is fast, memory efficient, and has a variety of plug-ins to customize its functionality. Flexsearch is well documented and researched, making it an ideal tool for quickly searching large datasets. It can be used to search any type of text, including webpages and images. Its features include fuzzy search, phrase search, stop words removal, stemming, and soundex matching. Flexsearch also has a powerful query language that allows users to construct complex searches. Additionally, it is compatible with Elasticsearch and Solr, allowing users to easily integrate it into their existing search solutions.

New details about Google's new Pixel 4 have been leaked on Jon Prosser's YouTube channel. Prosser has previously leaked accurate details on the Pixel 3 and Pixel 3 XL, as well as other upcoming devices. The leaked details include a 5.7-inch display, a dual rear camera setup, and a unique new gesture feature that will allow users to control their phone without touching the screen. Prosser also claims that Google will be using the latest Qualcomm Snapdragon 855 processor, 6GB of RAM, and 64 GB of storage. In addition, the Pixel 4 will have a 3,700 mAh battery with support for 18W fast charging. Lastly, the Pixel 4 will come in three colors: black, white and "Oh So Orange."

Fleet is a build tool for Rust. It can compile up to five times faster than cargo. Fleet works by optimizing builds using existing tooling available in the Rust ecosystem. It can also cache compiled artifacts, making builds more efficient. Fleet also provides diagnostic output to help developers understand why their build fails, and how they can fix it.

The boom in food delivery apps in China has flooded the country with takeout containers, utensils, and bags. Most of the plastic is thrown away rather than recycled. While the convenience of food delivery apps is undeniable, the environmental impact of all this plastic waste is concerning. Companies are working to reduce their reliance on single-use plastics, but it's not enough. Governments should take action to create regulations and enforce them to help reduce the amount of plastic waste that enters the environment. Additionally, consumers need to be educated about the importance of reducing single-use plastic consumption. By increasing public awareness, we can make a collective effort to save our planet from the dangers of plastic pollution.

Gene Levoff, the previous senior director of law and corporate security at Apple until September last year, has been charged with securities fraud and is set to appear in court . The US Department of Justice has accused Levoff of insider trading involving Apple stock between 2011 and 2016. During this time, prosecutors allege that Levoff misused his access to private information about the company's earnings results and engaged in illegal trades of Apple securities before the publication of the company's quarterly financial results. Levoff faces three counts of securities fraud and one count of wire fraud. If convicted on all charges he faces up to 25 years in prison and a significant fine. In response to the charges, Apple said it had cooperated with the government's investigation and noted that Levoff had been terminated from the company last year.

A Chinese court has granted Qualcomm an injunction against Apple in a patent infringement case. The patents affect all devices sold with iOS 11 or earlier, so all iPhones from the 6s to the X are affected. The injunction bans Apple from selling its iPhones in China, which is the world's largest smartphone market. Qualcomm has accused Apple of infringing on its patents related to photo editing, app management and touchscreen technology. Apple has denied any wrongdoing and said it plans to appeal the court's decision. The ruling could have a significant impact on Apple's business in China, where the company generates about 20 percent of its total revenue. Apple could face a hefty fine if it continues to sell its phones in the country without paying Qualcomm for the use of its patents. It is unclear how long the injunction will last, but it could be costly for Apple if it remains in effect for an extended period of time.

Pulse is a logging system for Apple Platforms. It records logs locally and they never leave the device. Screenshots of Pulse running on various Apple devices are available in the screenshots section of the website.

Most smartphones sold today have large displays and this presents new challenges and opportunities for app makers and designers. The first iPhone was designed for comfortable one-handed operation, but larger screens make this difficult. Designers have to rethink how best to use the extra space in order to make their apps easier to use and more enjoyable for users. One challenge posed by large displays is that app makers must consider how to effectively utilize the extra space without overwhelming or confusing users. App makers need to be creative when it comes to designing user interfaces, as well as ensuring that important elements of the app are easy to find and use. Additionally, they must ensure that text, images, and other elements do not become too small when viewed on a large display. Another challenge posed by larger displays is that they can consume more power than smaller displays. As such, app makers must optimize their apps to run efficiently on the device, making sure that they don't drain the battery too quickly. Overall, large displays offer both challenges and opportunities for app makers and designers. By taking into account the challenges posed by large displays, app makers can create better experiences for their users that take full advantage of the extra screen size.

Facebook's Deepfake Detection Challenge is an open competition to find algorithms that can spot AI-manipulated videos. This year's winning algorithm could spot real-world examples of deep fakes with an average accuracy of 96. The challenge was launched in December 2019 and 1,500 teams from across the world took part. The contest was judged on how accurately algorithms could detect deep fakes and manipulated videos using a dataset provided by Facebook. Teams had to develop models that could distinguish between real and fake videos. The top three teams achieved detection accuracies of 95.8, 95.7 and 95.5. Facebook has since released the winning algorithm to the public in order to share and encourage further research into deepfake detection. The company also plans to continue holding competitions in the future to further improve deepfake detection technology.

Physicists from the US have found that when graphene is assembled into a double-layer stack, the proximity produces quantum states that have never been observed before. These states are an example of Dirac cones, which are points in a material's energy spectrum where electrons can move with zero resistance. The US team used scanning tunneling microscopy to observe the new quantum states, which appear as bright spots in the graphene's bandgap. The researchers believe that these states could be useful for creating efficient electronic devices and possibly even quantum computing chips.

Wyze has confirmed that a server leak exposed the details of roughly 2.4 million smart device customers. An internal database was accidentally exposed online. Wyze was testing new methods to securely store its customer information when the incident happened. The exposed database contained users' email addresses, passwords, and the MAC addresses of their devices. Fortunately, no financial data or other sensitive information was leaked. Wyze has taken steps to fix the issue and secure the server. They have also notified affected customers and reset their passwords as a precaution. The company is currently conducting an investigation into the incident and taking steps to prevent similar issues from occurring in the future. Wyze has also stated that it will provide more information about the incident once it has completed its internal review.

Mojo Vision, a startup focused on invisible computing, unveiled a contact lens that has a display that can show information and notifications. Users can interact with the interface by focusing their eyes on various points and blinking in certain patterns. The lens also has sensors that can detect the wearer's environment, including temperature, light levels, and air quality. Additionally, the lens can be used to measure glucose levels in the eye, making it a potential game-changer for people with diabetes. The contact lens is powered by an ultra-thin battery and contains a tiny microprocessor and wireless antenna that allows it to connect to the internet. With its tiny display, Mojo Vision's contact lens is capable of showing text and images, as well as providing notifications from services like calendars and weather alerts. The company hopes to eventually add augmented reality features, such as overlaying directions or other information onto the user's view of the world. The technology could revolutionize how people interact with information, making it easier and more intuitive to access the data they need. It could also provide a new way for people to monitor their health, allowing them to check their blood sugar and other metrics without having to take out a device. Finally, the contact lens could open up new possibilities for augmented reality, allowing users to virtually explore their surroundings or gain insights into their environment.

A new Tesla Semi truck prototype has been spotted in Truckee, CA. The engineering has been completed on the truck and some production models are scheduled for late 2021. There is no word on what the final specs of the truck will be, or when it will be available for sale. The Tesla Semi is expected to have a range of up to 500 miles per charge and offer improved safety features such as automatic emergency braking, lane keeping assistance and side collision avoidance. It will also feature an automated driving mode for long-haul trips.

Konstellate allows users to manage Kubernetes resources and their relationships through a UI. It can easily create complex YAML and export them as Helm charts or Kustomize templates. Resources can be grouped and organized into stacks. Konstellate provides a visual way to interact with Kubernetes resources so that users can track, monitor, and manage them in an intuitive manner. It also simplifies the process of creating complex configurations by providing templates and wizards. Additionally, it offers policy-based enforcement and audit capabilities for Kubernetes resources.

Amazon has opened a brick-and-mortar clothing store in Los Angeles, California. Amazon Style will feature clothing from brands like Levi's, Tommy Hilfiger, Champion, and more. Store employees will be present to help customers find items and provide personalized recommendations. Customers can also use the Amazon app to scan products for more information and purchase them from their mobile device. Additionally, shoppers will have access to Alexa-enabled devices in-store that can answer questions and offer styling tips. The store is part of the company's expansion into physical retail spaces.

Amazon just announced a bunch of new gadgets ahead of the busy holiday shopping season. They include the Astro home robot, a smart thermostat, an Amazon Echo Show that can play videos and make Skype calls, and a new Amazon Fire TV Cube. All of these devices will give consumers more control over their home environment and allow them to access their favorite content quickly and conveniently. With the Astro robot, users can ask it questions, schedule reminders, and play games. The thermostat will allow users to adjust their home temperature from anywhere in the world, while the Echo Show will let them communicate with friends and family using video calling. Finally, the Fire TV Cube will give users access to their favorite streaming services and live cable channels without the need for a separate device.

Locket is an app that turns Apple's widget system into a private social networking platform. The app allows users to put live photos from friends in a widget on the home screen of their iPhone and interact with them. Users can also post photos, videos, messages, and audio clips to their friends' widgets, as well as like and comment on content posted by others. Locket also lets users link their accounts to Twitter and Facebook, so they can see what their friends are posting in those networks as well.

Axie Infinity is an NFT-based game made by a Vietnam-based company named Sky Mavis. It allows players to earn meaningful income by playing the game. Players can buy and sell in-game items such as Axies (digital creatures), land, and more. The game also features a battle system, where players can fight against each other with their Axie teams. Players also have the option to breed new Axies, create their own teams and build a community. The game is blockchain-based, meaning that all gameplay data and in-game items are stored on the Ethereum blockchain. This provides a secure, immutable record of ownership, allowing users to trade and sell their items without any third-party interference.

The most common issue for new data scientists is that they don't question their own results. It is important to validate the results that are generated from machines as the output may not be accurate or may lead to incorrect conclusions. Data scientists should also be wary of bias in their data sets, as this can lead to skewed results and erroneous assumptions. Additionally, data scientists need to ensure that they have a good understanding of the data they are working with, as well as any underlying assumptions, in order to ensure the accuracy of their results.

Algo Deck is an open-source collection of over 200 algorithmic flash cards. The aim of the project is to prepare developers to succeed in algorithm and data structure interviews. Topics covered include Binary Search, Graphs, Sorting Algorithms, Greedy Algorithms, and more. The cards feature concise explanations of each algorithm, as well as sample code in Python, Java, and JavaScript. Additionally, there are detailed solutions to common interview questions and coding puzzles related to the topics. Algo Deck was developed by software engineers from Google, Amazon, and Microsoft. It is available for free on GitHub and can be used as a personal study aid or as part of a group study session.

It is easy to burn out employees as you learn how to manage groups of people. This article contains advice for managers of small teams and startups on how to avoid burnout in employees, which can have a detrimental effect on productivity and morale. 1. Prioritize employee wellness: Make sure to take the time to check in with your team members and ensure they're taking care of themselves. Provide resources for mental and physical health, such as access to counseling services, paid sick days, or activities that promote well-being. 2. Encourage work-life balance: Establish policies that allow for flexible schedules and encourage employees to take breaks throughout the day. Identify when someone is feeling overwhelmed and provide them with additional support. 3. Foster an open and collaborative environment: Encourage your team to collaborate and help each other out whenever possible. Host weekly meetings to discuss progress and any issues that arise. Set clear expectations and goals so everyone knows what they need to do and how they can support each other. 4. Create a supportive culture: Recognize and reward hard work, celebrate successes, and create an atmosphere where employees feel valued and appreciated. Be understanding and provide feedback in a constructive manner. 5. Monitor workloads: Ensure that workloads are reasonable and employees aren't overwhelmed. Allow for input from employees about their workloads and adjust accordingly. 6. Promote self-care: Encourage employees to practice self-care and make sure they're taking time for themselves. Offer individualized resources, such as mindfulness classes or mentorship programs.

Apple is facing an antitrust investigation after Spotify filed a complaint with the European Commission for Apple's anti-competitive business strategies. Spotify is frustrated with Apple's 30 percent take of subscription fees and the fact that Apple does not allow links to external purchasing options within the App Store. The European Commission has launched an antitrust investigation into Apple's App Store rules. The investigation will focus on whether Apple's practices limit choice and reduce competition in the streaming music market. It will also investigate whether Apple uses its control of the App Store to unfairly favor its own streaming music service, Apple Music, over services like Spotify. The investigation is expected to last several months and could result in Apple being ordered to change its business practices or face large fines. In the meantime, Apple could be ordered to suspend the rules that are being investigated while the inquiry continues. This could potentially give Spotify an advantage in the streaming music market, as it would allow them to link to external purchasing options within their app on the App Store.

Future Crunch is a once every other week newsletter full of optimistic news and breakthroughs in science and technology. It was created by Anthony De Brier and is now run by a team of writers, editors and data analysts. The newsletter aims to inform people of the latest developments in science, technology, and sustainability. Each issue contains five or more articles on topics such as artificial intelligence, renewable energy, space exploration, robotics, climate change, and genetics. The content also includes interviews with innovators, entrepreneurs, and experts from around the world. Crunch also offers an online store where readers can purchase books, apparel, and other products related to the topics discussed in the newsletter.

TF Quant Finance is a high-performance TensorFlow library for quantitative finance. It provides TensorFlow support for foundational mathematical methods, mid-level methods, and specific pricing models. End-to-end examples are available. It is designed for researchers, quants, and traders.

xh is a tool for sending HTTP requests. It supports HTTPS, sending data as JSON or as form fields, downloads, authentication, proxies, and more. A GIF example is available in the link below. Example: ![Example]

DoorDash is testing a feature called'Return a Package' that allows customers to book a delivery person to return packages to the nearest post office, UPS, or FedEx location. Customers will be able to track their package delivery progress in real-time and receive a confirmation when the package has been successfully returned. This is an exciting new feature that could be beneficial for customers who need to return packages quickly and easily. It will also help DoorDash save time and resources since they won't have to deal with the hassle of returning packages themselves. By using Return a Package, DoorDash customers can rest assured that their items will be returned safely and in a timely manner.

Google Wallet is returning and may take over Google Pay. Wallet will likely become a place for digital cards, while Pay will remain the primary service for paying for things. Google is hoping to make Wallet the go-to place for managing digital cards, and will eventually include features like loyalty programs and rewards.

React Hook Form makes it super easy to integrate and create forms that are fast performing and compact. A live demo is available. There is also a form builder to help customize the forms to fit your needs. React Hook Form is a library that provides an easy way to create forms in React applications. It uses modern JavaScript and React concepts to provide an efficient, powerful, and flexible solution for creating forms with minimal effort. With React Hook Form, developers can quickly create custom forms without having to write any custom code. The library also provides powerful tools for validation, error handling, and performance optimization.

A cache of chat logs from the Conti ransomware group was leaked online by an insider. Conti recently stated their support for the Russian invasion and vowed to retaliate against anyone who opposed it. The chat logs revealed conversations between Conti members discussing the operation, potential targets, and methods for executing their attacks. They also discussed techniques for exploiting vulnerabilities in systems and networks, as well as how to cover their tracks to avoid detection. Additionally, the logs showed that the group was actively recruiting new members and planning future operations. The leak of the Conti ransomware group's chat logs is a major security breach with potentially devastating consequences. By revealing the group's plans and strategies, these logs can help law enforcement and cybersecurity experts identify, investigate, and ultimately disrupt or prevent future cyberattacks. Furthermore, the leaked information can be used to alert potential victims and provide them with guidance on how to protect themselves against such attacks. Finally, the logs can serve as an invaluable source of intelligence, enabling organizations to better understand the tactics, techniques, and procedures used by the Conti ransomware group and other malicious actors.

Amazon will now allow anyone to publish their custom skills on the Alexa store, after the successful launch of their Alexa Skills Blueprint program last year. Users are able to create their own custom skills for the Alexa assistant using a series of templates and tools provided by Amazon. With the new launch, users will be able to publish their skills on the Alexa store, allowing anyone with an Alexa device to access them. This makes it easier than ever for users to create custom skills that are tailored to their specific needs. The new feature also gives developers more control over how their skills are presented in the Alexa store, allowing them to better showcase their skills.

Google is partnering with Roomba to make smart homes smarter by using maps of customers homes collected by Roomba. They want to make an integration that will let you say "Ok Google, ask Roomba to clean my home." This integration will allow users to control their Roomba device from their voice-enabled Google Home or Android device. The integration will also use the maps collected by Roomba to give personalized cleaning suggestions and recommendations for optimal cleaning results.

Full Self-Driving on Tesla vehicles works for highway driving, but when it comes to inner-city streets, it still has some ways to go. The most recent update shows that more features are being added to the self-driving software, such as stop sign recognition and obstacle avoidance. However, the inner-city streets present unique challenges due to the complexity of the environment. For example, the car must be able to recognize traffic lights, navigate through busy intersections, and accurately read signs. Additionally, the car must be able to handle unexpected events, such as pedestrians suddenly crossing the street or a cyclist riding too close. These are all things that Tesla's self-driving technology must learn in order to safely navigate inner-city streets.

Speed up code reviews with pull request notifications on Slack. Swarmia gives your engineering team the visibility and Slack notifications you need to review and merge pull requests faster."Swarmia's Slack integration allows you to receive notifications as soon as a pull request is opened. You can quickly review the code and make sure it meets your standards before merging it into your production codebase. With Swarmia, you can easily manage your entire development process in one place and speed up reviews with ease.

Facial Recognition technology has developed quickly but the law has not yet caught up with it. Using public camera footage and images of people obtained through their employer's websites combined with facial recognition technology, companies can now track and monitor people's movements in public. This has the potential to infringe on people's privacy rights and raise ethical concerns. The use of facial recognition technology is largely unregulated, and there is no consensus on what regulations should be in place. The European Union has proposed a ban on using facial recognition technology for certain applications such as surveillance, but this has yet to be implemented. In the United States, some states have passed laws regulating the use of facial recognition technology, including bans on its use for certain purposes. In order to ensure people's privacy rights are respected, governments must pass laws that clearly define how facial recognition technology can be used and what data it can access. Companies should also be held responsible for ensuring their systems comply with any applicable laws. Additionally, individuals should be informed when their image is being collected and stored, as well as how long it will be kept and who will have access to it. These measures would help protect people's privacy while still allowing companies to make use of this powerful technology.

Huawei recently unveiled a potential Android replacement and it is apparently now working on a Google Maps alternative. Map Kit is a tool for software developers to create apps around a "map-like" interface, and the company has already worked with Booking.com to integrate it into its travel app. Huawei reportedly wants Map Kit to be used for ride-hailing, navigation, and on-demand deliveries, similar to how Google Maps is currently utilized. The Chinese tech giant also plans to use AI technology to power its mapping service, allowing it to provide real-time traffic updates, route optimization, and other features. Huawei's goal is to create an efficient system that can rival Google Maps in terms of accuracy and user experience. It remains to be seen if Map Kit will become a viable alternative to Google Maps, but it is certainly an ambitious project.

A developer has created a way to scale macOS using docker. Each instance is able to access services like iMessage as Docker-OSX generates unique codes for its macOS hardware. The developer claims that it is the only way to create a macOS experience in the cloud. While this is an interesting concept, it is not the only way to create a macOS experience in the cloud. Other popular options include using Apple's own iCloud services or running a virtual machine on a cloud provider such as Amazon Web Services (AWS). There are also various third-party solutions such as MacinCloud and CloudDesktopOnline that offer macOS hosting in the cloud. Each of these options offers its own unique advantages, so it is important to evaluate them carefully before making a decision.

Google recently added a new feature called Self Share that allows users to easily share data between Android and Chrome OS devices. It uses Bluetooth, WebRTS, and peer-to-peer Wi-Fi to securely share files, photos, videos, and other data between devices. The feature is intended to make it easier for users to collaborate and transfer data between Android and Chrome OS devices. It also provides a secure connection that prevents unwanted access to the shared data. Furthermore, users can control the type of content they share, as well as who can view it.

Spotify has bought The Ringer, a podcast-centric media company owned by Bill Simmons. Simmons and his employees will all be absorbed in the deal. The Ringer has around 30 titles, including sports, culture and tech-focused shows. Spotify plans to use the company's content and expertise to bolster its own podcast portfolio, which includes both original shows and acquisitions. The deal also gives Spotify more control over the podcasting landscape, as it now owns one of the biggest independent players in the space.

Neuromorphic computing hardware is special hardware developed to model the behavior of biological neurons. A group of researchers from the US have developed a non-silicon version of the hardware that is inspired by the behavior of neurons in the brain. This hardware uses nanowires and memristors to model the electrical signals sent by neurons. Neuromorphic computing has the potential to revolutionize various aspects of computing, such as artificial intelligence, machine learning, and computer vision.

Humans can learn echolocation to navigate mazes and identify the size and orientation of objects in just 10 weeks. Yes, humans can learn echolocation to navigate mazes and identify the size and orientation of objects in just 10 weeks. During this time, humans can be taught how to create clicks with their mouths that will bounce off objects and give them a sense of what is around them. They can use this knowledge to gain spatial understanding of their environment and navigate through any maze or obstacle course. Additionally, humans can learn to distinguish between different sizes and orientations of objects by listening to the way the clicks sound when they reflect off the objects. With enough practice, humans should be able to develop a reliable skill set that they can use to find their way around and identify objects in their environment.

A team of Italian scientists has created a hydrogel that can remove paints from other paints of similar chemical composition. It can be used to repair street art that has been vandalised or to restore old artwork. The hydrogel was created by a team of scientists at the University of Rome Tor Vergata, who used polymers and proteins that were able to absorb paint molecules from surfaces. The hydrogel is able to bind to the molecules of paint and then remove them from the surface without damaging the underlying material. This makes it ideal for restoring street art or artwork that has been damaged. The hydrogel can be applied to a surface with a brush or spray bottle, and it will gradually absorb the paint molecules. Once it has absorbed all the paint molecules, it can be easily removed with a cloth or paper towel. The hydrogel has already been tested on various materials, including concrete, glass, metal, and even painted walls. It proved to be effective in removing paint from all these materials, with no damage to the underlying material. The hydrogel is still being refined, but the researchers believe that it could soon be available commercially. If so, it could be an invaluable tool for those looking to restore or repair street art or artwork that has been damaged by vandals or the elements.

China's National Health Commission has confirmed the first case of human infection with H10N3, a strain of bird flu. The patient survived and there were no other cases. Widespread transmission of the virus has not been reported The National Health Commission has issued a statement confirming the first human case of H10N3, a strain of avian influenza. The patient, who is from Zhejiang Province in eastern China, was hospitalized on April 28 and diagnosed with the virus on May 28. After treatment, the patient has recovered and been discharged from hospital. The commission is currently monitoring the situation and encouraging citizens to take preventive measures such as wearing masks and washing hands regularly. No other cases of human infection have been reported and there is no evidence of transmission among humans. The commission has also warned that the virus might be able to spread among birds and domestic poultry and is working with local authorities to implement effective control and prevention measures.

Thousands of people protested in Belarus on the weekend over the results of the presidential election. Long-time president Alexander Lukashenko won 80 percent of the vote, extending his 26-year long rule. The protesters were angered by reports of widespread fraud and ballot-stuffing, and demanded a recount or new elections. Police used tear gas and rubber bullets to disperse the crowds. There have also been reports of detentions and beatings of protestors.

The Great Suspender, a popular Chrome extension that automatically suspended open tabs that haven't been used for a while, has been removed from Google's Chrome Web Store. Apparently, some sketchy code was included in the extension that violated Google's terms of service. Google has removed The Great Suspender from its Chrome Web Store, citing suspicious code that violated its terms of service. According to reports, the extension was collecting user information and sending it to a remote server, which could have been used for malicious purposes. In response, Google has disabled the extension and is warning users to uninstall it if they had already installed it. The developers of The Great Suspender deny any malicious intent and claim that the data collected was only being used to improve the extension's features. However, they have agreed to shut down the project and delete all associated data. Google's decision to remove The Great Suspender demonstrates its commitment to protecting user privacy, as well as its willingness to take swift action when necessary. It also serves as a reminder that users should be cautious when installing browser extensions, as some may contain malicious code.

The Comma Two is a device that can add assisted driving features to cars. It operates at level two autonomy. The device requires drivers to pay attention to the road and intervene when needed. It is equipped with a variety of sensors, including radar, cameras, and ultrasonic sensors. These sensors are used to detect objects in the car's vicinity and adjust the speed and steering of the vehicle to maintain a safe distance from other vehicles and obstacles. The Comma Two also features lane-keeping assistance and adaptive cruise control, which can help reduce driver fatigue and improve safety. The device is compatible with both Android and iOS devices, and it can be installed quickly and easily.

Solana is a proof-of-stake blockchain with a mechanism called proof-of-history. This article is a guide on how to build a full stack dapp using Solana. It introduces the ecosystem and how to get started building a distributed app. The first step is to become familiar with the Solana ecosystem. Solana provides developers with the tools and APIs needed to build decentralized applications. It supports a wide range of programming languages, including Rust, JavaScript, Python, and more. Once you have become familiar with the ecosystem, you will need to obtain a Solana account and configure your development environment. This includes setting up a local development node, installing necessary software, and obtaining an account keypair. To deploy your application, you will need to create a smart contract in the language of your choice. You can also use the Solana SDK to develop new applications or modify existing ones. Once deployed, the application will be accessible by anyone who has access to the Solana network. Finally, you will need to interact with the application using the Solana API. This includes submitting transactions, reading data from the blockchain, and other related functionality. By following the steps outlined above, you should now have a basic understanding of how to build a full stack dapp on the Solana blockchain. To learn more about developing on Solana, check out the official Solana documentation.

Shijian-21, or SJ-21, is a Chinese satellite designed to test and verify space debris mitigation technologies. It was recently observed pulling a dead satellite out of its normal orbit and into an orbit where it will eventually reenter the atmosphere and burn up. This is a major step forward in the effort to reduce the amount of space debris that is accumulating in Earth's orbit. The satellite was launched in July 2020, as part of China's Long March-4B rocket mission. It is equipped with a robotic arm and a capture device, which are capable of grasping objects up to 350 kilograms in weight. The satellite also features a variety of sensors and cameras for monitoring the captured object. SJ-21 is the first satellite of its kind to be sent into space and has already proven successful in its mission. In addition to being able to de-orbit discarded satellites, it is also capable of stabilizing their orbits, allowing them to remain in a safe area of space. This technology could potentially be used to help prevent further collisions between satellites and other space debris. In the future, SJ-21 could be used to clean up other types of space debris, such as defunct spacecraft and pieces of rocket boosters. This could have a significant impact on the environment by reducing the amount of trash in orbit and preventing long-term damage to our planet.

Apple's custom-designed M2 chips entered production this month. The chips will be introduced with new Macs in the second half of 2021. They are being manufactured by Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing. The M2 chips are expected to provide performance and power efficiency gains over Intel's current line of processors. They will likely be used in the upcoming MacBook Pro, iMac, and Mac Pro models. Apple is also rumored to be working on an ARM-based chip for the Mac lineup as well, but it is unclear when these chips will enter production.

Scientists were able to use light and bio-ink to print a human ear-like structure under the skin of mice without a single surgical cut. Digital light processing-based 3D bioprinting is a new technology that combines computer-aided design, biomaterials, and photolithography. The process uses light to cure the bioink, which contains living cells, into 3D structures that can be loaded onto a bioprinter and implanted into the body. The scientists used a technique known as projection stereolithography to create an ear-like structure using a mix of cartilage cells and hydrogels. They then implanted the structure under the skin of mice. After two months, the ear had developed a cartilaginous matrix and was vascularized, meaning it had its own blood vessel network. The study demonstrated that 3D bioprinting can be a powerful tool for creating complex living structures that can integrate with the body.

Today marks Google's official launch for AMP support for email, more than a year after they first announced their intentions of supporting the format. AMP will allow emails to become much more interactive, with features such as carousels, embedded videos, and forms allowing for easier navigation for users. Additionally, AMP emails could help marketers to better track their campaigns and see how people are engaging with them. This could be a great tool for businesses to help boost their email marketing efforts in the future.

Scientists have developed a new gene-editing tool that is more accurate than CRISPR-Cas9. Prime editing can mend about 89 percent of the 75,000 or so harmful mutations in the human genome. This new tool works by using a combination of two existing CRISPR systems, which enables it to edit a single letter in the DNA code without cutting both strands of the double helix. This is a major breakthrough in genetic engineering, as it has the potential to correct genetic diseases without disrupting other parts of the genome. Prime editing could revolutionize the field of medicine and make gene therapy much more effective.

SVGs have cool benefits like crisp image quality with a single file, support for emojis, inline icons, and dark mode detection. This article discusses how to add SVG favicons to your website. First, open a text editor and create a new blank document. You can then paste in SVG code to create your favicon. If you don't have any SVG code, you can find an online SVG generator or source a file from a stock image site. Once you have an SVG file, you'll need to add it to your website. This can be done by linking it in the HTML head section of your website. You'll need to include a link tag with the rel attribute set to "icon" and the href attribute pointing at the SVG file. Next, you'll need to create a fallback favicon for browsers that don't support SVG. You can do this by creating and saving a 1616 pixel PNG file, then adding a link tag with the rel attribute set to "icon" and the href attribute pointing at the PNG file. Finally, you'll need to declare the SVG as the preferred icon by adding a link tag with the rel attribute set to "prefetch" and the href attribute pointing at the SVG file. Once you have all of these steps complete, you will have successfully added an SVG favicon to your website. This will give your site a modern look and make it stand out from other websites. Additionally, SVG favicons are more efficient than traditional raster images, meaning they will load faster and use less bandwidth.

Are you scared to look at your AWS bill every month?. If you're staring at your AWS bill wondering what's going on, you're not alone. Our cloud cost management experts have encountered many AWS customers who are scared to look at their bills, and it's a common issue. The good news is that there are ways to mitigate the shock of an unexpectedly high AWS bill. First and foremost, it's important to understand where your money is going and why. By gaining visibility into your usage, you can take steps to optimize your cloud environment and make sure you're only paying for the services you need. Additionally, setting up automated alerts and notifications can help you stay on top of your costs and maintain control of your budget. Finally, be sure to take advantage of cost-saving opportunities like Reserved Instances and AWS Savings Plans.

Xiaomi is the world's biggest smartphone vendor, with 17.1 percent of the global market. The company has been aggressively expanding since Huawei received its US export bans. Xiaomi has 58 .7 million shipments in the first quarter of 2021, which is up by 66.7 percent compared to last year. The company is particularly strong in the Indian market, where it controls 28.9 percent of the market. It has also made progress in other markets such as Europe, where it now holds 5.2 percent of the market. Xiaomi's strength is its ability to offer high-quality products at relatively low prices. The company has also been expanding its product portfolio, recently launching a new line of electric bikes and scooters. Xiaomi is well-positioned to capitalize on the growing trend of people looking for affordable technology.

Mint is a programming language for front-end web development. It features reusable components, styling, routing, global and local state handling, and synchronous and asynchronous computations for Single Page Applications. The syntax is similar to HTML and CSS and is designed to be intuitive and easy to learn. It also provides features such as mobile-first design, server-side rendering, static type checking, and hot code reloading.

This Twitter thread follows Facebook's company-wide end-of-year meeting. During the meeting, the speakers discuss the company's role in the major events of the year, reflecting on the role it played in the 2020 US election and its role in promoting social justice. They also discuss the company's plans for 2021, including new initiatives to help promote digital literacy, combat misinformation, and create a more equitable future. The speaker also encourage employees to take action in their personal lives to support these changes.

Nine years after hundreds of thousands of people fled the area, nature has started to reclaim the space around Fukushima in Japan. In recent years, many evacuation orders have lifted , and people are returning home to find their neighborhoods overgrown with foliage. The Fukushima prefecture has seen an explosion of plant growth as a result of the lack of human activity in the area since the disaster. This has resulted in an increase in biodiversity and the return of many species of birds and other wildlife to the area. Local communities have taken advantage of this, creating projects like "Fukushima Flower Fest" to promote the natural beauty of the region and encourage tourism. In addition, the government has implemented various measures to help the environment recover. These include replanting trees, removing contaminated soil, and improving sewage systems. Scientists have been monitoring the effects of radiation on the environment, and while there is still evidence of contamination, the level of radiation has decreased significantly. The recovery of Fukushima is still ongoing and while it may take years for the area to fully recover, the resilience of nature is helping the region come back to life.

A Mexican startup called Biomitech has developed an artificial tree that it claims is capable of processing the same amount of air pollution as 368 living trees. Unlike trees, Biourban 's artificial tree requires no water or soil and can be used in both urban and rural areas. Biomitech claims that its artificial tree is capable of capturing up to 1,400 grams of pollutants per hour, including carbon dioxide and the fine particles that cause smog. The company has designed the device to provide clean air for an area of 4,000 square meters, making it an ideal solution for cities with high levels of air pollution. The idea behind the artificial tree is to replace trees that are not present in urban areas, or to supplement existing vegetation in areas that do not have sufficient numbers of trees to provide enough air purification. Additionally, the device does not require much maintenance, as it is made from recyclable materials and runs on solar power. The product has already been installed in some cities in Mexico and the company plans to expand to other countries in the near future. As air pollution continues to be a major problem in many cities around the world, solutions such as Biomitech's artificial tree could help to reduce the health risks associated with poor air quality.

Artemis is NASA's next manned moon mission, which is planned for 2024. It will be the first time astronauts have set foot on the lunar surface since 1972. Two astronauts , one man and one woman, will travel to the moon in the Orion spacecraft. On their journey, they will fly past the Moon, enter its orbit, and land on the lunar surface in the region known as the Sea of Tranquility. They will explore the area, collect samples, and set up a long-term base camp. The mission is part of NASA's plan to send astronauts to Mars by the 2030s.

NASA will test drive a robot underneath Antarctica's sea ice in preparation for a mission in the subsurface oceans of Jupiter's moon, Europa. Buoyant Rover for Under-Ice Exploration, or BRUIE, is a modified version of the autonomous underwater vehicle (AUV) developed by NASA's Jet Propulsion Laboratory (JPL). The rover will be tested in Antarctica's McMurdo Sound, which has similar characteristics to Europa's icy environment. The rover is designed to explore beneath the sea ice and seek out pockets of liquid water that may exist underneath the surface. During the mission, BRUIE will collect data on ocean currents, temperature, and salinity, as well as search for microbial life within the subsurface ocean. This data will help scientists better understand the environment of Europa's oceans and prepare them for future missions.

SpaceX is starting a program to take carbon dioxide out of the atmosphere and turn it into rocket fuel. The technology will be important on Mars, as fuel could be made from the carbon dioxide in the atmosphere. SpaceX is developing a new project to capture carbon dioxide (CO2) from Earth's atmosphere and transform it into rocket fuel for use on Mars. The program is part of SpaceX's long-term mission to establish a self-sustaining human presence on the Red Planet. The technology works by using a process called Sabatier Reaction which combines hydrogen and CO2 to produce methane and water. The methane can then be used as rocket fuel, allowing spacecraft to refuel on Mars without having to transport fuel from Earth. SpaceX plans to develop the technology at its Texas test facility and eventually bring it to Mars. In addition to providing a potentially sustainable source of fuel, the technology could also help reduce atmospheric CO2 levels. By capturing and repurposing carbon, SpaceX's program would effectively act as an artificial carbon sink, helping to reduce the amount of greenhouse gases in the atmosphere.

Fortescue Future Industries (FFI), an Australian mining company, has announced a project to create an electric infinity train that will be able to move loads of iron ore without ever needing to refuel. The train will be powered by a combination of solar energy, wind energy and hydrogen fuel cells, and will be able to travel up to 1000 kilometres without stopping. The project is expected to revolutionize the mining industry in Australia, allowing FFI to move large amounts of ore more quickly and efficiently than ever before. It also has the potential to reduce emissions from the transport of ore, as the train will not need to use any traditional fuels. The project is estimated to cost around 1 billion to build, with FFI planning to finance the project through both public and private investment. The project is still in its early stages, with FFI currently focusing on research and development. This includes testing the viability of the technology and obtaining the necessary permits and approvals from the government. If all goes according to plan, the electric infinity train could begin operation as early as 2022.

This article details the process of searching for a job in tech. It follows the author through the application, screening, interview, and negotiation processes, breaking down each process and how to best navigate them. It includes advice from successful professionals on how to stand out and make a lasting impression, as well as tips on how to negotiate for the best outcome. The article also provides resources for job seekers looking to stay up to date on the latest trends in the tech industry.

The developer preview for Android 12 is now available for Pixel devices. Android 12 updates how the OS handles images, videos, and future security updates. The developer preview is full of new features and optimizations that developers can use to create amazing experiences on Android devices. Developers can test out the new OS and provide feedback to Google directly.

DeepMind has published a paper on their system AlphaZero, an AI that can crack any game that provides all the relevant decision-making information. This includes games like chess and go, but also more complex games like shogi and the Chinese game of xiangqi. AlphaZero is a general purpose AI that can learn to master any game with perfect play, given only the rules of the game. It works by using a combination of deep reinforcement learning and Monte Carlo tree search to continuously improve its abilities. AlphaZero has already been shown to outperform existing AI systems in chess, shogi, and go.

Cameo Live is a new video call option from Cameo that allows users to book a Zoom call with a celebrity. The prices can go up to as high a thousand dollars per call depending on the celebrity. This product is perfect for those who want to have a one-on-one conversation with their favorite celebrities and make memories that will last a lifetime. Cameo Live also allows users to make requests such as custom messages, video dedications, or even singing a song. With Cameo Live, you can now look forward to making a connection with a celebrity in an intimate setting.

A study at Columbia University Irving Medical Center has found that Far-UVC light can safely kill 99.9 of seasonal coronaviruses present in airborne droplets. Conventional UV lamps can kill viruses , but their use is limited because they can also damage human skin and eyes. The study found that Far-UVC light (which has a wavelength of 222 nanometers) was just as effective at killing the viruses without damaging human cells. This could be a promising development in fighting the spread of COVID-19 and other airborne illnesses.

Embeddinghub is a database built for machine learning embeddings. Embeddings are dense numerical representations of real-world objects and relationships. They are used to quantify how similar vectors are to each other, enabling machines to compare and understand data. Embeddinghub provides access to pre-trained embeddings for use in natural language processing, computer vision, and other machine learning tasks. The database also offers an API for developers to easily integrate embeddings into their applications.
Listen Notes is a podcast search engine and database which was built without a lot of engineers and is based on easily accessible technology. Instagram was acquired by Facebook for 1 billion in 2012.

MoviePass is coming back under the ownership of cofounder Stacy Spikes. The company was acquired out of bankruptcy for an undisclosed amount below 250,000. Spikes plans to relaunch the business with a focus on creating a more sustainable subscription model. The new MoviePass will be centered around a three-tiered pricing structure, allowing customers to choose the plan that best suits their needs. Subscribers will have access to a variety of movie theaters, and Spikes also plans to develop partnerships with other entertainment services, such as streaming platforms. Additionally, the company is looking to create an in-app marketplace to allow customers to purchase tickets, concessions, and merchandise.

So the Robinhood checking and savings account that was in Friday's TLDR that offered 3 interest turned out to be a bit too good to be true. The accounts claimed to offer 3 interest, but it turns out that the accounts only pay 0.30 APY. While this is still a decent rate when compared to many other banks, it's not as high as initially advertised.

Ten eggs were harvested from the last two remaining northern white rhinoceroses, potentially saving the species from extinction. Neither of the white rhinos can carry a baby to term, so the eggs were harvested and fertilized with sperm from a deceased male white rhino. The embryos are being stored in liquid nitrogen and will be implanted into a surrogate mother when the technology is available. This is an incredible breakthrough for conservationists and could possibly save the species from extinction. The eggs were harvested using a non-invasive procedure that involved collecting follicular fluid from the female rhinos. The embryos were then inseminated using a technique called intracytoplasmic sperm injection (ICSI). This process involves injecting a single sperm directly into the egg, allowing it to fertilize. Once the embryos were successfully created, they were immediately frozen in liquid nitrogen and stored until scientists can find a way to implant them into a surrogate mother. The hope is that once the technology becomes available, the embryos will be implanted into a surrogate mother of another subspecies, such as a southern white rhino or an eastern black rhino. Doing so would help boost the genetic diversity of the northern white rhino population, while also increasing their numbers. This groundbreaking scientific advancement could be a monumental step forward in the fight to save the northern white rhino from extinction. Conservationists are optimistic that this could be the first successful attempt at using assisted reproductive technology to bring back an endangered species.

Most object detectors enumerate a large list of potential object locations and then classify each item, which is a large waste of resources as well as an inefficient approach. Objects can be detected more efficiently by using techniques such as convolutional neural networks (CNNs) or region-based convolutional neural networks (R-CNNs). These methods utilize learned features to detect objects, potentially eliminating the need to enumerate all possible locations. Additionally, these methods often do not require complex data preprocessing, which helps save time and resources.

oneshot is an easy way to set up an HTTP server to share files, web pages, or other outputs using the command line. Users just need to specify the path to the file or directory they want to share, and the server will automatically be set up. It also supports HTTPS, so users can securely share their files if needed.

This article features an interview with Tony Fadell. Fadell was instrumental in the development of the iPod and iPhone at Apple. He co-founded Nest Labs, which was sold to Google in 2014 and then spun off as an independent company in 2015. He talks about the current state of artificial intelligence (AI) and how it can be used to improve everyday tasks, such as scheduling appointments or managing finances. He also discusses the potential for AI to create ethical dilemmas and what steps need to be taken to ensure responsible use of the technology. htmlq can extract content from HTML files using CSS selectors. It can be used to find all the links in a page, the text content of a post, pretty print a html file, etc. Here's an example of how to use htmlq to extract all the links from a page: " 'python import htmlq create a new HTMLQuery object query htmlq.HTMLQ find all the links in the page links query.find a output each link for link in links: print (link.attrshref " ' The above code will output the href attribute of each link on the page. You can use other CSS selectors to narrow down the list of elements you want to extract. For more information on using htmlq, check out their [documentation] .

Norway is building the world's first ship tunnel to help vessels navigate the Stadhavet Sea. The tunnel will cost around 2.8 billion Norwegian kroner and take between three to four years to construct. It will be 1,700 meters long and 36 meters wide, and will provide a safer and more efficient passage for vessels travelling between the two sides of the Stadhavet Sea. The tunnel is expected to open in 2023 and will enable ships to pass through without having to wait for weather conditions to improve. The tunnel will also reduce fuel costs, emissions, and noise pollution.

Virgilio aims to help others navigate through the wide amount of information available on the internet and provide a clear and complete organic learning path for several tools, fields, skills, and technologies. The goal of Virgilio is to help people choose the right learning path for themselves. It does this by offering curated learning paths that are tailored to each user's specific interests, needs, and goals, as well as providing access to a library of high-quality, user-friendly online courses. Virgilio also provides resources such as tutorials, articles, videos, webinars, and other materials to help users learn quickly and effectively. Additionally, Virgilio offers personalized guidance from experienced mentors who can provide support and advice as users move through their learning journey.

Porter is a Kubernetes-powered PaaS that runs on any cloud provider. It features one-click provisioning of a Kubernetes cluster for AWS, GCP, and Digital Ocean, a Heroku-like GUI, simple deployment of applications, and an intuitive web-based UI. Porter is designed to make it easy for developers to deploy and manage applications on Kubernetes without having to learn the complexities of Kubernetes. It also makes it simple to scale applications up or down as needed.

Aevum is a startup with an uncrewed aircraft that can take small payloads out to space. The aircraft doesn't use any groundbreaking technology, and it looks similar to existing jet aircraft. However, it does use advanced materials, propulsion systems, and navigation systems to make it more efficient and reliable. The company plans to launch satellites, deliver packages, and transport cargo. The aircraft is still in the early stages of development and testing, but if successful, it could revolutionize the space industry.

The TECLA is a 3D printed house that was designed based on the hives of a species of wasp found in the northern hemisphere. It is made of materials taken from natural sources, including wood, clay, and straw. The TECLA is designed to provide a comfortable, energy-efficient home with minimal environmental impact. It features an open floor plan, with two bedrooms, a kitchen, and a living room. The walls of the structure are made of 3D printed panels that can be easily assembled or taken apart. The house is also equipped with solar panels, allowing it to generate its own electricity.

Reddit has updated its search feature to index comments. Users will now have an option to search through comments, making it easier to find something specific. The ability to search comments will be available in the Reddit mobile app, as well as on desktop. The update is expected to make it easier for users to find relevant content and conversations. Additionally, users can now search through the full comment history of a post, rather than having to sift through pages manually. This should provide a more comprehensive search experience.

Running a startup can be hard as many people don't know what they are doing wrong. This thread contains observations and lessons from founders and business owners that were not successful. 1. Failure to take risks: Many entrepreneurs fail because they are unwilling to take risks. They think that playing it safe is the best way to succeed, but this is not always the case. Taking risks can lead to greater rewards and opportunities. 2. Not understanding the market: Entrepreneurs often make the mistake of thinking that their product or service is the best and that everyone will love it. However, it is important to understand your target market and what they need before launching a business. 3. Lack of focus: Many entrepreneurs try to do too much at once, which makes it difficult to stay on track and produce results. It is important to focus on one task at a time and put all of your energy into that. 4. Poor financial management: Managing finances is essential for any business but many entrepreneurs fail to properly manage their finances. This leads to cash flow problems, which can quickly derail the success of a startup. 5. No plan for scaling up: Many entrepreneurs fail to plan for the future when it comes to scaling up their business. It is important to have a plan in place to ensure that you can keep up with demand as your business grows. 6. Lack of marketing: Marketing is essential for any business but many entrepreneurs don't invest enough in it. Without proper marketing, you won't be able to get your product or service out there and attract customers.

CSS linear gradients get washed out and muddy in the middle unless steps are taken to avoid the effect. This article teaches developers how to avoid the gray dead zone of linear gradients by using the following steps: 1. Define your gradient stops. A gradient stop is a color that marks the beginning and end points of the gradient. Gradient stops should be defined in percentages to ensure that the gradient looks consistent across different browsers. 2. Use fewer stops. Too many stops can lead to muddy gradients. To avoid this, use fewer stops and spread them further apart. This will help create a smoother effect. 3. Increase the contrast between stops. By increasing the contrast between stops, you can create a more vibrant and visually appealing gradient. 4. Make sure there are no overlapping stops. Overlapping stops can cause unexpected results. To prevent this from happening, make sure all stops are evenly spaced apart. 5. Use a greater range of hues. Utilizing a wide range of hues can help create a more dynamic gradient. 6. Add a subtle texture. Adding a subtle texture to your gradient can help give it a more natural and realistic look.

Amazon plans to add a fuel and inflation surcharge to the fees it collects from US third-party sellers who use its fulfillment services. The new fee will go into effect on April 1, 2021. The surcharge will be calculated based on the US fuel index and consumer price index (CPI) and will vary by region. Sellers will be notified of the exact amount of the surcharge through their account dashboard. Amazon said that it will adjust the surcharge each month to ensure that it adequately covers its costs associated with providing the service.

OctoSQL is a query engine that can write standard SQL queries on data stored in multiple databases, NoSQL databases, and files in various formats. If a data source doesn't support the SQL language, OctoSQL can automatically generate a query in the native query language. It can also aggregate and join data from multiple sources into one result. OctoSQL is designed to be modular and extensible with plugins for different data sources and output formats. It supports a wide range of databases and file formats such as CSV, JSON, Excel, Parquet, and many others. Furthermore, OctoSQL allows for custom functions to be written for complex operations. OctoSQL is an open-source tool and can be used for free. It's built on top of Apache Arrow which enables faster execution times and better resource utilization. This makes it an ideal choice for large datasets and complex queries.

Zoox recently published a video showing its autonomous system driving for an hour in downtown San Francisco. The video is available in the article. A safety driver was behind the wheel for the entire duration of the drive. The video shows Zoox's autonomous system driving in downtown San Francisco for an hour with a safety driver behind the wheel. The vehicle navigates through traffic, detects and responds to pedestrians and cyclists, and obeys traffic laws. Zoox also demonstrated its ability to recognize construction zones, lane merges, and other situations that require caution. The company says its technology is designed to be both safe and efficient.

Follow is a new feature in Google Chrome that displays an RSS reader on the New Tab page. Users will see a Follow button in the overflow menu, which adds the current website to their list of feeds. Once added, users will be able to read the content from the website directly on their New Tab page. Follow also adds stories from other sources that the user has subscribed to, giving them access to a wider range of content than ever before. The feature is designed to help users stay up-to-date with their favorite topics and websites without having to switch tabs or windows.

Many people claim that there are no use cases for crypto, but they're wrong. This article discusses the many different use cases for crypto. Crypto is successful at being money. It provides a payment system that is fast, secure, and borderless. It's also used for storing value. Crypto can also be used to buy and sell goods and services, as well as to trade in financial markets. Crypto can also be used as collateral in loans and other financial instruments. Additionally, crypto can be used to facilitate crowdfunding and tokenization, as well as to create smart contracts and decentralized applications (dApps). Lastly, crypto can be used to protect user identities and data by providing secure authentication and encryption.

While plants might look like peaceful, passive victims of the world, they actually spend a lot of energy fighting to stay alive. When an insect bites a leaf, the leaf releases an enzyme that can kill the pest. Some plants are equipped with a defense system of thorns and prickles, which prevents animals from eating them. Plants also compete with each other for resources like sunlight and water by growing taller or spreading their roots wider. Furthermore, some plants have evolved to produce toxins that make them inedible to predators. All these measures help plants survive in their environment.

A new pill has been developed that could replace the need for external injections. The pill was developed to replace the need to inject insulin externally by deploying a spring-loaded needle that injects the drug directly into the stomach. The pill is currently in the early stages of development and is scheduled to be tested in clinical trials in the near future. The potential benefits of this new pill are immense. For people with diabetes, it would mean a more convenient way to maintain their blood sugar levels without the need for painful daily injections. It could also reduce stress associated with having to constantly monitor their insulin levels. Additionally, the pill may make it easier for people who have difficulty administering injections, such as children or those with disabilities. Finally, if successful, this new pill could potentially eliminate the cost and inconvenience associated with purchasing or storing external insulin injections.

Starlink's mobile app was the most downloaded application from the Apple App Store in Ukraine on Sunday. The app has tripled its global downloads over the past two weeks. It is designed to provide users with internet access, even in places where there is no cellular coverage. The app uses a network of satellites to provide users with high-speed internet connectivity. Starlink's mobile app is available for both Apple and Android devices.

Stanford Pupper is a robot designed to help students get involved with robotics research. It costs around 600-900 to build, depending on if you already own existing tools or parts, and can be used to teach beginners about robotics, engineering, and programming. It is equipped with a range of sensors and actuators to help it interact with the world around it. Stanford Pupper also comes with a variety of software tools that allow users to program it and control its behavior. Additionally, the robot has an open-source architecture, allowing users to build upon the existing designs and create their own custom robots.

Synthetic wavelength holography is a new non-line-of-sight method that can rapidly capture full-field images of large areas with submillimeter precision. The method has endless potential applications, including noninvasive medical imaging, autonomous navigation, and surveillance. It is based on the principles of wavelength holography, which uses a combination of light source and detectors to capture data at multiple wavelengths. The data is then combined to create an image of the scene that can be used to identify objects and their locations. Synthetic wavelength holography has the potential to revolutionize many industries, as it provides a more efficient, accurate, and cost-effective way to capture images.

I was looking around for a good React component library to use for the TLDR website, when I stumbled upon this excellent curated list. It has a fairly comprehensive list of component libraries and frameworks, along with detailed reviews and opinions from users. It looks like a great resource to help me choose the best library for my project.

This library contains tools, methodologies, and resources for integrating security throughout the entire IT lifecycle. In a DevSecOps Model, security is integrated as early as possible in the lifecycle of information systems, and is a key factor in the success of any system. The library includes tools such as secure coding frameworks and libraries, automated security testing tools, threat detection and analytics platforms, secure configuration management tools, and more. The resources also cover topics such as compliance and security best practices, incident response processes, and secure software development lifecycle (SDLC) methods. Additionally, the library provides guidance on how to integrate security into DevOps workflows, optimize security operations, and more.

According to internal Amazon documents, Amazon is preparing to release a wrist-worn device that is supposed to be able to read human emotions. The voice-activated wristband will determine the state of a person's emotions and will be able to alert people when their feelings are out of balance. The device is said to use sensors, microphones, and artificial intelligence (AI) to measure and analyze a person's emotional state. It is unclear whether the device will be available commercially or if it will be used for internal research purposes only.

NASA scientists discovered cyclopropenylidene in the atmosphere of Saturn's moon Titan. The simple, carbon-based molecule has never been seen in an atmosphere before. Titan has long been considered one of the most Earth-like places in our solar system, and the discovery of this molecule is further evidence that its atmosphere is quite similar to Earth's. Cyclopropenylidene is an important molecule for understanding Titan because it helps scientists understand the environment and chemistry of the moon's atmosphere.
