It has been theorized that cyclopropenylidene could be used as a precursor for more complex molecules, such as polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons (PAHs). PAHs are molecules that are present in interstellar dust and have been associated with the origin of life on Earth. By studying the presence of cyclopropenylidene in Titan's atmosphere, scientists can gain more insight into the potential for prebiotic chemistry in the outer solar system.

Scientists can manipulate dreams using an app combined with a sleep-tracking device called Dormio. In a recent study, the researchers inserted certain topics into a person's dreams using the technique. The researchers used the app to play audio recordings at specific times during sleep cycles. The content of the audio would depend on the desired dream topics. For example, if the study was on fear, the audio played might include explosions or other frightening sounds. The sleep-tracking device Dormio is worn overnight by participants in the study. It records brainwaves and other physiological data, which helps scientists determine when the person is entering REM sleep. This is the stage of sleep where most dreaming occurs. When the desired sleep stage is reached, the app plays a cue sound such as a tone or a voice command. This cues the participant that they should begin dreaming about the desired topics. The dream manipulation technique has been effective in studies of fear, memory, and creativity. While the results are promising, more research needs to be done before this method can be used in clinical settings.

The advertising industry is turning to technology that can seamlessly insert computer-generated images, so items can be digitally added to almost any movie or TV show. UK advertising business Mirriad has developed a technology that can scan for brand logos and product placements in video content and automatically insert a digital version of an advertiser's product into the scene. For example, a soda can be digitally added to a character's hand or a billboard can be inserted into a background scene. This technology helps advertisers get their message to consumers without disrupting the viewer experience. It also allows brands to appear in content they wouldn't have access to otherwise.

Nvidia has used a new Generative Adversarial Network (GAN) to create a neural network that can generate an unlimited number of high-quality, realistic faces. A GAN works by having one network (the generator) generate data that looks real, while another network (the discriminator) tries to detect which data is generated and which is real. The two networks then work together to improve the generation of realistic faces. Nvidia has used this technology to create a library of thousands of high-quality synthetic faces that can be used for various applications such as deepfake detection, facial recognition, computer vision tasks and more.

Etsy House is an interactive augmented reality experience that lets shoppers tour a virtual home decorated with items from the Etsy marketplace. The house features true-to-scale renderings and 360-degree imagery, allowing users to explore each room from any angle. With voice commands, shoppers can browse featured Etsy items and virtually place them within the house. Shoppers can then purchase selected items directly from the mobile app.

An eight-year-old has discovered a way around her Apple Screen Time limits by using the iMessage App store. By accessing YouTube through the iMessage App store, the girl was able to bypass the Screen Time limits imposed by her parents. The parents should contact Apple directly to see what sort of solutions they can offer to prevent this loophole from being used. They may also want to consider using a third party software that offers more robust parental control options. Additionally, they should speak with their daughter and explain why these limits have been set and that it is important for her to follow them. Finally, they should check in with her periodically to ensure she is following the rules.

Physicists from the University of Iowa have discovered a new type of aurora in a nearly two-decade-old video. Diffuse auroral erasers are a part of the background-like glow of auroras and are caused by electrons hitting the atmosphere from above. The researchers found that these erasers were much more frequent than previously thought, and could be seen in videos of auroras taken from Earth's surface. This discovery could help scientists better understand how energy is transferred between particles in the atmosphere and ultimately help them better predict space weather.

In Part 1, when comparing the uses of Kafka vs MQTT, we concluded that in a basic publish-and-subscribe model of an IoT device, Kafka might be overkill. However, we also noted that when dealing with more complicated architectures, Kafka may be the better option. In Part 2, we looked at how Kafka and MQTT can be used together to create a more robust architecture for an IoT device. We concluded that this combination of technologies can provide a powerful platform that offers scalability, reliability, and security. Furthermore, this technology stack can be tailored to meet the needs of any particular use case. In conclusion, both Kafka and MQTT have their own strengths and weaknesses. Depending on the requirements of your specific application, it might be best to use either one or the other, or a combination of both.

Google has discontinued the Pixel 3A and 3A XL smartphones. It is now listed as out of stock on the Google Store. Other stores may still have remaining stock. A successor to the Pixel 3A and 3A XL, the Pixel 4a was announced on August 3, 2020.

France is building a nuclear-powered aircraft carrier to replace its Charles de Gaulle carrier by 2038. According to French President Emmanuel Macron, the decision is part of France's climate strategy, as nuclear ships are more fuel-efficient than those powered by conventional fossil fuels. The new carrier, which will be named the Richelieu, is expected to be twice the size of the current Charles de Gaulle and reportedly cost nearly 5 billion (6.1 billion). It will be built by a consortium of French companies and is expected to have a displacement of up to 75,000 tonnes. The Richelieu will be equipped with a next-generation nuclear propulsion system and advanced combat capabilities, including an onboard air defence system. It will also have a crew of 1,250 sailors and will be able to carry up to 40 aircraft.

This Hacker News thread discusses how to attract applications from senior talent and what can be done to increase attractiveness to potential employees. The top suggestions from the thread include: 1. Make sure you offer competitive compensation and benefits packages. 2. Showcase a strong company culture and worklife balance. 3. Highlight professional development opportunities. 4. Emphasize your commitment to diversity and inclusion. 5. Demonstrate that you value employees' input and feedback. 6. Focus on long-term career growth potential. 7. Offer flexible working arrangements. 8. Create an attractive office environment. 9. Promote team building activities. 10. Invest in learning and development initiatives.

NASA's Parker Solar Probe has captured images of Venus' surface. Venus' surface is blocked by a thick atmosphere, which makes it hard to take pictures of. However, the surface is still visible when using special instruments such as the Wide-Field Imager on the Parker Solar Probe. The probe has also been able to capture images of Venus' clouds, which are composed of sulphuric acid, as well as its poles and day side. The pictures reveal features such as mountains, volcanoes, and other geological features. These images help scientists learn more about the planet and its atmosphere.

Scan is a feature on Snapchat that allows users to get more information on objects around them. Snap launched the feature last year at its Partner Summit. New features for Scan include improved object recognition, new categories, and the ability to view more information about an object. With Scan, users can point their camera at objects like books, artwork, buildings, and more to get detailed information about them. Snap also allows users to follow interests related to the object they scanned, which will bring up related content in the Snapchat feed.

The ACLU polled the 20 biggest brick and mortar retailers in the US last year and only one said they did not routinely photograph customers. Walmart admitted to testing facial recognition technology, but did not confirm if it was actively used in stores. Walmart is the only retailer of the 20 biggest brick and mortar retailers in the US that said they do not routinely photograph customers. Walmart has tested facial recognition technology, but did not confirm if it is actively used in stores.

This article discusses WebAssembly and its possible future applications. WebAssembly is an intermediate layer between various programming languages and many different execution environments. It can be used to run code from many different languages in the same environment, as well as compile code more quickly and efficiently than traditional methods. WebAssembly is currently being used in web browsers, video game engines, and other applications, but its potential for use in the future goes far beyond that. Possible uses include enabling high-performance machine learning, creating distributed applications across multiple environments, and even running entire operating systems within a browser. WebAssembly also has the potential to be used to create virtualized hardware, allowing users to run applications or services on machines they do not own. By making it easier to move code between platforms, WebAssembly could revolutionize the way code is shared and developed, potentially opening up new opportunities for developers and users alike.

MasterCard has signed a deal with cryptocurrency firm Bakkt to make crypto options available to merchants and banks across its payments network. Banks on the network will be able to accept cryptocurrencies as payments from customers and merchants, while merchants will be able to transact with cryptocurrency payments from customers. The partnership is part of MasterCard's larger effort to further explore digital asset payments. The collaboration between Bakkt and MasterCard represents an important step towards greater adoption of digital asset payments. This partnership will make it easier for merchants and banks to accept crypto payments, which could spur more widespread consumer adoption of cryptocurrencies. By allowing merchants to accept crypto payments, the partnership could provide a major boost to the industry. Additionally, the integration of cryptocurrencies into the MasterCard network will bring more transparency to the payments ecosystem and improve the security of digital payments.

Researchers from Columbia University have established a method for growing human hair in a dish using 3D printing without the need for implantation into human skin. The method uses a combination of stem cells from human scalp tissue, 3D printing technology and a hydrogel scaffold to generate human hair follicles. The team used a 3D printer to create the structure of the follicle, which was then filled with the stem cells and a hydrogel. The follicle was then placed in an incubator to encourage its growth. The results showed that the method was successful in generating new hair follicles and strands of hair. The researchers believe that the technique could be used to treat hair loss in humans in the future. They suggest it could also be used to generate hair for cosmetic purposes.

Scientists from the University of Southern California were able to visualize memories forming in the brains of genetically modified zebrafish in the lab. The team expected the brains to form similar patterns of neural activity during memory formation as those seen in mammals. The scientists used a technique called optogenetics to genetically modify the zebrafish so they could control the brain activity of individual neurons with light. Then, they used this technique to observe how different patterns of neuronal activity were linked to the formation of memories. The results showed that the brains of the zebrafish formed memories in a way that was strikingly similar to what has been observed in mammalian brains. This suggests that the fundamental principles of memory formation are deeply conserved across species. The findings could help inform our understanding of how memories form and provide insight into potential treatments for neurological disorders like Alzheimer's disease.

StoreDot, an Israeli company, has developed car batteries capable of fully charging in five minutes. The batteries can be mass-produced on standard production lines. StoreDot has so far raised 130 million dollars in investment, and plans to begin mass production of the batteries by 2022. The development of these car batteries is an exciting breakthrough in the automotive industry. With fully charged batteries capable of being produced on standard production lines, cars will no longer be limited by long charging times. StoreDot's investment signals that the technology is ready for large-scale adoption and could revolutionize the way we power our vehicles. In addition, the batteries are designed to be cheaper than current lithium-ion batteries, making them more cost-effective for consumers. This innovation could help reduce global emissions, as more people switch to electric cars powered by these batteries.

The Windows Calculator app ships pre-installed with Windows. It is written in C and provides standard, scientific, and programmer calculator functionality. Calculator is also able to do measurement and currency conversions, and includes a graphing mode. The Calculator app can be found under Windows Accessories in the start menu of Windows 10. It is available for free on the Microsoft Store for any version of Windows from 7 to 10.

Apple has released the iOS 13.1 beta, weeks before its September 10th event where it is expected to announce the iPhone 11 to the world. The early beta release may be an indication that the company is on track to release its next version of iOS on September 10th, alongside the new iPhones. The iOS 13.1 beta includes a handful of bug fixes and performance improvements that weren't included in the initial version of iOS 13. It also brings back iOS' "Shortcuts" app, which had been removed from iOS 13. The update also includes a new feature called "Audio Sharing," which allows two sets of AirPods to be connected to the same iPhone or iPad. The release of the beta suggests that Apple may be close to releasing the final version of iOS 13, likely alongside its upcoming iPhone 11 models. If true, this would mean that users could expect to get their hands on the new software as early as September 10th.

The Facility for Rare Isotope Beams aims to create thousands of isotopes never before recorded on Earth. There are 285 isotopes of elements that exist on Earth, but there are an estimated 2,000 that have yet to be discovered and created. The Facility will use intense beams of particles to create isotopes that cannot be found in nature. These rare isotopes can then be studied to gain a better understanding of the fundamental properties of matter and the universe. By studying these new elements, scientists can learn more about our world and the origins of life. Additionally, some of the rare isotopes produced at the Facility could be used in medical treatments and other applications.

SpaceX has successfully fired up Super Heavy, the largest rocket booster in the world. Booster 3 was completed around July 1 and it passed its first cryogenic proof test on July 6. The test involved Super Heavy undergoing a "hot fire" or static fire test, where all 27 of its Raptor engines were lit up at once for the first time. This was an important step towards SpaceX's goal of sending humans and satellites to space. Future tests will involve more complex maneuvers such as controlling the engine gimbals and testing the flight control surfaces. After proving that Super Heavy is capable of flying, SpaceX will move on to testing an integrated system with Starship, the spacecraft it plans to use to transport people and cargo to the Moon and Mars.

Beartype is a pure-Python PEP-compliant constant-time runtime type checker. It brings static typing to Python while still preserving the permissive benefits of duck typing. Beartype can be used to assure the correctness of function parameters and return types at runtime, without sacrificing Python's dynamic nature. It is designed to be used as a library in existing applications, and can be integrated with existing testing frameworks such as Pytest. Beartype leverages type hints introduced in Python 3.5 to validate input types and return types for functions. Beartype enables developers to validate their code quickly at runtime, allowing them to catch errors before they reach production. It also provides static analysis tools to identify potential type issues and help developers find code smells. Finally, it allows developers to write more expressive code by making type annotations explicit.

Samsung's Exynos 2200 is a new in-house mobile processor that implements a GPU with AMD's RDNA 2 graphics architecture, enabling features like hardware-accelerated ray tracing. Samsung and AMD first announced the collaboration in December 2020, and the processor is expected to power future Samsung flagship devices. The Exynos 2200 features an 8-core ARM Cortex-A78 CPU and six efficient cores based on ARM's new Cortex-X1 architecture. The GPU also supports up to 16GB of LPDDR5 RAM and a maximum display resolution of 3200x1800. Additionally, the Exynos 2200 includes support for 5G networks and Wi-Fi 6E.

Android 10 will start rolling out to devices starting with the Pixel phones, including the Pixel 1. The update will include fully gestural navigation, full support for a dark mode, improved privacy and security, a new way to manage notifications, and many other improvements. Other devices may receive the update at different times, depending on their manufacturer.

Reddit Talk is a new social audio product that allows subreddit moderators to start Clubhouse-like Talks. While moderators will have control over who can speak in the sessions, anybody on Reddit can join the Talk and listen. During the Talk, moderators can moderate the conversation in real time, ensure conversations stay on topic, and even allow for QA sessions with the audience. Additionally, moderators can also record their Talks to make them available for later listening. Talk is currently in its early stages, but it has the potential to be a powerful tool for moderators to engage with their communities and have meaningful conversations. It could also help create a more diverse and inclusive community since users from all backgrounds would be able to participate. In addition, Talks could be used to host public events or panel discussions related to specific topics. As Talk continues to develop, the possibilities are endless.

England's Chester Zoo and a tissue bank called Nature's SAFE have partnered up to cryogenically freeze genetic material from animals that pass away at the zoo. The preserved material could be used to help revive the species if needed in the future. The partnership between Chester Zoo and Nature's SAFE will help ensure that important genetic material from endangered animals is not lost forever. The tissue bank will store the frozen material from zoo animals, which could be used in the future to help conserve species and restore populations. It is hoped that this initiative will provide a valuable tool for conservationists and scientists who are working to protect endangered species. The partnership also aims to promote research into animal health, genetics, and breeding programs.

Seattle Startup Zin Boats creates electric boats that can go a hundred miles or more and recharge using an ordinary wall plug. The boats require virtually no maintenance and can be used in any body of water. They feature a sleek design and come in three sizes: small, medium, and large. The boats are perfect for recreational use or fishing trips, as they are easy to maneuver and do not require a fuel tank. Zin Boats also offers safety features such as emergency stop switches and automatic shutoff when the boat enters shallow waters.

The Perturb-seq map is the first comprehensive functional map of genes that are expressed in human cells. The data is available for any scientist to use. It allows scientists to study gene expression in a wide variety of conditions, including those where perturbations such as drugs or environmental factors are applied. The data is based on single-cell sequencing of human cell lines and includes information about gene expression, metabolic pathways, and other cellular functions. Perturb-seq can be used to identify new therapeutic targets, understand how different drugs or treatments affect gene expression, and identify potential biomarkers for disease. In addition, it has the potential to provide insight into how cells respond to changes in their environment.

Uber's apps are available on iOS, Android, and the web, which means that they need to be written three times and usually by different developers. This requires time and careful coordination to ensure that all versions of the app are bug-free and offer a consistent user experience across platforms.

Houthi rebels have claimed responsibility for an attack that caused fires at a major oil processing facility and nearby oil field in Saudi Arabia. 10 drones were involved in the attack, according to the group. The attack was widely condemned by the international community, with the United Nations calling for a full and immediate investigation. The United States also condemned the attack and offered its support for Saudi Arabia in responding to the attack. US Secretary of State Mike Pompeo said that the attack "demonstrates the complexity of the regional security environment and the need to address threats from all sources."

Ice cream develops a crunchy texture if left out of the freezer for too long due to overly large ice crystals. Scientists from the University of Tennessee have developed a method of controlling the size of ice crystals in ice cream, which helps to reduce the occurrence of this problem. The process involves rapid cooling and slow freezing, which limits the growth of large ice crystals. This technology has been adopted by many commercial ice cream makers, making it easier for consumers to enjoy a creamy texture from their frozen treats.

Twitter is laying off 30 of its talent-acquisition team. The company suspended hiring in May to shave costs. Twitter executives are restructuring the company to align with business needs. Elon Musk, the CEO of Tesla and SpaceX, said that the layoffs were necessary to maintain financial stability. Twitter has been struggling financially due to decreasing user engagement and revenue growth. The layoffs are a way for the company to become more efficient and focus on its core products and services. Twitter is hoping that streamlining its operations will help it better compete with rivals such as Facebook and Snapchat.

Lemonadejs is a super lightweight vanilla javascript micro-library that helps with the integration between JavaScript and HTML. It supports two-way binding and integrates natively with Jsuites to make it easy to create custom components. It supports all modern browsers and is extremely light weight, making it perfect for mobile and web applications. Lemonadejs also provides a wide range of plugins to help with development.

Earth Day's 50th anniversary is on April 22. Originally, events were planned for the big day, but the movement has now been forced online. Organizers have planned a three-day live-streamed event for April 22-24 with talks, music, and other activities. The goal is to bring together people from all over the world to celebrate Earth Day's 50th anniversary and to share important environmental messages. The theme of this year's Earth Day is "climate action." It is a call to action for individuals, communities, corporations, and governments to take urgent steps to protect the planet from the devastating effects of climate change. Earth Day organizers also want to emphasize the importance of green jobs, clean energy, and sustainable development. In addition to the live stream, people are encouraged to join in on social media by taking part in Earth Day activities such as planting trees, organizing beach cleanups, or participating in virtual marches. People can also support environmental causes by supporting green businesses or donating to charities that are working to protect the environment.

This article talks about the experience of a solo developer who decided to offer phone support for a couple of their apps in Japan. As the user base was small, the developer thought it would be a good idea to offer phone support in order to build better relationships with their users. The developer started by offering free phone support for each app, but soon found that providing this was unsustainable. To offset the cost of their phone service, the developer began charging a fee for premium support. This fee was based on the amount of time a user needed help or the complexity of the issue they were experiencing. The developer also found it important to differentiate between "basic" and "premium" customers. Basic customers received standard support via email or chat while premium customers were given priority access to the phone line. The developer also tracked customer response times and made sure to respond quickly to any issue raised. The experience was a success for the developer. By offering premium support, they were able to build closer relationships with their customers and ensure that their apps were always running smoothly. They also gained valuable knowledge about their users, which enabled them to improve the quality of their products. In addition, the fees earned from their premium support service helped to cover the cost of providing phone support. Overall, offering phone support can be an effective way for solo developers to build stronger relationships with their customers and provide high-quality support. However, it is important to carefully consider how to structure the service in order to ensure it is sustainable and profitable.

An astrophotographer has released several highly detailed images of the sun stitched together from 1,500,000 individual pictures. It was captured using a modified telescope that uses two telescopic filters, one to block out light from the sun's visible spectrum and one to allow for infrared and ultraviolet. The images provide a unique view of the sun, allowing scientists to observe the sun's activity and monitor changes in its atmosphere over time. This data can help us better understand the sun's behavior and how it affects Earth and other planets in our solar system.

Anker has announced a 3D printer that can print five times faster than its competition. The AnkerMake M5 comes with a webcam that can monitor and record prints. It prints with PLA and ABS filaments in a range of resolutions from 0.1mm to 0.4mm, and is compatible with all major slicing software. AnkerMake M5 has an enclosed build chamber for enhanced safety and temperature control. It also features a touchscreen interface and automated bed leveling for easy setup. Finally, the printer is equipped with a filament run-out detection system that pauses the print job when the filament runs out.

This repository contains a curated list of libraries for a faster machine learning workflow. The list is divided into the different phases of machine learning development, and then further broken down into categories. The list includes libraries for data analysis, pre-processing, feature engineering, model building, evaluation, and deployment. Each library has a brief description of its purpose, along with a link to the library's website or documentation. This list is intended to help machine learning practitioners quickly find the right library or tool for their needs.

Samsung has only just announced their Galaxy Fold phone, but they're already working on concepts and designs based on the feedback that they're receiving from their first foldable device. Two new prototypes have been leaked that could hint at a new Samsung folding phone. The two devices feature a clamshell design, with a large display on the outside and a smaller display when closed. Both phones also feature a rear camera and volume buttons on the side. It's unclear if these devices will ever make it to market, but it's exciting to see where Samsung is taking their foldable device technology.

The James Webb Space Telescope (JWST) is set to launch on Halloween this year, after decades of careful planning and development. It will travel from Earth to a gravitational eddy known as the second Lagrange point, located 1 million miles away from Earth. Once there, it will be able to observe the universe in wavelengths of light that are invisible to current telescopes, such as infrared and near-infrared radiation. The telescope will have a 6.5 meter mirror, which is more than seven times larger than the Hubble Space Telescope. This will allow it to see further into space and provide much sharper images. Additionally, its location at the second Lagrange point will give it an unobstructed view of the cosmos. The JWST is an ambitious project that promises to revolutionize our understanding of the universe. It will be capable of examining the first stars and galaxies that formed after the Big Bang, observing exoplanets, and analyzing the atmospheres of distant planets. It could also help us better understand dark matter, dark energy, and the mysterious phenomenon of black holes. By providing us with more data and insight into these phenomena, the JWST could play a crucial role in advancing our knowledge of the universe.

Gridsort sorts data by storing it in a simplified binary cube, which offers excellent cache utilization. It is a simplified implementation of cubesort. Benchmarks and visualizations are available. Gridsort is an efficient sorting algorithm that takes advantage of the spatial locality of memory to improve cache utilization and reduce the number of comparisons needed. It works by creating a simplified binary cube data structure, where each cell in the cube corresponds to a value in the array to be sorted. The cube is then traversed in a top-down fashion, and cells are compared to their neighbors to determine which ones should be sorted. This process continues until the entire array is sorted. Gridsort is typically faster than traditional sorting algorithms such as quicksort and merge sort, and it is particularly well suited for sorting large data sets.

SpaceX's SN3 prototype experienced a structural failure while undergoing the same cryptogenic proof test that killed the previous two Starship prototypes. The test involves filling the vehicle's fuel tanks to the point of rupture, which triggers an explosive decompression. SpaceX has not yet provided an official explanation for the failure of SN3, though CEO Elon Musk has stated that it appeared to be related to a production error. The company is conducting further tests and analysis to determine the cause of the incident.

36,000 startups have used LTSE Equity to build their cap table. Flexible, fast onboarding. No hidden pricing. Understand how to build a cap table with our public demo and start your journey today. The Long-Term Stock Exchange (LTSE) provides a comprehensive equity platform to help startups build and manage their cap table. Our platform is designed to reduce complexity and make it easy for founders to track and manage their equity. We provide fast, secure onboarding and flexible pricing that is transparent and easy to understand. With the LTSE Equity Platform, startups can quickly set up their cap table, issue shares, and securely manage their equity data. Get started building your cap table today with our public demo.

Shopify has launched around 100 new features for customers interested in social commerce, local shopping offers, cryptocurrency, B2B selling, and more. The new features are part of a semi-annual product release cycle and are designed to make the Shopify platform easier and more efficient for merchants. The new features include: 1. Social Commerce: Merchants can now add social media accounts such as Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter to their Shopify stores and connect with customers directly from the Shopify dashboard. They can also create special offers and promotions to drive sales through their social media channels. 2. Local Shopping Offers: Merchants can now offer local customers exclusive discounts and promotions, allowing them to support their local businesses while still saving money on their purchases. 3. Cryptocurrency: Merchants can now accept payments in cryptocurrency through Shopify's integrated payment processor, Shopify Payments. 4. B2B Selling: Merchants can now set up a dedicated B2B store on Shopify that is tailored to the specific needs of their business customers. This includes custom pricing, discounts, and order management tools that are tailored to their B2B clients. 5. Enhanced Store Performance: Shopify has improved its platform performance, making it faster and more reliable for both merchants and customers. The platform now supports faster loading times, better search engine optimization, and improved security. 6. AI-Powered Product Suggestions: Shopify's AI-powered product suggestion feature helps merchants tailor their product recommendations to each customer's individual interests. 7. Improved Mobile App Experience: Shopify's mobile app has been redesigned with a streamlined interface, making it easier and faster to manage your store on the go. 8. Enhanced Analytics and Reporting: Shopify now offers advanced analytics and reporting tools so merchants can get real-time insights into their store performance and make data-driven decisions.

Clocking into work every day can result in a vague sense of dissatisfaction when the work doesn't seem meaningful. This article discusses four different ways to ignite motivation for work. The first is to establish clear goals and objectives. This will help create a sense of purpose and direction in the work. Secondly, take responsibility for your own progress and performance. Be proactive in achieving goals and taking on new challenges. Thirdly, find ways to make work more enjoyable. Look for creative opportunities to add fun to the job or set aside time for breaks throughout the day. Lastly, focus on the bigger picture. Try to remember why you chose this job and how it fits into your larger plans and goals.

Many things can be done to make animals live longer, even though we don't know exactly why these things work. These can include changing diets, taking certain drugs, or special supplements. Diet modifications can include increasing the amount of fresh fruits and vegetables in an animal's diet, reducing the amount of processed food, or providing an appropriate balance of proteins, carbohydrates, and fats. Drugs that are sometimes prescribed to extend an animal's life include thyroid hormone, anti-inflammatory medications, and antioxidants. Special supplements such as omega 3 fatty acids, probiotics, and glucosamine may also be beneficial. To make sure animals live longer, it is important to regularly visit a veterinarian for checkups, administer vaccinations, and provide regular exercise.

Easy OCR is a package for detecting text in images. It supports 42 languages, including Chinese, Japanese, Korean, and Thai. Examples and a list of supported languages are available in the documentation. Easy OCR uses a combination of computer vision and machine learning algorithms to detect text from images. It is designed to be easy to use, with straightforward API calls and minimal setup required. The package can be used for applications such as document recognition, invoice processing, and form data extraction.

Apple's App Store had it's biggest week ever with 1.22 billion in sales between Christmas Eve and New Year's Eve. It then had it's biggest day ever on New Year's Day with 322 million in purchases. This was a record-breaking week and day for the App Store, as these figures represent a 16 increase in spending over the same period last year. The App Store's success is due to the increasing popularity of mobile gaming, which accounted for nearly half of the spending during this period. Games such as Among Us, Roblox, and Call of Duty: Mobile all saw huge increases in downloads and sales. Additionally, Apple Arcade, Apple's subscription gaming service, had its biggest week ever with 60 percent more subscribers than the same time last year. The App Store also benefited from its holiday promotions, including the "Apps We Love" campaign, which highlighted popular apps and games. These promotions drove increased downloads and boosted sales for the App Store. Overall, Apple's App Store had a successful week and day, setting records for both total sales and individual days. This is a testament to the continued growth of the mobile gaming industry and the effectiveness of Apple's promotions. It will be interesting to see if the App Store can maintain its momentum into 2021.

MIT has released a 7-minute video that shows President Richard Nixon delivering an Apollo 11 contingency speech. It took the team at MIT more than half a year to create the video, which is a computer generated animation. The team used archival audio recordings of Nixon's speech and combined them with 3D elements to create the animation. The video depicts Nixon in his office giving the speech he would have given if the Apollo 11 mission had gone wrong. The animation shows him delivering the speech in front of a wall of windows that looks out onto the White House Rose Garden. The animation also features an animated version of Secretary of State William P. Rogers standing by the President's side. The video was released in honor of the 50th anniversary of the Apollo 11 moon landing. It serves as a reminder of the risks taken by the pioneering astronauts who risked their lives for the advancement of science and humanity. By creating this animation, MIT has provided us all with a chance to appreciate the courage and sacrifice of the Apollo 11 crew.

Cana has unveiled a drink machine that can synthesize almost any drink. The machine uses a cartridge that contains flavor compounds that can be combined to create the flavor of any drink. The machine also uses a proprietary algorithm to precisely mix the flavor compounds to match the desired taste. The company says that the machine can replicate almost any commercial drink, from soft drinks to alcoholic beverages. It can even create custom-flavored drinks with just a few simple inputs. The machine is the first of its kind and could revolutionize the way people enjoy drinks.

This project implements a backend for sql.js that treats IndexedDB like a disk and stores data in blocks there. It makes the sqlite3 database persistent in a way where it can be used as a single file. The project is written in JavaScript and uses the IndexedDB API to create and manage the database. It also provides an API for accessing and manipulating the data stored in the database. The API is designed to be compatible with the sqlite3 API, so that existing applications can easily migrate to this new storage system. The project also includes a command-line interface (CLI) for interacting with the database and a web interface for visualizing the data stored in the database. This project is useful for applications that require persistent storage, but don't have access to traditional databases or need a more compact storage solution. It is also useful for applications that need to store large amounts of data, such as IoT devices.

Over the weekend, the Ikea at Harajuku in Tokyo hosted an installation starring Imma, a virtual influencer. People who passed by the first floor of the store were able to take photos with Imma, who appeared in the form of a hologram. The installation was part of Ikea's new campaign, "Designing Life Together," which encourages people to come together and create a better future. The campaign also features real-life influencers like Japanese model Kiko Mizuhara, who helped promote the event on her social media channels. At the installation, visitors could interact with Imma and ask her questions about design, the environment, and living sustainably. She also shared sustainability tips and encouraged people to think about how their choices can help shape the world for the better. Imma, who was created by Tokyo-based technology company XR Studio, has become popular as a virtual influencer in Japan since her launch in 2020. This was her first public appearance using a hologram, and it drew a lot of attention from both locals and tourists alike. It's clear that virtual influencers like Imma are becoming increasingly popular and accepted in mainstream culture. As more companies realize the potential of this type of technology, we can expect to see more collaborations between brands and virtual influencers in the near future.

Facebook and Ray-Ban's Wayfarer Stories smart glasses are now available for purchase in the US, UK, Italy, Australia, Ireland, and Canada. The 299 glasses can record photos and 30-second videos , and also share them on social media platforms. The glasses are equipped with a 13MP camera, Bluetooth connectivity, and dual microphones for recording audio. Additionally, the glasses can be used to activate certain apps on compatible devices and can connect to Facebook's augmented reality platform, Spark AR.

This is a really detailed illustrated flowchart for learning to become an expert web developer in 2018, starting from "Learn HTML" and going all the way through complex topics like "Deployment Hosting." Learn HTML V Learn CSS V Learn JavaScript V Learn Responsive Design V Learn jQuery V Learn Version Control V Learn Databases V Learn Server-Side Languages (e.g., PHP, Python, Ruby) V Learn Frameworks (e.g., Rails, Django, Laravel) V Learn Web Services (e.g., REST, SOAP) V Learn Security Authentication V Learn Integrating Third-Party APIs V Learn Testing Debugging V Learn Deployment Hosting

This article follows how a flaw was discovered and exploited in an internal test version of Google Cloud Deployment Manager. The flaw allowed requests to be issued to Google internal services that would normally be inaccessible. The flaw was initially discovered by a security researcher while testing the Google Cloud Deployment Manager (GCDM). GCDM is a service used to manage and deploy applications on Google Cloud Platform. Upon further investigation, the researcher noticed that requests were being allowed to internal Google services, which are normally inaccessible from outside of their network. This could potentially allow an attacker to gain access to sensitive information or even launch attacks against these internal services. To exploit this flaw, the researcher set up a malicious server that was able to issue requests to the Google internal services. After some testing, the researcher was able to successfully issue requests to the services, allowing them to access data and resources that would normally be inaccessible. Once the researcher had identified the flaw, they reported it to Google who then quickly patched the vulnerability. In response to the incident, Google also implemented additional security measures to prevent similar exploits in the future. This case serves as a reminder of the importance of maintaining secure systems, especially when dealing with cloud-based services. It also highlights the need for organizations to regularly monitor their systems for any suspicious activity, as well as have effective processes in place to respond quickly to any issues that arise.

Signal is testing a new peer-to-peer payment system in the UK called Signal Payments. The system uses MobileCoin, a cryptocurrency with a close relationship with Signal co-founder and CEO Moxie Marlinspike. The system is designed to allow users to easily and securely send money to each other, without the need for a third-party intermediary or a bank account. It is also designed to be fast, secure, and low cost.

Amazon has revealed two new robots at the re:MARS conference that are designed to move products around its warehouses. The Xanthus is an upgrade for Amazon's shelf-bots that will let the robots quickly scan shelves and pick items for orders, while the Pegasus is a larger robot that will move large items and pallets around the warehouses. Both robots are part of Amazon's effort to automate its warehouses and make them more efficient. The company has been investing heavily in robotics and automation to help reduce labor costs and speed up deliveries. It remains to be seen how successful they will be, but it's clear that Amazon is serious about using robots to improve its operations.

A new privacy feature in Firefox strips custom URL query parameters from URLs to prevent tracking. The Query Parameter Stripping feature automatically strips various query parameters from clicked links and from the URL bar. This new feature is designed to protect users' privacy by preventing third-party tracking companies from collecting data about users' browsing habits. Additionally, it can help prevent sites from using custom query parameters to track user activity on their site. For example, a website may have a unique query parameter added to each link that is clicked, allowing it to track which links are being clicked and thus build up a profile of the user's interests. The Query Parameter Stripping feature in Firefox prevents this kind of tracking by automatically stripping out any custom query parameters before the link is followed.

XRSpace will be launching its Mova virtual reality headset later this year. The device will sell for 599. It features 5G support, a hand tracking interface, and a virtual world that users can explore and interact with. It also has an integrated audio system and a high-resolution display. The headset will come with two controllers for immersive gaming experiences. Additionally, the headset can be used with a range of other VR accessories such as headsets and controllers from other brands.

The seahorse placenta is a fascinating example of convergent evolution. Male seahorses' brood pouches develop and function like human placentas. During pregnancy, the males provide embryos with everything they need. They use their placenta-like pouch to transport oxygen, hormones, and nutrients from the male to the embryo. The seahorse placenta is similar to human placentas in that it allows for direct transfer of materials between the parents and the offspring. However, unlike human placentas, the seahorse placenta also serves as a protective cocoon for the developing embryos. This provides an added layer of protection from predators and environmental conditions.

Mark Zuckerberg has highlighted four areas (data portability, election integrity, harmful content, and privacy) which he believes require regulation, in an op-ed published on March 30. He stated that a global framework should be established that allows people to easily transfer their data from one service to another. He also called for the enforcement of rules and standards to protect election integrity, prevent the spread of harmful content, and ensure the privacy of users' data. Additionally, he advocated for the implementation of artificial intelligence tools to detect and remove fake accounts and other malicious activity. Finally, he pledged to work with lawmakers to help craft legislation that addresses these issues.

Alexa will now be able to proactively act on Hunches thanks to its latest update. Amazon's device has been able to sense habits and ask about them since 2018, but now Alexa will be able to respond and take action when it recognizes a Hunches. This means that Alexa can start playing music, remind you of tasks, or even order food for you without you having to say a word.

Google will keep its 200,000 full-time and contract employees working remotely until at least July 2021. Sundar Pichai, CEO of Alphabet, made the announcement last week following a meeting with the company's executive team. Google had initially planned to reopen its offices in phases starting in June, but Pichai said the company will instead extend its remote work policy due to the ongoing pandemic. He also noted that while some employees may be able to return to the office in a limited capacity, Google is still encouraging most of its staff to work from home. The decision has received mixed reactions from Google employees and commentators. Some have argued that the extended period of remote work could lead to a decrease in productivity, while others have welcomed the announcement as it provides more flexibility for workers. Regardless, Google's move shows how deeply the pandemic has impacted workplace culture. As more companies embrace remote work, it remains to be seen if this trend will continue beyond 2021.

Samsung held its first Unpacked event of 2022 on Wednesday. It announced the Galaxy S22 Ultra, S22, and S22, the Galaxy Tab S8, Tab S8, and Tab S8 Ultra, and the Galaxy Buds Pro. The company also revealed its new Exynos 1200 processor and a range of new camera technologies for its flagship phones. In addition, Samsung unveiled improvements to its One UI interface, as well as an expanded partnership with Google that will make Android 12 available on all of its upcoming devices. Finally, the company showcased its new SmartTag Bluetooth tracking device.

Apple hit a 23 market share in China in Q4, 2021, thanks to the success of the iPhone 13. The new iPhone was a success due to its lower starting price, improved features, and larger screen size. Apple's market share was up from 15 in Q4 2020, reflecting the growth of the Chinese smartphone market and Apple's increasing popularity among Chinese consumers.

The Surface Duo is now available for pre-order and will ship on September 10. Microsoft will sell the dual-screen phone unlocked for 1,399. ATT will also stock the device. It will be available in two color options, icy black and glacier. The device features two 5.6-inch displays that can be used together or separately. It runs on the Android 10 operating system and is powered by a Qualcomm Snapdragon 855 processor. It has 6GB of RAM and up to 256GB of storage. It also has an 11MP main camera and an 8MP front-facing camera. It has a built-in fingerprint sensor and supports wireless charging.

Google has sent Pixel 7 CAD files to case manufacturers. Files are usually sent to third parties in order to have accessories ready on the release date. The Pixel 7 is expected to be released later this year. Google usually sends CAD files to case manufacturers about a month or two before the device's official release date. This allows them time to design and create cases for the device, so they are ready and available on the day of launch. The CAD files contain detailed information about the device's dimensions, port and button locations, and any other important details that the manufacturer may need to know in order to create an accurate case.

Power Fx is a low-code programming language that is general-purpose, strongly typed, declarative, and functional. It helps users create canvas-based apps and it works with products such as the Power Platform and Office 365. Power Fx enables users to quickly create apps for the web, desktop, and mobile devices without having to write code. The language is designed to be easy to read and understand and can be used to build powerful solutions with a few lines of code.

AI Gahaku is an AI artist that can generate artwork from photos that you upload. You just have to upload a photo that shows your entire face and then select the style you want your artwork to be in. The AI will then generate a beautiful piece of art based on the photo you uploaded.

WeWork has closed down around 2,300 phone booths at some of its sites in the US and Canada after it discovered elevated levels of formaldehyde. The discovery was made after a third-party testing firm conducted air quality tests and found the toxic chemical in some of their phone booths. WeWork has since removed all of the affected booths, as well as any nearby materials that could have been exposed to formaldehyde. The company is now working with environmental experts and industrial hygienists to identify the source of the formaldehyde, test other locations, and develop new safety protocols.

Apple has issued a recall on some of its 15-inch MacBook Pro laptops sold between September 2015 and February 2017. These laptops contain batteries that may overheat and pose a fire safety risk. Apple is asking customers to stop using affected MacBook Pro units. Customers with affected models can go to Apple's website, enter their laptop's serial number and find out if it is eligible for a battery replacement. Apple stores and authorized service providers will replace the battery free of charge.

This is a cool Javascript library that lets you simulate reflections on mobile websites (there's a gif in this repo that shows the library simulating glare on a credit card number entry form). It uses WebGL to render 3D reflections in real time, and adds realism to your mobile website designs. It works on both Android and iOS devices.

The US federal government is spending 5 billion over five years to build a nationwide network of fast chargers for electric vehicles. It will start by focusing on the Interstate Highway System and then expand to other major roads. The funds will be used for grants to states, local governments, tribes, territories, and the private sector to build out the network. The goal is to have at least one fast charger available every 50 miles on the Interstate Highway System by the end of 2025. The network will help connect communities and serve as a catalyst for electric vehicle adoption across the country. It will also help reduce emissions from transportation and support the growth of clean energy sources like wind and solar.

Disappearing-People is a JavaScript library for removing people from complex backgrounds in real-time. It uses TensorFlow.js in the web browser. A GIF showing a person being removed from the background using the library can be seen here:

Find and fix things across all of your code faster with Sourcegraph. See how the most productive dev teams use Sourcegraph to build software you rely on. From remediating vulnerabilities, to understanding code and navigating dependencies, Sourcegraph helps developers be more productive. Sourcegraph is a code search and navigation platform that provides developers with the tools they need to quickly and efficiently find and fix issues across their code. It makes it easy to explore code, understand context, and take action. You can use Sourcegraph to search for specific code, scan for vulnerabilities, trace changes to dependencies, and quickly identify and remediate bugs. With its powerful features, Sourcegraph helps teams be more productive and efficient when developing and maintaining their codebase.

Webinar: Move Fast and Don't Break Privacy. Not all data is created equal. Some data is special and requires better protection.In this webinar, we will discuss how leading companies like Apple and Microsoft are taking steps to ensure that they protect special data while still moving quickly. We will discuss the legal implications of different approaches and look at best practices for protecting privacy. We will also look at tools and strategies available to help companies protect their customers' data. Finally, we will share some case studies of companies that have successfully implemented their privacy protection strategies.

Optogenetics is a method of controlling neurons with light. A team of researchers from Northwestern University built an ultraminiature, wireless, battery-free, and fully implantable optogenetics device for mice that allowed them to control specific neurons with light. The device, which is almost entirely composed of silicon, is similar in size and shape to a grain of rice. It consists of an LED light source, two microphones, and a laser driver, all powered by ultrasound. When the ultrasound energy strikes the device, it produces a small electrical current that powers the LED, lasers, and microphones. The LED sends pulses of light to activate or deactivate targeted neurons. This technology could allow researchers to manipulate neuron activity without the need for large external equipment, which could revolutionize neuroscience research.
Elon Musk tweeted out the video from the camera attached to SpaceX's Falcon 9 rocket as it aborted the plan to land on the landing pad and instead stabilized just above the water.

Many IOT devices require you to use proprietary apps that can't be audited for security. Sometimes, the only way to ensure privacy on a device is to hack it. This is a dangerous practice and should only be done by experienced professionals. Additionally, if you do decide to hack the device, make sure that you have the necessary legal permissions beforehand.

Google has recently faced many employee protests in its offices across the globe, with employees disagreeing with the company's handling of sexual harassment within the business. While working at the company, employees have demonstrated their commitment to creating a better workplace by forming an organization called the 'Google Walkout'. The group has organized various protests and walkouts across Google's offices to express their grievances, calling for better policies and protections for victims of sexual harassment. Additionally, Google employees have also demanded increased transparency from the company regarding its handling of such cases. Employees have also pushed for more diversity in hiring practices, as well as greater pay equality.

Amazon is developing a technology that will allow customers to connect their credit card information to their hands, allowing them to purchase items with their palms. The company has been working on this technology since 2017 and it is expected to be released sometime in 2020. The system will work by scanning a customer's palm with an infrared camera, which will then connect their credit card information through the Amazon app. Customers will then be able to pay for items simply by pressing their palm against the scanner. The technology has the potential to revolutionize the way customers make payments for goods and services, as it eliminates the need for them to physically carry cards or cash. It also provides an extra layer of security, as it is not possible to replicate someone's unique handprint. Additionally, the technology could potentially be used to authenticate customers' identities when logging into accounts or verifying payments. Amazon's palm payment technology is just one example of the company's efforts to innovate and stay ahead of its competitors. Amazon has long been known for pushing the boundaries of what's possible with technology and this new development only further cements its position as a leader in the field.

Bill Gates has left Microsoft's board and stepped down from his position on the board of Berkshire Hathaway. Gates stated that he decided to step down in order to dedicate more time to his philanthropic efforts, including the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation. He will continue to be involved with Microsoft as a technology advisor. Gates joined Microsoft as one of its first employees in 1975 and served as its CEO until 2000. He has been a prominent figure in the technology industry for decades and is widely considered to be a pioneer in the field.

Being a solo founder can be difficult and it can take a while to find a rhythm that works without burning out. Patience and perseverance will help with dealing with the challenges faced by solo founders. It is important to take the time to research, plan and strategize in order to create a successful business. Setting realistic goals, managing expectations, and taking breaks when needed can also help solo founders stay on track and remain motivated.

The Human Pangenome Project aims to gather, organize, and make accessible a representation of all genetic diversity found in people. The data could help reveal information about genetic risk for disease, ancestry, gene expression, and so on. The project has the potential to revolutionize how we view our genes and provide valuable insight into many aspects of human health and wellness.

Nintendo has announced Mario Kart Live: Home Circuit, a game where players use their Nintendo Switches to pilot a physical kart around their home. Players can set up various gate ways around their house to create different race courses, compete against Koopalings in Grand Prix races, and unlock character-themed karts. The game also supports up to four players for local multiplayer, allowing friends to join in on the racing fun. Mario Kart Live: Home Circuit is set to launch on October 16th, 2020.

Physicists predict that information can be transmitted across two black holes paired via quantum entanglement. If the theory is correct, it might offer clues on how to unite quantum mechanics with general relativity, two of the major theories in physics. The concept of using quantum entanglement to transmit information across black holes is still theoretical and has yet to be tested. In theory, if two black holes are entangled, then any change to one should affect the other instantaneously, regardless of the distance between them. This could allow for information to be shared between them in a way that is faster than the speed of light, which would violate one of the fundamental laws of physics. However, this type of transmission would be limited by a variety of factors such as the size of the black holes, the strength of the entanglement, and the amount of energy available to make the exchange. If successful, the transmission of information between black holes could provide support for the idea that the universe is built on a quantum foundation and that the classical laws of physics can be unified with the principles of quantum mechanics. It could also open new possibilities for understanding the nature of space-time and how gravity behaves at the quantum level.

Gitmoji allows you to use emojis on git commit messages to provide an easy way to identify the purpose or intention of a commit. A guide on how to use Gitmoji can be found [here] . Gitmoji is a great way to make your commit messages more visual, and to give them a bit of personality. It can also help you to quickly scan through a list of commits and get an idea of what has been changed without having to read the full message.

Navigate on Autopilot is a new feature by Tesla that is moving it closer to its self-driving future. It offers step-by-step navigation overlayed on a map (like you would get with a GPS) and includes features such as Autopark, Auto Lane Change, Autosteer, and Traffic Light and Stop Sign Control. It is designed to make driving easier and safer, reducing the need for manual input from the driver. While it is still important to be attentive and watch the road at all times, Autopilot can help to reduce stress and fatigue during long drives.

Apple has been reportedly building its own sports platform as part of its Apple TV streaming service. References to something called'SportsKit' have been found in the iOS 15.2 beta. The platform is believed to be an API-based framework that will allow developers to create sports-related apps for Apple products. It appears to include support for live streaming, scoring, and stats. The platform could also be used to provide a hub for teams and leagues to manage their own content and broadcast games or matches. Apple has not yet officially announced the platform, but it is expected to be unveiled in the near future.

Mozilla has created a new VRAR browser called Firefox Reality. Mozilla has rethought everything to make a browser usable in virtual, mixed, and augmented reality settings. Text input is still necessary, but the experience is optimized for voice commands, gaze-based navigation, and hand controllers. Firefox Reality also supports WebXR standard, allowing developers to use one codebase to create immersive experiences on any device.

Toyota has fitted racing cars with hydrogen combustion engines to test the feasibility of the technology for use in commercial vehicles. The technology still suffers from limitations regarding range, and the durability of the engines presents a challenge. Toyota engineers are working on ways to improve the technology, such as developing lightweight materials that reduce the weight of the engine and using advanced fuel injection systems to increase efficiency. They are also conducting research into ways to store and transport hydrogen safely and economically.

A lab-created microbe with fully redesigned DNA was created by scientists in Cambridge. The modified Escherichia coli (E coli) bacteria contained a genetic code that had been trimmed by scientists to remove all but the essential genes needed for survival. By removing many of the thousands of genes found in the natural form of E coli, researchers were able to create a much simpler organism that is easier to study and manipulate. The modified bacteria also has potential applications in biotechnology as it could be used to produce medicines or other products. It could also be used to clean up toxic waste or to make renewable fuels. The new microbe may provide a platform for future research into synthetic biology and could lead to the creation of more complex organisms with custom-designed functions.

SvgPathEditor is an in-browser SVG path editor. Users can use the controls to specify a path or create an image using the graphical interface. Paths can be easily copied to and from the clipboard, or imported from SVG files. The editor supports a variety of common SVG path commands, including bezier curves and arcs. SvgPathEditor is ideal for web designers who need to quickly edit and manipulate paths in their designs. It can also be used by developers who need to create complex shapes programmatically. The code is open source and available on GitHub, so it can be easily integrated into any existing project.

Apple has launched a new tool that gathers anonymous data from Apple Maps to show how well people are following social distancing guidelines. It is designed for health-care professionals and government officials to help them understand how people are responding to stay at home orders. The tool uses data from Apple Maps, which collects anonymous information about the number of people driving, walking, and taking public transit in a given area. This data can then be used to compare the number of people on the street to the number of people normally seen in that area. The tool also provides insights into average distance traveled and time spent outside the home.

Identify the root cause of an incident with a single search. Incident response is stressful and overwhelming, but it doesn't need to be. Identify the root cause of an incident, the first step in any incident response, by using a single search. A single search can be used to identify the root cause of an incident by searching for information about the incident such as time it happened, affected systems and services, users involved, and other relevant data. This could include looking at system or application logs, reviewing security alerts, or researching recent changes that may have caused the issue. Knowing the root cause of the incident will help the incident responders determine the best approach to resolving it.

Signal is a private messaging app that doesn't track or store data on its users. In this thread, the Signal development team answers questions by Redditors. The team plans to answer questions about the app's features, security protocols, and any other issues that Redditors may have.

The Exploration Extravehicular Mobility Unit (xEMU) is a new type of spacesuit designed for protecting astronauts from the harsh environment of the lunar surface. NASA has plans to use the xEMU suit for the upcoming Artemis mission to the Moon. The xEMU suit is a next-generation spacesuit designed to provide greater mobility and protection to astronauts when exploring the lunar surface. It features a lighter, more flexible pressure garment than previous models, allowing for increased range of motion. The suit also has a built-in life support system, providing astronauts with oxygen, cooling and humidity control. Additionally, the suit is equipped with an on-board computer that can monitor vital signs and provide data back to mission control. Finally, the xEMU suit is designed to be easier to don and doff than earlier models, reducing the time needed to prepare for spacewalks.

Allstar is a GitHub App for setting and enforcing security policies. It can continuously monitor and detect settings and files in repositories to find items that may be risky or violate your internal policies. Allstar can be used to prevent accidental exposure of sensitive data, enforce security best practices, and ensure compliance with various standards (e.g., GDPR). It's an ideal solution for organizations that need to ensure their codebase is secure and compliant.

Yusaku Maezawa, billionaire Japanese entrepreneur and art collector, will be SpaceX's first passenger in its trip around the Moon. He will bring artists (a film director, a painter, a dancer, a musician and a fashion designer) with him to inspire them to create works that reflect their experience of the mission. Maezawa has stated that he will also invite other artists from around the world to join his mission. He is planning to launch the mission in 2023.

Former Reddit CEO Yishan Wong is building a system to transform desert land into fertile ground to grow the trees we need to help stop climate change. Trees can recapture carbon from the atmosphere, making them one of the most effective tools we have to combat climate change. Wong's project is part of a larger effort called Reforesting the Sahara (RTS). RTS is working with local governments and communities in the desert region to implement projects that will help reduce the effects of climate change by planting trees and restoring soil fertility. This includes using innovative technologies such as hydroponic gardens and drip irrigation systems to make the most of limited water resources. The goal is to create a sustainable and profitable agroforestry system that can be replicated in other arid regions around the world. In addition to planting trees, RTS also works to educate local communities about sustainable farming practices, encourages them to form cooperatives, and helps them access resources from international agencies. Wong's efforts are helping to make it possible for people to achieve food security and economic stability in an area where it has been difficult to do so before.

Intel will invest at least 20 billion on a new chip manufacturing site in New Albany, Ohio. The location will host two chip factories and employ at least 3,000 people. The total investment is expected to be much bigger and could reach up to 50 billion. Intel will use the new site to produce its latest chips, including the advanced 7-nanometer chip technology. The project is expected to create thousands of jobs across the state, as well as support local businesses and the community.

Quantum chess is a version of regular chess that incorporates the quantum concepts of superposition, entanglement, and interference. The game teaches players to develop an intuitive sense of the rules of quantum mechanics, while also providing a platform for exploring the role of chance and uncertainty in decision making. In quantum chess, all pieces can exist in multiple locations at once, and moves are based on probabilities rather than certainties. This allows for more complex strategies and unpredictable outcomes, making it an exciting new challenge for players of all levels.

Quantum sensors use the fragility of quantum effects to achieve extraordinary sensitivity to the slightest disturbances in the environment. They could be used to study brain conditions, reveal hidden underground structures, create more accurate navigation systems, and detect the subtle movements of distant objects in space. Quantum sensors can detect changes as small as a single atom, vastly improving the accuracy and sensitivity of measurement. They could also be used to measure magnetic fields with incredible precision, allowing scientists to explore the Earth's deep interior or even map out interstellar clouds of gas. Additionally, quantum sensors could be used to detect and monitor hazardous materials, such as radioactive waste, in the environment.

Netflix gained 15.77 million paid subscribers globally in the first quarter of 2020, its biggest quarter yet. It earned 709 million, with revenue growing to 5.77 billion in the quarter. This was an increase of 24 year-over-year. Netflix's strong Q1 performance is due in part to the coronavirus pandemic, as people around the world are spending more time at home and turning to streaming services for entertainment. The company has also been investing heavily in content, particularly in original productions, which have helped drive subscriber growth. Netflix has also been expanding its international presence, launching new services in countries such as India and South Korea.

US President Donald Trump will sign an executive order on social media firms after an incident where Twitter added fact-check links to one of his tweets. Trump threatened to'strongly regulate' or even 'close down' social media firms, claiming they are biased against him. The exact contents of the executive order have not been released, but President Trump has said it will focus on protecting free speech online. It could involve changes to Section 230 of the Communications Decency Act, which provides legal immunity for websites from content posted by third parties. The executive order could also address other areas of concern, such as the use of algorithms to tailor what users see in their news feeds. It is unclear whether the executive order will be limited to Twitter, or if it will apply to other social media companies like Facebook and YouTube.

You don't need a computer science degree to become a software developer. The skill can be self-taught. Having patience with yourself during the learning process will allow you to easier pick up the necessary skills. There are many online resources, such as video tutorials and coding bootcamps, that can help you learn the fundamentals of software development. Additionally, having a strong problem-solving approach and an understanding of basic computer science concepts will be beneficial. Finally, gaining experience in developing software through internships or freelance projects is a great way to get your foot in the door.

Aptera Motors is rolling out the first mass-produced solar car this year. The three-wheeled vehicle is covered in 34 square feet of solar cells, which can provide enough energy to power the car up to 45 miles on a single charge. The car can be charged with a standard 120V wall outlet, and the solar cells can generate enough power to extend the range of the vehicle to an additional 40-50 miles per day. Additionally, Aptera Motors offers an optional battery pack that provides an additional 60-100 miles of range.

Walmart aims to service 50 percent of the US with its Delivery Unlimited membership program by the end of the year. Customers can choose to either pay an annual fee of 98 or a monthly fee of 12.95 for unlimited deliveries on orders of 35 or more. Delivery Unlimited members also receive additional benefits such as same-day delivery and discounts on select items. Walmart plans to expand the program to include more cities in 2021.

This report from Levels.fyi examines the data they collected in 2021 to find the top paying companies and locations. The top paying company for entry-level engineers was Two Sigma. The average salary of entry-level engineers at Two Sigma was 161,000. The top paying location for entry-level engineers was the San Francisco Bay Area, with an average salary of 133,000. The report also examined the average salaries for mid-level and senior-level engineers. For mid-level engineers, the average salary at Two Sigma was 224,000, while the average salary in the San Francisco Bay Area was 181,000. For senior-level engineers, the average salary at Two Sigma was 297,000, while the average salary in the San Francisco Bay Area was 229,000. The report also looked at the number of job openings available for entry-level engineers at each company and location. The report found that Two Sigma had the most job openings available, with over 600 listed job postings. In comparison, the San Francisco Bay Area had around 400 job postings available for entry-level engineers. Overall, the report shows that Two Sigma is the highest paying company for entry-level engineers, followed by the San Francisco Bay Area. Additionally, the report found that Two Sigma had the most job postings available for entry-level engineers. Finally, the report showed that salaries for mid-level and senior-level engineers are significantly higher than those for entry-level engineers.

Current milk alternatives just aren't the same, so Impossible Foods is now working on a food replacement that looks, tastes, and behaves like cow's milk. The Impossible Investigator project aims to create a milk alternative that is made from plants and can be used in any recipe that calls for cow's milk. The team is looking into various plant-based sources, such as soy, almond, rice, and oat milk, as well as other ingredients that could be mixed together to create the desired texture and taste. The end goal is to create a product that is both delicious and environmentally friendly.

BuildXL is a build engine that runs over 30,000 builds per day internally at Microsoft. Thousands of developers use BuildXL on their desktops for fast builds with mega-sized codebases. BuildXL has been designed to be fast, reliable and scalable. It is used for building many of Microsoft's flagship products including Windows, Office and Visual Studio. BuildXL is also being used by a number of external companies, such as Facebook, Google and Amazon.

Microdiff is a zero-dependency object and array comparison library. It is fast, extremely lightweight, and easy to use. Microdiff features support for Deno, Node, the web, service workers, TypeScript, and more. Microdiff has no external dependencies and works on any platform. It is designed to be as fast as possible, with simple API calls that are easy to understand and use. Using Microdiff, you can quickly compare two objects or arrays of any type and determine whether they are equal or not. It supports deep comparisons for objects, arrays, and even functions. Microdiff also features a powerful diffing algorithm which can identify the differences between two objects and generate a report containing those changes.
