Scientists from the University of Oxford and robotics firm Devanthro grew cells on a robot skeleton in an experiment designed to create more flexible lab-grown cells. The researchers used the robot skeleton to manipulate the cells, which were grown in a 3D structure called a hydrogel, in order to study their behavior. The team found that the cells responded to changes in temperature, pressure, and other mechanical stimuli, suggesting that the robotic skeleton could be used as an artificial environment to stimulate and study cells. The research could lead to more accurate models of how cells respond to various environmental conditions, which could be used to develop better treatments for diseases or improve tissue engineering techniques.

Using private backend servers for small projects that need to use a database can become annoying. Hosting a static website is much easier. There are many free and reliable options, such as GitHub Pages and Amazon S3. Additionally, services such as Heroku and Microsoft Azure provide free hosting for small projects.

In an effort to combat preventable diseases, 23andMe will start testing customers for diabetes and other health conditions with their Health and Ancestry Service test. The test will not indicate a diagnosis, but it will provide customers with information about their genetic predisposition and risk factors for certain conditions. The company also plans to give customers access to genetic counselors and other health resources to help them better understand their results.

China blocked Wikipedia in April, using DNS injections to prevent its citizens from accessing the encyclopedia. There has been no official statement as to why the website was blocked. In the past, China has blocked Wikipedia for containing information that the government considered to be sensitive or politically controversial. In addition, some believe the block is part of China's strategy to censor online content and limit access to certain websites.

Rutgers engineers have created a 3D-printed smart gel that changes shape when exposed to light and a 3D-printed stretchy material that can reveal colors when the light changes. These developments could lead to new applications in robotics, medical devices and sensors. The smart gel is made from a combination of polymers and light-sensitive molecules, and is capable of changing shape when exposed to certain frequencies of visible light. The stretchy material, made from a combination of silicone rubber and photochromic dyes, has the ability to respond to changes in light by displaying different colors. Both materials are very tough and durable and can be customized to fit any application. By combining these two materials, engineers can create soft robotic components that are able to change shape or color according to their environment. This technology could be used for a variety of applications such as biomedical devices, sensors and actuators, and even wearable technology.

Mercedes Benz's future Level 4 and Level 5 autonomous driving cars will choose to save drivers before pedestrians in the event of an accident. Driverless vehicles may have to make split-second decisions in situations where they must choose between two or more outcomes with negative results. In such cases, Mercedes Benz has stated that their autonomous vehicles will prioritize the safety of drivers and passengers over pedestrians. The company is working to ensure that future vehicles are programmed to prioritize the safety of all involved, but ultimately the priority will remain on the driver's safety.

Apple's 2019 event has finished, bringing a bounty of exciting announcements. The Apple TV Plus will launch on November 1st at 4.99 per month. A year-long subscription to the service will be included with the purchase of certain Apple devices. Apple also announced three new iPhones, the iPhone 11, 11 Pro, and 11 Pro Max. The phones feature improved cameras, better battery life, and faster processors. The company also unveiled the Apple Watch Series 5, which includes an always-on display and a built-in compass. Finally, Apple announced the 7th generation iPad, featuring a larger 10.2 inch Retina Display and compatibility with the Apple Pencil.

Details on Samsung's upcoming Galaxy A53 have been leaked. The new phone will have a 6.5-inch FHD 120Hz display with a built-in fingerprint sensor under the glass, a mid-range Samsung Exynos 9611 processor, 6GB of RAM and 128GB of storage. It will also feature a quad rear camera setup with a 48-megapixel primary lens, 8-megapixel ultra wide-angle lens, 5-megapixel macro lens, and 2-megapixel depth sensor. On the front, there will be a 32-megapixel selfie camera. The phone will be powered by a 5000mAh battery and will support 15W fast-charging technology.

Scientists at the University of Tokyo have created an artificial nose using mosquito odor receptors. The team placed the mosquito receptors on a chip and monitored the setup with a microscope. The mosquito odor receptors, which are specialized proteins, can detect a wide range of odors, from the sweet smell of flowers to the foul smells of rotten food. The team then used artificial intelligence (AI) algorithms to interpret the signals generated by the receptors, allowing them to identify different smells. The researchers believe that their artificial nose could eventually be used for applications such as detecting hazardous gases or explosives. It could also help researchers better understand how mosquitoes detect and respond to odors, which could lead to new ways of controlling their behavior.

Apple's new Human Interface Guidelines suggest that developers place the new 'Sign in with Apple' button in iPhone and iPad apps above other sign-in options. Users generally select the default option, so by placing the 'Sign in with Apple' button at the top, it allows users to easily sign-in and access the app. Additionally, developers should also ensure that the button is prominently displayed and easy to select.

GitHub Actions is a CICD tool that runs alongside code in GitHub. It can cut release times down to five minutes and revert releases with the touch of a button . It allows for automated testing, build, and deployment of code to any platform including AWS, Azure, and Google Cloud. GitHub Actions enables developers to take control of their development pipeline and automate tasks such as running tests, building apps, and deploying services. In addition, it can be used to monitor the health of code repositories, detect vulnerabilities, and trigger Slack notifications.

Burger King has unveiled updated restaurant designs that feature dedicated mobile order and curbside pick-up areas, drive-in and walk-up order areas, an enhanced drive-thru experience, exterior dining spaces, and sustainable interior materials and finishes. The company has also added digital menu boards, contactless payment options, and interactive kiosks to facilitate a safe and convenient ordering experience.

Leaks from a marketing website seem to confirm that the Pixel 6 will have a new Magic Eraser feature and get five years of Android security updates. Magic Eraser can be used for quick and easy retouching of photos and videos, which is expected to give the Pixel 6 an edge over its competitors. Additionally, Google has promised five years of Android security updates, meaning that users of the Pixel 6 can have peace of mind knowing that their device will remain secure and up-to-date for a longer period of time.

Amazon's IMDb has launched a free ad-supported streaming service called Freedive, which is available via the IMDb website and Amazon's Fire TV (it's coming soon to IMDb's mobile app). It offers a selection of classic TV shows and movies, including Fringe, Memento, The Last Samurai, True Romance, and more. Freedive includes a range of genres, from comedy to drama, horror, family, and action. It also includes IMDb original videos such as interviews with popular celebrities, as well as trailers and behind-the-scenes footage. In addition, Freedive provides customers access to Amazon Prime Video titles at no additional cost.

MIT announced that it is planning a 1 billion college called the MIT Stephen A. Schwarzman College of Computing, named after Blackstone CEO Steve Schwarzman who donated 350 million. The new college will focus on advancing education and research in computer science, artificial intelligence, data science, and related fields. It will also create new interdisciplinary opportunities for students to explore the ethical implications of technology and its impact on society. The college is part of a 1 billion investment by MIT to advance computing at the Institute.

The New York Times has acquired Serial Productions, the audio production company behind popular podcast series Serial. Serial Productions was formed in 2017 after the success of the podcast, which told the story of a Baltimore teen's conviction for murder. It has since produced five seasons of the podcast, as well as other audio projects such as S-Town and Nice White Parents. The acquisition will allow The New York Times to expand its reach into audio journalism, and build on its existing portfolio of podcasts such as The Daily, Modern Love, and the recently launched 1619 Project. Serial Productions will continue to operate independently within The Times, with its team of producers and editors in place. The Times will also acquire two other projects from Serial Productions: the documentary production company This American Life, which produces stories about people, culture, and politics; and the education podcast series Slow Burn. The acquisition gives The Times access to a large and loyal fan base, and allows them to further develop their audio content offerings. It is expected that Serial Productions' expertise and editorial experience will help The Times grow its audio programming, and create new opportunities for both companies. It also allows The Times to capitalize on the growing popularity of podcasts, giving them a foothold in the highly competitive audio market.

Google has come under fire again with the revelation that its Nest Secure product had a built-in microphone. The microphone has existed in the product since launch but was never disclosed to consumers and only recently discovered by a customer. Google has responded to the controversy by apologizing for not disclosing the existence of the microphone and stating that it was never intended to be used or activated. Google has also stated that it is working on an update to the Nest Secure product which will enable customers to choose whether or not to enable the microphone feature. This controversy highlights the importance for companies to be transparent about their data collection practices. Consumers need to feel confident that they are in control of their data and know how it is being used. Companies should be open and honest with customers about what data is collected, how it is stored, and how it is used. If a company wishes to collect additional data, they should provide customers with a clear explanation of why they are doing so and seek permission before doing so.

Tesla plans to open its Supercharger network to non-Tesla electric vehicles in the US in late 2022. Elon Musk has been talking about opening up the network to other companies' electric vehicles since at least 2019. The Supercharger network has already been opened up to non-Tesla electric vehicles in Europe. Tesla's Supercharger network is the largest public fast-charging network in the world. It currently includes more than 19,000 Superchargers across North America, Europe, and Asia. Opening up the network to other companies' electric vehicles will make it easier for EV owners to find charging stations. This could help accelerate the adoption of electric vehicles and reduce range anxiety. By opening up its Supercharger network to non-Tesla electric vehicles, Tesla is demonstrating its commitment to accelerating the transition to sustainable energy. Tesla's goal is to make electric vehicles accessible to all, regardless of the make or model.

A CSS pseudo-element is a keyword added to a selector that lets you style a specific part of a selected element. This post discusses five pseudo-elements in order to help you better understand the concept. 1.::before - allows you to insert content before the selected element. It's commonly used to add decorative elements like icons or bullets to lists. 2.::after - allows you to insert content after the selected element. It's often used for adding extra content andor styling to an element. 3.::first-letter - allows you to style the first letter of a text block. This can be used to create interesting typography effects. 4.::first-line - allows you to style the first line of a text block. This can also be used to create interesting typography effects. 5.::selection - allows you to style text that has been highlighted by the user. This is useful for providing visual feedback when users select text.

Microsoft's Edge browser will be upgraded to the Chromium-based version on January 15. Windows 10 users will be automatically transitioned to the new version. The launch date was announced last year, but has been delayed due to the pandemic. The new Edge browser will offer improved compatibility with other Chromium-based browsers, such as Google Chrome and Brave. It will also include features such as password management, tracking protection, and optimized settings for better battery life. Microsoft has also promised enhanced privacy controls for users.

Coronavirus has traveled across the world, with new cases of the virus being found in non-travelers. The World Health Organization recently warned that the window of opportunity to contain the virus is narrowing and countries must take immediate, aggressive action to contain the outbreak. Countries have responded by increasing public health efforts, such as contact tracing, quarantining those with confirmed cases, and travel restrictions. Governments are also providing medical support for those affected and introducing measures to protect vulnerable populations from the virus. Additionally, many countries have implemented social distancing measures and closed schools, universities, and other public spaces in order to reduce the spread of the virus.

The new iPod touch has been announced. It will use the A10 Fusion chip, which was introduced with the iPhone 7, and comes in many new colors. The device will also feature a 4-inch Retina display, support for Group FaceTime, Augmented Reality capabilities, up to 256GB of storage, and more. It will also come with iOS 12 preinstalled. This new device is sure to be a hit with music lovers, gamers, and photographers alike.

SpaceX has successfully launched a second crew into orbit inside its Crew Dragon spacecraft. Crew-1 was Crew Dragon's first operational mission. The Crew Dragon will automatically dock to the ISS and the four astronauts onboard will spend six months conducting research and experiments. The mission is a milestone for SpaceX, as it marks the first time the company has sent astronauts to the International Space Station (ISS).

A team of engineers in Korea has designed a new Virtual Reality glove that can create the sensation of touch when manipulating digital objects. VR gloves are not new, but this new design is unique in that it uses a combination of sensors and actuators to create the sensation of touch. The glove has an array of tactile sensors embedded in the fingertips which detect contact with virtual objects, and it also has several actuators that can simulate different sensations, from a light vibration to a firm grip. With this technology, users will be able to experience the sensation of touching digital objects, making the experience of using VR much more immersive.

Alphabet and SoftBank recently announced that they successfully ran a stable LTE connection from a solar-powered drone 62,000 feet high. The connection was used to make an international video call from the drone to the ground. This is an impressive feat of engineering, as it shows that a stable LTE connection can be established in such extreme conditions. This development has significant implications for the field of telecommunications, as it suggests that high-altitude drones could potentially be used to extend mobile and internet services to remote areas. It could also improve the speed and reliability of existing mobile networks by providing additional coverage in hard-to-reach places. This could be a game-changer for businesses and consumers alike.

Disney Parks' chairman recently ended a presentation by showing off a retractable lightsaber. The design appears to be based on a patent registered in 2018. This article contains a description of the patent, which shows how the lightsaber works. The patent describes a retractable lightsaber that can be used to simulate a realistic fight in a controlled environment. The device is powered by an internal battery and features a motorized blade which is housed inside a hollow tube. The blade is connected to a trigger mechanism and when activated, the blade will extend out of the tube until it reaches its desired length. The motorized blade is equipped with sensors to detect contact and automatically retract when contact is made. The lightsaber also features a safety switch, allowing users to activate the blade without having to worry about unintentionally injuring someone. Additionally, the lightsaber is designed to be lightweight and portable for easy transportation and storage. The design also includes a vibration-dampening system to reduce noise from the motorized blade. Overall, the patent describes a unique and innovative design for a retractable lightsaber that could revolutionize the way we experience simulated fights. With this new technology, fans of the Star Wars franchise would be able to enjoy a realistic dueling experience, even in a controlled environment.

Red Carpet Entertainment LLC is offering 3,000 rich Americans the chance to put up 15,000 and pay up to 2,500 per movie to watch the latest releases in their homes. The company will provide a full library of movies from major Hollywood studios, independent film makers, and other small-scale productions. Customers will be able to choose from a variety of genres including action, drama, comedy, animated, horror, and more. Additionally, they will have access to bonus content such as behind-the-scenes footage, interviews with actors and directors, as well as other exclusive documents. Red Carpet Entertainment LLC also offers customers the ability to rent or purchase additional movies at discounted prices. This offering could be an attractive option for those who enjoy watching movies but cannot make it to a theater or find time to do so. It is also beneficial for people who want to watch a wider range of films than what's available in traditional theaters. Finally, it allows customers to watch the latest releases without having to wait for them to reach their local cinema.

This is a new site launched by Spotify's design team that has a bunch of articles going into depth about how they approach certain areas of design. If you're a design enthusiast, this is a great resource for learning about different areas of design and how Spotify approaches them. The articles are written by both Spotify's team members and also from outside experts.

A 3.1 billion dollar deal for Uber to purchase its biggest competitor in the Middle East, Careem, is expected to be made public on March 26. Uber is believed to have offered Careem a combination of cash and stock in the deal, which was first reported by Reuters. The acquisition will give Uber a foothold in some of the most prominent markets in the region, including Egypt, Saudi Arabia, and the United Arab Emirates. The deal is also expected to help Uber expand its services into other Middle Eastern countries such as Jordan, Qatar, and Lebanon. The move comes as Uber has been increasing its presence in the region, having already acquired food delivery company Ando earlier this year. It has also invested heavily in the region with the launch of its ride-sharing service in Dubai last year. The acquisition is part of Uber's strategy to become the dominant player in the Middle East. In addition to its own services, the company has recently struck deals with local taxi companies to expand its presence. For Careem, the sale marks a major milestone for the company, which has seen tremendous growth over the past few years. Founded in 2012, Careem now operates in more than 100 cities across 15 countries in the region. This deal could help Careem further expand its reach and cement its position as one of the leading ride-hailing companies in the Middle East.

Jeffrey Berns, CEO of Blockchains LLC, wants the Nevada government to allow companies like his to form local governments on land they own, granting them power over everything from schools to taxes. He believes this form of government could help foster innovation and provide a unique opportunity to create new models of governance. The Nevada state government has yet to take a stance on Berns' proposal. It is likely that the government will be hesitant to grant such power to private entities, given the potential for abuse. Berns' proposal could potentially lead to a situation where individuals or groups are able to create their own laws, regulations, and standards without any oversight from the state. Additionally, some people may view it as a form of corporate welfare, where companies are allowed to avoid paying taxes for services provided by the government. At the same time, local governments are already in place in many parts of the world, such as in the United Kingdom, Canada, and most U.S. states. In these cases, local governments have certain powers delegated to them from the state government. This could be a way to explore a similar model in Nevada, where private entities are granted some autonomy while still being subject to the laws and regulations of the state. Ultimately, the decision rests with the Nevada state government. If they choose to pursue Berns' proposal, they would need to consider the risks and benefits carefully to ensure that it does not pose a threat to democracy or public safety.

This short video shows a synthetic President Obama with an artificial voice introducing a course on deep learning taught at MIT. The entire video is fake and was created using deep learning and artificial intelligence. The synthetic Obama speaks with a natural cadence and is able to deliver the same message as if he were speaking in real life. The technology used to create this video is impressive and shows the potential for AI to revolutionize how we communicate with each other. This video also highlights the importance of developing ethical approaches to using artificial intelligence and how it can be used responsibly.

Blocks have shown up in almost every blogging tool, web editor, note-taking app, and content management system, but they are almost all proprietary and non-standard. Blocks are often limited to specific features, such as formatting text or creating a table. In recent years, there has been a push for standardization of blocks across different platforms. This way, content created in one platform can be easily transferred to another. The World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) is currently working on the Web Platform for Blockchains, which would provide an open and standardized set of blocks. This could enable developers to create applications that leverage blockchains across multiple platforms without having to rewrite code. The implementation of this technology is still in its early stages, but it promises to revolutionize how we interact with the web and the way we build applications. Once this standard is adopted, it would make it much easier to create cross-platform apps and websites that use blockchains, as well as help ensure uniformity and interoperability across different platforms.

The United Arab Emirates launched its first interplanetary orbiter, Hope, to Mars in July. It took over six years for the UAE Space Agency to launch the Mars-bound spacecraft, which was named "Hope" by the UAE leadership in reference to the optimism and ambition of the nation's youth. The orbiter is expected to arrive at Mars in February 2021, where it will spend at least one Martian year studying the atmosphere of the Red Planet. The mission's data will be used to better understand climate change on Mars and help further investigate the potential for life on the planet. Hope is an exciting milestone for the UAE and a proud moment for all its citizens.

Edtr.io is an in-line web editor written in React. Pages made in edtr.io look like the final page. Developers can create pages by dragging and dropping elements. Edtr.io is lean , fast and mobile friendly. Edtr.io is designed to be simple, intuitive and easy to use. It has a drag-and-drop interface that allows developers to easily create responsive websites. Developers can also customize the look and feel of pages with custom HTML, CSS and JavaScript code. Edtr.io also supports other features like live preview, collaboration, analytics, SEO and more.

Twitter is appointing Elon Musk to its board of directors. Musk will serve as a Class II director with a term that expires at Twitter's 2024 annual shareholder meeting. He will also serve as a member of Twitter's Audit Committee. Musk is known for his roles as CEO of Tesla and SpaceX, as well as his investments in other technology companies. He brings valuable expertise to Twitter's Board of Directors, especially in the areas of innovation, manufacturing, and engineering. As a leading innovator, Musk has an impressive track record that includes creating revolutionary products like electric cars and reusable rockets. With his knowledge and experience, he should be able to further the company's goal of becoming a leader in technological innovation. By adding Musk to its board of directors, Twitter is making a statement that it is committed to continuing to innovate and remain competitive in the tech industry. His presence on the board should help the company stay ahead of the competition, create more value for shareholders, and benefit users.

Jerdon's jumping worker ants can become reproductive queens when their queens die. The transition comes with changes to the ant's brain, gene expression, hormone levels, and cell composition. Researchers have identified more than 350 genes that are associated with the transition from worker to queen. These genes help control the transition from female worker to a reproductive queen, allowing them to lay eggs and start their own colonies.

In recent years, China has created an armada of huge ships that dredge up sand from the ocean floor. The largest of these ships can suck up 8,000 cubic yards of sand in a single hour. The dredgers are used to create artificial islands, which are then used to build new infrastructure and other developments. China has also used these ships to reclaim vast amounts of land along its coastlines, increasing the country's territorial waters by more than 2,000 square miles. This activity has been met with criticism from some countries in the region, as it is seen as potentially infringing on their territorial waters. Despite this, China continues to use its dredgers to expand its presence in the South China Sea.

Free eBook: Migrating Workloads to The Alternative Cloud. Make the best choice when it comes to your move to the alternative cloud. In this free eBook, learn about three migrations types, the benefits of each, and the considerations that must be taken into account to ensure a successful transition. 1. Lift and Shift Migration: Learn the basics of a lift and shift migration, how it works, and the benefits and drawbacks of this type of migration. 2. Rehosting: Understand what rehosting is, the benefits of rehosting, and the challenges you may face when undertaking a rehosting project. 3. Refactoring: Explore what refactoring is, the advantages, and the potential complexity of refactoring. 4. Security Considerations: Discover the security concerns to consider when migrating workloads to the alternative cloud. 5. Best Practices for Moving to the Alternative Cloud: Find out the best practices for successful migration to the alternative cloud.

IBM is acquiring Red Hat for 34 billion. Red Hat is an open source, enterprise software company best known distributing and supporting their enterprise version of Linux. IBM will pay all cash for the purchase, making it the largest software acquisition in history. This acquisition will help IBM become a major cloud provider and expand its capabilities in the open source space. It will also give IBM access to a large customer base and allow it to offer more services to its customers.

A new, non-lethal weapon based on microwave radar technology is being developed by China and is designed to cause pain over distances without any permanent injuries. The Microwave Active Denial System (MADS) is a mobile, hand-held device that produces microwaves of the same frequency used for cooking. The microwaves are emitted in short pulses and cause an intense heating sensation on the skin, which is described as feeling like a "rubber band snapping" or a "stinging nettle." The intensity of the sensation can be adjusted to cause pain but not injury. The MADS is designed to be used in crowd control situations, to disperse people without causing any physical harm. The MADS works by emitting a microwave beam that penetrates approximately 164th of an inch into the skin. The microwaves heat the top layer of skin, causing an unbearable burning sensation that is difficult to bear. The heat is non-lethal and dissipates quickly once the device is switched off. The MADS has been tested extensively and is considered safe when used properly. The MADS has potential applications in law enforcement, military, and security operations. It could be used to disperse large crowds without causing any lasting physical harm. However, it is important to note that the use of MADS is still regulated by international laws and must be used responsibly. Furthermore, the MADS should only be used as a last resort and its effects should be monitored closely.

Medusa is a headless commerce engine for creating digital commerce apps. It can be used as a backend of an app, as an application, to create traditional e-commerce websites, and as an API. It is designed to be a comprehensive e-commerce platform, providing solutions for selling both physical and digital products. It also provides features such as inventory management, customer segmentation, shipping and payment options, and analytics. Medusa also offers integrations with third-party applications such as analytics tools and marketing platforms.

Facebook Gaming is introducing a new feature that lets viewers hop into game streams with their favorite gaming personalities. Viewers can now click a button to open games and join their favorite streamers in-game. This feature is available on both Android and iOS devices, and it gives gamers the chance to play alongside their friends or content creators they admire. The feature works with a variety of popular titles including Fortnite, Minecraft, PUBG, and Apex Legends. It's designed to give viewers an interactive way to engage with their favorite personalities and deepen their connection with them.

M2cgen transpiles trained statistical models into Python, C, or Java. Users can supply M2cgen with a range of models (linear, SVM, tree, random forest, or boosting) and the tool will generate a full-fledged program that can be used to make predictions. The generated code is optimized for performance and offers an easy way to integrate predictive models into production applications.

A Florida-based unmanned trucking company, Starsky Robotics, has set a record for the fastest that an unmanned truck has driven on a public road. It hit 55 MPH in a test run on a Florida highway. Starsky Robotics is the first company to autonomously drive an unmanned truck over 50 MPH on a public road in the United States. The company has been testing its technology for several months, but this was the first time that it achieved such high speeds. The company is hoping to deploy its trucks with driverless capabilities in the near future. To achieve this, the company is working with state and federal regulators to ensure the safety of its vehicles.

From June 1, any photos uploaded to Google Photos will count towards the user's storage limit unless the photos come from a Pixel phone. Google One plans are available for users who need more storage than the free 15GB. Users can purchase Google One plans that offer additional storage space ranging from 100GB to 30TB. These plans are available for both individuals and families, with discounts available for family plans. Additionally, uploaded photos from Pixel phones will remain exempt from the storage limit.

At the beginning of the year, OpenAI released the model-weights and code for CLIP, a model trained to determine which caption from a set of captions best fits a given image. OpenAI released CLIP as part of its mission to advance artificial intelligence for the benefit of all humanity, and to promote the responsible use of AI. The model was trained on millions of images from the OpenImages dataset, and is capable of quickly understanding what is in an image and generating captions that accurately describe it. It can also be used to generate creative captions for images. By making this technology freely available, OpenAI hopes to make it easier for other researchers to develop their own applications and accelerate the development of AI-powered applications.

This is a newsletter about CSS layouts (flexboxes, grids, modals, and all that good stuff). If you often find yourself googling stuff like "vertical align not working," you might want to bookmark this page. We're here to help you get a better understanding of all things related to CSS layouts. We'll cover topics such as flexbox, grid systems, modals, and more. Each month, we'll provide tips, tricks, and tutorials to help you get the most out of your layout design. If there's something specific you'd like us to address, let us know - we'd love to hear from you! And don't forget to follow us on social media to stay up-to-date with the latest in web design news and trends. Thanks for joining us and happy designing!

Stay-at-home and social distancing may have played a major role in romance scams reaching record levels in 2020. Total losses were estimated at 304 million. The total dollar losses have decreased significantly since 2018, when they were estimated at over 1 billion. Stay-at-home and social distancing requirements likely have had a major impact on the rise of romance scams in 2020 due to the increased reliance on online dating platforms. With people stuck at home, scammers have had an easier time finding potential victims to target. They use clever tactics to lure their victims into believing that they are forming an emotional connection with them, and then quickly try to exploit them for financial gain. Additionally, the restricted physical contact may have made it easier for scammers to carry out their activities undetected. Victims can be less likely to recognize the red flags associated with these scams as they rely more heavily on online communication, making them more vulnerable to manipulation.

The Virgin Hyperloop is a transport system that features high-tech pods zooming through tunnels at speeds of up to 760 miles an hour using magnetic levitation. It is supposed to be the world's first "ultra-fast and ultra-efficient" mode of transportation. The system is being developed by Virgin Hyperloop One, which has been working on the technology since 2014. The idea is that passengers will be able to travel long distances in a matter of minutes, making it much faster than traditional forms of transportation like air and rail.

Disney announced updates to its streaming services and provided sneak peeks for upcoming shows and movies at its investor day presentation on Thursday. It announced a new bundle that includes Disney, Hulu, and ESPN, as well as a new Star-branded international streaming service. The company also revealed more details about its upcoming shows like WandaVision, Falcon The Winter Soldier, and The Mandalorian. Finally, it shared a first look at Pixar's Luca and Marvel's Loki, along with the upcoming movies Cruella and Black Panther 2.

Waymo just announced that it hit 10 million miles in real world testing of its self-driving cars. However, the company also uses a simulator to drive 10 million test miles per day in order to further refine its technology. Waymo's simulator helps the company test and refine its self-driving cars by allowing them to virtually drive through different scenarios, such as traffic jams or inclement weather, that they may not encounter in the real world. These simulations help the company improve the accuracy of its algorithms and prepare its vehicles for any potential hazards on the road. Additionally, the simulator allows Waymo to identify and fix bugs before they become a problem in the real world.

Two centuries ago, it was established that the average human body temperature was 98.6 degrees Fahrenheit, or 37 degrees Celsius. Scientists have noticed a drop in average body temperature in recent years, however, and the current average is closer to 98.2 degrees Fahrenheit, or 36.8 Celsius. This slight decrease in body temperature may be due to several factors, including changes in diet and activity levels, environmental temperatures, and advances in medical technology that allow us to measure more accurately.

Elon Musk has laid out how he will fund the 46.5 billion purchase of Twitter. Musk will receive loans from Morgan Stanley worth 25.5 billion and cover the remaining 21 billion through a combination of cash on hand and debt. He will also use 2 billion worth of his own shares as collateral for the loan.

Tesla has released its Full Self-Driving Beta v9 update. It uses Tesla Vision, a computer vision system that relies on optical imagery. The release notes do not reveal many details of the changes, but they do mention that the system can now recognize traffic lights and stop signs, as well as detect pedestrians, cyclists and cars in urban areas. It is also capable of lane guidance on highways and has been improved to better navigate complex intersections. The update will eventually allow drivers to summon their vehicle from a parking spot.

The Experimental Advanced Superconducting Tokamak (EAST) fusion reactor in China reached temperatures of 70 million degrees Celsius, five times hotter than the Sun, for more than 17 minutes during a test in 2020. The reactor is the first of its kind in the world to reach such temperatures and could pave the way for future fusion reactors that could provide nearly limitless clean energy. Other milestones achieved by EAST include becoming the world's longest-running superconducting tokamak, achieving a stable high temperature plasma discharge for more than 10 minutes, and achieving a sustained high-confinement state with a current of 5 million amperes.

A group of Instacart employees voted to unionize with the United Food and Commercial Workers Local 1546 on Saturday. Managers distributed anti-union literature prior to the vote, claiming that a union would lead to fewer benefits and job security. The vote by Instacart employees to unionize is an important step forward in the fight for better wages, benefits, and job security for workers in the gig economy. Despite the managers distributing anti-union literature, many of the employees recognized the importance of joining a union in order to ensure their rights and protections as workers are respected. Unionization is a powerful tool that can help ensure that all workers have fair wages, safe working conditions, and access to benefits. Through collective bargaining, unions can advocate on behalf of employees to win improvements to pay and working conditions, and give workers a stronger voice in their workplace. Instacart employees have taken an important first step in the fight to improve their working conditions. As more gig economy workers choose to unionize, it will be increasingly difficult for employers to ignore the demands of their workers.

Solar panels emit infrared radiation at night. The photons going out into the night sky cool down the solar cell. This temperature difference can be used to generate electricity using a thermoelectric generator. The amount of energy generated from thermoelectric generators is relatively low, but it can be used to power small devices such as sensors or microcontrollers. Additionally, thermoelectric generators can be used to supplement solar panel output during low-light periods, such as at night or on cloudy days.

Instagram is rolling out several new messaging features. The features include music sharing, replying while browsing, quick sending, online status, silent messages, polls, chat customization, co-watching videos, a lo-fi chat mode, and disappearing messages. Music sharing allows users to share music directly through their messages, without leaving the conversation. Replying while browsing allows users to reply to messages while they are still browsing the Instagram feed. Quick sending will allow users to quickly send photos, videos, and other content to their contacts with a single tap. Online status will show when contacts are active on the app. Silent messages will let users send a message that won't generate any notifications. Polls will allow users to create questions in their chats and get responses from others. Chat customization will offer various themes and colors to choose from. Co-watching videos will enable multiple people to watch a video simultaneously within a chat. The lo-fi chat mode will help reduce distractions by limiting the amount of incoming messages. Finally, disappearing messages will let users send messages that automatically delete after the recipient has seen them.

Four years ago in San Francisco, more than 700 engineers competed in a competition to build an AI system that could pass an 8th-grade test. 80,000 in prize money was awarded to the winners. The competition, called AI2 8th-Grade Science Challenge (AI2-8GSC), was sponsored by the Allen Institute for Artificial Intelligence (AI2). The challenge required teams of engineers to build an AI system that could answer science questions on a standardized 8th-grade science test. The competition ran over several months and included three rounds. The team with the highest score in each round won prize money ranging from 10,000 to 50,000. In the end, the winning team was awarded 80,000. The competition had a major impact on the field of AI research. It highlighted the potential of AI to perform complex tasks and demonstrated how far AI systems have come. It also increased awareness of AI technology among the public and inspired more people to get involved in AI research.

Uber and Lyft have been awarded a five-year 810 million transportation contract by the US government to provide transportation for federal employees and their families. It is unclear how the two companies will use the funds, but it is likely that a portion of the money will go towards providing discounted rides for federal employees, investing in research and development, expanding their fleets, and upgrading their technology platforms. Additionally, they may also invest in infrastructure improvements, such as adding electric charging stations and building bike lanes.

PostgreSQL 14 has a new multirange feature that makes range types in PostgreSQL more powerful. Range types allow developers to store various kinds of intervals with upper and lower bounds. Using the new multirange feature, developers can store multiple ranges in a single column. This allows for more efficient storage of data and eliminates the need to create separate columns for each range. The new feature also allows developers to perform powerful queries on range types using PostgreSQL's built-in functions. This makes it easier to retrieve information stored in a range type column and simplifies the development process.

Particle3D is a company that is pioneering a novel method for 3D printing lightweight, customized bone implants that fuse with the skeleton before slowly disappearing. While surgeons have been using 3D printing to fabricate implants for some time, these implants are typically made out of solid materials that remain in the body indefinitely. Particle3D's process is different: it uses a special powder and laser technology to create micro-particles that mimic natural bone structure. These particles then fuse with the patient's own bones and gradually dissolve over time. This allows the patient to receive a customized implant without the need for a surgery to remove it; the implant will simply disappear as the patient heals.

Since March, many bettors have switched to betting on esports as traditional sports and casinos have declined. Every significant bookmaker now offers esports. Worldwide esports gambling revenue is expected to reach 14 billion by the year 2024. Esports betting is becoming increasingly popular, as it offers a convenient and safe way for bettors to wager on their favorite competitions and teams. Esports betting also allows bettors to take advantage of various markets, such as futures bets, live betting, and handicap betting. Additionally, many bookmakers offer competitive odds and bonuses to entice new customers. As esports continues to grow in popularity, more bookmakers will join the esports betting space, offering bettors more variety and choice.

Researchers from Facebook AI have created a model for robotic locomotion that adapts in real-time to any terrain it encounters. Rapid Motor Adaptation was developed from the idea that humans are able to learn and adapt quickly when navigating a new environment. The model enables robots to adjust the way they move in order to traverse an unfamiliar terrain, based on visual input. The technology uses a deep reinforcement learning approach that combines perception with motor control. This allows the robot to develop a "muscle memory" of how to react to different obstacles. The robot is trained to interpret visual input and then generate a set of commands to adjust its movement accordingly. The model has been tested on a robotic platform in a variety of terrains and achieved success rates of up to 90. It is hoped that this technology could eventually be used for more complex applications such as exploration and search-and-rescue missions.

Facebook is rolling out its Novi wallet in the US and Guatemala in a pilot program. Users will be able to purchase Paxos Dollar (USDP) using Novi, with Novi depositing the assets directly in Paxos. The wallet is being rolled out in conjunction with Facebook's new cryptocurrency project, Libra, which will enable users to send and receive money instantly on the platform. Novi will also allow users to make payments on the Calibra network, which is a layer two payment system built on top of the Libra network. This allows users to make payments with low fees and faster settlement times than traditional payment methods. Additionally, Novi users will be able to access other digital assets such as Bitcoin, Ethereum, and USD Coin once the project launches.

NSFW.js allows for client-side content filtering, meaning that image files can be classified before it reaches the server. It classifies images into one of 5 categories: drawing, hentai, neutral, porn, and sexy. Using the library is as simple as including it in a web page and calling the function NSFW.js.filter on an image URL. The function will return one of five categories, allowing for appropriate filtering before the image is displayed.

Silicon Valley security startup Verkada suffered a major security breach, with the hackers gaining access to over 150,000 of the company's cameras. Verkada serves companies like Tesla, Cloudflare, and Equinox, and the breach was reportedly enabled by a single admin account with hardcoded credentials. The hackers who accessed Verkada's network obtained access to live video feeds from its customers, including hospitals, schools, and prisons, as well as internal company data. The hackers also managed to gain access to customer data such as usernames, encrypted passwords, email addresses, and IP addresses. In response to the breach, Verkada has disabled all internal administrator accounts and reset customer credentials. It is working with law enforcement, cybersecurity experts, and an independent third-party to conduct a thorough investigation of the incident. The company has also committed to taking steps to strengthen its security, including implementing multi-factor authentication, stronger encryption of customer data, and improved logging and alerting capabilities.

Instacart, an app that allows users to have groceries and other household items delivered, has changed it's tipping policy. The previous tipping policy included tip amounts in it's minimum payouts, meaning drivers would receive a certain amount for their deliveries regardless of whether or not customers tipped. The new policy now allows customers to choose to tip after their groceries are delivered, with the option to add a tip ranging from no tip up to 10. This change has been made in response to customer feedback and is intended to provide drivers with more control over the income they earn.

21 feature films from Japanese animation house Studio Ghibli will be added to Netflix's library for all regions outside the US, Canada, and Japan starting next month. WarnerMedia obtained the streaming rights to the films, which include classics like My Neighbor Totoro, Kiki's Delivery Service, and Spirited Away, in April. The 21 movies will be available to stream on Netflix from February 1st, 2021. This marks the first time that Studio Ghibli films have been made available for streaming outside the US, Canada, and Japan. The announcement comes shortly after WarnerMedia secured the exclusive streaming rights to the studio's catalog. The availability of these beloved films on Netflix is sure to delight fans across the world. Studio Ghibli has been a major force in the animation industry since its founding in 1985, producing some of the most iconic and beloved films of all time. The studio is responsible for classics such as My Neighbor Totoro, Kiki's Delivery Service, and Spirited Away, as well as more recent hits like Howl's Moving Castle and Ponyo. With the addition of these films to Netflix's library, viewers around the world will now have access to one of the most beloved collections of animation ever created.

The US Navy is planning to expand its fleet so that there will be two small warships to every large warship by 2030. In order to do this, they plan to increase the number of ships in their fleet. They will also invest in modernizing existing vessels, as well as building new ones. The Navy is currently working on a 355-ship fleet plan, which includes building ships such as the guided missile destroyers, littoral combat ships, and Arleigh Burke-class destroyers. Additionally, they are looking into unmanned ships and other innovative technologies to help them reach their goal.

Our brain perceives what we see in 3D by processing and combining the images from both of our eyes. A new study shows that cuttlefish also perceive the world similarly. Our brain takes the slightly different images from each eye and combines them to form a 3D image. This is done by the visual cortex combining both images, and then calculating the differences between them to create depth perception.

Not everyone enjoys working from home, but finding an office-based job can be difficult now, especially since a company offering office jobs can be seen as a red flag. This means that many people are stuck with either working from home or taking a job that is not well suited for their skill set. The best way to find a job that fits your skill set and is office-based is to start by looking online. You can use job search engines to help you find the right job for you. You can also search for companies that offer remote work, as some of them may have openings for office-based positions. Additionally, networking with people in your industry can help you learn about potential opportunities. You may even want to consider setting up informational interviews with potential employers to get a better understanding of the role and what it entails. Finally, consider attending job fairs or other networking events to increase your chances of finding a job that suits your skills and is office-based.

This repository contains information designed for prospective analytical employees to help them in their job searches. It lists job-search platforms, sites with employee reviews on companies, online courses, competitions, skills, and more that can help job seekers stand out among the crowd. It also contains information on how to prepare for analytical interviews, such as what questions to expect, tips for giving effective data-driven presentations, and advice on how to negotiate salary and benefits. Finally, it provides resources to help job seekers stay up to date with current trends in analytics, such as data science blogs, conferences, and online communities.

Dwarf Fortress is a simulation game where players play in a deeply detailed randomly generated fantasy world. It was programmed by one developer, Tarn Adams, who has been working on the game since 2006. The game is highly complex and procedurally generated, with a focus on realism, historical accuracy, and construction. The game includes elements of city building, exploration, survival, and resource management. It also features an extensive combat system with unique weapons and creatures. Dwarf Fortress has been praised for its complexity and depth, and has been described as "a labor of love."

CRISPRoff is a new gene-editing technology that can control gene expression while leaving the sequence of the DNA unchanged. Using CRISPRoff, scientists can silence the vast majority of genes without altering their underlying sequences. CRISPRoff is based on the CRISPR-Cas system, which uses a type of bacterial immune system to protect against viral infections. In the CRISPR-Cas system, a short RNA molecule binds to a specific sequence of DNA and recruits the Cas9 protein, which then cuts the DNA strand at that particular site. In contrast to the CRISPR-Cas system, CRISPRoff doesn't cut the DNA strand. Instead, it uses a modified version of the CRISPR-Cas system, called dCas9, to recruit transcription factors that can bind to the DNA and inhibit gene expression without making any changes to the underlying sequence. By targeting these transcription factors to specific sites in the genome, scientists can selectively turn off genes without causing any permanent changes to the DNA. This technology has numerous potential applications in both medical and agricultural research. For example, it could be used to create new treatments for genetic diseases, or to develop crops that are more resistant to disease and pests. It could also be used to better understand the role of individual genes in development and disease.

The success of Beyond Meat and Impossible Foods has led to other plant-based meat replacements appearing in the market. 18 vegetable-based burgers, seven black bean burgers, and eight meat-analogue burgers are now available. Many of these products are lower in saturated fat and offer more fiber than traditional beef burgers, while some also contain additional health benefits from added vitamins and minerals. Additionally, many of these plant-based meat alternatives are free from hormones, antibiotics, and preservatives. These products are often made with a combination of soy, lentils, wheat protein, or mushrooms, and have a very similar texture to ground beef.

This article is an introduction to learning COmmon Business Oriented Language (COBOL). COBOL is a domain-specific language for business. It excels in managing and manipulating heterogeneous data in record structures, and it is the most widely used language for creating business applications. It is used to create applications that are used in a variety of industries, including banking, finance, insurance, and government. COBOL was first developed by a team of computer scientists in 1959, and since then has been updated to meet the needs of the changing computing world. It is a high-level programming language, which means it is easily readable by humans and it is also structured, which makes it easier to debug. COBOL is designed to be used with data files, which allows data to be stored, retrieved, and manipulated. COBOL is divided into four divisions: the identification division, environment division, data division, and procedure division. The identification division identifies the program and its author, while the environment division sets up the runtime environment. The data division defines the data structures used in the program, while the procedure division contains the code that actually runs the program. In order to use COBOL effectively, one must understand the syntax and structure of the language. COBOL's syntax is relatively simple, but it does have many rules that must be followed for a program to run correctly. For example, each line of code must begin with an indicator that specifies what type of instruction it is, such as READ or WRITE. In addition, all variables must be declared before they can be used in the program. Learning COBOL requires patience and dedication, but it can be a rewarding experience. Once you understand the basics, you'll be able to create complex business applications that can be used in a wide range of industries.

A Hong Kong tycoon is suing the salesman that convinced him to use a supercomputer to handle his trading, a decision which cost him more than 20 million. It is alleged that the salesman had misled the tycoon about the capabilities of the supercomputer and failed to inform him of its limitations. The tycoon is seeking compensation for the losses he incurred as a result of his decision to purchase the supercomputer. The tycoon's legal team will likely have to prove that the salesman should have known of the computer's limitations and that their failure to provide adequate information was negligent. The onus of proof will be on the tycoon to demonstrate that the salesperson made statements or representations that were false, misleading or deceptive in nature. The court may consider evidence such as the contract between the parties, communications between the two, the tycoon's own expertise and knowledge, and the experience or qualifications of the salesman. Ultimately, the court will weigh all of the evidence to determine if the salesman was liable for the tycoon's losses.

Memory is a new feature for Google Assistant that uses a digital locker to store things like to-do lists, notes, reading lists, images, and more. It is designed so users can find and access information quickly and easily. Memory is available on both Android and iOS devices. It is also accessible through the Google Assistant app.

Get started today and unlock the power of accelerated computing with Vultr Talon.

DuckDuckGo is working on a desktop browser that will help users avoid being tracked. The browser will have robust privacy protection turned on by default and function in the same way as other browsers. It will also feature an enhanced version of its existing privacy protection, which blocks third-party tracking and advertising cookies, as well as secure encryption for all searches. Additionally, the browser will provide users with access to DuckDuckGo's suite of privacy tools, such as its Privacy Essentials browser extension.

Nebular is a UI library based on Eva Design System specifications, with over 40 UI components, four visual themes, and Auth and Security modules. It was created to be customizable, responsive and easy to use. Nebular components are built with Angular and NativeScript, and they offer great performance, responsive design, accessibility support, and a wide range of customization options. It also includes authentication modules for OAuth2, OpenID Connect, and JWT, as well as security features such as two-factor authentication and passwordless login. All components are highly customizable, so developers can easily create custom designs that match their application's requirements.

The Front-End Developer Handbook is a guide for anyone to learn about the practice of front-end development. It was designed for potential and current front-end developers to equip themselves with the necessary skills to become successful in the field. It is divided into several sections to cover a wide range of topics, such as HTML, CSS, JavaScript, accessibility usability, version control, and more. The guide also includes links to helpful resources for further learning.

Fitbit announced a new premium service called Fitbit Care designed for health care customers or employers and health systems that use Fitbit to keep tabs on employees' health efforts and provide health coaching. The service includes access to a team of coaches, nurses and doctors who can offer personalized instruction and advice on how to use Fitbit devices to reach goals. It also allows employers to have access to data and insights to better understand the health of their populations and make informed decisions about workplace health initiatives.

WebGLStudio.js is a browser-based 3D graphics suite that can edit scenes and materials, design effects and shaders, and code behaviors. Everything is done in-browser, and completed works can be shared. WebGLStudio.js is built around the Three.js library, which provides a JavaScript interface for creating 3D scenes and objects. WebGLStudio.js adds features like an event system, scene editor, material editor, and more. It also comes with an integrated text editor, allowing users to write their own custom shaders and behaviors. With WebGLStudio.js, users can create interactive 3D experiences without needing to write code or install any software.

Google is testing a new feature on their Google Maps app that will allow users to receive directions though their phone camera in real time. The feature will create an augmented reality experience, allowing users to see their route as they move around in the real world. The feature will also alert users when they are approaching a turn or intersection, making it easier for them to stay on track. Google is hoping the new feature will make navigation easier and more intuitive for users, especially those who are unfamiliar with their surroundings. The feature is currently being tested on Android devices and is scheduled to roll out to all devices soon.

Lint for Sketch makes creating consistent designs easy. In computer programming, Linting is the process of using code to analyze other code for errors. Lint for Sketch analyzes Sketch design files and helps identify inconsistencies and errors. It can check for things like colors, fonts, sizes, styles, and more. With Lint for Sketch, designers can quickly check their designs for errors and ensure that they are consistent and up to standards.

A SpaceX Starship rocket prototype has exploded during a pressure test. It was the second to explode in four months. Founder Elon Musk has laughed off the incident, saying that failures are to be expected when testing new technologies, and that the company will learn from the failure and improve its designs. He also noted that SpaceX has achieved a number of successful launches and landings in recent months.

HTTPX is a next-generation HTTP client for Python which aims to provide more functionality than the requests module. In addition to the standard features of requests, HTTPX has sessions with cookie support, built-in compression and decompression of responses, asynchronous requests, web sockets, and more. It also has better performance and more efficient use of resources than the requests module.

Uber and Lyft must classify their drivers as employees unless their emergency appeal to block the ruling is successful. The companies have been under pressure for months to reclassify their drivers as employees, which would entitle them to benefits such as minimum wage and health care. The California Supreme Court recently rejected their attempt to overturn a law that requires them to classify their workers as employees. The companies have now asked the Ninth Circuit Court of Appeals for an emergency stay on the ruling.

Singapore currently produces about 10 percent of its food. Due to climate change and population growth, it aims to produce 30 percent of its food by 2030. In order to achieve this, Singapore is investing in urban agriculture initiatives, such as vertical farming. It is also encouraging the use of hydroponic and aquaponic systems to grow fruits and vegetables in smaller spaces. To further increase its food production capabilities, Singapore is investing in research and development of new technologies, including precision agriculture, robotics, and artificial intelligence. Other initiatives include working with local farmers to produce more food, supporting the development of agrotechnology parks, and encouraging the adoption of sustainable agricultural practices.

Amazon is bringing 25,000 jobs with average salaries of 150,000 to Queens in New York City, but locals are protesting the 1.525 billion (48,000 per job) that Amazon is receiving in subsidies from the state and city. They are concerned that this money could be better spent on infrastructure, housing, and schools, among other things. This is a difficult situation because it involves two competing interests. On the one hand, Amazon's 25,000 jobs would bring much-needed economic activity to Queens and create thousands of high-paying jobs. On the other, the 1.525 billion subsidy is a substantial amount of public money that could be invested in infrastructure and other services that would benefit the local community. It is important to consider the broader implications of this situation when making any decisions. For example, if the city were to invest the funds in infrastructure instead, would the benefits outweigh the costs? How many jobs would be created and what would the salary range be? What type of long-term economic impact would this investment have on the local economy? Ultimately, it is up to the people of Queens to decide how they want to use the funds. It is possible to strike a balance between the pros and cons of Amazon's job creation and the city's public investment. If a compromise is reached, both sides can benefit. For example, Amazon could agree to pay higher wages or provide additional training opportunities for local residents, while the city could commit to investing a portion of the money into infrastructure projects or other initiatives in the local community.

Microsoft has agreed to make it easier for customers to independently repair its devices. As You Sow, an investor advocacy nonprofit, filed a shareholder resolution with the SEC in June . The resolution called on Microsoft to reduce the number of steps it takes customers to repair its devices, and make sure that independent repair shops have access to necessary parts, tools, and information to do the job. Microsoft has agreed to make it easier for customers to independently repair its devices. It will continue to provide service parts, tools, and diagnostic software to customers who want to fix their own devices or take them to a third-party repair shop. Microsoft is also making it easier for customers to find certified repair shops through its website. Finally, the company is committed to providing clear instructions and advice to help customers repair their devices.

Amazon is in advanced talks to buy self-driving startup Zoox, which was valued at 3.2 billion in 2018. The deal is still being finalized and discussions could still fall apart. If the deal is successful, Amazon would become the latest tech giant to make a major move into the self-driving car space. Self-driving technology has been seen as an important component for companies such as Amazon, which are hoping to expand their delivery services and reduce reliance on human labor. The acquisition of Zoox could also give Amazon a leg up in its competition with rivals such as Uber and Waymo. The startup has developed its own autonomous driving system, and its vehicles have already undergone extensive testing. It's unclear how much Amazon is offering for Zoox, but the purchase price is likely to be significantly higher than the company's last valuation.

It's a big day for billionaires with rockets folks! Jeff Bezos' rocket company Blue Origin is set to launch their New Shepard 10 rocket at 9:30 AM EST (3 hours from now). The rocket will be carrying several experiments and payloads into space. The launch of the New Shepard 10 rocket marks a major milestone for Blue Origin as it is the first time they will be sending an orbital-class rocket into space. This historic moment could have implications for future space exploration, as Blue Origin looks to become a leader in private spaceflight. The launch can be watched live on YouTube and through Blue Origin's website. After the launch, the company will be holding a press conference to discuss the mission and its results. Be sure to tune in and follow along!

Trevor Milton has stepped down from Nikola's board of directors. Milton will be replaced by Stephen Girsky, a former vice-chairman of GM. Nikola shares fell 22 percent in US pre-market trading following the news. The news of Milton's departure comes after a series of controversies and legal issues surrounding the company, including allegations of fraud and misleading investors. Nikola has denied any wrongdoing and said that the investigations have not concluded. The company has also come under scrutiny for its business partnerships with GM and other companies. Girsky is expected to bring more experience and oversight to Nikola as it navigates these issues and works to build out its hydrogen fuel cell electric vehicle development and production plans. As part of the transition, Milton will remain as an adviser to the company.

A team of scientists used high-energy X-rays to analyze ancient Egyptian papyri fragments and found lead compounds in both the red and black inks used. This is evidence that lead -based pigments were used in the ink of ancient Egyptian documents, a practice that had been suggested by previous researchers. The team also identified carbon and other elements in the ink, which allowed them to distinguish between different inks used on the same document. The findings suggest that ancient Egyptians had a sophisticated knowledge of chemistry and colorants, and it could help historians better understand ancient texts.

Many of Apple's employees have been fighting against the company's plans to require employees to work at least three days a week in the office. Employees were originally told to return to their offices by September, but due to the protests, Apple has since delayed the plan indefinitely. Apple has also made a number of changes in response to the protests, such as granting employees more flexible hours and allowing them to take unpaid leave for up to two months. The company has also said that it will continue to evaluate the situation and make adjustments as needed.

Scientists at the Fermilab in Illinois have measured the mass of a subatomic particle called the W boson. The ultraprecise measurement found that the particle had a mass seven standard deviations greater than the Standard Model prediction. The discovery of the W boson with a mass seven standard deviations greater than the predicted value confirms that there is new physics beyond the Standard Model. The discrepancy between the measured and predicted values could be due to an undiscovered particle or interactions in the subatomic world that have yet to be discovered. It also strengthens the case for further research into the behavior of particles at the smallest scale. Scientists are now looking for further evidence of this new physics, which could provide insight into some of the unsolved mysteries of modern physics.

Barcelona-based startup Kreios Space plans to send satellites on very low Earth orbit (VLEO) missions. VLEO is a zone between 95 to 250 miles of altitude. Most satellites operate at higher altitudes such as Low Earth Orbit (LEO) ranging from 95 to 1,200 miles. Kreios Space's satellites will be used for applications such as remote sensing, maritime surveillance, asset tracking, and communication services. The company plans to leverage their low altitude to provide better resolution images, faster response times, and a more cost-effective service than traditional LEO missions. The company has developed a propulsion system that allows their satellites to remain in VLEO orbits, which is critical for the success of their mission. Kreios Space is currently working with customers and partners to develop their first VLEO satellite. They plan to launch their first satellite in 2021 and have ambitious goals to launch up to 50 satellites over the next five years.

A new privacy-focused cryptocurrency has become popular recently, and not only because of its Harry Potter theme. Grin promises to create a cryptocurrency that is both 'light' and completely anonymous. It uses a technology called MimbleWimble, which is designed to offer stronger privacy protections than other cryptocurrencies. Grin also has no pre-mine, meaning that all coins are created in an equal manner and not held by any particular person or group. This ensures that the coin remains fair and decentralized. Grin also has low transaction fees, meaning it can be used for small purchases without having to worry about high fees. Finally, Grin has no ICO or pre-sale, meaning that the developers have no incentive to inflate the value of the currency. All of these features make Grin an attractive option for those looking for a private and secure way to store and transfer their wealth.

A team of researchers from the University of Cambridge has increased the amount of energy extractable from photosynthetic bacteria by over an order of magnitude. Scientists have been trying to harness photosynthetic bacteria such as cyanobacteria to generate energy since the 1970s. These bacteria convert light energy into electrical energy using a process called "biophotovoltaics," however the efficiency of this process had been limited until now. The team of researchers increased the efficiency of the biophotovoltaic process by creating a new kind of semi-conducting material that could be used to augment the existing process. The new material, called a "bio-hybrid nanostructure," is composed of organic and inorganic components that work together to maximize the amount of energy that can be extracted from the bacteria. The research team believes that their new material could eventually lead to the development of more efficient and cost effective biophotovoltaic cells. This would enable the creation of an entirely renewable source of energy that could provide electricity to homes, businesses and even entire cities. Although the technology is still in its infancy, the team is optimistic that their findings will one day revolutionize the way we generate energy.

This website contains a collection of JavaScript utilities that fit within a single line of code. Categories include arrays, date time, DOM, number, string, and misc. Users are welcome to submit their own utilities to the collection. The website also features a blog section, which provides helpful JavaScript tutorials and tips. Users can also find links to resources such as frameworks, libraries, and plugins.

Tesla is selling a mini Cyberquad designed for kids for 1,900. The Cyberquad can get up to around 15 miles on a full charge, which takes five hours. It can go up to speeds of up to 15 mph and comes with adjustable speed settings. It also features a front headlight, a USB charging port, and a storage compartment.

Sperm counts in the West have dropped by 50 percent due to pesticides, plastics, and other chemicals. Chemicals used to make plastic soft and flexible, like phthalates, are endocrine disruptors , meaning they interfere with the body's hormones. This can cause sperm production to be reduced, leading to a decrease in sperm counts. The use of pesticides can also reduce sperm count by killing off beneficial organisms that aid in sperm production. In addition, exposure to radiation from cell phones and other electronic devices may damage DNA in sperm, reducing their numbers.

Joby Aviation has joined forces with Uber to launch a flying taxi service by 2023. Joby has been working on electric aviation for over a decade. It was relatively obscure before the Uber partnership. Now, they are leading the effort to make flying taxis a reality. Joby's aircraft is powered by 12 electric engines and can reach speeds of up to 200mph, with a range of 150 miles. The company plans to deploy a network of all-electric vertical takeoff and landing (eVTOL) vehicles that will allow riders to travel quickly and economically over congested city traffic. Joby's aircraft is designed to be safe, reliable, and quiet. It has redundant systems in place to ensure safety and reliability, while also ensuring low noise levels. The aircraft is also designed to be easy to maintain and use, allowing for quick deployment and lower operating costs. In addition, the aircraft is designed to be energy efficient, using a battery system that is designed to last for more than 1,000 flights. Through its partnership with Uber, Joby will provide the technology, aircraft, and services needed to develop the world's first on-demand urban air taxi service. Uber will provide the customer service and operations infrastructure, as well as the application platform needed to power the service. The two companies plan to launch the service in select cities by 2023.

Tensorflow Privacy implements Tensorflow optimizers for training machine learning models with differential privacy. The repository contains source code, tutorials, and analysis tools for computing under these privacy constraints. Contribution to the repository is welcome. TensorFlow Privacy can help machine learning practitioners achieve differential privacy in their model training, by using techniques such as adding noise to gradients and clipping weights. It also provides tools for verifying that a trained model satisfies certain privacy guarantees. Finally, it includes several tutorials and code examples to help users get started with differentially private training.

In a project called Mission Shakti, India has successfully tested its Anti-Satellite (ASAT) Missile, which destroyed a low-orbiting satellite on Wednesday. While it is unknown who the satellite belonged to, India is one of the only four countries in the world, along with the United States, China and Russia, to possess this capability. The test is a major milestone for India's space program, as it makes the country a member of an elite group of nations that have demonstrated their ability to shoot down satellites in orbit.
