This is also a significant step forward for India's defense capabilities, as the ASAT missile can be used to take out enemy satellites or prevent them from being used for surveillance or intelligence gathering purposes. It is important to note that the test does not violate any international treaties or regulations, since the target satellite was orbiting at a relatively low altitude. However, some experts have expressed concern that the debris created by the destruction of the satellite could have negative long-term effects on other satellites in the same orbit. They are also worried that other countries may now feel the need to develop their own ASAT missiles in order to keep up with India. Regardless, India has made a bold statement with this mission and it will undoubtedly have long-lasting implications for the global space race.

Mobile Verification Toolkit is a collection of tools that automates the process of gathering forensic traces of potential compromises on Android and iOS devices. It was developed by the Amnesty International Digital Verification Corps to help human rights advocates, journalists and others verify information they receive from mobile devices. The toolkit includes a variety of tools that can be used to collect data such as call logs, text messages, photos, videos, and other files. It also includes instructions for analyzing the data collected. The toolkit is designed to be used by those with little to no technical knowledge, so its interface is simple and straightforward.

Google employees will not be able to expense on food and other perks like home office furniture and fitness subscriptions while working from home. Employees will not be able to expense for meals, transportation, or entertainment expenses incurred while working from home. However, employees may be able to access certain corporate discounts or other incentives if available.

The 61st International Mathematical Olympiad (IMO) is the first IMO that has been held remotely and may also be the last time that artificial intelligence doesn't compete. Researchers view the 2020 IMO as a testbed for future AI-driven educational technology. The 2020 IMO was administered to over 6,000 students from 115 countries and featured a total of six problems which were designed and marked by the IMO Committee. Each problem was composed of two questions with supplementary materials providing additional information or guidance to the students. The problems covered topics such as algebra, number theory, geometry, combinatorics, probability and statistics, and graph theory. In addition to the main competition, the 2020 IMO also included multiple ancillary events such as an online seminar series, an international lecture series, and an online exhibition. The virtual format of the event enabled IMO participants from around the world to interact in real time and gain exposure to other countries' mathematical cultures. By enabling students to engage in discussion and collaboration, it is hoped that these activities will aid in developing a global community of mathematicians. Given the success of the 2020 IMO, there has been increased interest in using artificial intelligence (AI) in mathematical competitions. AI can be used to create puzzles and provide solutions to existing problems, allowing students to focus on higher-level problem solving rather than on basic calculations. AI could also help assess student performance, provide feedback on their work, and suggest areas of improvement. As AI becomes more advanced, it could potentially be used to evaluate students' written explanations and offer feedback on their performance. This could lead to a more comprehensive assessment of student progress and help identify areas of strength and weakness. AI could also be used to generate personalized learning pathways for each student, helping them to hone in on their individual strengths and weaknesses. Ultimately, AI technology has the potential to revolutionize the way we teach and learn mathematics. By providing an efficient, accurate assessment system and personalized learning pathways, AI could help students better prepare for future international math competitions and give them the tools they need to succeed.

Voice is a new social media platform that rewards its users for quality content. It is based on the EOS blockchain. Users on the platform are rewarded with Voice tokens for creating, curating, and interacting with content. Voice also allows users to monetize their content and build a reputation based on their contributions to the platform. The platform also incentivizes users to continue creating quality content by rewarding them with tokens for upvoting and commenting on other users' posts.

The antitrust probe into Google is now moving beyond the company's advertising business and will start to investigate its search and Android businesses. The civil investigative demands into Google might result in the company being found to have been abusing its dominant market position. Google could face significant fines and be forced to make changes to its business practices if the probe finds any wrongdoing.

Chipotle Mexican Grill will open its first digital-only restaurant on Saturday. The location will only service online orders and will not include a dining room or an area for ordering. Customers can place orders through the company's website or mobile app and pick up their food from a designated area. The restaurant is located in Highland Falls, New York and will be open seven days a week from 11 a.m. to 8 p.m. The new digital-only restaurant follows the success of Chipotle's restaurants that also offer delivery services. The opening of the new location is part of the company's efforts to expand its digital presence and provide customers with more options for ordering and picking up their food.

Facebook is buying a 10 stake in India's Reliance Industries for 5.7 billion. Reliance Industries owns a share of Jio Platforms Ltd, who owns Jio Infocomm, a telecom business. WhatsApp , a Facebook-owned company, will be partnering with Jio Platforms to bring digital services to more Indians. This will help Facebook to expand its presence in India, one of the largest markets for social media and mobile internet.

Usually, if a company finds a product on Amazon that breaches copyright they can ask Amazon to take down the product listing. Project Zero is a new program by Amazon that helps brands protect their intellectual property by allowing them to directly remove suspected counterfeits. This program is available to brands that register with Amazon Brand Registry and meet certain eligibility requirements. If a company finds a product on Amazon that breaches copyright and they are not enrolled in the Project Zero program, they can still take action against the listing. They can report the product to Amazon using the Report Infringement form and provide evidence of the infringement. Amazon will then review and take action if appropriate. If the product remains active after being reported, the company may consider taking legal action against the seller.

YouTube and Amazon have finally ended their feud after a year of negotiations. The YouTube app will now return to Amazon's Fire TV products, and the Amazon Prime Video app will be available on select Smart TVs and game consoles powered by Google's Android TV operating system. The feud began in 2017 when Amazon stopped selling some Google products, including the Chromecast streaming device and the Home smart speaker. In response, Google blocked YouTube from the Fire TV platform, which left millions of Amazon customers unable to watch their favorite videos. After a year of negotiations, both companies have agreed to make their services available on each other's platforms. The agreement is a major win for consumers as it ensures they can access both services on their preferred devices. By making their products more widely available, both companies are better positioned to compete with their rivals, such as Apple and Roku.

Sidewalk Labs, a subsidiary of Alphabet which focuses on city and urban development, has released its Master Innovation and Development Plan for a proposed smart neighborhood on Toronto's Eastern Waterfront. It outlines innovative uses of public spaces, cutting-edge technologies, improved sustainability measures, and economic opportunities. The plan includes proposals for connected streets with sensors to help track traffic and pedestrian data, energy efficient buildings, and a local digital currency. It also features ideas for new green infrastructure, such as rain gardens, and space for parks and other public amenities. Sidewalk Labs also plans to create an independent civic data trust to manage the collected data, and invest in initiatives related to affordable housing, jobs, and education.

Researchers with NASAJPL-Caltech recently revealed'Mars Dogs' robots that can maneuver in ways that the wheeled rovers on other planets never could. They are a modified version of Boston Dynamics' Spot robot, outfitted with a custom-built suspension system that allows them to traverse the Martian terrain. The robots are designed to help scientists explore the Red Planet and gather data about its geological features. The team hopes that the 'Mars Dogs' will be able to collect scientific data from hard-to-reach areas, such as cliffs and crevices, that traditional rovers cannot access. They also plan to use the robots to take images, collect samples, and conduct experiments on Mars. With their impressive mobility capabilities, the 'Mars Dogs' could significantly increase our understanding of the planet's geology and environment.

Russia plans to temporarily disconnect the entire country from the internet in an exercise designed to test the country's internet infrastructure in case of a cyber-war. The test is expected to begin on April 1 and will last for several hours. The Russian government has stated that the purpose of the test is to ensure that Russia can protect its citizens and vital infrastructure from cyber-attacks in the event of an international conflict. During the test, internet service providers will be required to re-route all traffic through a single exchange point, which will be monitored by the government. This will allow the government to analyze the data flow and identify any potential vulnerabilities. In addition, the government has promised that there will be no disruption of service for ordinary users during the test.

Uber and autonomous vehicle company Motional have partnered up to provide autonomous deliveries through Uber Eats. A pilot program will launch sometime in early 2022 in Santa Monica, California. Only certain restaurants will be able to participate in the program and deliveries will only be available to certain areas. Customers will be able to track their order in real-time, including knowing when it has left the restaurant and when it is expected to arrive. The vehicles used for the program are specially designed for food delivery and feature temperature-controlled compartments to ensure safe delivery of food. Additionally, safety drivers will be used to monitor the vehicles and take over if needed.

The World Economic Forum's'Future of Jobs Report' surveys corporate executives in 35 countries around the world about how they think the workforce will change in the next five years. Its findings include predictions that the use of automation technologies, such as robotics and artificial intelligence, will increase significantly; the global workforce will become increasingly mobile; and there will be a greater emphasis on skills for the digital economy. The report also finds that the jobs landscape will become more complex, with multiple job categories emerging, the need for new types of skills, and a shift towards non-standard forms of employment, such as freelance and contract work.

Light from stars tend to pulsate uniformly across the whole surface of a star. Astronomers have discovered a teardrop-shaped object that only pulses from one side. The star is about one-third the size of our Sun and is believed to be an exoplanet, meaning that it orbits a star outside of our Solar System. This could indicate that the planet has an eccentric orbit around its star, causing the light to only pulse from one side of the planet.

Facebook has unveiled its plans to build Facebook Horizon, a virtual reality sandbox universe where users can create their own environments and games, play and socialize with friends, or just explore. The platform is expected to launch in 2020 and will be available on the Oculus Quest, Oculus Rift, and HTC VIVE headsets. Facebook Horizon is designed to provide a safe and secure place for people to explore, create, and play together in virtual reality. It will feature a range of tools that allow users to customize their own worlds and build their own games, as well as providing access to a variety of social experiences. The platform will also feature interactive tutorials and guides to help new players learn how to use the various features and tools, as well as allowing users to join existing activities or events hosted by other members of the community. Facebook Horizon will be free to play, with optional in-app purchases available to unlock additional content. The company hopes to make the platform a welcoming and inclusive environment for everyone, and has promised to take steps to ensure the safety of all its users.

This is a set of 3,000 company logos in SVG format. I actually built the TLDR sponsors page right before I found this, but this would have made it much easier! The logos can be used for a variety of purposes, such as website design, mobile app design, print media, or any other application that requires the use of vector graphics. They are all in SVG format, making them resolution-independent and easy to scale. Each logo comes with a transparent background, so they will look great on any color background. Additionally, all logos include their branding colors as part of the package, making it easy for designers to quickly update a logo's colors if needed.

Researchers at MIT have observed electron whirlpools for the first time in crystals of tungsten ditelluride. Electricity is made up of discrete particles, and it can flow with the viscosity of a liquid in solid materials. In tungsten ditelluride, the electrical current can move in swirling patterns like whirlpools. The researchers used a scanning tunneling microscope to image electrons moving in the material. They found that electrons were moving in circular patterns around defects in the crystal structure. The electron whirlpools were formed when two electrons with opposite spins got close enough together that their wavefunctions overlapped and interfered. This caused them to repel each other and form a vortex-like motion. The researchers believe that the electron whirlpools could have potential applications in electronics and spintronics. By understanding the underlying physics behind these whirlpools, they may be able to use them to create more efficient transistors and memory devices. They also suggest that the whirlpools could be used to transport energy or information between components.

Netflix unveiled a virtual streamer this week as the host of a weekly show on the company's YouTube channel. N-ko Mei Kurono is a sheep-human lifeform. Virtual YouTubers (Vtubers) are becoming increasingly popular in Japan, and Netflix is the first major international media company to embrace the trend. N-ko will host "Netflix Chilling with N-ko," a weekly show which will feature episodes about various Netflix shows and movies. The show will also include interviews with cast and crew members from Netflix Originals. The company believes that N-ko will be able to engage more deeply with viewers by virtue of being a virtual character.

A Belgian research group discovered a major security flaw in the keyless entry system of the Tesla Model X. The attack uses a device built from a Raspberry Pi computer and a cheap radio transmitter, which costs around 40. The attack works by intercepting the signals sent from the car to the key fob when it is used to unlock the doors. The attackers then use the Raspberry Pi to replay those signals, allowing them to open the car without having access to the actual key fob. Tesla has since released a software update to address the security flaw. The update requires owners to enter their unique PIN code each time they use the keyless entry system. This prevents attackers from using the same signal-spoofing technique to gain access to the vehicle. Tesla also recommends that owners keep their key fobs in a Faraday bag when not in use, which will block any malicious radio signals from being received by the key fob.

OpenAI has released the full version of GPT-2, a text-generating AI system. When it was first announced, there were concerns that it could be misused to spread fake news, spam, and other malicious content. In response to these concerns, OpenAI has taken a number of steps to ensure that GPT-2 is used responsibly. Most importantly, they have released the full version of GPT-2 as open source software, allowing anyone to access and use it responsibly. They have also set up a moderation system to monitor how GPT-2 is being used, and are working with researchers and content creators to ensure its use is responsible. Finally, they have provided clear guidelines on how GPT-2 should be used, emphasizing respect for copyright laws and ethical principles.

The truth is in the code: Fixing vulnerabilities with Sourcegraph. Remediate vulnerabilities with confidence knowing you found every instance of affected code and track your remediation initiatives to completion with Sourcegraph. Sourcegraph is a code search and security vulnerability platform that enables engineering teams to quickly identify, fix, and verify security vulnerabilities in their codebase. With Sourcegraph, teams can easily search through and explore their codebase to identify all instances of affected code, review the changes needed to remediate the issue, and track the progress of the remediation initiatives to completion. Sourcegraph also provides automated alerts when new or existing vulnerabilities are detected, allowing teams to act quickly on potential issues.

Appwrite is a set of Docker microservices that serves as an end-to-end backend server for Web, Mobile, Native, or Backend apps. It can be used to easily integrate user authentication , data storage, real-time communication, serverless functions, payments and more into any app. Appwrite is open source and can be used to quickly build powerful, secure, and reliable applications. Appwrite is built with modern technologies such as Node.js, MongoDB, Redis, and GraphQL. The microservices are designed to be independent and can be customized to fit any specific requirements. Appwrite also includes tools to help developers manage their projects, including a CLI and an API Explorer.

Amazon has purchased Facebook's small-satellite division. Facebook was designing and testing ways to advance satellite connectivity as part of an effort to enable the next generation of broadband infrastructure. It is unclear what Amazon plans to do with the technology, though speculation suggests that Amazon may use it to widen its own internet infrastructure capabilities.

Google Cloud has made its first major acquisition under its new CEO, Thomas Kurian. Kurian, a former executive at Oracle, joined Google in November and had announced plans to expand the company's cloud business. Google has acquired Looker, a Santa Cruz-based business intelligence platform which provides data analytics and visualization tools to help companies draw insights from large datasets. The acquisition is reportedly worth 2.6 billion. Looker will become part of Google Cloud's portfolio as a standalone product, and its team will remain in Santa Cruz, with Google Cloud President Tariq Shaukat overseeing the integration into Google Cloud. According to Google, Looker will help bring customers more "unified data experiences" across marketing, sales, finance, and other departments, while also helping them gain deeper insights from their data. The acquisition marks a major move for Google Cloud, which has been looking to expand its presence in the enterprise market. It is also one of the largest acquisitions made by Google since founding CEO Sundar Pichai took over in 2015. The purchase of Looker is expected to accelerate Google Cloud's growth and strengthen its position against competitors such as Amazon Web Services and Microsoft Azure.

CS106A - Code in Place is the first half of CS106A, a popular course at Stanford University that teaches the fundamentals of computer programming through Python. It assumes no previous experience with programming and starts from the basics. The course covers topics such as variables, strings, conditionals, loops, functions, classes, and objects. It also introduces students to some of the more advanced features of Python including recursion and object-oriented programming. Throughout the course, students complete hands-on projects to apply what they learn.

Harvard has created a Harvard Ambulatory Microrobot the size of a penny that can run at speeds of 13.9 body lengths per second. HAMR-JR was built as a test to harness the power of minuscule robots to explore and interact with their environment. The tiny robot consists of two millimeter-long legs, each driven by its own motor. It is powered by a battery that can last for up to five minutes at a time. With its small size and high speed, HAMR-JR could be used in medical applications, such as delivering drugs or performing surgery. The robot also has applications outside of medicine, such as search and rescue missions and environmental monitoring.

Scientists from Japan have found a species of slug that can self-decapitate and regrow their bodies from their heads. It appears that the slug does this in response to parasites and other environmental threats. The species of slug, named Onchidiopsis japonica, was discovered by researchers from the Graduate School of Science at Kyoto University in Japan. The slugs have an unusual adaptation that allows them to sacrifice their heads in order to survive if they are threatened by parasites or other environmental factors. The detached head then regenerates its body over time. This unique trait is believed to be the result of a combination of genetic and epigenetic factors, which control the expression of genes without altering the underlying DNA sequence. This means that the decapitation and regeneration process can occur multiple times in the same individual, allowing it to survive multiple threats. The discovery of this phenomenon highlights the remarkable adaptability of some species to survive in extreme environments. It also provides insight into the potential for humans to develop similar regenerative abilities.

Google has announced the Pixel 4A, Pixel 5, and the Pixel 4A 5G. The Pixel 4A will ship on August 20th while the other two handsets will ship sometime this fall. The Pixel 4A is powered by a Qualcomm Snapdragon 730G processor and has a 5.8-inch FHD OLED display with a hole-punch camera. It also comes with 6GB of RAM and 128GB of storage. It has a 12MP primary rear camera and an 8MP selfie camera. The device will launch with Android 10 and its battery is rated at 3,140 mAh. The Pixel 5 is powered by the Snapdragon 765G processor and has a 6-inch FHD OLED display with a hole-punch camera. It has 8GB of RAM and 128GB of storage. It has a dual-camera setup on the back consisting of a 12.2MP primary camera and a 16MP ultrawide angle lens. It has an 8MP selfie camera and the device will launch with Android 11. Its battery is rated at 4,000mAh. The Pixel 4A 5G is powered by the same Snapdragon 765G processor as the Pixel 5 and has a 6.2-inch FHD OLED display with a hole-punch camera. It has 6GB of RAM and 128GB of storage. It has a dual-camera setup on the back consisting of a 12.2MP primary camera and a 16MP ultrawide angle lens. It has an 8MP selfie camera and the device will launch with Android 11. Its battery is rated at 3,885mAh.

GitHub Sponsors is a way to fund your Open Source project, but most developers aren't getting the most out of it. Getting people to sponsor you can be difficult. A few tips to help increase your success include creating a compelling project description and goal, creating easy ways for people to support you, leveraging social media to promote your project, and offering rewards or incentives to people who sponsor you. Additionally, having a consistent presence in the Open Source community can be helpful in gaining visibility. Finally, it's important to remember that building relationships with potential sponsors is key to getting them to invest in your project.

El Salvador may become the world's first sovereign nation to adopt bitcoin as legal tender. The country recently partnered with digital wallet company Strike to build modern financial infrastructure using bitcoin. The Central American country of nearly 6.5 million people is one of the poorest in the region, with an economy largely based on remittances from its citizens working abroad. The adoption of bitcoin as legal tender could provide a much-needed boost to El Salvador's economy by providing more efficient and secure financial services for its citizens. The move would also make it easier for overseas workers to send money home without relying on potentially expensive international banking services. Additionally, bitcoin's blockchain technology could provide increased transparency and accountability in government transactions. The initiative is still in its early stages and further details are yet to be released. However, if successful, El Salvador could set a precedent for other countries looking to adopt cryptocurrency as legal tender.

A fossilized dinosaur embryo preparing to hatch from its egg was discovered in southern China. It is one of the best-preserved dinosaur embryos ever found. The embryo's posture was similar to that of a modern bird, suggesting that dinosaurs may have hatched in a similar way. The discovery of the fossilized dinosaur embryo is an exciting one for paleontologists, as it provides new insight into the early development and behavior of dinosaurs. The embryo was embedded in fine-grained sediment and preserved in three dimensions. It revealed details such as the embryo's head, limbs, and tail, which had been partially extended, suggesting that the embryo was preparing to hatch from its egg. The position of the embryo suggests that dinosaurs may have hatched in a similar manner to modern birds, with their heads bent forward and their legs almost fully extended. This implies that some form of parental care may have been involved in dinosaur hatching, similar to what is seen today in many species of birds. The discovery also has implications for other aspects of dinosaur biology, such as their growth rate, metabolism, and feeding habits. The embryo's size implies that the animal would have been relatively mature at the time of hatching, which suggests that dinosaurs grew very quickly during their early stages of life. This discovery provides a fascinating glimpse into the world of dinosaurs, giving us insight into their behavior and biology. It is a reminder that even though they are extinct, we can still learn a great deal about them through careful study of the fossil record.

GPT-3 is OpenAI's new language model. It has 175 billion parameters, but it is unclear whether a full version or whether one of seven smaller versions will be released. GPT-3 is the third iteration of OpenAI's Generative Pre-trained Transformer (GPT) series. It is a large transformer-based language model that has been trained on a dataset of 45TB of text. GPT-3 can be used for a variety of natural language processing (NLP) tasks, such as summarization, question answering, translation, and text generation. Its goal is to provide state-of-the-art results without task-specific fine-tuning. GPT-3 has already demonstrated impressive performance in a number of tasks, including question-answering, summarization, and text generation.

Scientists have determined that mantis shrimp will fight longer and harder for burrows of ideal size by pitching them against each other in a competition over preferred burrows. There were two groups of mantis shrimp observed in the study, with one being more aggressive than the other. In the competition, the aggressive group was found to win out a majority of the time. In addition, researchers also noted that mantis shrimp would fight longer and harder when they had access to burrows of ideal size. The study found that the more aggressive shrimp spent more time defending their burrow, while the less aggressive shrimp moved around more and were less likely to hold onto the same burrow for an extended period of time. Overall, the study revealed that mantis shrimp will fight longer and harder for burrows of ideal size when they are engaged in competition with each other. This helps them ensure access to preferred habitats and resources and can increase their chances of survival.

Instacart is still seeing a surge in customer demands and has recently announced that it will hire another 250,000 shoppers on top of the 300,000 shoppers it hired last month. The company has also announced several measures to ensure the safety of both its customers and shoppers, including contactless delivery, requiring shoppers to wear face masks, and providing an increased number of disinfecting supplies for shoppers. Additionally, Instacart is using machine learning technology to optimize route planning and delivery times. Finally, the company is working with local and national health organizations to provide free groceries to those in need during the pandemic.

I'm a big fan of these rapid-fire type blog posts (you might want to check out Tyler Cowen's Marginal Revolution if you enjoy them too). This is basically a list of interesting facts, news items, and new developments that I've come across in the past week. 1. Scientists have discovered a new species of deep-sea fish off the coast of Australia, dubbed the "black dragonfish" due to its pitch black scales and long, pointed teeth. 2. In a historic first, scientists have successfully edited human embryos using the CRISPR gene-editing technology. 3. The world's largest radio telescope, the Five-hundred-meter Aperture Spherical Telescope (FAST), has been completed in China. 4. Researchers in the UK have developed a new type of artificial intelligence algorithm called "DeepMind" which is capable of playing complex video games better than any other computer system. 5. After months of negotiations, the US and China have agreed on a landmark trade deal that will reduce tariffs and open up markets for both countries. 6. Scientists in Antarctica have discovered an ancient meteorite that could provide insight into the beginnings of our solar system. 7. Google has announced plans to launch an internet satellite constellation that will beam wireless internet access to remote areas around the globe. 8. The European Space Agency's Rosetta spacecraft has ended its 12-year mission by crash-landing on the surface of a comet.

Thomas Dohmke is stepping into the CEO role at GitHub. Nat Friedman will become the Chairman Emeritus of the service. Dohmke has a background as a developer and open source advocate, and his experience in community building will be a great asset for GitHub. Friedman has been the CEO of GitHub since its acquisition by Microsoft in 2018, and he will continue to serve as an advisor to the company. He is also joining Microsoft's board of directors. The leadership change follows a long period of growth for GitHub, which recently surpassed 40 million users. The platform enables software developers, teams, and enterprises to collaborate on code development and other tasks. Dohmke said he was looking forward to leading the company into its next phase of growth. Friedman said that he was proud of what the team had accomplished under his leadership and that he was excited to see the new CEO take the reins. He praised Dohmke's deep understanding of the open source community and said that he was confident the company would continue to thrive under his guidance. This leadership transition comes at a key moment for GitHub. The company faces increasing competition from other code hosting platforms, such as GitLab, and it needs to remain competitive in order to continue its success. With Dohmke at the helm and Friedman offering his expertise, GitHub is well-positioned to remain a key player in the industry.

Amazon's yet-unnamed Lord of the Rings original series will debut on Prime Video on September 22, 2022. The series will take place thousands of years before the events of The Lord of the Rings and explore new storylines that are previously untold in the Tolkien universe.

DazzleSpy is a macOS malware that was installed using an exploit that only required targets to visit a booby-trapped webpage. The malware would have required significant resources to develop. It was used to target high-value targets, such as political activists and government officials. DazzleSpy is a sophisticated piece of malware that is designed to steal data from victims' computers, such as documents, emails, passwords, and other confidential information. It can also take screenshots, record keystrokes, and exfiltrate data via an FTP server. It does this by exploiting vulnerabilities in the OS X operating system. The malware was discovered by security firm Kaspersky Lab in April 2021. It is believed to have been developed by a Chinese-speaking threat actor and is related to the LuckyCat campaign. The campaign has been active since 2016 and is believed to be targeting people in Asia, Europe, the Middle East, and Africa. It is believed to be part of a larger espionage operation.

new.css is a classless CSS framework that can write modern websites using only HTML. It features a dark mode and support for custom color themes and fonts using CSS variables. It also provides a grid system, typography styles, and various utility classes. The library is designed to be lightweight and portable, so it can be used in any project without the need for additional libraries or frameworks.

The US military has been building a massive database with millions of images of faces, irises, fingerprints, and DNA data over the last 15 years. There are at least 7.4 million records in the database, which is used to identify individuals for military and intelligence agencies. The data is collected from sources such as passport applications, driver's licenses, and biometric scans from people who have been detained by U.S. forces. This information is used to track individuals and identify potential suspects as well as verify identities of personnel at various government facilities. Additionally, the military has used facial recognition technology to identify suspected terrorists and other threats in the Middle East.

Green Launch is a company that wants to launch satellites into space using a huge gas cannon. A hydrogen impulse launcher is a long tube filled with hydrogen, helium, and oxygen mixed with a combustible fuel, such as kerosene. The launcher is placed on the ground and pointed toward space. When ignited, the fuel will rapidly expand, creating an enormous force that will propel the satellite into orbit. The gas cannon is relatively inexpensive compared to traditional rocket launchers, and it can launch satellites in a fraction of the time.

CSS was never designed to be a server-side language, but that doesn't mean that it can't be used as one. This article walks through how to use CSS as a server-side language in order to create dynamic web pages. First, it's important to note that CSS is not a programming language, but rather a style sheet language used to describe the presentation of HTML documents. This means that it does not have the capability to execute commands, such as looping or if-then statements. However, CSS can still be used to create dynamic websites by taking advantage of its rules-based approach. The most common way to use CSS as a server-side language is with preprocessors. Preprocessors like Sass and Less allow developers to write code snippets that are then compiled into valid CSS. This allows for more complex logic than what is possible in regular CSS, including looping and conditions. Another way to use CSS as a server-side language is to take advantage of the power of the cascade. By using the cascade, developers can define different styles for the same element based on certain conditions, such as device type or user role. This allows them to create dynamic webpages without having to write any additional code. Finally, CSS can also be used to create dynamic websites using JavaScript. By using JavaScript libraries like jQuery and React, developers can write code that manipulates the DOM and applies CSS styles based on certain conditions. This is especially useful for creating interactive features such as drop-down menus and image galleries. By taking advantage of the power of CSS, developers can create dynamic webpages without having to learn a traditional programming language. It's important to keep in mind that CSS is not a programming language, but by using preprocessors and the cascade, it is possible to create dynamic webpages.

As one of the largest social networks, Facebook receives a massive amount of content from users all over the world. While Facebook has rules regarding the type of content that can be posted and shared, it can still be difficult for the company to keep up with all of the user-generated content that is posted. To ensure that Facebook stays in compliance with its rules and regulations, it has implemented several automated systems and processes that help to monitor and remove any inappropriate or offensive content. This includes using artificial intelligence (AI) algorithms to detect and remove posts that violate the company's terms of service, as well as human moderators to review flagged content. Additionally, Facebook has implemented a system of community standards and guidelines that users must adhere to when posting on the site, and violations of these standards can result in the removal of posts or even user accounts.

A study has confirmed that new neurons are still being made well past adolescence, and suggested that older studies that had claimed otherwise were flawed in their methodology. Older studies had claimed that neuron creation was limited to early childhood, but this study has overturned this belief. The researchers used a technique called BrdU labeling, in which injections of bromodeoxyuridine (BrdU) were given to the subjects and then tracked over time. This enabled them to accurately measure the rate of neuron production and the duration of the process. The results showed that new neurons are indeed created throughout adulthood, though at a much slower pace than during childhood. This finding is important for understanding the human brain and could lead to advances in research on neurodegenerative diseases and mental health disorders. It may also have implications for therapies targeting neurogenesis, such as those that use stem cells. Additionally, it could help scientists understand why some brains stay healthy and functioning into old age while others start to show cognitive decline earlier. Overall, this study provides an important new insight into the complexity of the human brain and how it develops throughout life. It overturns existing beliefs about neuron formation and highlights the importance of using accurate techniques when studying the brain.

Urban Air Port will build its first Air-One transport hub for autonomous delivery drones and electric flying cars in Coventry, UK. The facility will launch later this year and support the development of an airport infrastructure that enables seamless, zero-emission travel. Air-One will manage the safe take-off and landing of both drones and electric aircrafts, provide recharging stations for vehicles, and enable efficient cargo handling operations. The hub will also support a range of other services such as passenger check-in and baggage handling. Through such facilities, Urban Air Port is seeking to revolutionize the way in which people and goods move around cities.

Meta released an update on Horizon's user growth during its most recent earnings call. Since Horizon Worlds was rolled out to all Quest users in the US and Canada in June 2020, the platform has seen a steady increase in user growth. Active users have more than tripled since the launch, with more than 1.5 million active players playing Horizon each month. The company also reported that its average revenue per user (ARPU) had doubled over the same period.

Redis 7.0 is now available. It adds almost 50 new commands and options. The most notable improvements are Redis Functions, AVLv2, command introspection, and Sharded PubSub. A lot of development effort has gone into making Redis 7 more efficient, secure, and reliable.

Darling is a runtime environment for macOS applications. It can be used to run macOS applications on most 64-bit x86 Linux distributions. It implements a complete Darwin environment and attempts to be binary compatible with Apple's own macOS. Darling is still in its early stages, so it may not be able to run all macOS applications yet.

Facebook has officially released its desktop redesign which features a dark mode, a tabbed home screen, and a cleaner profile. Users can now start to opt-in to the new design and access the new features. The new design provides a more intuitive, organized, and modern user experience. Additionally, it offers users access to better customization options for their profile page, including the ability to add a cover photo and highlight sections of their page. Additionally, the tabbed home screen makes it easier to access different areas of the site such as news feed, groups, events, and marketplace. Finally, the dark mode provides a more soothing and calming experience while using the site. Overall, Facebook's desktop redesign is an exciting improvement that should make navigating the site much smoother.

Blocks is a JSX-based page builder for creating websites without writing code. It comes with built-in components that are designed and implemented with Theme UI. The editor reads and writes JSON and JSX to configure pages, components, and themes. Blocks integrates with most popular CMSs, making it easy to manage content in a familiar way. It also has support for custom post types, allowing developers to create custom page layouts that take advantage of custom fields. Additionally, Blocks provides tools for creating custom themes, which can be easily shared and reused across multiple websites.

Machine learning and traditional algorithms are substantially different ways of computing. Researchers are starting to use machine learning to improve the performance of traditional algorithms. This article provides examples of how these two methods can be combined to come up with better solutions. 1. Natural Language Processing: Traditional algorithms are used to process natural language, while machine learning is used to improve the accuracy of the processing and provide more detailed insights into the data. By combining the two approaches, researchers can develop algorithms that understand language better and provide more specific results. 2. Image Recognition: Machine learning can be used to recognize objects and scenes in images, while traditional algorithms can be used to further refine the results and provide additional information. Combining the two methods makes it possible to create highly accurate image recognition systems. 3. Medical Diagnosis: Traditional algorithms can be used to analyze patient data and generate predictions about their health, while machine learning can be used to further refine the results and improve their accuracy. Combining the two methods can help medical professionals diagnose patients more accurately and quickly. 4. Fraud Detection: Traditional algorithms can be used to detect patterns in financial transactions, while machine learning can be used to identify more sophisticated fraud cases. By combining the two approaches, financial institutions can make more accurate decisions about which transactions should be blocked or allowed. 5. Automated Trading:Traditional algorithms are used to analyze market data and generate trading signals, while machine learning can be used to identify new opportunities in the market and optimize trades for maximum return. Combining the two techniques can help traders maximize their profits.

Deep Nostalgia is an AI-powered service offered by online genealogy company MyHeritage that creates moving portraits from still photos. It uses pre-recorded driver videos of facial movements and applies them to the target photo. Customers can upload a still photo of their ancestor, a family member or any other beloved person, and the Deep Nostalgia feature will animate the image to simulate a natural human-like movement. The service also enables users to preview, customize and share the resulting video.
'Can AI Kick It' is a team of Dutch academics who used AI techniques to generate music that was then entered into Eurovision. The lyrics were especially novel, but the team didn't win the contest.

Reddit has acquired Dubsmash, a short-form video social platform. Dubsmash will continue to exist as a separate platform and brand, but its software will be integrated into Reddit. Reddit has acquired Dubsmash to help expand its reach into the video sharing space and offer users more ways to create and share content. The acquisition will also allow Reddit to tap into Dubsmash's strong user base of young people, giving it access to an important demographic for its advertising efforts. Reddit plans to use Dubsmash to develop new features such as live streaming and video messaging.

This article tells the story of how a team generated a massive amount of data with their MVP and blew through their cloud budget for the year by May. Multiple teams were involved in the project and they used a variety of tools and techniques to create the MVP and collect data. The article explains how the team was able to generate so much data, the challenges they faced, and the lessons they learned along the way. It also touches on the importance of budgeting for cloud resources and monitoring usage.

Apple's'Time Flies' event will be on September 15. While the event usually means the announcement of new iPhones, it is unlikely that new iPhones will be announced at the event as Apple has already released their new models. However, Apple is expected to announce new Apple Watches, iPads, and other products at the event.

NASA has given SpaceX approval to launch its first astronauts into space. There are still additional reviews to be completed, but there should be no major issues standing in the way of a successful mission. SpaceX has been working diligently to complete the necessary preparations and safety reviews for its Crew Dragon spacecraft, which will be used to transport the astronauts. The mission is expected to launch in late May or early June of 2020.

Apple's AirTags trackers were mentioned on a recent Apple Support video. The tracking tags will bring Find My iPhone-style location service to other items, such as keys. Apple's ability to track items is made possible by the ultra-wideband technology found in recent iPhones, which allows for more precise location tracking. The tags will be small, and users can attach them to items they want to keep track of. They will also include a button that can trigger an audible alert when a tag is nearby, so it's easier to find lost items.

Scientists at MIT have published a paper detailing a new type of artificial brain synapse that can potentially produce devices that can handle complex AI computing locally without having to rely on cloud computing. The artificial brain synapse, called an "artificial neuron," is a type of neuron-inspired circuit that can be used to create neural networks and deep learning systems. The device is made up of two parts: a transistor array which is used to store data, and an artificial synapse which acts as the connection between the two transistors. The artificial synapse is capable of dynamically adapting its connections in response to different inputs, allowing it to learn from its environment in a manner similar to how biological neurons work. Using this technology, researchers hope to create more efficient and powerful AI systems that can be used for a variety of applications, such as robotics, autonomous vehicles, medical diagnosis, and natural language processing. By being able to process information locally, these devices would also reduce the need for cloud computing, which can be expensive and inefficient. In the future, this technology could potentially be used to create even more sophisticated AI systems that can solve complex problems and make decisions faster than ever before.

Scientists in France have developed a method for recycling PET plastics by modifying organisms to produce an enzyme that breaks down the plastic. The broken-down plastic can then be used to create new products. The scientists hope that this process will help reduce plastic waste and reduce the environmental impact of plastic production.

Scientists have 3D printed cyanobacteria and graphene onto a mushroom in order to produce electricity. Shining a light on the cyanobacteria will kickstart their photosynthesis, which causes them to give off electrons. The electrons travel through the graphene and into the mushroom, where they are collected as electricity. This research has potential applications in creating self-powered, sustainable, bio-hybrid systems.

RediSQL is a fast, in-memory, SQL engine. Based on Redis, it is easy to use, works with standard SQL, and can reach speeds of up to 130,000 inserts per second. RediSQL is open source and can be used as a standalone engine, or embedded into applications. It is designed to provide high performance, scalability, and data integrity. With RediSQL, developers can quickly spin up an application with powerful SQL capabilities.

Jordan Peterson has announced the development of a new social media platform, Thinkspot. The platform aims to provide users the best features of other social media, but without the censorship. It allows users to post their thoughts and opinions, connect with like-minded people, and have meaningful conversations. Features such as a points system, comment sections, and topic suggestion tools are also included. Peterson wants to create a platform which encourages meaningful discussion, rather than simply allowing users to post whatever they want.

Golden Gate is a framework that enables secure and reliable communication between IoT devices over Bluetooth Low Energy. It allows developers to easily implement functionality using familiar standards even when devices are not connected to the internet. The framework is based on the Internet of Things (IoT) communication protocol, Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE), which enables two-way communication over short distances without the need for an internet connection. The framework also provides a secure and reliable way to transfer data between IoT devices, with the aid of the Advanced Encryption Standard (AES). It also offers developers more flexibility, by allowing them to write their own code that runs on top of the framework. In addition, the framework includes features such as device discovery, data exchange, and error handling. These features allow developers to quickly set up and manage a network of connected IoT devices. Furthermore, the framework is designed to scale for larger networks, and can accommodate many devices at once.

Currently, cars in the US are required to have steering wheels, mirrors, and foot pedals. The US Department of Transportation issued a statement saying that it "intends to reconsider the current Federal Motor Vehicle Safety Standards for steering controls, mirrors, and foot pedals on passenger cars." In order to ensure the safety of drivers on the roads, the US Department of Transportation has proposed a new set of standards that would require vehicles to be equipped with a variety of new features including: -A minimum number of airbags, front and rear -Emergency brake override system -Automatic emergency braking system -Enhanced visibility features -Rearview camera systems -Electronic Stability Control -Automatic cruise control -Lane departure warning systems -Blind spot detection systems -Collision avoidance systems These proposed regulations would significantly improve the safety of drivers and passengers in the United States and are an important step towards creating a safer driving environment.

Meta plans to release a high-end virtual reality headset later this year. Project Cambria will have specs similar to a Chromebook and will run a custom VR operating system based on Linux. The headset will come with a wireless controller and will feature gesture and voice recognition capabilities. Additionally, Project Cambria will be capable of connecting to PCs, laptops, and other digital devices. This will allow users to access a variety of content from their digital libraries. The headset is expected to cost around 400 and will be released sometime in the fall.

While businesses are complaining about the shortage of workers, older job seekers are finding that even with the right qualifications for the job, they are being turned away due to age bias. Companies may fear that older workers will be less productive, cost more in benefits, or be too set in their ways to learn new skills. However, research shows that hiring older workers can actually benefit businesses, as they are typically more reliable and have a wealth of experience from past jobs. To combat age bias, companies should consider implementing an age-diverse recruitment policy. This would mean actively recruiting experienced candidates of all ages and looking for the right fit for any given position, rather than automatically ruling out those who are older. Additionally, businesses should provide opportunities for older employees to receive training and stay current in their field. Finally, employers should make sure to provide equal pay, benefits, and advancement opportunities for all applicants, regardless of age. By taking these steps, businesses can ensure that they are not missing out on talented and experienced older job seekers.

China's state-owned train developer CRRC has unveiled a magnetic levitation train that can reach speeds of up to 600 kph. It began development in 2016, with a successful trial run on a test track in 2017. The train is designed to be more energy efficient, reduce the amount of noise pollution, and improve safety features for passengers. It can also travel through tunnels and bridges without generating any air resistance. The train is set to be operational in China by 2021 and is currently being tested in other countries around the world.

For those of you who don't know him Rob Walling is an OG internet small business entrepreneur, cohost of the Startups for the Rest of Us, and cofounder of Microconf. Rob Walling is an entrepreneur and author with a focus on software-as-a-service (SaaS) businesses. He is best known for his work in the startup space, including cohosting the Startups for the Rest of Us podcast, founding the Microconf conference, and writing the book Start Small, Stay Small: A Developer's Guide to Launching a Startup. He has also founded several SaaS companies, including HitTail, Drip, and TinySeed. Walling is a mentor and advisor to many startups, and is a frequent speaker at tech conferences.

A report by the World Wildlife Foundation involving 59 scientists has found that humanity has wiped out 60 of mammals, birds, fish and reptiles since 1970. Other studies have shown that more than 500 species have become extinct in the last century and that current rates of extinction are at least 100 times higher than natural background rates. According to the report, the main causes of the decline in wildlife populations are habitat loss and degradation, overexploitation, climate change, pollution, and invasive alien species. The report warns that if these trends continue, one million species could be extinct by 2050.

A 33-foot-long 3D printer can build new homes in 24 hours. It is currently building a neighborhood in a rural area on the outskirts of a town in Southern Mexico. The printer works by layering a special concrete mixture to form the walls, roof and other components of the home. It is being used to build affordable housing in rural areas where traditional construction methods are too expensive or not available. The 3D printer can produce a single story, two-bedroom home in just 24 hours and the cost of materials for each home is approximately 4,000. This technology has the potential to revolutionize the way people construct housing in developing countries, providing a much more affordable option for those living in poverty.

Deep Daze is a command-line tool for text to image generation using OpenAI's CLIP and Siren. Users simply type a description of an image, for example,'a house in the forest', and the Deep Daze tool will take this description and generate a corresponding image. Deep Daze is designed to make it easy for users to quickly generate images from text and can be used for various creative projects, such as creating artwork, creating game assets, or just exploring the possibilities of machine learning.

Y Combinator has built many resources that have been helpful for developers over the years. This page lists all the tools and resources with a description and year of release. 1. Y Combinator Startup Library (2020): This library is an online collection of resources for entrepreneurs, including interviews with Y Combinator founders, startup advice, and more. 2. Y Combinator Application Template (2020): This template helps guide early-stage startups through the application process for Y Combinator's accelerator program. 3. YC Jobs Board (2019): The YC Jobs Board is a job board for tech companies and startups looking to hire from the Y Combinator network. 4. YC Open (2017): YC Open is a platform that enables startups to collaborate with Y Combinator alumni and get mentorship, advice, and support. 5. YC Wiki (2013): The YC Wiki is an encyclopedia of information related to Y Combinator and the startups it accelerates. 6. Hacker News (2007): Hacker News is a news site that curates and discusses stories about tech, startups, and entrepreneurship. It was created by Y Combinator founder Paul Graham in 2007 and acquired by Y Combinator in 2016.

Gravity Sketch is a program that allows people to 'paint' in 3D in Virtual Reality. Ford has recently started to explore the technology and they have a customized version designed for their needs. Gravity Sketch is a powerful tool that allows users to create and sculpt 3D models quickly and easily in virtual reality using motion and touch controllers. Ford has implemented this technology in order to bring product design and ideation processes into the modern age, which helps designers visualize and refine product ideas much faster than traditional methods. With Gravity Sketch, Ford can quickly see how different elements of a product might fit together or could be changed to make it better. This technology also allows for team collaboration, enabling multiple people to work on designs simultaneously. The program supports both freehand sketching and extruded shapes, allowing for even more creative freedom.

Bemisia tabaci is a whitefly that acquired a gene from its plant host millions of years ago, allowing it to neutralize a toxin that some plants produce to defend against the whitefly. This gene is found in many populations of B. tabaci, and it plays an important role in allowing the whitefly to survive on a variety of plants.

Reddit experienced an hour-long outage on Wednesday afternoon as volatility returned to stocks, including GameStop and AMC. GameStop closed up about 104 on Wednesday. The firm's finance head recently announced his resignation and the company's board added three new members. Reddit's outage occurred around the same time that GameStop's stock rose, but it is unclear whether the two events were related.

In 2017, Astrophysicists at the European Space Agency spotted an iceberg the size of Las Vegas breaking off the Pine Island Glacier in West Antarctica. The iceberg has since changed shape, but is still believed to be around the size of Las Vegas. The iceberg was discovered using ESA's Sentinel-1 satellite data and has been tracked since December 2017. With a total area of 2,239 square kilometers (865 sq mi), it is one of the largest icebergs ever recorded in Antarctica. The iceberg split from the Pine Island Glacier, which is already one of the fastest-changing glaciers in the region. Scientists believe that this break off could accelerate the glacier's retreat due to increased calving. The iceberg is expected to drift northwards along the coast for several years before breaking up into smaller pieces.

magniX, an Australian engineering firm, in a partnership with Harbour Air, a Canadian air-ferry service, has performed the first fully-electric commercial aircraft test flight. The 15-minute flight took place in Vancouver, Canada and was powered by a 750-horsepower electric motor. The success of the test flight marks an important milestone in aviation history as it is the first commercial aircraft to be powered entirely by electricity. This technology has the potential to revolutionize air travel, as electric motors offer more efficient operation than traditional combustion engines. The benefits of electric propulsion include lower fuel costs, reduced emissions, quieter operations and increased reliability. MagniX and Harbour Air plan to continue testing the electric motor and begin transitioning their fleet of planes from combustion engines to electric motors in the near future. They anticipate that the transition will take several years and that their fleet of planes will eventually become completely electric. This could represent a major step forward for the aviation industry, as electric power could reduce not only operational costs but also environmental impacts. The success of this test flight could potentially open the door to other airlines around the world converting to electric power. If successful, electric motors could provide a clean, efficient alternative to combustion engines, ushering in a new era of sustainable air travel.

Facebook and Ubisoft have reportedly signed a deal to release the next Splinter Cell and Assassin's Creed games exclusively on the Oculus VR. Exclusive games are a major selling point for any VR platform and this could be a major boon for Oculus. This deal could also help Facebook attract more users to its VR platform, as the highly successful Splinter Cell and Assassin's Creed franchises are sure to draw in gamers who may not have previously considered using Oculus. Additionally, this could be an opportunity for Ubisoft to further expand its presence in the VR market, as it has seen success with games like Eagle Flight and Werewolves Within.

Haidilao, a Chinese hotpot chain, opened the world's first fully automated restaurant on Sunday. Robots will take orders, prepare food, and deliver it to customers. There's an automated restaurant in China, it will certainly revolutionize the restaurant industry in the world. The opening of the world's first fully automated restaurant marks a new era for the restaurant industry, as well as the service industry in general. Automation has long been seen as a way to reduce costs and increase efficiency, but this is the first time it has been applied to the full scope of a restaurant experience. With robots preparing food and taking orders, customers can expect faster, more efficient service and an even better overall dining experience. It also offers businesses the opportunity to reduce their labor costs and improve their profit margins. For customers, it offers a unique and convenient experience that could be replicated in restaurants all over the world.

An engineer at a startup that is planning an exit asks others for experiences for how their workplaces changed after other startups either sold via IPOs or changed ownership in other ways Employees experienced a change in company culture, often becoming more focused on the bottom line. Some employees were laid off or reassigned to different roles as the new owners restructured the organization. Benefits may have changed, with new owners often introducing cost-cutting measures. Management may have been replaced with executives from the new owner's organization. Employee morale might have decreased due to uncertainty about the future of the organization. Some employees had their stock options converted to cash upon acquisition, while others received additional equity from the new owners. The startup's goals and priorities may have shifted significantly after the exit.

Ekioh is a UK-based company that is developing its own browser from scratch. Flow will be built from a blank slate, with its own rendering engine. The project aims to create a browser that is secure and efficient, while also respecting users' privacy. Ekioh's Flow will be an open source project, with the code available for anyone to inspect and contribute to. The company plans to launch its first version of Flow in early 2021. Ekioh has already released a few previews of what the browser will look like and how it will work. The preview images show that the browser will have a modern, minimalistic design and will support features such as tabbed browsing, private browsing, and ad-blocking. The browser is also expected to offer advanced security features such as sandboxing and full disk encryption. In addition, Ekioh plans to implement features that make browsing easier and more efficient. These include pop-up blocking, automatic form completion, and the ability to save passwords. The company also hopes to include tools that allow developers to easily create and manage their own extensions. Overall, Ekioh's Flow looks promising and could be an interesting alternative to existing browsers. It will be interesting to see how the company progresses in developing this new browser and if it can live up to its potential.

The Senate's new infrastructure bill may shape the future of cryptocurrency in the US. The bill promises public spending on major projects and it proposes taxes on crypto brokers to fund it. Should the bill pass, it could be a major boost to the US crypto industry. It would open the door for increased investment in blockchain technology and provide an incentive for more people to get involved with cryptocurrency. Additionally, the taxes on crypto brokers could be used to fund research into new technologies and applications of blockchain technology. This could lead to more innovation in the space and bring new opportunities to the US economy.

Uniqlo has managed to automate 90 percent of its flagship Tokyo warehouse. The facility includes a two-armed robot that can fold and box t-shirts. Uniqlo's parent company, Fast Retailing, partnered with OMRON to develop the robotic technology. The automated process allows Uniqlo to keep up with customer demands for its popular clothing items. The robots also help reduce labor costs and increase efficiency, allowing Uniqlo to offer lower prices to customers. The automation system has allowed Uniqlo to reduce inventory waste, which helps them stay competitive in the market.

JupyterLite is a JupyterLab distribution that runs entirely in the browser. It features a Python kernel backed by Pyodide, basic session and kernel management, code consoles, and more. It can be used to create and run notebooks, explore data sets, run machine learning experiments, and more. Unlike a full-fledged JupyterLab installation, JupyterLite does not require a server, making it ideal for students and others who wish to have a lightweight, hosted web-based notebook experience.

Quaise Energy is an MIT spinout that wants to use X-rays to melt rock to create the world's deepest holes and capture geothermal energy. It plans to use a microwave-emitting antenna to convert electricity into microwaves, which will be directed at the rock. The microwaves will heat the rock to temperatures of up to 2,000 degrees Celsius and melt it, creating a channel that can be used to access geothermal energy. The company plans to use the technology to create holes up to a kilometer deep, more than double the current record of 400 meters. The team is currently working on the final design and engineering of their system, with plans to pilot their first project in 2021.

Crowdsec is a modern behavior detection system written in Go. It can detect peers with aggressive behaviors to prevent them from accessing systems. Crowdsec features a fast and easy installation, with no need for manual configuration. It is also highly customizable, allowing users to tailor their security stack according to their needs. Crowdsec is open source and available on GitHub.

mirrord mirrors traffic from production environments into development environments. It captures traffic from targeted pods through a privileged pod on the same node. mirrord is both a Visual Studio Code extension and a CLI. Why mirrord Mirrord makes it easier for engineers to develop, debug, and test applications running in production environments. By replicating production traffic into development environments, engineers can work with the same data and scenarios found in production. How it works The mirrord Visual Studio Code extension enables users to select a target pod from a Kubernetes cluster and then configure it to mirror traffic into a development environment. Once configured, mirrord captures traffic from the targeted pod and replicates it into a development environment. It also provides real-time feedback on the status of the mirrored traffic and allows users to quickly enable or disable the mirroring. Mirrord's CLI enables users to perform the same functions as the Visual Studio Code extension, but without the need for a graphical user interface. It can be used to configure and manage mirroring sessions from the command line.

Uber plans to add trains, buses, planes, and car rentals to its UK app this year. It will expand these services to other countries if the test goes well. The company is also planning to add bike-sharing and electric scooter rental options. It is also working on creating a single app that can be used for all its transportation services. This would allow customers to easily book, compare, and pay for rides with Uber.

Traitor packages methods to exploit local misconfigurations and vulnerabilities in order to gain root access. Users can just run the binary on the target machine and it will exploit most common misconfigurations and vulnerabilities. It will then give users root access on the target machine.

Woven Planet Holdings, a subsidiary of Toyota, is buying Lyft's self-driving division for 550 million in cash paid over five years. Lyft will see an annual savings of 100 million in operating expenses and will also receive royalties on any future revenue generated by the self-driving division. The deal will give Woven Planet access to Lyft's autonomous vehicle technology, which is being used in pilot programs across the United States. Woven Planet will be responsible for further developing and scaling the technology, with a focus on deploying it in Toyota vehicles. This acquisition will allow the companies to address the challenges of autonomous driving innovation together, and bring Woven Planet one step closer to its goal of creating a safer and more convenient mobility experience for everyone.

Oculus has announced business versions of their VR headsets, designed for enterprise use. The Oculus Go for business will start at 599 (64 GB) and the Oculus Quest for enterprise at 999 (128 GB). These headsets are designed for use in virtual office spaces, remote collaboration, and virtual training for businesses. The Oculus Go for business includes features such as access to the Oculus app store, a custom enterprise portal to manage user accounts, integration with existing corporate networks, and support for enterprise-level security and privacy tools. The Oculus Quest for enterprise includes all of the features of the Go for business plus additional features such as 3D room scanning, custom environment tracking, and hand tracking. Both headsets come with a one-year warranty and tech support.

The Israeli surveillance company NSO Group sells hacking software used by authoritarian governments to target citizens around the world. Pegasus is a malware that infects mobile devices and extracts data. It has been used to target journalists and human rights activists, spy on conversations, and track people's locations. The software is designed to be impossible to detect, allowing oppressive governments to monitor citizens with impunity. NSO Group claims the technology is only used for monitoring criminal activity but it has been linked to numerous abuses of human rights. The company has faced significant criticism for its products' potential for misuse and has been accused of enabling authoritarian governments to violate their citizens' rights.

Facebook, Instagram, and WhatsApp users had difficulty loading images, videos, and other data on their apps today due to a system outage. In an official statement, Facebook said that the issue was caused by "an internal configuration change," and that it was working to resolve the issue as quickly as possible. The company apologized for any inconvenience caused and said it was investigating the root cause of the problem.

President Donald Trump has signed an executive order that targets tech companies. Section 230 of the Communications Decency Act gives internet companies broad immunity from liability for the content their users post. Trump's executive order calls for the Federal Communications Commission to reexamine the law, and for the Department of Justice to craft a legislative proposal for Congress to modify the law. The order also calls for the Federal Trade Commission to consider taking action against companies that violate their terms of service and discriminate against certain viewpoints. The goal of the executive order is to make tech companies more accountable for what appears on their platforms.

Luna allows developers to design, prototype, develop, and refactor any application by linking visual elements together. Developers are able to collaborate with a team, interactively fine-tune parameters, inspect the results, and share their work. Luna provides an intuitive way to build applications quickly and efficiently, with the ability to easily change or update components as needed. With its drag-and-drop interface, developers can quickly create and customize UI elements, add logic and data connections, and even build entire applications without writing any code.

OpenBot leverages a smartphone's sensing and computation capabilities to create a low-cost robot. The project includes a design for a small electric vehicle that serves as a robot body. OpenBot uses various sensors, such as gyroscopes, accelerometers, temperature sensors and cameras, to detect its environment. These sensors enable the robot to navigate autonomously, identify objects and interact with humans. Additionally, OpenBot is equipped with a custom-built Android application that provides an interface for controlling the robot. The application also allows users to access the robot's sensor data and program it to complete tasks. Finally, OpenBot is open source, meaning anyone can build their own robot using the design plans provided.

Bitcoin's Taproot update has gone live with near-universal support. The update will bring greater transaction privacy through Schorr signatures, which will make simple transactions indistinguishable from multi-signature transactions. Taproot allows for improved scalability, as it introduces new features that make it easier to combine multiple transactions into a single one. This will make Bitcoin more efficient and reduce fees. Additionally, Taproot will introduce script branching, which will enable smarter contract contracts, allowing for more complex transactions with trustless execution.

As COVID-19 grabs the attention of the world, the war against antibiotic-resistant bacteria wages on. The number of people dying from bacterial infections could grow from 700,000 annually last year to 10 million by 2050, according to the World Health Organization. The rise in antibiotic-resistant bacteria has been attributed to the overuse of antibiotics, which occurs when people take antibiotics for illnesses caused by viruses, or when they are prescribed antibiotics for infections that do not require them. In addition, bacteria can become resistant to antibiotics when they are exposed to low doses over a long period of time. In order to combat this growing threat, governments and healthcare organizations have begun to implement strategies to reduce the misuse and overuse of antibiotics. These strategies include raising public awareness about the dangers of taking antibiotics when they are not needed and educating healthcare providers on the appropriate uses of antibiotics. Additionally, research is ongoing to develop new and innovative ways to treat bacterial infections without relying on traditional antibiotics. This includes the use of bacteriophages, which are naturally occurring viruses that attack bacteria, as well as other treatments such as antibodies and probiotics. It is clear that the war against antibiotic-resistant bacteria cannot be won overnight. However, with continued effort and innovation, it is possible to slow down and ultimately overcome this global health crisis.

Docker-OSX automates the installation of OSX-KVM inside a docker container. It is possible to customize the size and version of the VM using build arguments. Docker-OSX can be used to run OS X applications on any platform that supports docker. It is also useful for testing and development of Mac applications.

NASA will be conducting extensive workplace safety reviews at SpaceX and Boeing due to Elon Musk smoking marijuana on Joe Rogan's podcast. NASA's administrator Jim Bridenstine says "If I see something that's inappropriate, the key concern to me is what is the culture that led to that inappropriateness and is NASA involved in that." NASA will be conducting a comprehensive review of workplace safety at SpaceX and Boeing to ensure that the companies are adhering to all necessary safety protocols. This review will include assessing the company's culture and any possible violations of safety regulations that could have occurred due to Elon Musk smoking marijuana on Joe Rogan's podcast. The review will also evaluate any other potential risks that could arise from the current work environment. The results of this review will help inform NASA's decision-making on how to best support the space exploration industry.
