As part of the review, NASA will be consulting with the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) and the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA). To ensure the highest level of safety for its employees and contractors, NASA expects both SpaceX and Boeing to take prompt action to address any safety issues identified during the review.

Cryptocurrency company Ripple has announced a major partnership with MoneyGram. MoneyGram will start using Ripple's cryptocurrency, XRP, as part of its day-to-day operations. Ripple has long argued that banks should use XRP to transfer money quickly and cheaply, and this new partnership could be a major boost for the cryptocurrency. MoneyGram will trial using XRP for some cross-border payments over the next two years. The companies have also agreed to an equity investment, with Ripple buying a 50 million stake in MoneyGram.

There is a gene that codes for a protein called cytochrome P450, which exists in many mammals' livers, helping them clean up toxins. Scientists spliced this gene from a rabbit's liver into the genome of a tobacco plant. As a result, the tobacco plant can now break down certain toxins that it could not before.

iRobot has announced today it's first autonomous lawnmower robot. Unlike other autonomous lawnmower robots which require a wire to be laid down to define the robot's boundaries, iRobot's lawnmower robot uses a unique sensor-based system which is able to detect and avoid obstacles in the lawn. The robot is capable of cutting grass up to 12 acre in size on a single charge and can be easily programmed from an app on the user's smartphone.

A Dutch company called Beladon is creating the world's first floating dairy farm. The farm will house 40 cows, and will recycle as much as it can. Cows will be fed a mix of grass and fodder, and the manure will be used to produce biogas and fertilizer. The farm will also use solar panels and wind turbines to generate power. Additionally, the company has plans to develop a fish farm alongside the dairy farm, which will use the manure from the cows as fertilizer. The project is expected to be completed by 2021.

InfluxDB has everything you need to build time series applications - a multi-tenanted time series database, UI and dashboarding tools, background processing, and monitoring agent. All this makes deployment and maintenance of a time series application easier. InfluxDB provides a powerful query language for performing analytics and a data model for storing metric and event data. It is optimized for high performance and horizontal scalability, making it ideal for applications that require real-time insights into their data. It also has built-in integrations for popular monitoring agents and can be easily extended with custom plugins.

SpaceX stacked a Starship prototype rocket on top of a Super Heavy rocket booster for the first time on Friday morning at the company's facility in Boca Chica, Texas. Starship SN15, the fifth full-scale prototype of SpaceX's next-generation spacecraft, was stacked atop a single Super Heavy booster. The combination stands at about 165 feet tall and marks the first time in history that a Starship rocket has been integrated with its Super Heavy booster. The move marks an important step forward for SpaceX as it works to develop a fully reusable launch system capable of sending humans and payloads to the Moon and beyond. The company is aiming to eventually fly both the Starship and Super Heavy boosters multiple times on the same mission and establish an entirely sustainable transportation system for space exploration. The stacking process also comes after several failed attempts to get Starship off the ground. Last month, the fourth prototype of the spacecraft, SN11, exploded shortly after takeoff. However, Elon Musk, the CEO and founder of SpaceX, remains confident that the company is making progress. He tweeted out earlier this week that the Starship will "soon be able to land refly many times per day." Friday's stack marks a major milestone in SpaceX's efforts to make human spaceflight more efficient and cost-effective. In the coming weeks, the company plans to conduct ground tests and potentially even a low-altitude test flight of the StarshipSuper Heavy combo. If successful, these tests could pave the way for the first orbital flights of the vehicle later this year.

GitHub Sponsors is a way for developers to get funding from sponsors. It is available to developers in 32 regions, but there is currently a waitlist. GitHub takes zero fees, and sponsors can be both individuals and organizations. Sponsors can choose to support developers on a monthly basis, and developers are able to set up goals for their funding.

Jina is a fast, cloud-native neural search framework that can build deep learning-powered search apps in minutes. It supports all data types. Demos are available in the repository. Jina is designed to be flexible and extensible by taking advantage of the latest deep learning techniques. It consists of a powerful search engine with an easy-to-use Python API, a distributed backend that can run on Kubernetes, Docker, or any other cloud service, and an intelligent indexing system based on neural networks. With Jina, users can quickly deploy search applications using their own data and models.

Tesla's 100MW Powerpack battery has provided South Australia with the same grid services as peaker plants, but cheaper, quicker, and with zero-emissions through its battery system. The energy system cost 66 million and is the largest lithium-ion battery storage project in the world. It was deployed by Tesla in 2017 to provide emergency energy services to South Australia's power grid. The system has helped to stabilize the grid, reduce emissions, and improve reliability for consumers. Additionally, it has enabled renewable energy sources such as wind turbines to be integrated into the energy grid more efficiently. The Powerpack has been so successful that other countries, including China and India, are looking to replicate its model.

GAF Energy's Timberline Solar shingles can be installed by any roofer with a nail gun. They are weatherproof and can be walked on for roof maintenance. Other solar shingles require a special roofer with specialized installation equipment. Timberline Solar shingles are also designed to be more aesthetically pleasing than other solar shingles, which often have bulky and unattractive designs.

Every machine learning model is based on linear algebra. This document contains introductory level linear algebra notes for applied machine learning. The notes are meant to be used as a reference or quick reminder of concepts. Vector A vector is an array of numbers. It can be represented in standard form as: br ec{v} egin{pmatrix} a b c end{pmatrix} br Where a, b, and c are real numbers. Vectors can also be written in column form as: br ec{v} egin{pmatrix} a b c end{pmatrix}T br The vector can also be written in components as: br ec{v} ahat{i} bhat{j} chat{k} br Where hat{i}, hat{j}, and hat{k} are unit vectors in the x, y, and z directions respectively. Matrix A matrix is a two-dimensional array of numbers. It can be written in standard form as: br X egin{pmatrix} a b c d end{pmatrix} br Where a, b, c, and d are real numbers. Matrices can also be written in row form as: br X egin{pmatrix} a b c d end{pmatrix} br Dot Product The dot product of two vectors is defined as: br ec{u} cdot ec{v} u1v1 u2v2 ... unvn br Where ec{u} and ec{v} are two vectors of length n. The dot product has the following properties: Commutative: ec{u} cdot ec{v} ec{v} cdot ec{u} Distributive: (ec{u} ec{v cdot ec{w} ec{u} cdot ec{w} ec{v} cdot ec{w} Associative: ec{u} cdot (ec{v} cdot ec{w (ec{u} cdot ec{v cdot ec{w} Matrix Multiplication Matrix multiplication is defined as: br X cdot Y egin{pmatrix} a b c d end{pmatrix} cdot egin{pmatrix} e f g h end{pmatrix} egin{pmatrix} ae bg af bh ce dg cf dh end{pmatrix} br Where X and Y are matrices of size m imes n and n imes p respectively. Matrix multiplication has the following properties: Associative: (X cdot Y) cdot Z X cdot (Y cdot Z) Distributive: X cdot (Y Z) X cdot Y X cdot Z

Spotify Technology might be looking at acquiring Ringer, a sports and pop-culture startup. Ringer is involved in the podcast business, like the other four startups that Spotify bought in 2019. It produces various podcasts and other content related to sports, music, culture, and entertainment. If Spotify were to acquire Ringer, it would give the streaming giant access to a large library of podcast content, as well as the ability to produce new podcasts in-house. This could potentially help Spotify build out its podcast offerings and reach more people. Additionally, it would allow Spotify to expand its presence in the sports and pop-culture space, giving it a larger footprint in these areas.

A team of scientists has increased the size of their potato crops by splicing a human gene that encodes a fat-regulating protein into them. The potatoes grew 50 percent larger than their unaltered counterparts. This technique is known as genetic engineering, and it has been used to modify plants for decades. The inserted gene in this case encodes a protein that helps regulate fat accumulation in the plant, allowing for increased size. This technology has its benefits, such as increasing crop yields, but there are also potential risks associated with it. It is important to consider these risks carefully before introducing any genetically modified organisms into the food supply.

Pfizer has developed a pill designed to stop Covid-19. It is now starting human trials on the drug, which showed no significant risks or safety concerns during its animal studies. The drug is an antibody therapy designed to neutralize the virus before it can do any damage. Pfizer hopes to have results of the trials soon, which could lead to emergency authorization of the drug.

Google's Fi VPN is a service available to subscribers of its Fi network. VPNs are services that give users a private connection while using the open internet, ensuring that traffic is encrypted and secure. Google's Fi VPN adds an extra layer of security to the network, encrypting all data going in and out of the device, protecting users from malicious actors on the internet. The service also offers protection against phishing, malware, and other attacks that could impact user privacy. The Fi VPN is available on Android and iOS devices, and includes unlimited data usage.

Luminary is a platform for podcasts that will be launching in June. The new podcast app will focus on subscriptions and will be ad-free. Many big names have already signed up to be part of the platform, including Spotify and RadioPublic. The app also includes features such as personalized recommendations, an easy-to-use interface, and access to millions of podcasts. It will also allow users to download episodes for offline listening.

This is a guide for moving from macOS to Linux. It discusses different distros, how to optimize battery life, and various other tweaks to the OS that can make transitioning easier. 1. Choose a Distro - The first step in transitioning from macOS to Linux is to choose a distro. Popular choices include Ubuntu, Fedora, Debian, and Mint. Each distro has its own unique features, so do some research and find the one that best suits your needs. 2. Install the OS - Once you've chosen a distro, download the ISO and create a bootable USB drive. Then boot the computer from the USB drive and follow the instructions to install the OS. 3. Configuration - After the installation is complete, there are several things you can do to configure the system for optimum performance. These include installing drivers, setting up the display resolution, configuring sound settings, and setting up the network connection. 4. Optimize Battery Life - You can also optimize battery life by changing certain system settings. This includes reducing screen brightness, disabling unnecessary services and applications, and adjusting power management settings. 5. Tweak the System - There are several other tweaks you can make to the system to customize it to your liking. This includes installing themes, setting up launchers, and enabling compositing effects. 6. Get Familiar with the System - Finally, it's important to get familiar with the system and how it works. Read through documentation, watch tutorials, and explore the different features available. This will help you get comfortable with the new OS.

tmpsms generates a temporary phone number for receiving SMSes. It was designed for bug bounty hunters who don't want to use their personal phone numbers. tmpsms can be integrated with Slack so you can receive notifications in your team's chat. tmpsms is currently available in the US and Canada. It provides a disposable phone number that you can use to receive SMS messages anonymously. The service also has advanced features such as auto-forwarding, scheduling, blacklisting, custom sender IDs, and more. You can easily manage your account using its web dashboard.

A study on birth rates between 1950 to 2017 (across all countries) showed a crazy decline in birth rates from 4.7 children per woman in 1950 to 2.4 children per woman in 2017. The study showed a decrease of 0.7 children per woman every decade. The decline in birth rates is largely attributed to the rise of women in the workplace and the availability of contraceptives, making it easier for women to control their fertility. Other factors that have contributed to the decline include increased education levels, improved access to healthcare and family planning services, rising costs of raising children, increased urbanization, and changing cultural attitudes towards larger families. In some countries, such as China, the decline has been even more dramatic due to government policies such as the one-child policy, which was introduced in 1979 and only recently relaxed in 2015. Overall, the declining birth rate across all countries is expected to continue into the future, with continued access to contraception, increasing education levels, and changing social norms influencing the trend.

Disney CEO Bob Iger resigned from Apple's board on September 10, the same day that Apple unveiled the launch date and subscription price for the Apple TV Plus. The introduction of the Apple TV Plus subscription service had been rumored for several months, and Iger's resignation was seen as a sign that there could be some competition in the streaming market. Iger had served on Apple's board since 2011 and was a close advisor to Apple CEO Tim Cook. In a statement announcing his departure, Iger said that he felt it was best for him to resign from Apple's board so that he could focus on Disney's streaming services. He also said that he plans to remain close friends with Cook and Apple.

Motor Neuron Disease eventually takes away its victim's ability to speak, but a new AI-based tool developed by Rolls-Royce may help patients speak again. Rolls Royce worked with the Motor Neuron Disease Association to create a text-to-speech system that uses AI to interpret facial expressions and gestures. The technology interprets the user's intent and converts it into speech, allowing them to communicate more effectively and with more control. This groundbreaking technology could revolutionize the lives of MND patients, providing them with a way to express their thoughts and feelings despite the physical limitations of their condition.

Facebook is expected to unveil the Oculus Quest 2 at the Facebook Connect conference later this week. Videos posted briefly on Facebook's Blueprint e-learning platform exposed details about the device. The Oculus Quest 2 is expected to be a direct successor to the original Oculus Quest, with upgraded hardware and new features. The new device is expected to feature an improved display, with a resolution of 1832x1920 per eye, which is a 50 increase from the first generation Oculus Quest. It will also feature Qualcomm's Snapdragon XR2 platform, which will provide better performance than the first generation Oculus Quest. Other features include 6GB of RAM, 256GB of storage, and support for 90Hz refresh rate. The Oculus Quest 2 is also expected to feature redesigned controllers, which are said to improve ergonomics, and haptic feedback to provide a more immersive experience. Additionally, Facebook has partnered with Logitech to create a dedicated Oculus Quest 2 controller, although it is unclear if this will be included in the package. Facebook is also rumored to launch an all-in-one VR headset, which will be powered by the Oculus Quest 2 hardware. This headset is expected to provide an even more immersive experience than traditional VR headsets, as it will be able to track movement without the need for external sensors. The Oculus Quest 2 is expected to be available in late 2020 and could cost up to 400.

Google will start loading Search and Maps with information on vaccination sites. The update will roll out in the coming weeks to Arizona, Louisiana, Mississippi, and Texas, with more areas to follow soon. Google will be working with state and local health authorities, pharmacies, and hospitals to ensure that the information is accurate and up to date. The feature will include information on where to get vaccinated, how to make an appointment, and other relevant details. Users will also be able to use Google Maps to find nearby vaccination sites. This new update should make it much easier for people to find out where they can get vaccinated and take the necessary steps to do so.

Python 3.9 was released on October 5 and as with every new version of Python, it includes new, improved, and deprecated features. A link to the complete list of changes can be found here: The major new features of Python 3.9 include: PEP 572, Assignment Expressions PEP 570, Positional-Only Parameters PEP 587, Python Initialization Configuration PEP 590, Vectorcall: a fast calling protocol for CPython PEP 578, Runtime Audit Hooks PEP 584, Union Operators in dict PEP 587, TypedDict PEP 595, Context Variables PEP 598, f-strings support for self-documenting expressions and debugging New APIs including time functions with nanosecond resolution, IO implementation, etc. Improved debugging Performance improvements

Amazon will be adding a Venmo option to checkout for users in the US starting next year. The retail giant recently announced its third-quarter results, a 13 year-over-year revenue increase. The new Venmo payment option is part of Amazon's effort to expand its customer base by allowing customers to pay for products using the popular payment app. The move is expected to make online shopping even easier and more convenient for users in the US. Venmo users will be able to link their accounts to Amazon and use the app to quickly complete purchases without having to manually enter credit card information. In addition, customers can also split payments with friends or family members on Venmo when buying from Amazon. The company has already begun testing the feature with select users in the US, and it plans to roll out the feature nationwide sometime next year.

Boston Dynamics has released a new video showing its entire lineup of robots doing a coordinated dance routine. The company was recently purchased by Hyundai from SoftBank for 1.1 billion. The video shows its four-legged dog-like robot Spot, humanoid robot Atlas, and two versions of its wheeled delivery robot Handle dancing to the pop hit "Do You Love Me" by The Contours. The robots move in perfect synchronization, showcasing the advanced capabilities of Boston Dynamics' robots.

This is an article written by Jeff Atwood, former CEO of Stack Overflow. He says that Stack Overflow isn't a discussion forum, it's meant to be more like a wiki. It is a repository of knowledge, where users can both ask and answer questions. Atwood believes that the key to Stack Overflow's success is its focus on quality over quantity. He explains that while the site was designed to be an open source question and answer platform, it has since become "the world's largest repository of expert knowledge." This means that users don't need to sift through hundreds of irrelevant or low-quality posts; instead, they can find reliable information quickly. Atwood also argues that Stack Overflow's system of reputation and badges incentivizes users to provide accurate and helpful answers. He also points out that the site's moderation system helps ensure that people are not only helping each other but doing it in a respectful manner. All of these factors combine to create a platform where people can access reliable information quickly and easily. Overall, Atwood believes that the key to Stack Overflow's success is its focus on quality over quantity. By ensuring that users are providing accurate and helpful answers, and by creating a platform where people can access reliable information quickly and easily, Stack Overflow has become one of the most successful online communities for knowledge sharing.

Clubhouse leaked a messaging feature called Backchannel to some users last week. Backchannel is a way for users to communicate over text instead of audio. The feature was not referenced in the Clubhouse app's changelog, so it appears that the feature is still being tested. It is not clear when or if Backchannel will be available to all Clubhouse users.

Fuchsia is Google's latest operating system for the Google Home Hub. The OS is only available for the first-generation Home Hub devices. Fuchsia was launched quietly. It wasn't even mentioned in Google's IO 2018 keynote. Fuchsia is a new, open source, capability-based operating system that runs on modern 64-bit Intel and ARM processors, with support for the latest standards like Bluetooth, Wi-Fi and more. It is designed to be secure, fast and reliable. It is powered by Google's own Flutter software development kit, making it easier for developers to create apps. It also supports Android apps through Google Play.

This is a video of Mark Zuckerberg announcing Oculus Quest, a wireless All in One VR headset with touch controllers shipping next spring for 399. There will be 50 games available for the platform at launch. [VIDEO: ]

The Apple Store went down for just over an hour on Tuesday and came back with a brand-new look. The new design is filled with cards, similar to Apple's Store app, that feature product categories like Mac, iPad, iPhone, and Apple Watch. The new design also features a personalized recommendations section, which shows products curated just for the individual user. Additionally, shoppers can now search for products using a new visual search tool, and make purchases with Apple Pay.

The results of a Phase 1 trial to study the effects of microdosing LSD have been published. Researchers were testing whether microdosing psychedelics could be useful as a therapeutic approach to improve mental health. The study aimed to assess the safety of LSD microdosing and its potential effects on psychological wellbeing, creativity, and other aspects of mental health. Results showed that overall, the participants in the study did not experience any serious adverse events from taking the drug. They also reported increases in creative performance, increased focus and improved mood. The authors concluded that the results indicate that microdosing LSD may be a safe and effective way to improve mental health, though further studies are needed to draw definitive conclusions.

The basking shark is an endangered species that feeds on zooplankton, tiny creatures found near the surface of the ocean. It was once common off the coast of western Europe. It is the second-largest species of shark, reaching a length of up to 12 m (39 ft). Its diet consists mainly of copepods and other planktonic crustaceans, small fish, and squid. The basking shark is a slow-moving filter feeder, using its huge mouth to strain large quantities of water for food. It is found in temperate waters around the world and is seasonally migratory. Populations have declined significantly due to fishing pressure, and it is now listed as vulnerable by the International Union for Conservation of Nature.

Companies such as Facebook and Google may soon be forced to inform customers individually on how much profit they gain from customer data. The proposed Designing Accounting Safeguards to Help Broaden Corporate Accountability Act of 2019, or the DASHBOARD Act, is a bill that would require public companies to disclose information about their data usage and the profits they make from it. The DASHBOARD Act was introduced in the U.S. House of Representatives by Rep. Ro Khanna (D-Calif.) and has been referred to the House Committee on Financial Services. The act requires publicly traded companies with over 1 billion in annual revenue to provide individualized reports to customers regarding how their data is used and how much money they are making from it. The reports must be provided on a regular basis and should include an explanation of the data collected, what services the data is used for, and the estimated value of the data. The bill also requires companies to provide customers with the ability to opt out of their data being used in certain ways, as well as the right to delete their data altogether. Additionally, companies must offer customers the ability to access their own data and have the option to transfer it to other services. If passed, the DASHBOARD Act could have major implications for tech giants such as Facebook and Google, who rely heavily on data to generate profit. It would also benefit consumers, giving them more control over their data and helping them understand how companies use it to their advantage.

This article follows a software engineering student's attempt at training a more efficient version of the 124M parameter version of GPT-2. The resulting model didn't perform as well as GPT-2. A software engineering student recently attempted to train a more efficient version of the 124M parameter version of GPT-2. The goal was to come up with a model that would perform better than GPT-2 while having fewer parameters. The student's method involved distilling the knowledge learned by the original GPT-2 model into a smaller, more efficient model. For this task, the student implemented a knowledge distillation approach based on the paper "Distilling Task-Specific Knowledge from BERT into Simple Neural Networks" (Clark et al., 2019). First, the student trained a larger model using the same GPT-2 architecture and hyperparameters as before. Then, the student used the distilled model to generate a new set of weights for a much smaller model. This smaller model had only 8M parameters compared to 124M in the original GPT-2 model. Although the resulting model had fewer parameters, it did not perform as well as GPT-2. The student hypothesized that this was due to the fact that the distilled model did not have access to enough information from the original GPT-2 model. As a result, the student concluded that a more thorough exploration of different methods of distillation is necessary in order to successfully train a smaller, more efficient version of GPT-2.

Microsoft has announced new Cloud PC integrations into Windows 11. Windows 365 is a service that lets businesses stream a version of Windows 10 or Windows 11 in a web browser or on virtual machines in the cloud. This new integration will allow businesses to access their cloud-hosted Windows 11 environment from their local PCs and laptops, giving them a more seamless experience for accessing their work documents, applications, and other business data. Additionally, businesses will be able to access their files and applications from any device, allowing them to stay productive wherever they are. Microsoft has also announced that the new Cloud PC integration will include features such as high performance graphics capabilities, security tools, and management tools to help businesses manage their cloud environment. Businesses will also have access to support services and resources to help them get the most out of their Windows 11 environment. Overall, this new integration is designed to make it easier for businesses to use Windows 11 in the cloud, while providing them with more control over how they access their data and applications. With this integration, Microsoft is making it simpler for businesses to take advantage of the power of Windows 11 in the cloud, helping them to remain agile and competitive in today's changing market.

Cibo express has confirmed its first check-out free store at Newark Liberty airport. The store will use Amazon's Just Walk Out cashier-less technology. Just Walk Out uses the technology used in Amazon Go stores, which requires customers to scan a QR code when they enter the store and then uses sensors, cameras and weight scales to track what items are picked up and automatically charge customers' Amazon accounts when they leave.

A group of startups is using end-to-end learning to teach self-driving cars how to drive. Despite investors sinking more than 100 billion into self-driving car technology, driverless tech is still years away from being widely available. End-to-end learning involves teaching the car to drive by feeding it data related to camera images, sensors, and other inputs, instead of programming it with a fixed set of rules. This type of deep learning allows the cars to learn from experience, using trial and error to develop better driving skills. With end-to-end learning, the cars can be taught how to respond to various driving scenarios, eliminating the need for tedious manual coding. The ultimate goal is for self-driving cars to become safe enough to be released on public roads without an operator present.

A team of Chinese researchers used a quantum computer to design a new type of qubit that significantly outperformed their previous designs. The new qubit design can hold its quantum state for longer periods of time, allowing it to perform more complex calculations and operate at higher speeds. The team utilized a quantum annealing algorithm to map out the optimal qubit design, which they were able to verify using a superconducting quantum processor. The researchers hope that their work will lead to improved quantum computing systems and applications.

Leaf 3 is a PHP framework for creating web apps and APIs with a clean, simple, and flexible structure. It is powered by an ecosystem of powerful modules with zero configuration. Leaf 3 is lightweight and highly extensible, making it easy to create custom applications quickly. It also includes a command-line tool for scaffolding applications with just a few commands.

Learn about Workato, the fastest-growing enterprise automation platform during this year's Automate conference, which features sessions with Serena Williams, the CIO of GitLab, the "Godfather of MarTech" and more. Learn how to leverage automation to improve efficiency, reduce costs and increase customer satisfaction. Gain insights into the latest trends in AI-driven automation, such as natural language processing, computer vision and machine learning. Plus, get a hands-on demo of the Workato platform and see it in action.

Python autocomplete is a project that experiments with using an LSTM model to autocomplete python code. Test results show that it can save users between 30 to 50 percent of the time they spend writing code, while also providing them with more concise and meaningful code. The project is designed to reduce programming errors and improve the overall efficiency of coding in Python. The model uses a combination of recurrent neural networks (RNNs) and long short-term memory (LSTM) networks to learn from a dataset of existing Python code. The model then predicts the next line of code for a user as they type. It can also suggest alternative lines of code that may be more efficient or better suited for the task at hand. This helps users to quickly generate code that is both accurate and optimized. Overall, the autocomplete project is a valuable tool for experienced and novice Python developers alike, allowing them to write code faster and with fewer errors. As the project continues to be developed and refined, it will become increasingly useful and powerful in helping developers create quality code efficiently.

Set Your Day to Music with Productivity Playlists from Setapp. A playlist to help you focus. A playlist to inspire creativity. A playlist to hold your daily standup meeting to. Whatever you need, these productivity playlists have you covered. Get ready to hit your goals and get stuff done with the perfect tunes.

Origin Space, a Chinese private space resources company, will launch a space mining robot in November. The small satellite will enter a 500-kilometer-altitude sun-synchronous orbit, where it will be testing a variety of technologies related to space mining. The satellite will be equipped with an Autonomous Navigation System, which enables the robotic spacecraft to autonomously detect and track asteroids in outer space. It will also feature a small arm that can manipulate objects in space, as well as a visible camera and infrared spectrometer used for remote sensing and navigation. The goal of the mission is to explore the potential of using robots to extract resources from asteroids. The robot will collect data on asteroid composition and structure, as well as test refining techniques. The data gathered will be used by Origin Space to develop the technology needed to extract resources from asteroids in the future. Ultimately, Origin Space hopes to use its technology to mine water, metals, and other valuable materials from asteroids and return them to Earth. This would provide a sustainable source of resources and reduce the environmental impact of traditional mining operations on our planet.

This case study investigates how TikTok created a'fun and addictive' app. The setup can seem a bit tedious, with users having to select from different interests before being shown any content, but the end result is a highly tailored experience that keeps users coming back for more. TikTok started by creating an app that was easy to use and intuitive. To begin with, users were able to create their own profiles and add interests. This allowed TikTok to understand what types of content users would be interested in. Once the user had added their interests, they were then shown a feed of recommended videos tailored to their specific interests. The app also features a range of interactive elements such as filters, editing tools and effects to make videos more fun and engaging. Users can also follow other accounts and share posts with friends - this helps create a sense of community within the app. Finally, TikTok also runs regular challenges. This allows users to take part in creative competitions or collaborate on new ideas. These challenges help keep users engaged and motivated to continue using the app. Overall, TikTok has created a fun and addictive app that encourages users to come back for more. By creating an intuitive setup process and providing tailored content, users are able to find content that suits their interests quickly and easily. The range of interactive elements and challenges further engage users, helping to create a loyal following and driving downloads and usage.

Scientists have created a vaccine for cat allergies that trains the immune systems of cats, instead of desensitizing the immune system of people allergic to cats. Hypocat trains the cat's immune system to stop producing Fel d 1, a protein that causes allergic reactions. The vaccine works by injecting the cat with a modified version of the Fel d 1 protein, which is then recognized by the cat's immune system as a potential threat. The cat's body then produces antibodies to fight off the perceived threat, and in doing so, builds up immunity to Fel d 1. As a result, the cat no longer produces the allergen, meaning that people who are allergic to cats can be around the vaccinated animal without experiencing any symptoms. Though the Hypocat vaccine is still in its early stages, it has shown promise in initial clinical trials and could provide a much-needed solution for people who suffer from cat allergies.

Plus, there are no set-up fees or commitments required to start using the CDP.

Apple has released iOS 12, which features significant performance improvements over iOS 11 (it is 40 faster for launching apps and up to 70 faster for launching the camera). It also has a number of new features such as Screen Time, Group FaceTime and Memoji. The update also includes enhanced augmented reality capabilities, improved privacy features, better notifications and more. iOS 12 is available as a free upgrade for all compatible devices.

Scientists from Stanford have posted the mRNA sequence that powers the Moderna Covid-19 vaccine on GitHub. The scientists sequenced the mRNA using samples obtained from discarded vaccines. No vaccines were used in the sequencing process. The mRNA sequence is available on the Stanford team's GitHub page, which can be accessed here:

It is possible to draw appealing animations with just a little SVG, Javascript, and CSS knowledge. This tutorial shows you how to create an animation using JavaScript functions to calculate the size and position of the elements involved. Step 1: Create an SVG Element Create an SVG element on the page that will be used for the animation. Use the SVG markup to set the width, height, and viewbox values for the element. Step 2: Set CSS Styles Use CSS to style the SVG element. This includes setting colors and outlines for the elements, as well as any other styling you may want to add. Step 3: Add JavaScript Functions Add JavaScript functions to calculate the size and position of your elements. This can include calculations for size, position, and rotation. Step 4: Animate with JavaScript Add JavaScript code to animate the SVG elements. This can include changing the size and position of the elements, as well as adding a transition effect. Step 5: Test and Tweak Test out your animation and tweak the settings until it looks just right. Make sure to thoroughly test the animation on different browsers and devices.

Dear PyGui is a Python GUI framework. It uses the immediate mode paradigm which allows for extremely dynamic interfaces. Dear PyGui draws widgets using the computer's GPU and works on Windows, macOS, and Linux. It supports many popular GUI libraries such as Qt, Tkinter, WxPython, Kivy, and PyGTK. Dear PyGui also provides a variety of tools for creating more complex user interfaces, including layout managers, visual editors, and a scripting language.

Using machine learning to analyze chest X-rays is difficult because the clinical labels required to train these algorithms are obtained through rule-based natural language processing or human annotation, both of which are highly time-consuming and costly. Additionally, chest X-rays can have a large degree of variability due to patient size, positioning and environment. As such, it is difficult to accurately annotate the images for machine learning algorithms in an efficient way.

The Maui Shell is a new convergent Linux shell that aims to work on both mobile and desktop. It is still a work in progress, but there are some usable features available. The shell is designed to be fast, intuitive, and user-friendly. It also has built-in support for various Linux distributions, including Ubuntu, Debian, Fedora, and more. It provides an alternative desktop environment for users who don't want to use a full desktop environment like GNOME or KDE. Additionally, the shell integrates with many popular online services such as Dropbox, Google Drive, Facebook, and Twitter.

Follow this step by step guide with working code examples to build a "Spotify Wrapped" clone using Mux's Data API. Step 1: Create Mux Account The first step is to create a Mux account. Mux is an API-first video platform that enables developers to add high quality video experiences to their applications. To get started, visit the Mux website and sign up for a free trial. Step 2: Set Up Your Data API Keys Once you have created your account, you'll need to set up your API keys. These will be used to authenticate your requests and provide authorization to access Mux's Data API. To do this, navigate to "Settings" in the Mux Dashboard and select "API Keys." Here you can create and manage your API keys. You will need two keys - one for read-only access and one for write access. Step 3: Create a New Project Now that you have your API keys set up, it's time to create a new project in the Mux dashboard. To do this, click the "Create Project" button in the top right corner of the dashboard. Give your project a name and click "Create." Step 4: Connect Your Project to Your Data API Keys Once your project is created, it's time to connect it to your Data API keys. Navigate to "Data API" in the left sidebar of your project and enter the read-only and write access keys you created in Step 2. Step 5: Create a "Spotify Wrapped" Clone Now that you've connected your project to your Data API keys, it's time to start building your Spotify Wrapped clone. Begin by creating a simple HTML page with a form that allows users to input their username and submit their request. This form should include an input field for the username and a submit button. Next, create a JavaScript file that contains a function that makes an AJAX request to the Mux Data API using the username from the form. This function should accept the username as a parameter and make an AJAX request using the username as the query string. Once the AJAX request is complete, parse through the response data and extract the user's most-played songs, album artwork, and playlists. Finally, use this data to generate a "Spotify Wrapped" style report that displays the user's most-played songs, albums, and playlists. Here is a working example of the code needed to accomplish this task: HTML Form form input type"text" id"username" placeholder"Enter your Spotify username" input type"submit" value"Submit" onclick"getData " form JavaScript Function function getData (username) { var xhttp new XMLHttpRequest ; xhttp.onreadystatechange function { if (this.readyState 4 this.status 200) { var response JSON.parse (xhttp.responseText); Parse response data and extract user's most-played songs, album artwork, and playlists Generate a "Spotify Wrapped" style report } }; xhttp.open GET," , true); xhttp.setRequestHeader Authorization', 'Basic [read-only api key; xhttp.send ; }

AWS SaaS Boost is a tool that helps software developers migrate to a Software-as-a-Service delivery model. It provides core software elements for running SaaS workloads in the cloud, including tenant management, user authentication, billing and reporting, and analytics. AWS SaaS Boost also helps developers automate the provisioning of infrastructure and applications for SaaS workloads, allowing them to quickly scale up their offerings. Additionally, the tool includes pre-built integrations with popular third-party services such as payment processors, customer relationship management systems, and marketing automation software. By utilizing AWS SaaS Boost, developers can reduce their time to market and improve their overall operational efficiency.

Skelleftea is a town in the far north of Sweden with a climate-conscious focus. It runs on 100 renewable energy and recycles 120,000 tonnes of electronic waste a year. The town has invested heavily in renewable energy sources such as wind, solar and hydroelectric power, as well as supporting local businesses and industries to reduce their carbon footprint. It also has a number of smart city initiatives, such as intelligent transport systems, smart grids and smart buildings, that are helping it to become more sustainable. The local government is committed to creating an ecologically healthy environment for its citizens by encouraging green and sustainable living.

Lucid has beaten the Tesla Model S Plaid prototype's Laguna Seca race track record with its Air electric vehicle. The tri-motor performance version of the Air electric has over 1,200 horsepower and can go from 0 to 60 mph in 2.5 seconds. It completed the lap in 1 minute 33.2 seconds, beating the Tesla Model S Plaid's time of 1 minute 36.555 seconds. The Lucid Air also has a range of over 500 miles on a single charge. This news marks a major milestone for Lucid Motors and their electric vehicles.

Elon Musk has told several of his close friends and associates that he is planning to move to Texas. Musk put his Californian houses on the market and expanded operations in Texas, including building a new Tesla factory. He has also spoken about the high taxes and regulations of California, and the business-friendly environment in Texas.

Everyone is talking about Kubernetes! Apps running in these workloads probably have the concept of users. And where you have users, you have auth. We'll cover topics like service-to-service communication, identity federation, single sign-on (SSO), and multi-factor authentication.

Large and mysterious land carvings have been discovered in India's Thar Desert. The geoglyphs may be the largest-ever graphical depictions designed by humans. They were discovered using Google Earth during a routine search. The figures depict animals, humans, and other patterns that stretch for miles across the desert. While the age of the figures is unknown, it is likely that they are hundreds of years old. The discovery has been called "one of the most significant finds of its kind" by experts in the field. Though little is known about the carvings or their creators, archaeologists believe that the figures may have been created by nomadic tribes as a form of artistic expression. Others theorize that they could be related to religious ceremonies, or even ancient astronomical markings. Regardless of their purpose, these mysterious figures offer an intriguing glimpse into India's past. They are a reminder of how civilizations throughout history have left their mark on the landscape, creating lasting monuments of human creativity.

The pandemic is making it more normal for people to start and develop relationships online without ever meeting in person. For many people, online romance is now the only option. This is a major shift in how relationships develop and form. It means that people are more likely to meet potential partners online, instead of relying on traditional methods such as meeting through family or friends, or in person at social events. The biggest challenge with online relationships is that it can be hard to know how someone truly is when you don't get to interact with them face-to-face. This makes it important to pay close attention to their words and actions, and make sure you communicate clearly about your expectations and boundaries. Additionally, it's important to remember that not all relationships formed online will work out; there is always a possibility that things could end unexpectedly. Overall, the pandemic has shifted the way many people find and form relationships, and it is important to remain aware of both the advantages and risks of online romance.

Marin County in the San Francisco Bay will pay Uber a subscription fee to use Uber's management software for its high-occupancy vehicle fleet. Marin Transit provides six-seater and wheelchair-accessible vans that are available to residents of Marin County for a nominal fee. The agreement with Uber includes use of its software platform to manage the fleet, and will allow Marin Transit to better track ridership and revenue. Uber's software will also help Marin Transit improve customer service by allowing customers to book rides in advance and track their vehicle's location.

Google announced a 5.5-inch Pixel 3 and a 6.3-inch Pixel 3 XL for 799 and 899 respectively (available on October 18th). It is also rolling out Google Duplex (the cool AI-driven assistant feature) and a suite of new camera features. The Pixel 3 will have an improved Titan M security chip, two 8MP front-facing cameras and a 12.2MP rear camera. It will also come with wireless charging, water resistance, and be available in three colors: Just Black, Clearly White, and Not Pink.
