Elastic Community Conference: Free Tech Event - Sign Up and Win a T-Shirt. Elastic, the company behind Elasticsearch, Kibana, Beats, and Logstash is hosting its annual community event on February 27th. Join us for a day of technical talks, networking, and hands-on workshops with the Elastic team. Plus, be sure to sign up for your chance to win a free Elastic t-shirt. See you there!

The gene-editing performed on Chinese twins in order to immunize them against HIV may have had unintended mutations. He Jiankui had targeted the CCR5 gene in twins Lulu and Nana , which is known to be associated with HIV immunity. However, it is impossible to predict exactly how the editing process may have affected other genes, since gene-editing technology is still relatively new and has not been extensively studied yet. The potential for off-target mutations or unintended consequences is always present when using gene-editing technology. In this case, there are concerns that He Jiankui's experiments may have caused permanent changes in the twins' genomes that could have long-term, unknown effects.

Researchers from London have developed a deep neural network that can determine a person's emotional state by analyzing wireless signals. The technique involves sending radio signals towards targets and measuring the signal's frequency as it bounces back. The signals are then processed by the neural network, which is trained to recognize patterns in the data that indicate whether a person is feeling happy, sad, angry, etc. The team tested the system on 200 people and found that it was able to accurately detect emotions with an accuracy of over 80 percent. This is significantly better than traditional methods such as facial recognition or voice analysis, which may only reach an accuracy of around 60-70 percent. The researchers believe that this technology could be used in healthcare settings, such as hospitals, to monitor the emotional state of patients and help diagnose mental health issues. It could also provide valuable insights into how people interact with one another, providing novel ways of studying human behavior.

The Planetary Society, an organization founded by Carl Sagan, Bruce Murray, and Louis Friedman, is sending a small spacecraft to orbit the planet. Known as the LightSail 2, the satellite is designed to demonstrate the potential of solar sailing, a form of space travel that uses the momentum of photons from the Sun to propel spacecrafts. The LightSail 2 will be launched in late 2019 aboard a SpaceX Falcon Heavy rocket. Once it reaches orbit, the satellite will deploy its four triangular mylar sails, which measure 32 square meters (344 square feet). When the sails are deployed, the spacecraft will be pushed along by the pressure of light particles, or photons, bouncing off its sails. The spacecraft will orbit Earth for several months and then attempt to raise its altitude using solar radiation pressure. If this experiment is successful, it could pave the way for future missions that use solar sailing as a primary means of propulsion. Solar sailing has been proposed as a way to explore beyond our solar system, since it does not require fuel like conventional rockets. It is also a much more efficient way to explore the outer planets in our own solar system, since it would take much less time to reach distant destinations.

Regular Expressions (regex) are a tool for manipulating strings. Regex can sometimes take an extremely long time to match or fail on some strings. This can be exploited by malicious actors to cause an application to perform large calculations with the intent of slowing down or crashing it. To prevent this, regex should be limited in length, and the amount of time that an application will spend trying to match a regex should also be limited. Additionally, it is important to use regular expression libraries and tools which are designed to be efficient and secure.

A researcher from the Swiss research institute EMPA has developed an invisible lock system that uses conductive ink on a transparent polymer film to create invisible buttons. The result is a secure system that is difficult to replicate and can be used on any type of door. The EMPA-developed invisible lock system works by using conductive ink to create an invisible button on the transparent polymer film. Pressure from a fingertip on the invisible button activates two switches which then trigger an electronic locking mechanism. The system is battery powered and can be installed on any type of door. It is also tamperproof, as any attempt to replicate the invisible buttons will cause the circuit to break, making it impossible to open the door. The EMPA researcher believes this technology could have many applications in the security industry, such as being used for private residences, hotels, offices, and even military installations. The system is also capable of being integrated with other forms of security, such as access control systems and biometric scanners. This could potentially make it much more difficult for criminals to gain access to restricted areas or private property. Overall, the EMPA-developed invisible lock system is an innovative and secure way to protect valuable assets. It is easy to install, tamperproof, and provides added protection for anyone who wants to ensure their privacy and security.

Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos has created a 2 billion fund called the Day One Fund to help homeless families and create a network of nonprofit preschools in low-income communities. It will also provide funding for organizations that help homeless families. The fund will be administered by Bezos's philanthropic arm, the Bezos Day One Fund.

Japan's terrain doesn't allow for forests of wind turbines or fields of solar panels, so Japanese engineers are looking to ocean currents for renewable energy. The IHI Corporation has completed the first phase of a project to generate electricity from ocean currents off the coast of Fukushima, Japan. The project uses a device called a "Marine Current Turbine" that works much like a wind turbine, but is designed to capture energy from ocean currents. The turbine is connected to an underwater cable that transmits the generated electricity to shore. The turbine has been operating since late 2018 and has generated enough electricity to power about 20 households. The project is part of an effort by Japan to diversify its energy sources and reduce its dependence on fossil fuels. In addition to the Fukushima project, IHI is also exploring other locations for marine current turbines. While ocean current energy is still in its early stages, Japan hopes that it can become an important source of renewable energy in the future.

Fix vulnerabilities at scale with a single search. See how the most productive dev teams like Cloudflare use Sourcegraph to quickly find vulnerabilities and fix them at scale. Remediate vulnerabilities quickly and efficiently with Sourcegraph's powerful search capabilities. Sourcegraph helps you find vulnerable code, identify solutions, and fix them faster than ever before.

Google's DeepMind AI team has successfully trained its software to control a tokamak. Small reactors like tokamaks use software to monitor the state of the plasma they contain and respond to changes in the system. The DeepMind team trained its software to control a tokamak and achieved greater efficiency than existing methods. The AI was able to anticipate disruptions before they occurred and take corrective action to maintain stability. This is an important step in the development of more efficient fusion reactors, which are seen as a potential source of clean energy in the future.

Cows at the RusMoloko dairy farm near Moscow in Russia wear VR headsets to improve their conditions and to enable them to relax into producing more milk. Data from farms using the technology has shown that cows produce more milk when they are relaxed. The headsets provide the cows with a virtual reality environment featuring natural settings, such as a rolling green field or a beautiful beach scene. The virtual reality environment helps to reduce stress in the cows and also keep them calm, as it is designed to be soothing and enjoyable for the animals. It is reported that cows wearing the headsets can produce up to 3 more milk than those not wearing them. The VR headsets also allow farmers to monitor the cows' activity levels and make sure the animals are comfortable and healthy. In addition, the headsets help to reduce aggressive behavior among the cows, which can lead to fewer injuries and better overall welfare.

India shut down the internet in the state of Assam during protests against a new citizenship rule. The Citizenship Amendment Bill, which creates a pathway for citizenship for minorities in certain neighbouring countries, was met with protests in Assam due to concerns that it would lead to an influx of immigrants. The Indian government shut down internet access in the state as a precautionary measure to prevent the spread of misinformation and encourage peace.

Facebook Gaming has been launched in beta for a limited group of people. The service will launch with five games, including Gameloft's Asphalt 9: Legends. Out of Facebook's 2.7 billion users, over 700 million people are gamers. The service will allow players to stream their games and watch other streams. It will also feature a gaming video tab where users can find gaming-related videos. Facebook Gaming will also have tournaments, leaderboards, and rewards for players.

BepiColombo, a joint mission between the European Space Agency and the Japan Aerospace Exploration Agency, has sent back pictures of the crater-riddled surface of Mercury. The mission launched in 2018 and is on track to reach its destination in 2025, where it will map the surface of Mercury and collect data about the planet's magnetic field, atmosphere, and interior structure. The mission has captured detailed images of craters of various sizes, showing a variety of features, from smooth-walled depressions to jagged peaks. Scientists have also observed bright reflective areas on the planet's surface, which may indicate the presence of ice deposits within certain craters. BepiColombo's findings will help scientists better understand the evolution of the innermost planet in our solar system.

When you want to edit something using an online tool today, you usually have to upload the file to the tool by selecting the file or dragging it into your browser window. Once the file is uploaded, you can use the online tool to edit it as needed. Depending on the type of file and the online tool, you may have access to different editing options. For example, if you are editing a text document, you may be able to change font sizes and styles, add images, or make other changes. If you are editing an image, you may be able to crop it, adjust the brightness, or add effects.

Frequency Therapeutics is seeking to reverse hearing loss by regrowing hair cells in the inner ear. It has developed a drug candidate that can be injected into the ear to stimulate the regeneration of these cells. The company is currently conducting clinical trials to evaluate the effectiveness of this drug candidate in restoring hearing. If successful, Frequency Therapeutics could revolutionize the treatment of hearing loss and improve the quality of life for millions of people who suffer from this condition.

The United Arab Emirates is transitioning to a 4.5-day workweek. It will be moving from a Friday to Saturday weekend schedule to a Friday afternoon to Sunday weekend. The UAE government has said that the new workweek schedule will help promote greater work-life balance for its citizens. The new schedule will apply to both the public and private sectors and is expected to come into effect in June 2021.

Cymbospondylus youngorum may have been the first giant animal that ever lived on Earth. The new type of ichthyosaur was discovered in the Augusta Mountains of Nevada with a skull measuring two feet in length. It is believed to be the oldest and largest ichthyosaur known to science, living during the Early Triassic period over 245 million years ago. The species was named Cymbospondylus youngorum in honour of Dr. Robert Young, a curator of paleontology at the University of Nevada in Las Vegas who first recognized its importance. Cymbospondylus youngorum had a large size for an ichthyosaur, reaching up to 6 meters (20 feet) in length. Its body was long and slender with a powerful tail fin. It also had a pair of paddle-like limbs at the front which were used for steering and propulsion. The mouth of Cymbospondylus youngorum was filled with sharp teeth, suggesting it fed on fish and other small marine animals. It also had eyes that allowed it to see in low light conditions. The most remarkable feature of this ichthyosaur was its ability to stay submerged for long periods of time, possibly due to its large lungs and streamlined body. This giant ichthyosaur provides us with an exciting window into the past, allowing us to understand the ecology of the early oceans and the dynamic evolution of life on Earth.

lego is a fast static site generator that generates optimized, performant websites. It is built with NodeJS, supports Nunjucks and Liquid templates, automatically generates a sitemap and RSS feeds, generates optimized image assets, and offers many other features. It is ideal for developers who want to quickly build and deploy a website without any hassle.

Brewster Kahle founded Alexa Internet and the Internet Archive on the same day in 1996. Alexa was acquired by Amazon in a deal worth 250 million and converted into an online search engine to help customers find information on the web. The Internet Archive is a digital library dedicated to preserving and providing access to historical web pages, images, audio and video files, and other digital media.

SAGA's LUNARK is a habitat designed to help people live on the lunar surface. It has a carbon fiber shell that is arranged in an origami format that allows it to be compact for transportation and then easily expand once on the surface. The inside of the habitat has an airlock, living quarters, a kitchen, and other amenities. It is designed to utilize local resources such as ice or regolith for radiation shielding and water or oxygen supply. The habitat also has a robotic arm that can assist with tasks such as construction or maintenance.

Snapchat's Snap Kit allows developers to integrate Snapchat features into their apps. Hoop, a Tinder-like app developed on Snap Kit, quickly saw 2.5 million downloads after its launch. The app enabled users to pull in their profile data from Snapchat, such as Bitmoji, in order to create a playful dating experience. This allowed users to express themselves more than they could on other apps, with the ability to add creative elements such as stickers and emojis. Snap Kit also allows Hoop to use Snapchat's login feature, so users can quickly sign into the app without having to go through a lengthy authentication process. Additionally, the app enables users to share their profiles with each other on Snapchat. Snap Kit's integration with Hoop has been successful because it makes the user experience more enjoyable while also making the app easier to navigate. It also helps to give users a sense of security since they are already familiar with Snapchat. Finally, it allows for more creativity, which is important for a dating app where users want to stand out.

Bandit is a pure Elixir HTTP server for Plug applications. It can serve HTTP1.x and HTTP2 clients over both HTTP and HTTPS. The project prioritizes correctness, clarity, and performance, and is designed for extensibility. Bandit provides all the features one would expect from a production-ready web server, including HTTP2, TLS support, and logging. It also provides support for Websockets, streaming requests and responses, custom error handling, and more.

Airseas' Seawing is a parafoil kite designed to attach to ships to reduce emissions on shipping trips by up to 20. It can be mounted onto the deck of any standard commercial vessel, and is designed to harness the power of wind to reduce fuel consumption. The Seawing is a high-performance, automated kite system that uses a combination of sensors, artificial intelligence and autopilot software to provide precise control. It can adjust its angle of attack for maximum efficiency in any wind condition, allowing it to capture more wind energy than other traditional technologies. The Seawing also has an integrated wing-tip airfoil shape to further increase lift and reduce drag. By reducing fuel consumption and emissions, the Seawing can help to reduce costs, as well as contributing to a more sustainable future for shipping.

Elon Musk has revealed that he has a design for a submarine car, like the one from the James Bond movie 'The Spy Who Loved Me'. As a child, Musk was inspired by the movie and wanted to build a real-life version of the iconic vehicle. Musk's design has not been revealed yet, but he did mention that it will be electric and capable of travelling both on land and underwater. Musk also said that he plans on making the car fast, so that it could be used as an alternative to traditional transportation. He also mentioned that he hopes to make the car affordable so that everyone can enjoy its features.

Ford is releasing a comprehensive self-driving dataset to academics and researchers. The data was collected over a year and it comes from multiple self-driving vehicles. Ford is also sharing a 3-D simulator to further accelerate research. Ford is hoping that this data will help researchers develop new technologies and make improvements in autonomous vehicle safety. The data includes information about the car's speed, location, and environment. It also contains objects detected by the sensors such as traffic signals, pedestrians and other vehicles. The goal of sharing this data is to improve accuracy and reduce complexity in self-driving systems.

Apple has extended its deadline for employees returning to the office because of the increase of Covid-19 cases due to the Delta variant. The return to the offices was controversial , with some employees expressing concerns about their safety. The new deadline for an employee to return is now the end of July 2021, two months later than the original date of May 2021. Apple also announced that it will continue to offer flexible work arrangements and remote work options for those who prefer to work from home.

Google is completely reimagining mobile search. It is adding a newsfeed to its mobile search results, with news cards that look a lot like the Google News App (or Facebook, for that matter). Google is introducing a new personalization layer to its results, based on user interests and previous searches. It is also using AI-based algorithms to understand user intent in order to offer more relevant search results. Additionally, Google is integrating its various services into one unified search experience. For example, when you search for a restaurant, Google will show you not only reviews and ratings, but also images from Google Maps and information about reservations from OpenTable. All of these new features are designed to make mobile search faster, more useful, and more personalized.

After 25 years of marriage, Jeff and MacKenzie Bezos are getting divorced. They've been separated for a long time, but will continue to be "parents, friends, partners in ventures and projects, and as individuals pursuing ventures and adventures." The couple released a joint statement regarding their divorce, saying, "We feel incredibly lucky to have found each other and deeply grateful for every one of the years we have been married to each other. If we had known we would separate after 25 years, we would do it all again." Although the circumstances of the divorce are unknown, it is clear that both Jeff and MacKenzie Bezos remain committed to maintaining a strong relationship despite no longer being married. The two plan to continue working together on certain projects, and will prioritize their children's well-being during this difficult time.

Amazon Web Services has partnered with D-Wave, IonQ, and Rigetti to launch Braket, a quantum computing service. It has also announced the launch of the AWS Center for Quantum Computing , an interdisciplinary research center located on the Amazon campus in Seattle. Braket is designed to make quantum computing more accessible to a broader range of customers by providing a single, unified platform for exploring and experimenting with different quantum computing technologies. The Center for Quantum Computing will conduct research to advance the field of quantum computing, including developing new algorithms, architectures, and applications. Additionally, the Center will provide resources to support the development of quantum applications through tutorials, workshops, and events.

Scalene is a high-performance CPU and memory profiler for Python. It is fast as it uses sampling instead of instrumentation or relying on Python's tracing facilities. Scalene performs CPU profiling and memory usage tracking, both at a function level and line-by-line. It measures CPU time and uses the operating system's page fault counter to track memory usage. It also has an interactive console that can be used to inspect and analyze profiling data. Scalene is well suited for applications that require low overhead and precise profiling, as it does not instrument code or use tracing facilities.

The SvelteKit beta is now available. SvelteKit is a framework for building high-performance web apps. It features server-side rendering, routing, code-splitting for JS and CSS, adaptors for different serverless platforms, and an integrated development experience. With SvelteKit, you can create modern, complex applications with very little code. Try it out today and start building the apps of tomorrow!

GPS systems are unable to work underwater as water breaks down the radio waves GPS relies on to function. MIT scientists have developed a device called an underwater backscatter localization system which uses sound waves to allow underwater navigation, but this technology is still in the early stages of development.

Recurrent Neural Networks are a type of neural network that specializes in processing sequences. A common application of RNNs is for Natural Language Processing due to its effectiveness at handling long sequences of text. RNNs are able to remember context and information from previous inputs, allowing them to make predictions about future inputs in the sequence. They can also be used for a variety of other applications such as machine translation, image captioning, and predicting time series data.

btrace is an Android trace tool based on Systrace. It supports custom and native events, and it can be set to only capture trace events of the main thread. btrace is written in C and runs in user space on top of Android, allowing it to provide a real-time trace that is more responsive than a kernel based solution. btrace supports both kernel-space and user-space events, allowing for more detailed tracing than what is offered by the stock Android Systrace tool. Additionally, btrace can be used to monitor performance issues in multi-threaded applications.

BMW has developed an electric wingsuit capable of soaring through the sky at speeds of up to 186 mph. Professional skydiver and BASE jumper Peter Salzmann, who was part of the development team, said the suit is equipped with four electric ducted fans that provide enough thrust to keep the wearer airborne for up to 10 minutes. It also has a built-in parachute system for safe landing. The suit was tested in a wind tunnel and various outdoor locations. BMW said the wingsuit is still a prototype and not available for purchase yet.

Facebook came out with it's own smart home device, it's sort of a tablet with a speaker attached to the base. It's called Facebook Portal, and it comes in two sizes. It's designed to make video calls easier, and it also has a built-in camera that can be used for video conferencing, streaming music and videos, and playing games. It also includes Alexa voice control, so users can use the device to control their other smart home devices. The Portal also includes AI-powered features to keep conversations private and secure.

A new finding suggests that the Ebola viruses behind a new outbreak in Guinea may have originated from a survivor who carried the virus for at least five years. The World Health Organization (WHO) said that genetic sequencing of the viruses showed they were similar to those seen in an outbreak in the same area five years ago. The recent outbreak in Guinea was first reported in February 2021 and has killed at least 80 people as of April 2021. The WHO said it is possible that the virus may have been carried by a survivor from the previous outbreak, which killed more than 11,000 people across West Africa between 2014 and 2016. The new finding underscores the importance of monitoring the health of survivors and providing them with necessary medical care. It also highlights the need for further research into how long Ebola viruses can persist in humans after infection. Such findings could help inform how long survivors need to be monitored and how long public health measures should remain in place to prevent further outbreaks.

Scientists have grown plants in lunar soil using samples collected during the Apollo missions to the moon. The scientists grew thale cress, a small flowering plant that is attractive to pollinators, in a simulated moon-like environment. The soil was collected from the Apollo 11 and 17 missions in 1969 and 1972, respectively. The researchers found that the plants grew well in the lunar soil with no added nutrients or water, showing that it is possible for plants to survive in extraterrestrial environments. The findings could pave the way for future lunar exploration and provide insight into the potential for growing food in space.

The same CSS code can sometimes output different and unexpected results. CSS is a complex system and subtle differences can change how properties behave. This article looks at layout algorithms , inheritance and the cascade, specificity, and browser compatibility as some of the most common causes of unexpected results. Layout algorithms: CSS uses a variety of layout algorithms to determine how elements are positioned on the page. Different elements can be laid out in different ways, and understanding these differences can help you debug unexpected behavior. Inheritance and the cascade: CSS is designed to be inherited by child elements from their parent. This means that if a property is set on the parent, it will be applied to all its children unless it is overwritten with a more specific selector. This can be confusing, so it's important to understand the cascade and how it affects your code. Specificity: The order of selectors and properties can also cause unexpected results. When two selectors conflict, the one with higher specificity (the more specific selector) will always take precedence. It's important to pay attention to the specificity of your selectors, otherwise you may end up with unexpected results. Browser Compatibility: Different browsers interpret CSS differently, so it's important to test your code across multiple browsers to ensure compatibility. If you're seeing unexpected results, it may be due to a browser-specific issue. It's also important to make sure you're using the most up-to-date version of each browser.

Researchers at MIT have created a rechargeable lithium-ion battery in the form of a 460-foot-long fiber. The batteries can be manufactured to arbitrarily long lengths. They can be 3D-printed into any shape, and are only about three times thicker than a human hair. The battery is made up of an anode and a cathode, with a solid electrolyte in between. This combination allows the lithium ions to move back and forth between the anode and the cathode as the battery is charged and discharged. The fibers can withstand temperatures of up to 250 degrees Celsius (482 degrees Fahrenheit). Because they are so thin and lightweight, these batteries could be used in many applications, such as powering medical implants, wearable electronics, or even robots. They could also be woven into fabrics to provide power for smart clothing. The researchers believe that the batteries could be a potential alternative to traditional batteries due to their flexibility and small size.

The International Space Station is supposed to retire in 2024, though that date will probably be pushed back to 2030. It is slowly leaking air and getting increasingly expensive to maintain, so the international partners involved in its construction and operation have decided to start planning for its eventual retirement. The station was first launched in 1998, and since then it has been a hub for scientific research and exploration. Astronauts from around the world have lived and worked on board, as well as conducted dozens of experiments that could not be done on Earth. It has served as a testing ground for potential solutions to problems like space debris and climate change. When the station retires, its components will be retrieved and recycled or discarded. After that, the future of space exploration is still uncertain. Some experts suggest that the ISS could be replaced by a commercial space station, while others envision an entirely new type of space station. But whatever happens, the ISS will always be remembered as one of the most ambitious and successful international collaborations of all time.

Are you spending too much money on cloud computing?. Find out if you're spending too much on cloud computing with Splunk Observability Cloud - In addition to full-fidelity metrics, traces, and logs, Splunk Observability Cloud provides cost optimization capabilities to help you understand your cloud costs, identify opportunities to reduce costs, and take action to improve efficiency. The cost optimization features allow you to set budget limits, monitor usage trends, and get alerted when you exceed a threshold. This feature helps you ensure that you're not overspending on cloud computing and can help you identify cost-saving opportunities.

Scientists have found a way to control the blood-brain barrier at a molecular level and open it up for a couple of hours at a time. The absence of a blood-brain barrier has been linked to a variety of neurological disorders, including Alzheimer's disease, so this breakthrough could be an important step towards improved treatments. The process involves using targeted ultrasound waves combined with microbubbles to temporarily disrupt the tight junctions between brain cells that make up the barrier. Scientists believe this technique may allow drugs and other treatments to pass through to the brain easily, while also reducing the risk of unwanted side effects.

handwritten.js converts typed text to realistic handwriting. It takes the path to a text file as input and outputs a pdf. An example of the output is available in the repository. The handwritten font used is based on a font called Handwriting Draft created by Marcelo Magalhaes. The library uses this font to create a realistic handwriting effect. It also includes features such as randomizing letter size and spacing, creating an organic look.

Public health officials have long been urging Americans to limit the consumption of red and processed meats due to its links with heart disease, cancer, and other illnesses. Researchers have found that reducing the amount of red and processed meats consumed can help reduce the risk of these diseases. To lower the consumption of these meats, individuals should focus on eating more plant-based proteins such as beans, nuts, and lentils. Additionally, they should try to limit the amount of red and processed meats they consume by incorporating more fish, poultry, and other lean protein sources into their diet. Furthermore, individuals should make sure to cook red and processed meats to a safe internal temperature to reduce the risk of food-borne illnesses. Finally, individuals should consider vegetarian or vegan options when possible to further reduce their consumption of red and processed meats.

Apple announced new versions of the MacBook Air, the 13-inch MacBook Pro, and the Mac mini at its'One More Thing' live stream. The new hardware will use Apple's new M1 chip, which is based on the company's A14 Bionic processor. The M1 chip promises to deliver up to 3x faster CPU performance and up to 6x faster GPU performance than the previous generation of Macs. The new Macs also come with an updated operating system, macOS Big Sur, and improved battery life. The new MacBook Air and 13-inch MacBook Pro start at 999 and 1299 respectively, while the Mac mini starts at 699.

Tardigrades are microscopic extremophiles that can survive exposure to intense temperatures, pressures, and even the vacuum of space. A group of scientists recently recorded high-speed videos of the animals traversing the surface of an axe blade. The videos, filmed at 20,000 frames per second and slowed down to reveal their movements, show the tardigrades slowly climbing up the edge of the blade, using their four stubby legs to grip the metal surface and pull themselves up. The footage also shows the animals rotating their bodies in order to move from one part of the blade to another. The tardigrades' movements are surprisingly graceful for such tiny creatures. The footage reveals some interesting details about the tardigrades' physiology. For example, the scientists noticed that the animals were able to adhere to the metal surface with just the suction cups on their feet, which suggests that they may use a combination of suction and surface tension to move around. The videos also showed that the tardigrades can change direction quickly and easily by simply shifting their body weight. The researchers hope that further study of these videos will help us better understand how tardigrades survive in extreme environments and even in outer space.

This is a cool project that lets you make React components that look like Windows95 UI components. This project allows you to easily create React components that look like classic Windows 95 UI elements. It includes the necessary components such as buttons, text fields, checkboxes, radio buttons, and more. You can customize the colors and sizes of the components to match your design needs. The library also includes several other utilities such as a color palette and a utility for generating random colors. With this library you can quickly create React components that look just like Windows 95 UI elements.

Google's co-founders Larry Page and Sergey Brin have relinquished their control of Alphabet to the current Google CEO Sundar Pichai. They will continue to remain Alphabet employees and retain their board seats.

Iberospinus natarioi, a newly identified 8-meter-long predatory dinosaur, represents a new genus and species of spinosaurid, a group that includes the Spinosaurus. An analysis of the spinosaurid's jaws found that it had a unique tooth arrangement, suggesting that this new species may have been adapted to feed on different prey than its relatives. The fossilized remains of I. natarioi were found in the Early Cretaceous deposits of Spain's Ainsa Basin and date back approximately 125 million years. I. natarioi is the first spinosaurid dinosaur to be discovered in Europe, and the fifth globally. Its skull and lower jaw were well-preserved, allowing researchers to analyze features such as the number, size, shape, and orientation of teeth, which can tell us about how the animal fed. Analysis of I. natarioi's jaws revealed that it possessed a unique arrangement of its teeth, consisting of two rows of large, curved teeth along its upper jaw, and one row of smaller, more pointed teeth along its lower jaw. This tooth arrangement provides evidence that I. natarioi may have been adapted to feed on different types of prey than its relatives, such as fish, aquatic reptiles, and even small dinosaurs. The discovery of I. natarioi provides insight into the evolution of spinosaurids, and suggests that these predators may have had a more diverse diet than previously thought. The fossil remains of I. natarioi shed light on the evolutionary history of this group and provide an important window into understanding the ecology of predatory dinosaurs during the Early Cretaceous period.

Facebook's newsletter subscription service Bulletin could be launched before the end of June. There will be both free and paid versions of the platform. Facebook has recruited writers who focus on local news and events to contribute content to the app. It will be available in the US first and then expand to other countries. The platform is designed to let users subscribe to newsletters from their favorite outlets, allowing them to receive personalized content in their inboxes. Facebook plans to offer features like personalization, analytics, and integration with existing platforms.

Tailwind UI is a collection of professionally designed, pre-built, fully responsive HTML snippets that can be dropped into Tailwind projects. This page contains a collection of free sample components. Categories include buttons, cards, forms, images and more. Tailwind UI is designed to help developers quickly create beautiful and consistent UIs without having to write all the code themselves. The components are mobile-friendly and can be easily customized with Tailwind's utility classes.

DebugBear monitors your website performance and provides actionable insights to improve it. Includes in-depth technical reports built for developers. DebugBear helps you improve your website performance by providing detailed technical reports and actionable insights. It tracks page speed, page weight, and other metrics over time, so you can easily see what's changed since you last checked. DebugBear also shows how fast your page loads on different devices and browsers, giving you a more complete picture of your website performance. With DebugBear's detailed reports, you can quickly identify and fix issues like slow loading pages or large files that are weighing down your website.

Frustrated with your project management software? Shortcut is a goldilocks solution for software engineers, product managers, and designers, providing the ease of use of a simple tool with the power of a complex one. Shortcut offers teams the ability to collaborate in real-time on any project, manage tasks and deadlines, and keep everyone on the same page. It also includes powerful analytics tools to help you understand how your projects are progressing and what adjustments need to be made. With customizable workflows and reporting, Shortcut makes it easy to see the big picture and stay organized.

This repository contains a guide on how to secure anything, whether it is physical or digital. It covers best practices, defenses, vulnerabilities, and more. There are many resources linked throughout the guide to help you better understand the information provided. The guide is organized into four main sections: Physical Security, Network Security, Data Security, and Application Security. Each section contains a brief overview of the topic, followed by in-depth explanations of the concepts and best practices for securing assets in each area. Physical Security covers topics such as access control systems, physical barriers, and security cameras. Network Security covers topics such as firewalls, intrusion detection systems, and network segmentation. Data Security covers topics such as encryption, backup policies, and data privacy laws. Application Security covers topics such as application development best practices, secure coding, and testing. We hope that this guide can serve as a useful resource to help you better understand and protect your assets.

Scientists from the University of California San Diego have developed a method to create neurons. The technique is able to convert astrocytes, the supporting cells in the brain, into neurons, and could potentially be used to develop new treatments for neurological diseases. The method relies on reprogramming astrocytes, which are cells that provide physical and metabolic support to neurons, into functional neurons. The technique involves introducing certain proteins into the astrocytes, which causes them to become neurons. The team tested the technique in mouse models, and showed that the newly created neurons were able to form connections with other neurons and respond to stimuli. In addition, the converted neurons were stable and could survive long term. This research provides a potential new approach to treating neurological diseases. By creating new neurons from existing astrocytes, doctors may be able to replace lost or damaged neurons and restore neuronal networks in patients suffering from neurological conditions. Additionally, the technique may be useful for studying brain development and disease progression.

Daniel Wang, a professor of astronomy, has stitched together hundreds of images to create a panorama of the center of the Milky Way. The resulting map captures some of the most detailed images of the Milky Way ever taken. Using data from the European Southern Observatory's VISTA telescope, Wang and his team were able to construct a highly detailed panorama of the center of the Milky Way, including never-before-seen features, such as stars and gas clouds. The map provides scientists with a valuable tool for understanding the structure of our galaxy, and could even provide clues about how galaxies form and evolve over time.

Django SQL Dashboard provides an authenticated interface for executing read-only SQL queries against PostgreSQL databases. It can safely run multiple SQL queries, bookmark queries to be shared, create saved dashboards , and view query results in a tabular format. The dashboard also provides an easy-to-use interface for creating charts based on the data returned from queries.

Jack Ma has been absent from public view for the past two months. His last public appearance was in late October, where he blasted China's regulatory system. This resulted in speculation regarding his whereabouts, with some reports suggesting he had been placed under government scrutiny. However, it has since been confirmed that Ma is currently on a personal break and is not under investigation.

Amazon recently unveiled a brand called'Made for You' that makes custom-fitted clothes. Its first product is a 25 custom t-shirt. The process starts with the user inputting body dimension data , such as height, weight, and chest size, into the online system. Amazon then uses this data to generate a custom t-shirt pattern that is made to fit the user's dimensions. The user can then choose from a variety of colors, materials, and other customizable features, such as sleeve length and hem style. Once the user has selected their desired design, the shirt is printed and shipped directly to their door.

Match Group, the company that owns Tinder, has become the latest high-profile software maker to ditch the Play Store and instead use its own payment systems. Last year, Epic Games , the maker of Fortnite, chose to bypass Google's platform in favor of its own. Match Group has said that it will now use an in-app store for all purchases, rather than relying on Google's Play Store. This means that users will have to go directly through the company's website to purchase items, such as Tinder Plus and Gold subscriptions. Match Group is also introducing a new payment system, called "Tinder Payment," which allows users to pay with debit or credit cards or Apple Pay. The move is part of a larger trend of companies choosing to bypass the Play Store, in order to control their own customer data, payment systems, and pricing. Companies are also avoiding paying Google's 30 commission fee on purchases made within the app. Google has been criticized for its tight grip on the Android market, and other companies, such as Microsoft, have called for the tech giant to loosen its restrictions. It remains to be seen how Google will respond to Match Group's decision.

Vince Ramos was the owner of Phantom Secure, a company that customized BlackBerry phones to make ordinary wiretaps impossible. Phantom was started in 2008 as Ramos saw a need to protect people's privacy. Ramos was arrested in San Diego in 2018 and charged with participating in a criminal enterprise that operated Phantom Secure. The company allegedly provided encrypted phones to drug traffickers worldwide, including the Sinaloa cartel in Mexico. Ramos was accused of providing support to international drug trafficking organizations and laundering their profits. He pleaded guilty to the charges and was sentenced to nine years in prison in 2019.

Droidlet is a platform for building intelligent agents that simplifies integrating a wide range of machine learning algorithms to facilitate rapid prototyping. It can be used to quickly test out models and ideas, as well as to build more complex applications. Droidlet provides tools for developing and managing intelligent agents, such as natural language processing, planning, and decision trees. It also includes a library of pre-trained models, so developers can quickly get started with building their own agents. Additionally, Droidlet can be used to provide interactive experiences for users, such as conversations or games.

Google is planning to launch a high-end version of its Pixel Buds. The Pixel Buds Pro will come in four colors and will likely feature Adaptive Sound, a feature that adjusts the volume of the headphones based on the environment. The headphones will also be IPX4 certified, which means they'll be sweat and water resistant. They are expected to have Google's custom-designed 12mm dynamic speaker drivers, as well as a beamforming mike array for better sound isolation and clearer calls. Additionally, the Pixel Buds Pro will reportedly come with auto-pairing and a case that doubles as a charger.

Element Plus is a Vue.js 3.0 based UI component library for developers, designers, and product managers. It was designed with consistency, feedback, efficiency, and controllability in mind. Examples and demos of its components are available, and it can be used to create mobile and desktop applications with Vue.js 3.0.

Zoom has bought security start-up Keybase, which will allow it to implement end-to-end encryption in its meetings. Users will not be able to call into encrypted meetings via phone, and Zoom will have to rely on the security measures of the Keybase technology. Zoom has also announced that it will be making its platform open-source, allowing for further investigation into the privacy and security features of their services.

Mark Zuckerberg today released a 3200-word statement saying that encryption will be one of the keys to Facebook's future. He announced plans to shift the company's messaging platforms to be more secure, and to focus on privacy-protecting technologies like end-to-end encryption. Zuckerberg noted that encryption is a powerful tool for protecting people's security and safety, but said that the company would also need to work with law enforcement to help prevent harm. He also promised additional measures to protect the security of its users, including the deployment of artificial intelligence tools to detect content that violates Facebook's policies.

PacVim is a game that teaches the player Vim commands. It uses the concept of the classic game Pacman to get users to practice Vim commands in a fun environment. The game has levels that increase in difficulty, and uses various Vim commands to progress through each level. For example, the player may need to use 'h', 'j', 'k', and 'l' keys to move around a maze, or use 'd' and 'y' to delete and yank blocks of text. There are also bonus levels which have extra challenges and rewards. PacVim is an open source project and is available for both Windows and Linux systems.

All art establishments are concerned with the degradation of paintings. Harmful factors such as sunlight, moisture, and certain volatile organic compounds can accelerate degradation. Graphene may be the solution to this problem as it has been successfully used to create protective layers that are impermeable to air, water and other environmental pollutants. This protection can help to reduce the degradation of paintings by blocking out harmful factors such as UV light, moisture, and volatile organic compounds. Graphene may also be used in combination with other materials, such as glass, to form coatings that are even more effective at blocking these pollutants. Additionally, graphene can be applied to artwork in a variety of ways, such as through painting or spraying, allowing for greater flexibility and ease of application.

PredPol is a software that claims to use an algorithm to predict crime in specific sections of a city. Several police departments in the US have been quietly experimenting with the software, which takes into account factors such as past crime data, population demographics, and weather. PredPol uses a combination of historical data and predictive analytics to create heat maps that show where and when crimes are most likely to occur. The aim is to help police departments allocate their limited resources more effectively and prevent crime before it occurs.

Austria-based Cyclotech and Japanese delivery firm Yamato have partnered to create a concept delivery drone. The CCY-01 will use a thrust vectoring propulsion system developed by Cyclotech that will enable more precise and efficient maneuvers than the standard multirotor system. The drone will also be able to carry heavier payloads while consuming less energy. The partnership between Cyclotech and Yamato is expected to bring a new level of delivery efficiency to Japan. The CCY-01 drone has a range of up to 10km, which means it could deliver goods to a large area quickly and efficiently. It also has a maximum speed of 80kph, making it faster than most current delivery vehicles. Additionally, its thrust vectoring system makes it more maneuverable and capable of navigating tight spaces. The partnership between Cyclotech and Yamato is the latest example of how drone technology is being leveraged to improve delivery services in Japan. By using drones for deliveries, companies can reduce their carbon footprints and enable faster, more reliable deliveries to customers. In addition, drones could revolutionize the logistics industry by eliminating the need for human drivers and reducing labor costs.

Alibaba, known for its e-commerce platforms, has branched out into retail, restaurants, and even hotels. It has opened a hotel near its headquarters in Hangzhuo where almost everything is automated. Guests can check in and out with facial recognition technology, order food through their phones, and enjoy a fully automated experience. Alibaba also offers an online travel booking service called "Alitrip" that allows customers to book flights, hotels, and activities through the app. It has also announced plans to launch its own delivery service, Cainiao, which will provide same-day delivery for online orders.

Last year, SpaceX bought two oil rigs off the coast of Texas to convert them into ocean spaceports. One of the rigs, Phobus, has been moved to Pascagoula, Mississippi, where it is being converted into a launch platform. The other, Deimos, is still in the process of being transported and refurbished. Once completed, both rigs will be used to launch SpaceX rockets from the ocean, allowing for greater flexibility in mission launches. The conversion of the two oil rigs into spaceports is part of SpaceX's long-term plans for expanding its spaceflight capabilities. By using the rigs as launch platforms, SpaceX will be able to reduce costs by avoiding unnecessary construction onshore. Additionally, the rigs could potentially be used for experimental launches or recovery operations at sea. The use of ocean spaceports could open up the possibility of launching from multiple locations around the world, allowing SpaceX to reach more customers with its services.

Get started with our easy-to-use SDKs and APIs, no additional engineering resources needed. Our dashboard provides a single view of all your enterprise customers so you can keep track of their usage, health and compliance. Finally, our 247 support team is always available to help with any questions or issues that may arise.

Twitter's board intends to enforce Elon Musk's merger agreement. Musk had agreed to a transaction at 54.20 per share, but put the deal on hold pending proof that less than 20 percent of the company's shareholders opposed the merger. The board will review shareholder feedback, and if less than 20 percent of shareholders oppose the deal, the board will move forward with the merger.

A Windows zero-day exploit tool was stolen from the NSA's Equation Group by Chinese threat actors, who used the tool for years before the flaw was patched. A hacking group known as the Shadow Brokers obtained the tool and released it to the public in 2017. The exploit, known as "EternalBlue," allowed attackers to remotely execute code on vulnerable versions of Windows machines. It was used in a number of high-profile attacks, including the WannaCry ransomware worm and NotPetya malware outbreak. Microsoft responded by releasing a patch for the vulnerability, but not before hundreds of thousands of computers had been compromised.

SVGs have become popular due to their scalability, flexibility, and how lightweight they are. This article takes a look at SVG techniques such as SVG grids, fractional SVG stars, masks, and more. SVG Grids Grids are a great way to structure and organize SVG elements. They provide a base for accurately positioning elements and help create a consistent layout across all devices. Grids can also be used to define a specific area of the document, which can be useful for creating responsive designs. Fractional SVG Stars Fractional SVG stars provide an easy way to create interesting illustrations with just a few lines of code. By using a combination of circles, arcs, and lines, you can create stunning stars of any size or shape. You can even adjust the number of points on the star to create different effects. Masks Masks are an important tool for creating complex effects in SVG documents. A mask is essentially a layer that covers up part of an element or image, allowing the designer to create unique shapes and textures. For example, masks can be used to create the illusion of transparency in certain areas of an SVG document. Filters Filters allow designers to manipulate the properties of a graphic in order to achieve a desired effect. Filters can be used to add blur, contrast, brightness, grayscale, and other effects to an SVG document. They are especially useful when combined with masks, as they can be used to selectively apply effects to certain parts of the document. Animations Animations are a great way to make SVG documents come alive. Animations can be used to animate individual elements or entire scenes. By using a combination of keyframes, transformations, and easing functions, designers can create smooth and realistic animations.

Facebook Pay will start rolling out to the Facebook and Messenger apps for US users this week. It will eventually be available on all apps across Facebook's ecosystems in more countries. Facebook Pay will allow users to store their payment information in one secure place, so they can easily make payments across Facebook's apps and services, including WhatsApp and Instagram. Users will also be able to use it for peer-to-peer payments, as well as purchases from businesses on Facebook Marketplace, events, fundraisers, and more. The service is free to use, and Facebook promises that it will never charge any fees for people sending or receiving money. Facebook Pay is designed to provide a secure, convenient way to send and receive money, shop online, donate to causes, and more. It uses industry-leading security systems to protect user information, and it offers dedicated customer support if anything goes wrong. Facebook Pay is also integrated with existing payment methods, so users can choose the option that works best for them.

Java attempts to run trusted and untrusted code within the same virtual machine, with the only thing separating them being the permission system and visibility modifiers. A bug anywhere in the code can compromise the security of the entire system, so it is important to keep all code up-to-date and free from errors. Java also has a strict security policy that prevents malicious code from running on the system. It also uses a sandboxing method which limits the resources that untrusted code can access, making it more difficult for malicious code to do any damage. Finally, Java has built-in encryption and authentication protocols that help protect data when being transmitted over the network.

Experts Agree: Smart Investing Now Earlier Retirement. If you're a business owner or high earner, investing in solid financial assets should be your 1 priority. With the stocks and crypto markets continuing to rise, now is the perfect time to invest your money. By investing wisely now, you can ensure a comfortable retirement and financial security for yourself and your family. There are several key steps to smart investing. First, assess your financial goals and determine how much risk you're willing to take. Second, research different investment vehicles to decide which ones are best suited for your goals. Third, consult with a qualified financial advisor who can help you create an investment portfolio based on your needs. Fourth, monitor your investments regularly and make adjustments as needed. Lastly, diversify your investments so that you're not too heavily invested in any one asset class. Experts agree that smart investing now can lead to earlier retirement and greater financial security. By taking the time to research and plan your investments, you'll be well on your way to achieving your financial goals.

The Smart Tissue Autonomous Robot (Star) is the first robotic system to plan, adapt, and execute a surgical plan in soft tissue with minimal human intervention. It recently performed laparoscopic partial nephrectomy on a living pig, making it the first robot to perform such a procedure. The STAR system was developed by a team of engineers and clinicians at Children's National Health System in Washington, DC. The robot integrates advanced robotics and computer vision technologies, enabling it to plan and execute autonomous surgical tasks with accuracy levels that surpass that of human surgeons. The STAR system has significant advantages over traditional robotic surgery, including improved precision and reduced risk of complications. It is designed to reduce the time required to complete complex procedures, while providing better outcomes for patients. In addition, the robot's ability to adapt to tissue changes during the procedure means that it can be used for minimally invasive surgeries that are not currently possible with conventional robots. Looking ahead, the STAR system is expected to revolutionize the way surgeons perform complex soft-tissue procedures. With further development, this technology could be used for a variety of surgical specialties, including vascular, cardiac, and thoracic surgery.

Masten Space Systems will develop a lunar navigation and positioning system similar to GPS as part of a contract awarded through the Air Force Research Laboratory's AFWERX program. Current spacecraft navigation systems rely on ground-based tracking stations, which are limited in their ability to provide precise location data due to the distance between the spacecraft and Earth. The new system will enable autonomous navigation and position determination with minimal reliance on ground-based infrastructure. The system's capabilities include precision ranging, attitude determination, orbit determination, and navigation control. Masten Space Systems will leverage its experience in CubeSat technology as well as its flight heritage from more than 100 successful suborbital launches to develop the system. The lunar navigation and positioning system is expected to have applications beyond the Air Force Research Laboratory, such as NASA space missions.

Scientists have observed electrical activity similar to the brain activity of premature babies in lab-grown brains. The lab-grown brains are simplified versions of the organ that is grown in a laboratory using a combination of human cells and artificial molecules. The brains are grown in a petri dish and consist of two different types of brain tissue. The lab-grown brains have been observed to generate electrical activity similar to that of premature babies, although the activity is much simpler due to the lack of complexity in the lab-grown brain. This activity has been observed in response to stimuli such as light, sound, and touch. Scientists believe that this discovery could help them better understand how the developing brain works, as well as provide insights into treatments for neurological conditions that affect premature babies.

A quantum effect called superabsorption allows a collection of molecules to absorb light more efficiently than if each molecule were acting individually. Researchers have used this phenomenon to create a new type of solar panel that is capable of absorbing more light than conventional solar cells. This could lead to greater efficiency in the production of energy from sunlight.

Learn how OAuth is actually used in the real world. We cover topics like the eight common OAuth modes, how to use the Authorization Code grant, and why you should never use the Implicit grant. The eight common OAuth modes are Authorization Code, Implicit, Client Credentials, Resource Owner Password Credentials, SAML 2.0 Bearer Assertion Profile, JWT Bearer Token Profile, Device Flow and Refresh Token. Authorization Code grant is used for user-initiated logins. It includes a server-side application that exchanges an authorization code with the client application for an access token. This grant type is widely used by web and mobile applications as it provides secure access to the protected resource. Implicit grant should never be used as it does not provide enough security. It is used for browser-based applications and works by sending an access token directly to the client in the URL fragment. This means that anyone who has access to the URL can get the access token, which leads to a huge security vulnerability. Client Credentials grant is suitable for machine-to-machine authentication where no user interaction is necessary. It requires the client to send its credentials (client ID and secret) to the authorization server in exchange for an access token. Resource Owner Password Credentials grant is used when the user provides their username and password directly to the client application. This grant type is not recommended since it poses a security risk. SAML 2.0 Bearer Assertion Profile is used for single sign-on (SSO) solutions. It allows a user to authenticate once and then access multiple applications without having to sign in again. JWT Bearer Token Profile is used for delegating access to a third-party service or API. It allows a user to authorize a client application on their behalf so that the application can access resources without them having to provide their credentials. Device Flow is used for authentication in scenarios where there is no browser or any other interactive device available. It requires the user to use a separate device to approve the login request. Refresh Token is used to obtain a new access token after the existing one has expired. It is used to extend the lifetime of an access token beyond its initial expiration date.

asm is a package that provides algorithms optimized to leverage the characteristics of modern CPUs. Programs that fail to leverage the full sets of instructions available from cloud providers are inefficient and can result in high costs. In addition to optimizing code for modern CPUs, Asm provides a set of APIs for data manipulation and algorithm development, as well as tools for debugging, profiling, and optimization. It also includes libraries for linear algebra, probability theory, and machine learning.

Project Amber is a project from Alphabet X that is now available for the mental health community to help build upon. The project originally aimed to identify a specific biomarker that could help diagnose major depressive disorder. Now, the project is expanding its scope to explore how digital biomarkers and machine learning can be used to develop a better understanding of mental health conditions, including depression. Specifically, the team is looking for ways to leverage technology to improve diagnosis and treatment of mental health disorders by collecting digital signals from individuals' daily lives. They are exploring data from mobile phones, wearable devices, and other sources to gain insights into people's mental health. The team is also conducting research to better understand the relationship between digital biomarkers and mental health outcomes. This work has already led to the development of a screening tool to identify individuals at risk of developing depression. Amber has also been involved in the creation of a new protocol for detecting early signs of depression and anxiety in young adults. Overall, Project Amber is working to make mental health care more accessible, effective, and affordable by leveraging technology to better understand and treat mental health disorders.

Google will slow hiring for the rest of the year but will continue to onboard many of the people that they have hired but haven't started yet. The search company plans to focus more on developing existing products and services rather than hiring new employees. Google may also offer some employees voluntary buyouts or other incentives as part of its shift in strategy.

Researchers at Stanford University and the SLAC National Accelerator Laboratory have discovered a way to transform a substance found in fossil fuels into diamonds with pressure and low heat. Diamond s are known as the hardest natural material and are used in a variety of products from jewelry to cutting tools. The researchers found that when they exposed a hydrocarbon substance called benzene to pressures up to 1.5 million times the atmospheric pressure at sea level, and temperatures between 300 and 500 degrees Celsius, it transformed into diamond-like nanocrystals. These diamond-like crystals were similar in size and shape to what is seen in synthetic diamonds grown in a lab. The researchers believe this new method could be used to produce diamonds from low-cost sources like coal or petroleum. The method could also replace current diamond synthesis methods which use high temperatures and expensive catalysts. Using this new method, the scientists estimate that diamonds could potentially be produced at a fraction of the cost of traditional methods.

This repository contains a collection of resources on Falsehoods in development. Falsehood articles try to approach an unfamiliar domain by dispelling myths, pointing out common pitfalls, and showing inconsistencies and contradictions in the current state of the art. This collection of resources focuses on a variety of topics related to development, ranging from software engineering and project management to design and user experience. Included are articles that provide insight into common mistakes developers make, how to avoid them, and how to better navigate the constantly changing landscape of development. Additionally, this repository also includes tools and resources that can help with development projects and processes. We hope that this collection of resources can be used as an educational resource to help developers understand and address issues related to development. By providing a holistic view of the world of development, it is our goal to help developers stay informed and up-to-date with the latest developments in the field.

Samsung's new Galaxy Watch 5 Pro will have a capacitive touch bezel instead of a rotating bezel. It will have a raised bezel to provide more protection to the watch 's screen and will be covered with a scratch-resistant coating. The watch will also have improved battery life and an always-on display for better visibility in bright light conditions. Additionally, the Galaxy Watch 5 Pro will come equipped with Samsung's latest Tizen OS and its own app store, offering access to thousands of apps.

axum is a web application framework that takes full advantage of the tower and tower-http ecosystem of middleware, services, and utilities to get timeouts, tracing, compression, authorization, and more for your web applications. Axum lets you quickly create robust, secure, and performant web applications that scale as needed. It also provides an easy-to-use, extensible API to define the application behavior and manage configuration variables. Axum is designed to be highly modular and supports a wide range of integrations with cloud services, databases, and other external systems. With Axum, it's easy to get started on building modern web applications without having to worry about the underlying infrastructure.

A study has demonstrated how the sight or smell of a meal can trigger an inflammatory response that guides insulin production. The study, conducted by researchers at the University of California, San Francisco (UCSF), was published in the journal Cell Metabolism. The research team found that when mice were exposed to either the sight or smell of a meal, their bodies produced inflammatory signals that triggered the release of insulin from pancreatic cells. This response helped regulate the animals' blood sugar levels following the meal, preventing it from becoming too high. To make this discovery, the researchers used a technique called single-cell RNA sequencing, which allowed them to map the activity of different cells in the pancreas and observe how they responded to the presence of food. The team's findings suggest that the body's ability to regulate blood sugar by releasing insulin is not just a reaction to the digestion of food, but is also regulated by the senses. This could lead to new treatments for diabetes, as well as other diseases where insulin regulation is disrupted.

The way a river flows, where the path splits up and breaks into smaller channels like the branches of a tree, is called branching flow. It has been observed in many rivers and streams, and occurs when a river is flowing over an uneven surface. As the water flows, it encounters different levels of resistance as it travels, causing it to split up into smaller channels and create branching patterns. This type of flow can be beneficial for erosion control and habitat creation.

Future Meat Technologies announced its industrial cultured meat production facility on June 23. The factory, based in Israel, is capable of producing up to 1,100lbs of lab-grown meat every day. The facility is the first of its kind in the world and will enable the company to bring cultured meat to market sooner. The facility will use a proprietary production process that combines cell-based technology with fermentation and bioreactor engineering, enabling the industrial-scale production of high-quality, sustainable meat. The production process begins with animal cells, which are collected from livestock and stored in a nutrient medium. These cells are then placed into bioreactors where they are fed with oxygen and nutrients, allowing them to grow and divide. After several weeks, the cells differentiate into muscle and fat tissue, forming small pieces of meat. This meat is then frozen and packaged for sale. The company plans to use the factory to produce plant-based alternatives as well as lab-grown meats. The products created at the facility are expected to become available in retail stores and restaurants across Israel later this year. With this new facility, Future Meat Technologies is on the forefront of revolutionizing the meat industry. The company's goal is to reduce the environmental impact of traditional meat production while providing consumers with safe, healthy, and affordable food.

DiDi's co-founder and president Jean Liu told close associates that she plans to step down as she expects the government to eventually take over the company and appoint new management. Di's co-founder and president Jean Liu has not yet made an official announcement about her plans to step down. It is unclear if or when the government will take over the company and appoint new management.

Tesla has warned its employees that they could lose unemployment benefits if they choose to stay home due to COVID-19 concerns after being called back to work. Elon Musk reopened the company's U.S. factories on May 18th, despite local government orders to stay at home. The company has warned that employees who do not report for duty may be ineligible for unemployment benefits. Tesla is also reportedly offering bonuses to employees who return to work.

Space tourism may become a reality soon, with the construction of the Aurora Station beginning later this year. The Aurora Station aims to be the world's first space hotel, allowing tourists to spend up to 12 days in low-Earth orbit. It is being developed by Orion Span, a US-based space technology company, and plans to launch in late 2021. Guests will be able to experience microgravity, see the Northern and Southern Lights from their windows, and take part in educational activities such as growing food in space. The cost of a stay on the station is yet to be revealed, but Orion Span has indicated that it will be comparable to the price of a luxury cruise on Earth.

Zomato has acquired the Indian operations of Uber Eats for around 350 million. The deal will give Uber about 10 percent shareholding in Zomato. Uber Eats customers will be redirected to Zomato's platform and all Uber Eats restaurants will be integrated with Zomato's food delivery services. This deal is expected to create one of India's leading online food delivery services.

Kings of Leon's new album will be released in the form of a non-fungible token (NFT). There will be three types of tokens with different perks, such as front-row seats to future concerts, exclusive merchandise, and access to pre-release songs and videos. The tokens will be available for purchase on an online marketplace, and the proceeds from the sale of these tokens will go towards creating a fund for music education and helping young musicians reach their potential.

HNTerm allows you to browse Hacker News within your terminal. It queries the official HN API and displays current stories and comments. HNTerm only shows content that is currently visible. You can use HNTerm to: - View top stories on Hacker News. - Read comments on a story. - Search for stories and comments by keyword. - Filter stories, comments, and users. - Upvote or downvote stories and comments. - Post new stories and comments. - Follow users and view their latest activity.

Starship, SpaceX's next-generation rocket, partially burst apart during ground tests in Texas. SpaceX was conducting some pressure tests with the vehicle. The explosions were not completely unexpected, according to SpaceX. The company said that the tests were designed to push the Starship prototype to its limits in order to learn as much about the vehicle as possible. The failure of the Starship prototype is certainly a setback for SpaceX, but it does not mean the end of the program. In fact, the company is already working on the next prototype and is learning from the mistakes made with the first one. SpaceX CEO Elon Musk has made it clear that he expects there to be many failures along the way before the Starship is ready to fly. He has also stated that he believes that the Starship will eventually revolutionize space exploration. SpaceX is committed to pushing the boundaries of space exploration and this test is simply another step in the journey. While the explosion may have been a disappointment, it is also an opportunity to learn and make adjustments so that future versions of the Starship will be even more successful.

Early adopters of Tesla's entry-level Model 3 will soon have their software downgraded to match the same software as current entry-level Model 3s. The early adopters were able to enjoy the full self-driving (FSD) upgrade, however due to concerns raised by Tesla regarding safety, the FSD will be removed and replaced with the standard Autopilot driver assistance system. Tesla has stated that they are doing this to ensure that all cars have the same level of safety, regardless of when they were purchased. Although the new software downgrade may be annoying for some early adopters, it is important for Tesla to maintain consistent safety standards across all Model 3s. The company has also said that customers will still be able to purchase the full self-driving (FSD) upgrade in the future.

A 122,000-tonne ultra-large natural gas tanker is the first large ship to make an ocean passage of over 10,000 km under autonomous control. Prism Courage made the 33-day voyage from the port of Fujairah in the United Arab Emirates to Panama, a route which passes through the Red Sea, the Suez Canal, and the Caribbean Sea. The journey was completed autonomously with no human intervention, with technology developed by the ship's owner, Mitsui O.S.K. Lines (MOL). The voyage used an autonomous navigation system that combines satellite positioning data and ship radar to plot a course and detect obstacles. The vessel was monitored remotely from the company's offices in Tokyo. The successful voyage has demonstrated the potential for autonomous ships to revolutionize the shipping industry by reducing costs, improving safety, and increasing efficiency. In addition to avoiding the need for a crew, autonomous vessels also eliminate the risk of drunk or fatigued sailors making mistakes, as well as eliminating costly port-related delays due to bureaucracy. The use of autonomous ships is becoming increasingly popular, with several companies investing in research and development related to the technology. MOL plans to introduce more autonomous ships in the near future and has stated its commitment to continuing to develop this technology.

Tuplex is a parallel big data processing framework that runs data science pipelines written in Python at the speed of compiled code. It generates optimized LLVM bytecode for the given Python code, and then executes it in parallel using a distributed compute cluster. Tuplex is designed to be simple to use, and provides the ability to scale up your data processing jobs with minimal effort. It supports multiple languages including Python, Java, R, and Go.

A bundle package from Disney including Disney, Hulu, and ESPN will be available from the 12th of November for 12.99 a month. The pricing is cheaper than or on par with the current cost of subscribing to each service individually. Customers will be able to access content from a range of platforms including Disney, Hulu, and ESPN in a single subscription.
