All three streaming services will remain separate and customers will still have the ability to watch programming from any of the individual services.

Apple paid roughly 25 million for a movie at the Sundance Film Festival, the largest deal ever at the event. The purchase was made after a bidding war with Amazon. The movie, "Palm Springs" stars Andy Samberg and Cristin Milioti.

eBay is suing Amazon for allegedly using eBay's messaging system to lure third party sellers to Amazon's marketplace. eBay wants to ban Amazon from ever using its messaging system in the future, as well as receive compensation for damages.

Airbnb Online Experiences now offers remote activities, such as bartending and cooking classes, virtual bike tours, drawing lessons, and more. Experiences launched in 2016 as part of Airbnb's plan to expand its services beyond vacation rentals and into experiences. The company has partnered with local hosts to offer unique activities for travelers and locals alike. With Airbnb Online Experiences, guests can now enjoy remote activities from the comfort of their own home. Guests will have access to a variety of activities led by expert hosts such as cooking classes, virtual bike tours, drawing lessons, yoga classes, and more. All activities are designed with safety and security in mind, and all payments are processed securely through the Airbnb platform.

The reddish-brown'scars' that form on the surface of Jupiter's moon Europa are actually etched into the layer of water ice that covers the surface of a potentially habitable subsurface ocean. The cars are believed to be the result of intense radiation from Jupiter's magnetosphere interacting with Europa's icy surface. Scientists think that the radiation breaks up the water ice on the surface, creating chemical reactions which in turn form the reddish-brown color. These scars could potentially provide clues about what lies beneath the surface of Europa, giving scientists a better understanding of the environment and potential for life on this moon.

Researchers from the University of Central Florida have engineered a nanomaterial that repels water and can stay dry when submerged underwater. The design was inspired by the structure of a lotus leaf. The material is made up of nanotubes and nanoparticles, which create a waterproof surface that prevents water from sticking to it. The hydrophobic nanomaterial has potential applications in consumer electronics, medicine, aerospace, and other industries. It could be used to protect devices from water damage, for example, or to coat medical implants, making them more resistant to corrosion. In addition, the material could be used as a coating for aircraft surfaces to reduce ice formation. The researchers plan to continue their work to improve the durability and scalability of the material.

Devtron is a platform for operationalizing and maintaining applications on Kubernetes. It features a zero-code software delivery workflow, multi-cloud deployment, an application debugging dashboard, operational insights, and more. Screenshots are available here. Devtron is designed to make it easier for developers and operations teams to manage complex applications on Kubernetes. It automates many of the manual steps involved in deploying, monitoring and managing applications, allowing teams to focus on innovation instead of day-to-day operational tasks. It offers a single platform for both development and operations teams to collaborate on deployments, with features such as an application debugging dashboard, zero-code deployment workflow, multi-cloud deployment, operational insights and more. Devtron also helps teams ensure their applications are secure by providing automated security checks and compliance validation.

Two plant-based burger companies, Beyond Meat and Impossible Foods, are set to launch the next versions of their burgers. While both burgers are plant-based, their formulas are quite different. Beyond Meat uses pea protein, coconut oil, potato starch and other plant-based ingredients to create a patty that looks and tastes like beef. Impossible Foods has developed a burger which uses heme, an iron-containing molecule found in plants, to give the patty a more "meaty" flavor. Both options are great for those looking for a healthier alternative to beef burgers. The Beyond Burger is suitable for vegans and vegetarians, while the Impossible Burger can be cooked with either vegetable or animal fat. Ultimately, it's up to the consumer to decide which one offers the best taste and texture.

This article follows the story of Kayode, an A-grade student that was studying at one of the country's most elite educational institutions who turned to cybercrime during the pandemic. The article dives into the reasons why he chose to turn to cybercrime, his methods and the consequences of his actions. Kayode was a bright and ambitious student who had earned himself an A-grade at one of the most prestigious universities in the country. However, due to the pandemic and the subsequent economic crisis, Kayode found himself without a job or stable income. Desperate for money, he turned to cybercrime to make ends meet. He used his computer skills to create malicious software and phishing attacks that targeted vulnerable online websites and services. He stole passwords and personal information from unsuspecting victims and sold them on the dark web for profit. Kayode's activities soon caught the attention of law enforcement and he was arrested and charged with numerous counts of cybercrime. He was sentenced to three years in prison and ordered to pay reparations to the victims of his crimes. The consequences of Kayode's actions have been far-reaching, causing him to lose his reputation, respect and educational opportunities. His criminal record also makes it difficult for him to find employment, leaving him with few options to support himself after his release from prison. As Kayode's story shows, cybercrime can have serious repercussions. It is essential to keep in mind the potential consequences when considering any form of illegal activity, especially those that involve the internet. Cyber criminals may not always be aware of the consequences until it is too late.

SQLFlow connects SQL and Tensorflow together so that SQL can be used for machine learning. SQL is a popular data storage solution, so implementing machine learning capabilities to work with SQL data makes it easier for developers to use machine learning. SQLFlow allows users to write SQL queries and use Tensorflow to run AI models on the data generated by the query. This provides developers with a more efficient way to build, train, and deploy machine learning models.

It can be difficult for adults to learn other languages even after years of exposure. In animal studies, vagus nerve stimulation has been shown to prime adult sensory-perceptual systems and improve the ability to recognize and acquire a new language. The vagus nerve is a long nerve that runs from the brainstem to the abdomen, and it plays an important role in regulating many processes in the body such as heart rate, blood pressure and digestion. Stimulating the vagus nerve can have a positive effect on cognitive abilities, including language learning, by activating areas of the brain involved in language processing. In animal studies, vagus nerve stimulation has been shown to increase neural activity in the prefrontal cortex, which is associated with higher-order thinking and language processing. In addition, it has been found to activate the hippocampus, which is involved in memory formation and recall. This suggests that stimulating the vagus nerve may be effective in improving language recognition and acquisition in adults. In humans, a small study conducted in 2014 showed that vagus nerve stimulation improved language learning in adult patients suffering from epilepsy. The results of this study suggest that vagus nerve stimulation may have potential as a therapy for language learning difficulties. However, further research is needed to better understand its effects on language learning in healthy adults.

Jupiter's moon Europa is about the size of Earth and completely covered in ice. Scientists think that Europa has saltwater oceans, which is exciting because this means that it is possible for life to exist there.

A company from Finland, Solar Foods, is planning to sell a protein powder that is made out of CO2, water, and electricity. The idea for Solein originally began at NASA, and Solar Foods has now taken the technology to create a sustainable food source that is low-cost and easy to produce. The company's goal is to make its protein powder available for sale in 2021.

Amazon has introduced a new initiative called'less packaging, more smiles' that will see the company reduce the materials used for sending out items as well as provide instructions for reusing and recycling materials from packaging. The initiative will also encourage customers to opt for sustainable packaging options when ordering on Amazon. Additionally, Amazon has committed to using more recycled material in its packaging, reducing plastic use and developing new ways to package products.

Elon Musk has asked his Twitter followers to vote on whether he should sell 10 of his Tesla shares. The poll is a response to a proposed billionaires tax, which Musk opposes. Musk has said that if the poll receives enough votes, he will consider selling some of his Tesla shares in protest.

Netflix has bought Scanline, a major player in the special effects industry. Scanline has worked on several large productions, such as Game of Thrones, Godzilla vs. King Kong, and Justice League. Netflix has plans to use Scanline to create more realistic and visually stunning special effects for its own original content, allowing it to further differentiate itself from other streaming services. With Scanline in its portfolio, Netflix can now offer a wider variety of high-quality visual effects as part of its service.

OpenDrop is a command-line tool for sharing files between devices directly over Wi-Fi. It is protocol-compatible with Apple AirDrop. OpenDrop is currently only capable of sending to Apple devices that are running iOS 10 or above. OpenDrop works by using a combination of Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) and Wi-Fi Direct to create an ad-hoc network between the two devices. The sender then uses this network to transfer files directly over Wi-Fi without the need for an Internet connection. OpenDrop is open-source, so anyone can contribute to its development.

OnlyFans founder and CEO Tim Stokely is stepping down. Ami Gan, the company's former head of communications and marketing, will be taking over as CEO. Gan has worked for brands such as Microsoft and Apple, as well as media companies like BBC Worldwide and VICE. She was also the CEO of online fashion marketplace Lyst. Gan has stated that her vision for OnlyFans is to ensure it remains "a safe and secure platform for creators to express themselves, connect with their fans and make money." She plans to continue working on the platform's trust and safety policies and to make sure that it remains a safe space for all users. In addition, she intends to focus on the growth of the platform in other countries, as well as explore new revenue opportunities.

Google employees will hold a sit-in protest to protest retaliation against employees on May 1. In November, more than 20,000 employees walked out to protest against the company's handling of sexual harassment claims and the lack of transparency around workplace issues. The upcoming protest will focus on retaliation against employees who have spoken out about workplace issues, such as pay inequity and discrimination. Employees plan to gather at Google's headquarters in Mountain View, California and other offices across the world. They will demand that Google take meaningful steps to protect employees from retaliation for speaking up about workplace issues, implement an effective system for reporting and addressing workplace concerns, and increase transparency about its policies and practices.

Netflix is experiencing outages around the world, mostly affecting users in the US and Europe. Many people are still unable to connect to the service. Netflix started lowering its streaming quality in Europe earlier this week in response to the increased strain on internet networks due to the coronavirus pandemic. The company is working with ISPs to ensure streaming quality and availability.

At every job interview, applicants are asked whether they have any questions for the company, but few people take the opportunity to find out more about their potential employers. This is a mistake. Asking questions demonstrates that the applicant is prepared and engaged, qualities employers seek in potential hires. Questions can also help the applicant determine whether the company is a good fit for them. Questions about the company's culture, benefits package, and career development opportunities can help applicants make an informed decision about whether to accept a job offer. By taking the time to ask questions during a job interview, applicants can demonstrate their commitment and enthusiasm for the position and make a favorable impression on potential employers.

The plant-based meat industry is now worth 800 million and accounts for two percent of packaged meat sales. Both Beyond Meat and Impossible Foods have started to expand their product lines and are now available in more than 100,000 locations. Plant-based meat alternatives are growing in popularity due to their nutritional content and the fact that they are better for the environment than traditional meats. They also offer an alternative for those who are looking for a healthier diet. Companies are investing heavily in research and development of plant-based meats to ensure they are competitive with traditional meats. As the industry continues to grow, consumers can expect to see more plant-based meat options in stores and restaurants.

Atomize Code is a UI Design System for web apps featuring elegant and beautiful React components. It supports modern browsers and Internet Explorer 9, server-side rendering, and Electron. It is built with styled-components, Reactstrap, and a custom theming system. Atomize Code provides a comprehensive library of components that are easy to use and customize. Components include everything from buttons, forms, inputs, and tables to charts, maps, and calendars. The UI Design System is designed to be intuitive and pragmatic, allowing developers to quickly and easily build web apps. Atomize Code also makes it easy for developers to create themes for their applications, enabling them to match the look and feel of their brand, without having to code each component from scratch. Atomize Code provides an open source, extensible, and complex set of tools that can be used for any project.

Running out of cash is probably a founder's biggest fear. Indie Hackers is a community mostly made up of founders who shoulder their company's financial burden personally. They generally take on a lot of risk and responsibility for their companies. When cash starts to run out, founders should start by assessing the situation and looking for opportunities to increase revenue or cut costs. They should consider exploring other funding sources such as venture capital, crowdfunding, angel investors, and bank loans. Additionally, many founders benefit from seeking advice from experienced entrepreneurs who can provide guidance and help them make important decisions. Finally, it is important for founders to stay focused and resilient during this time, as it is often when things get difficult that innovation and creativity can be found.

The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration has issued a recall of 53,822 Tesla vehicles due to the Assertive mode on the company's Full Self-Driving software. Cars set on Assertive mode are equipped with an Autopilot feature, which allows them to automatically steer, accelerate, and brake on highways. However, it has been determined that this feature can cause the vehicles to speed up or slow down without warning due to unanticipated acceleration or braking events. As a result, Tesla is recalling all cars with the Assertive mode installed, and replacing the software with a new version that does not include this feature. In addition, Tesla is providing written instructions for owners to disable the Autopilot feature if they choose.

A group of researchers has developed a way to create food without sunlight using artificial photosynthesis. The method involves converting carbon dioxide, electricity, and water into acetate, and then feeding this to bacteria, which can then be used as a food source. The process is similar to photosynthesis in plants, but uses artificial materials such as semiconductors and catalysts instead of chlorophyll. The researchers believe that the technology could be used to produce food in areas where natural sunlight is limited or unavailable, such as space missions or certain parts of the world. They are currently working on scaling up the system so it can produce enough food for human consumption.

This repository contains a PyTorch implementation of "Multi-Level Pixel-Aligned Implicit Function for High-Resolution 3D Human Digitization." The code can create high-resolution 3D models of humans from a single image. A pre-trained model is provided. Getting Started Prerequisites Python 3 [PyTorch] 1.2 or later Installing Clone the repository: " ' git clone cd mvpainting " ' Download the pre-trained model: " ' wget " ' Usage Run the following command to generate a 3D human from an input image: " ' python main.py image PATHTOIMAGE outdir OUTPUTDIRECTORY " ' The output will be saved in the specified output directory as a PLY file. Citation If you use this code in your research, please cite the following paper: " ' inproceedings{choi2020multi, title{Multi-Level Pixel-Aligned Implicit Function for High-Resolution 3D Human Digitization}, author{Choi, Yeongjun and Kim, Jongmin and Kim, Jaegul and Han, Bohyung}, booktitle{Proceedings of the IEEECVF Conference on Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition}, pages{14091418}, year{2020} } " ' Acknowledgments This code was developed as part of a research project at Clova AI Research. We would like to thank our colleagues for their support and help.

Following the popularity of MoviePass, which peaked at 3.2 million subscribers earlier this summer, AMC rolled out its own subscription service, a 19.95 pass to watch up to 3 movies a week at any AMC theater. The response to AMC's subscription service has been overwhelmingly positive. Customers appreciate the unlimited access to movies and the ability to watch up to 3 movies a week, as well as the discounted ticket prices and concession stands. Additionally, AMC's pass offers an additional bonus feature - members can share their subscription with up to three family members or friends. This feature has also been well-received, as it allows customers to spend quality time together while still saving money.

China has blocked Bing, even though Bing already censors results in China. It's part of a wider crackdown on internet freedoms by the Communist Party, as they've blocked Instagram and WhatsApp, as well as other services. The ban appears to have been in place since July 2020.

This repository contains links to personal blogs written by people in tech. From automation to web development, these blogs contain a ton of information to keep you up to date in the tech world. 1. [A Cloud Guru] 2. [Minding My Business] 3. [Tech for Good] 4. [The Automators] 5. [DevOps.com] 6. [Coding Horror] 7. [DZone] 8. [The Changelog] 9. [Smashing Magazine] 10. [Web Dev Simplified]

data2vec is a multi-modal artificial intelligence algorithm from Meta that attempts to replicate the general learning ability that the human mind possesses. The team aimed to create an AI that can understand and reason with large amounts of available data. By combining multiple sources of data, such as text, images, audio, video, and sensor input, the algorithm is able to learn patterns and make predictions. Meta's data2vec technology uses a combination of natural language processing (NLP), deep learning, and machine learning to identify patterns in data. It then uses those patterns to generate insights and make predictions. The data2vec algorithm also incorporates metadata to better understand the context of each data point and draw meaningful correlations between different pieces of data. Meta's data2vec has been used in a variety of applications, such as customer segmentation, product recommendations, fraud detection, and predictive analytics. Its ability to combine data from different sources and utilize meta-data to gain insights makes it an attractive choice for companies looking to gain a competitive edge.

The US Navy has banned TikTok from government-issued mobile devices. It claims that the short-form video app is a cybersecurity threat, but declined to describe in detail what dangers the app poses. The Navy cited the possibility of "exfiltrating" sensitive data from its personnel's phones, although it is unclear whether any data has been exfiltrated from TikTok. The ban on TikTok follows similar restrictions imposed by the US Army and Marine Corps. Other branches of the military are reportedly also considering banning the app. These moves come as the Trump administration continues to pressure the Chinese-owned company over potential security concerns. The US government has called for a review of the app, which is owned by Beijing-based ByteDance, and has said it's considering banning the app in the US or forcing the company to divest itself of its US operations.

A 0day bug exists in iOS 13.4.1 that allows malicious attackers to steal iMessage history. The bug allows apps to access sms.db and send it to a remote server. Steps to exploit this bug include: 1. Install a malicious app on the target device. 2. The malicious app will exploit the 0day bug and gain access to sms.db. 3. The malicious app will then send sms.db to a remote server. 4. The attacker can then access the sms.db file and view the iMessage history.

Outrun lets you execute local commands using the processing power of another Linux machine. The commands don't need to be installed on the other machine, and local files and paths can be used. Using Outrun is easy. You simply enter the command you want to run on the remote machine, followed by the ssh connection details for the remote machine. Outrun will then execute the command on the remote machine and return the results to your local machine. Outrun also allows you to easily transfer files between machines, as well as manage multiple SSH connections.

Facebook has released a report that shows what content was most widely viewed by Americans between April and June. It contains sections showing the top 20 domains, links, pages, and videos that were viewed by users in the United States. The top 20 domains viewed by Americans between April and June are: 1. Facebook 2. YouTube 3. Google 4. Yahoo 5. Amazon 6. Twitter 7. Instagram 8. Microsoft 9. Apple 10. LinkedIn 11. Reddit 12. Pinterest 13. Netflix 14. ESPN 15. Walmart 16. News 17. Tumblr 18. Twitch 19. Adobe 20. AOL

Jack Dorsey, CEO of Twitter and Square, has told Square employees that they will be able to work from home even after the COVID-19 shelter-in-place orders end. Twitter had recently implemented a similar policy. Dorsey said that the new policy will help employees achieve better work-life balance, which is especially important as many people are still dealing with COVID-19's effects. He also noted that the company is committed to supporting employees in whatever way it can during these challenging times.

Stories of data loss can be embarrassing, but they help people learn useful things in case they end up in similar situations. This article tells the story of how a small startup lost a month's worth of customer data due to an unexpected software error. It highlights the importance of having a backup plan in place, as well as the need to regularly test systems and applications. The story also serves as a reminder that it's important to be proactive when it comes to data security, as well as to continuously monitor processes in order to prevent errors from occurring in the first place. Ultimately, this story provides an important lesson for businesses of all sizes: always have a plan in place to protect your valuable data.

Apple Glasses could have the ability to transform any surface into a virtual touch interface, according to a patent that the company filed back in 2016. The patent describes using augmented reality (AR) technology to project an interface onto surfaces, and detect touch input. This would allow users to interact with the projected interface in a variety of ways, such as tapping, swiping, and pinching. The patent also suggests that Apple Glasses could be used to project virtual buttons, sliders, and other user interface elements onto surfaces such as walls, tables, and flooring. This would allow users to control a device or application without having to use physical buttons or a touchscreen. The patent also mentions that the glasses could communicate their position to the device, allowing for more precise tracking of user interactions. The ability to turn any surface into a touch interface could have huge implications for both the entertainment and productivity industries. Games could be played on your living room wall, allowing for a much larger play area than what's currently offered by smartphones and tablets. Businesses could also take advantage of this technology, using it to create interactive presentations or training materials. Of course, there are still many technical challenges that need to be overcome before this kind of technology can be put into practice. But if Apple is able to make it work, the implications could be revolutionary.

React Arborist is a fully-featured tree component for React. It provides all the common features expected in a tree, for example, it can open and close folders, efficiently show thousands of nodes, and support a rich set of drag-and-drop events. It is also customizable, allowing you to easily create your own custom tree styles and behaviors. React Arborist is designed to be easy to integrate with existing React applications, and provides a robust API for manipulating and querying data within the tree.

HQ, the makers of HQ Trivia, is closing down its business and laying off its 25 employees. CEO Rus Yusupov sent a note to employees informing them of the company's closure and thanking them for their dedication and hard work. He also offered to provide each employee with a severance package, as well as financial assistance for job search efforts. Yusupov also shared that the company will be offering "additional resources" to help employees transition into new roles.

The resignations of Larry Page and Sergey Brin from their roles as CEO and president of Alphabet marked the end of an era. The pair cited changes to Google's all-hands meetings, which had become increasingly formal and corporate, as one of the reasons for their departure. Page and Brin have been credited with creating some of the world's most innovative products, from Google's search engine to its driverless cars. The pair will remain on Alphabet's board, but their day-to-day roles will now be filled by Sundar Pichai, who has been at Google since 2004. This change in leadership could signal a shift in the company's priorities, as Pichai is likely to focus on expanding Google's core business of online advertising.

Axiom Space has been selected by NASA to build the first commercial habitat module for the International Space Station. The module will be used as a destination for future commercial and international visitors, enabling private companies and governments to conduct research and other activities in space. The module will be designed and built by Axiom Space and its partners under the leadership of NASA's Commercial Low Earth Orbit Development Division. The design and construction process will include extensive consultation with all International Space Station partners. Once completed, the module will be attached to the ISS and become a part of the orbiting laboratory. It will offer capabilities such as pressurized volume for scientific experiments, medical research, and educational programs. Additionally, the module could serve as an inflatable habitat for long-term stays and provide a platform for commercial activities like data collection and manufacturing.

Researchers have created a smart textile that is flexible, breathable, durable, and functions as a display. It can be integrated with a fabric keyboard and power supply. The textile has a flexible display that can be used to show images, videos, and text. It can also be used as an interactive interface for gaming and other applications. The textile is made of a conductive yarn that is woven together with light-emitting diodes (LEDs). This allows the textile to be powered wirelessly and controlled using Bluetooth technology. The LEDs are connected to a controller that can be programmed to create different displays. The fabric keyboard is made of conductive fabric and can be used to input commands and control the display. The power supply is integrated into the textile, allowing it to be powered wirelessly. The smart textile provides a new way to interact with technology while remaining comfortable and lightweight. It can be used in a variety of applications, from interactive advertising and retail displays to entertainment and healthcare. The technology could also be used to create wearable devices such as smart watches, fitness trackers, and medical monitors. The combination of breathable materials and versatile displays makes this technology ideal for any application requiring interactive displays.

Scrollex is a library for building beautiful scroll experiences using minimal code. A library of interactive demos is available. It is built on top of the popular jQuery library. Scrollex allows developers to quickly create stunning scrolling experiences by specifying certain CSS properties that correspond to certain user interactions (e.g., mouse scroll, keyboard events). The library also comes with a few predefined effects that can be used with minimal effort. In addition, Scrollex provides support for custom scripts, allowing developers to make use of more advanced features.

Bitcoin mining uses a huge amount of electricity. A mining setup requires a building, hundreds of high-speed computer servers, a heavy-duty cooling system, and a location that can handle a large amount of power. The computers used for mining require a great deal of electricity to operate, and this electricity usage is often the biggest factor in the cost of mining.

Jeff Bezos will step down as CEO and become the executive chair of the Amazon board in Q3 2021. Andy Jassy will replace Bezos as CEO. Bezos plans to focus on new initiatives such as his space exploration company Blue Origin.

A team of researchers have genetically modified jellyfish so that their neurons light up when activated. This allowed them to watch the animal's neural activity as it behaved naturally. Jellyfish have simple nervous systems, so the researchers were able to observe their neural activity in response to changes in their environment. By observing how jellyfish responded to various stimuli, the researchers were able to learn more about how neurons work and how they can be used to control behavior. The findings could help scientists better understand how brains work and lead to new treatments for neurological disorders.

Airspeeder's electric flying race car has completed its first unpiloted test flights in southern Australia. The Alauda Mk3 is an electric vertical takeoff multicopter (eVTOL). It weighs 130 kilograms and is powered by an electric motor. The test flights, which took place at an airfield near Adelaide, marks the first stage of a project that aims to develop an all-electric air racing series. The goal is to create a zero-emission sport that will be held in cities around the world. Alauda plans to use the Mk3 to conduct a number of tests in order to ensure it meets the necessary safety and performance standards for racing. The company also hopes to host its first race in 2020. The Mk3 is the latest innovation in electric air racing and is set to revolutionize motorsport. It is designed to be fast, reliable and affordable. It uses advanced aerodynamics and lightweight materials to maximize speed, agility and efficiency. The aircraft has a top speed of over 190 kmh and can fly for up to 45 minutes before needing to be recharged. Alauda believes the Mk3 will open up the door for a new generation of pilots to experience the thrill of air racing. With its innovative design and low operating costs, the Mk3 offers a unique opportunity to bring motorsport to the masses.

Boeing announced the first successful test flight of NeXt, its autonomous, short-range taxi. This prototype was unveiled at CES 2019, and has a range of 50 miles. It's 30 feet long, 28 feet wide and has eight propellers. The test flight was conducted near Boeing's research and technology center in Missouri. During the flight, the unmanned vehicle took off, flew a pre-determined route, then landed safely. This successful test marks a major milestone for Boeing in its quest to develop the future of air mobility.

Google announced its goal to make AI more accessible by providing pre-built models and easier to use services, while still giving advanced developers tools to create custom models. The new offerings include Google Cloud AutoML, which enables users to train custom machine learning models without needing advanced coding skills. Additionally, Google has released TensorFlow Lite, an open source toolkit for deploying AI-powered apps on mobile and embedded devices. Google also announced a partnership with Coursera to offer AI courses that teach developers how to create machine learning models. Finally, Google is making its AI expertise more accessible with AI Hub, an online repository of pre-trained models and best practices for using them.

An Israeli startup, Nanox, has developed a new type of X-ray machine that generates 3D images. It emits less radiation and costs a fraction of the price of conventional imaging equipment. The machine is relatively small and can be installed quickly in any medical facility. It also has the capability to transmit images over the internet, allowing for remote diagnosis and consultation. Nanox is currently working with various healthcare providers around the world to install its technology in hospitals, clinics, and other healthcare settings. Nanox plans to make its technology accessible to those who cannot afford expensive imaging systems and ultimately increase the quality of care available to all.

Snap has acquired NextMind, a neurotech startup that created a headband that lets wearers control computer input with their thoughts. It plans to incorporate the technology into future versions of its Spectacles product. The acquisition cost Snap an estimated 100 million. This technology could be used to enable users to control augmented reality (AR) experiences with their minds, allowing them to interact more naturally with digital objects in the real world.

Apple is planning to build its own in-house technology and infrastructure for financial services. Financial services are a rapidly growing part of Apple's overall product strategy. Developing these services will allow Apple to develop and offer financial products directly to consumers. This move is part of Apple's larger strategy of expanding into new areas, such as healthcare and finance, in order to remain competitive in the technology market. The company plans to leverage its existing digital infrastructure, such as Apple Pay and Apple Card, to offer a range of financial services. Apple has already begun partnering with banks and other financial institutions to offer Apple Pay, an online payment system that allows users to make purchases directly from their iPhone or iPad. Additionally, Apple plans to launch its own credit card, called Apple Card, which will be available through Goldman Sachs. The company is also reportedly exploring ways to offer loans and investments. In addition, Apple is looking into offering insurance and wealth management services, as well as providing access to banking services, such as checking and savings accounts. Ultimately, Apple's foray into financial services will give the company greater control over its product offerings and create an opportunity for it to capture more of the consumer market. This could potentially result in increased profits and market share for Apple, as well as greater customer loyalty.

This article describes a vulnerability within iCloud Sharing and Safari 15 that allowed hackers to gain unauthorized camera access on Macs. It details how the vulnerability was discovered and how it works. It then explains the implications of the vulnerability and how Apple has responded. Finally, it provides steps users can take to protect their Macs from this vulnerability.

Apple's HomePod mini smart speaker has a secret temperature and humidity sensor in its casing. It isn't currently usable by owners of the device yet, but Apple has previously included sensors like this in other products, such as the HomePod and Apple TV. It is likely that Apple will eventually enable a feature allowing owners to view the temperature and humidity readings from their HomePod mini in a future software update.

Researchers have discovered a new Linux backdoor called Symbiote that uses novel evasion techniques to conceal its presence. It is able to scrub any sign of infection from the file system, memory and network traffic, making it difficult to detect. Symbiote is a sophisticated Linux backdoor capable of evading most security measures. It is programmed to hide its presence on the system by scrubbing any evidence of infection from the file system, memory, and network traffic. The malware also has the ability to download additional payloads in order to expand its capabilities. Symbiote is relatively new and therefore few tools exist to detect and remove it. However, researchers recommend using endpoint security solutions such as antivirus software, firewalls, and intrusion detection systems to monitor for suspicious activities or malicious files that may indicate the presence of Symbiote on your system. Additionally, users should update their systems regularly and practice good security hygiene in order to protect against Symbiote and other malicious threats.

A college student who stole 5 million in cryptocurrencies using SIM swap attacks (hacking the user's phone and using that to gain access to their email and cryptocurrency wallets) has committed a serious crime. Depending on the jurisdiction, this could be considered theft or fraud. In many places, this would be considered a felony offense, meaning the student could face jail time and hefty fines, depending on the amount taken and the severity of the attack. Additionally, the student may need to pay restitution for the stolen funds.

Xiaomi has partnered with Lamborghini to produce the Ninebot GoKart Pro Lamborghini Edition, an electric go-kart built purely for the track. It is similar to an early Segway Ninebot design , but with a much sleeker and more stylish design. The Ninebot GoKart Pro Lamborghini Edition is equipped with a powerful motor, a lightweight frame, and a unique suspension system. It also features two driving modes, allowing users to switch between a sportier and more aggressive driving experience or a more comfortable cruising mode. The go-kart has a top speed of 24 mph, making it suitable for adults and children alike. In addition, the Ninebot GoKart Pro Lamborghini Edition also comes with a free racing suit and helmet.

Tech companies are operating shuttle buses that go all the way to the Central Valley as more and more tech employees move into the area. When tech companies first started operating the shuttle buses, they went to popular locations like Mountain View and Palo Alto. Now, the shuttles are going to places like Merced, Tracy, and Manteca, giving tech employees the opportunity to move out of Silicon Valley while still keeping their jobs at the same company. The shuttles also offer other amenities such as free Wi-Fi, snacks, and comfortable seating.

With the rise of cheap small "Cube Satellites," startups are now taking photos and infrared images of factories, retail parking lots, oil tankers, and more and selling these images to customers. This is a relatively new phenomenon, but it has already had a major impact on the way businesses operate. Companies are now able to monitor their operations in real-time and make adjustments accordingly, rather than relying on outdated or inaccurate data. They can also use these images to assess the competition and plan their strategies accordingly. Additionally, governments are using this technology to better track illegal activity, such as illegal fishing or poaching. Finally, humanitarian organizations are using satellite imagery to better understand the environmental impacts of human activities and to help with disaster relief efforts.

Delta is a syntax-highlighter for git and diff output on the command line. It is compatible with all syntax-highlighting themes available on bat. Delta features language syntax highlighting, within-line insertiondeletion syntax highlighting, and text formatting. It is written in Rust and can be used in any terminal.

Microsoft has updated its Xbox Cloud Gaming app for Android, adding support for the dual-screen Surface Duo. Surface Duo users will see a virtual gamepad on one screen and the gaming experience on the other screen. They can also use an Xbox controller for a more immersive experience. The update also adds support for touch controls, allowing users to play games using their finger or stylus. Additionally, the app now allows users to purchase Xbox Game Pass Ultimate subscriptions directly through the app. Microsoft has also added support for 60 FPS streaming and 5.1 surround sound. Microsoft's Xbox Cloud Gaming service is available on both Android and iOS platforms. The service allows users to stream over 100 Xbox games on their device without needing to download them. It is currently in beta, but it is expected to be widely available soon.

Rome is an experimental JavaScript toolchain designed to replace many existing JavaScript tools. All components are custom and there are no third-party dependencies. It includes a compiler, linter, formatter, bundler, test runner, and more. Rome is designed to be extensible, allowing developers to add custom tools to their workflow.

Falso is a package that can produce fake data in the browser and NodeJS. It features more than 140 functions and it is tree shakeable and fully typed, so unused functions will be removed during bundling. It has built-in support for popular fake data formats such as Faker and Chance and it can generate a wide range of data types ranging from text to numbers, objects, images and more.

One of the most uncomfortable aspects of AI technology is that we do not understand how the algorithms that we end up with work. While we know that the technology is powerful and can be used to solve complex problems, we do not always know what is happening under the hood. This can cause a lot of anxiety and confusion, especially when it comes to decisions that have real-world consequences. To combat this issue, transparency and accountability must be built into the design and development of AI systems. This means that there needs to be a way for people to see how and why the algorithm is making decisions, as well as a way for people to challenge the decision if they feel it is wrong or unfair. Additionally, organizations should create ethical guidelines to ensure that their AI algorithms are designed with fairness and equity in mind.

The American CryptoFed DAO (decentralized autonomous organization) is the first legally recognized DAO in the US. It is based on the EOS protocol instead of Ethereum, the cryptocurrency most commonly associated with DAOs. The CryptoFed DAO is designed to create a decentralized network of cryptocurrency users and serve as a platform for them to engage in self-governance of the blockchain ecosystem. The DAO enables members to securely store, invest, and transact with digital assets, while also helping to promote transparency and trust among the community. It also offers its members a variety of services, such as voting rights and the ability to access liquidity pools, which are not typically available through traditional exchanges. The CryptoFed DAO also provides an innovative way for cryptocurrency users to interact with each other and participate in the blockchain space in an organized and secure manner.

When starting out in a career, it's okay to make bad bets that don't work out. What matters most is getting a body of work started. Joining a company means gaining the opportunity to work on meaningful projects, get hands-on experience in your field, and learn from mentors. It's also a chance to establish strong relationships with co-workers and supervisors who can provide references and feedback for future job opportunities. Furthermore, don't forget to take risks and practice self-reflection. Take advantage of any resources available to you and challenge yourself by setting new goals for yourself. Lastly, make sure to stay open-minded, as you never know what opportunities may arise.

Netflix plans to offer a less expensive tier supported by advertising. Many of its competitors have ad-backed tiers and many advertisers have pushed for the streaming giant to let them in. Netflix's current tiers range in price from 8.99 to 15.99, so a cheaper tier could be appealing to subscribers on a budget. The company has not released details on exactly what the ad-supported tier will look like, but it is expected to include access to some of Netflix's most popular content, including their original programming. It is also likely that the ad-supported tier will have fewer features than the pricier ones, such as no ability to watch content offline or access certain titles.

Rivian's network of Level 3 fast DC chargers will be accessible to nearly every other EV on the road. Rivian's charging network is capable of charging up to 150kW, meaning that it can charge an EV from 0-80 in as little as 30 minutes. Additionally, Rivian will provide access to its network of DC fast chargers to most other EVs on the market. Rivian's chargers will be open and available to all users, so you can use them when traveling or commuting in your electric vehicle. Rivian is also working with public and private partners to expand the reach of their charging network, making it even easier to find and access a convenient charging station.

Netflix's latest experiment, Fast Laughs, is a feed of short-form comedy clips drawn from its catalog of shows. Fast Laughs offers full-screen videos that can be swiped through vertically, with no need to select or search for content. Each clip is auto-curated, with the system selecting clips based on user preferences and viewing history. The feature is currently available on the Android and iOS apps, with an estimated launch date of early 2021 for other devices. Fast Laughs is designed to appeal to a wider audience than just fans of stand-up comedy or sitcoms. The short-form format makes the content more accessible and allows viewers to quickly get their comedy fix. It is also designed to be more engaging by allowing users to watch multiple clips in succession without having to search, select, or wait for loading times. Fast Laughs also offers a sense of discovery, as it serves up new and unexpected content that may be outside of a user's normal viewing range. Overall, Netflix's Fast Laughs experiment looks promising. It offers an easy way to enjoy quick bursts of comedy, and its unique format could be a great way for users to discover new shows and comedians. If successful, this could open up an entirely new genre of content for Netflix and create a whole new way for people to experience comedy.

Amazon will acquire MGM Studios for 8.45 billion. It will be the second-largest acquisition in Amazon's history after its purchase of Whole Foods in 2017. The deal shows how Amazon is looking to expand its presence in the entertainment industry, and gives the company access to some of Hollywood's most iconic films, TV shows, and franchises. MGM has a catalogue of over 4,000 films and 17,000 hours of television programming, including classic films such as The Wizard of Oz and Gone with the Wind, as well as popular franchises such as James Bond and Rocky. The acquisition will give Amazon a way to better compete with streaming services such as Netflix and Disney, as well as traditional media companies such as WarnerMedia and NBCUniversal.

More than 14,000 Etsy workers are striking from 11 to 18 April to protest the company's increase in transaction fees. The workers are asking the company to cancel its fee increase and reverse its decision to stop allowing sellers to use their own payment processing services. They are also asking for better communication from the company and more transparency about the changes it has made. In addition, they are asking for more support for small businesses on the platform. The strike is organized by the Etsy Sellers United group, a coalition of Etsy sellers who have come together to advocate for changes to the platform.

Developer Zukalous spent over one year creating a challenging platform game called 1 Screen Platformer. As it was his first game, he decided to make it short and focused on a single screen. The game consists of only one level that has to be completed within a certain time limit. It features a variety of obstacles and enemies, requiring the player to use their skills to navigate and survive each challenge. The goal is to reach the end of the level before the timer runs out. The player can collect coins along the way to increase their score and obtain extra lives. The game has been praised for its tight controls and challenging gameplay, as well as its unique art style. It has become popular among gamers who enjoy difficult platformers, as it requires strategy and quick reflexes. It also has a retro feel to it, with pixelated graphics and chiptune music.

Karate is a tool that combines API test-automation, mocks, performance-testing, and UI automation into a single framework. It uses BDD syntax and has powerful JSON and XML assertions built-in. Developers can use it to create tests quickly and easily, and it works with many popular development frameworks such as Java, Javascript, Groovy, and Cucumber. Karate also provides a wide range of assertions and matchers that make it easy to create complex tests. It can be used both for end-to-end testing as well as unit testing, making it an effective tool for both developers and testers.

Amazon has placed an order for 1,000 autonomous driving systems from Plus, a startup founded in 2016. Plus is set to go public soon with a valuation of 3.3 billion. The purchase marks Amazon's first major move into the autonomous vehicle market, and will likely have a major impact on the industry. The purchase of 1,000 autonomous driving systems from Plus is a major move by Amazon into the autonomous vehicle market. It reflects the company's confidence in the technology and its potential to revolutionize the transportation sector. The deal also signals Amazon's commitment to investing in innovative technologies, as well as its willingness to take risks in order to stay ahead of the competition. Additionally, the deal could help Plus to gain more attention from investors prior to its public offering. This could lead to an increase in its valuation, making the deal beneficial for both parties.

This repository contains a curated list of resources for practicing Data Science. It includes libraries, tutorials, code snippets, blog posts, talks, and more. Links are followed by a short description of the resources. Libraries - [NumPy] - NumPy is the fundamental package for scientific computing with Python. It contains among other things a powerful N-dimensional array object and useful linear algebra capabilities. - [Pandas] - Pandas is an open source library providing high-performance, easy-to-use data structures and data analysis tools for Python. - [Scikit-Learn] - Scikit-Learn is a machine learning library for Python. It features various classification, regression and clustering algorithms including support vector machines, random forests, gradient boosting, k-means and DBSCAN. Tutorials - [DataCamp] - DataCamp is an online platform offering interactive courses and tutorials in data science and analytics. - [Kaggle Learn] - Kaggle Learn is a set of online courses and tutorials to help people learn data science and machine learning. - [Dataquest] - Dataquest is an online platform offering guided data science tutorials and courses. Code Snippets - [GitHub: Awesome Machine Learning] - A curated list of awesome Machine Learning frameworks, libraries and software. - [GitHub: Awesome Data Science] - A curated list of awesome Data Science resources, libraries and software. Blog Posts - [The Official Google Research Blog] - The official blog of Google Research, featuring research news, updates and insights from the world of AI, machine learning and more. - [Towards Data Science] - A Medium publication sharing concepts, ideas, and codes related to data science, machine learning and artificial intelligence. - [Analytics Vidhya] - An online portal for data science enthusiasts to learn, share and discuss data science related topics. Talks - [TED: The Best Talks on Data Science] - A curated list of TED talks related to data science, machine learning and artificial intelligence. - [Google IO: Data Science Machine Learning] - A playlist of talks from Google IO related to data science and machine learning. - [Data Science Central Webinars] - A series of webinars from Data Science Central covering topics such as data science, machine learning, artificial intelligence and more.

Samsung's Galaxy S21 (799), Galaxy S21 Plus (999), and Galaxy S21 Ultra (1,199) have arrived. The Galaxy S21 features almost the same specs as the S21 Plus, excluding obvious differences like the display size, battery capacity and camera setup. The S21 Ultra comes with a bigger display, a bigger battery and improved camera capabilities. The Samsung Galaxy S21 features a 6.2-inch Dynamic AMOLED display, a 4000 mAh battery, and a triple rear camera setup with 12MP wide, 12MP ultra-wide, and 64MP telephoto lenses. It runs on Android 11 with Samsung's One UI 3.1 on top. It is powered by a Snapdragon 888 processor, 8GB of RAM, and 128GB of storage. The Samsung Galaxy S21 Plus features a 6.7-inch Dynamic AMOLED display, a 4800 mAh battery, and a quad rear camera setup with 12MP wide, 12MP ultra-wide, 64MP telephoto, and 12MP depth sensor lenses. It also runs on Android 11 with Samsung's One UI 3.1 on top and is powered by a Snapdragon 888 processor, 8GB of RAM, and 128GB of storage. Finally, the Samsung Galaxy S21 Ultra features a 6.8-inch Dynamic AMOLED display, a 5000 mAh battery, and a quad rear camera setup with 108MP wide, 12MP ultra-wide, 10MP telephoto, and 10MP depth sensor lenses. It also runs on Android 11 with Samsung's One UI 3.1 on top and is powered by a Snapdragon 888 processor, 12GB of RAM, and up to 512GB of storage.

Over the last two years, researchers have rewritten nearly every major chapter in our galaxy's history due to working with better data. In 2018, the European spacecraft Gaia released a 3D map of our Milky Way, which allowed researchers to measure the exact distances between stars and solar systems. This provided more accurate information about galaxy formation and the arrangement of stars within our own galaxy. In 2019, scientists used this data to show that our Milky Way is actually warped in a "S" shape, rather than the traditional disc shape. This finding was further supported by the observation of two new stellar streams, or clusters of stars, which were formed when smaller galaxies collided and merged with the Milky Way's disk billions of years ago. Additionally, in 2020, researchers used Gaia's data to discover an unexpected link between the large-scale structure of the Milky Way and the motions of stars near its center. This showed that the Milky Way's disk is not just warped, but also rotating faster in some places than in others. This discovery has implications for how our galaxy evolved over time, and could help explain why it looks the way it does today.

Scientists in China have developed an extremely fast charging technology that can charge a lithium-ion battery to up to 60 percent capacity in under six minutes. The technology involves a special coating on the battery electrodes that enables electrons to move quickly and efficiently between them, allowing for rapid charging. The technology has been tested in a lab setting and is expected to be commercialized in the near future.

A hacker claims to have stolen over 500GB of data from Microsoft's private GitHub repositories. The hacker had originally intended to sell the information but has now decided to give it away for free. If this is true, Microsoft should take immediate steps to secure their data and investigate how the hacker was able to access the information. They should also contact the authorities in order to determine if any laws have been broken. Additionally, Microsoft should consider offering a reward for anyone who can provide information regarding the potential hacker's identity.

While CRISPR technology has the potential to help many people, it also has the potential to be used as a dangerous weapon. The technology works by editing genes within living organisms. If used improperly, this technology could be used to create bioweapons that target specific populations or individuals with deadly results. The potential for misuse is concerning and requires careful regulation and oversight to ensure CRISPR is not used for malicious purposes.

Israel's Defense Ministry has created a laser that can intercept rockets and antitank guided missiles. It is based on a precision laser beam that can be focused on long-range targets and detonate them in the air. The laser's beam can travel for several kilometers and is capable of intercepting targets at a speed of up to Mach 5 (five times the speed of sound). The laser has an advanced tracking system that detects incoming threats and accurately directs the laser beam toward them. It also has a fire-control system that allows it to fire multiple shots in quick succession with high accuracy. The laser is capable of operating in all weather conditions and can be used both on land and at sea.

The pandemic has caused hairlines to recede faster than usual through both stress and the aftereffects of Covid-19. dNovo, a biotech startup, claims that it can create new hair using stem cell-based regenerative medicine. The process involves isolating stem cells from a small sample of the patient's own hair follicles, then culturing and re-injecting them into the scalp to stimulate growth. The procedure is still in clinical trials and not available for general use yet, but it could be a promising new solution for those suffering from hair loss due to the pandemic.

A leaked video of the Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 5G handset suggests that the device might be revealed at Samsung's upcoming August 5th Galaxy Unpacked event. The device appears visually similar to the original Galaxy Z Flip, but with an updated camera setup and a 5G modem. The video also hints at an improved processor, though it does not specify which one. Additionally, the video shows off a new 'My Color' feature, which allows users to customize the color of the device. The Galaxy Z Flip 5G is expected to be a more powerful version of the original Galaxy Z Flip. In addition to the 5G modem and upgraded processor, the device is expected to have an improved camera setup, larger battery, and faster charging capabilities. Samsung has previously released 5G versions of its flagship devices, such as the Galaxy S20 series, and the Z Flip 5G could follow suit. If the device is revealed at the August 5th event, we can expect to see further details regarding its pricing, availability, and specs. It will be interesting to see how the Galaxy Z Flip 5G compares to other foldable phones on the market, and whether or not it can help Samsung stay competitive in the foldable space.

Microsoft's DirectStorage API has arrived for Windows. The API allows games to stream tremendous amounts of data from an NVMe solid-state drive to a GPU without needing a CPU to mediate. It's designed to eliminate the need to download or install large files, allowing developers to create faster, smoother gaming experiences. Additionally, it can reduce latency and improve frame rates. DirectStorage is available with Windows 10 version 2004, which was released in May 2020.

Facebook and Instagram experienced intermittent outages during Thanksgiving. The services have since been restored. Instagram acknowledged the issue on Twitter early Thursday morning and Facebook began to restore access to its services later in the day. Facebook has not provided a statement on the cause of the outages.

Deep fakes or videos created using artificial intelligence technology and these videos are increasingly common and easy to make. The US government has taken notice of this technology and its potential risk to national security and public safety. Deep fakes can be used to spread disinformation or manipulate digital footage to discredit a person or organization. They can also be used to create fake news stories or spread false information. The US government has established an interagency working group to monitor the development of deep fakes and develop strategies to combat their use. The group includes representatives from the Department of Homeland Security, the Federal Bureau of Investigation, the Office of the Director of National Intelligence, the Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency, and other agencies. The group is tasked with examining the legal and policy implications of this technology and proposing solutions to protect against its misuse. Additionally, the US government has proposed legislation to criminalize the use of deep fakes for malicious purposes.

While there has been remarkable progress on object detection and re-identification in recent years, little attention has been focused on accomplishing the two tasks in a single network to improve the accuracy and efficiency. In this paper, we propose a unified deep learning network that can simultaneously perform object detection and re-identification in a single framework. The proposed network combines a convolutional neural network and a recurrent neural network to detect and identify objects in images. Our model takes an image as input and produces a set of bounding boxes with associated object identities. The proposed approach is evaluated on two publicly available datasets, Stanford Cars and VOC Pascal 2007, and shows promising results. The proposed model outperforms existing methods for both tasks, demonstrating the effectiveness of our approach.

This thread discusses projects that were developed but never became profitable. While we hear a lot about successful ventures, there is still a lot to learn from completed, yet unsuccessful, projects. Many of these projects fell short due to a lack of proper planning, poor execution, or simply bad timing. However, there are often lessons to be learned from the failure of a project and understanding why it failed can help to inform future endeavors. One example of an unsuccessful project is Google Glass. Google had high hopes for this wearable technology when it was released in 2013, but due to its high cost and privacy-violating features, it failed commercially. The company failed to anticipate user concerns and didn't adequately address them prior to launch. This serves as an important reminder that before launching any product or service, companies must consider customer needs and feedback. Another example of a failed project is Apple's AirPower wireless charging mat. After several years of development, the product was finally cancelled due to technical issues. It is believed that the batteries and coils used were too large and the product was unable to charge multiple devices simultaneously. This serves as a reminder that products must be tested thoroughly before launch and any potential problems must be identified and addressed in order to ensure success. Finally, an example of a failed project is Foursquare. Originally launched as a location-based social networking app, Foursquare failed to take off due to the emergence of more successful apps such as Instagram and Snapchat. This serves as an important reminder that companies must stay ahead of the curve in terms of trends and competition if they wish to remain relevant and competitive in their market. Overall, all of these examples illustrate the importance of careful planning and execution for any project. Understanding the possible pitfalls and being proactive about addressing customer needs is key to ensuring success.

Easily build on-demand and live video with Mux's API and dev-friendly docs. Plus, with built-in analytics, you can track engagement and performance metrics. Learn more. Mux's API and dev-friendly docs make it easy to build on-demand and live video. It also has built-in analytics that you can use to track engagement and performance metrics. With Mux, you can quickly and easily deploy streaming video solutions for your application or website.

This article covers five common types of tech interview questions. They include trivia-type questions, questions asking about technical specifics, questions obfuscated with fuzzy wording, and questions with unspecified behavior or answers. 1. Trivia-Type Questions: These questions test your knowledge of the tech industry, often focusing on topics such as the history of certain technologies, famous personalities in the industry, or commonly used acronyms. Examples of these types of questions include "Who invented the World Wide Web?" or "What does CPU stand for?" 2. Technical Specifics: These questions focus on a specific technology and ask you to explain how it works or why it is used. Examples of these types of questions include "Describe the differences between TCPIP and UDP" or "Explain the purpose of a web server." 3. Fuzzy Wording: These questions are intentionally worded in a vague manner and require you to parse them to determine the exact meaning and answer. Examples of these types of questions include "How would you go about optimizing a database query?" or "What steps would you take to secure a website?" 4. Unspecified Behavior: These questions ask you to describe the behavior of a system without providing any details about it. Examples of these types of questions include "How would you design an authentication system?" or "How would you handle a race condition?" 5. Unspecified Answers: These questions ask you to come up with potential solutions to a problem without providing any guidance. Examples of these types of questions include "What methods could you use to improve user experience on a website?" or "How might you reduce latency in a distributed system?"

This article tells the story of how a startup was almost acquired by Facebook. It details how the company was founded, how it raised its initial investments, its growth, its interactions with Facebook, and the eventual outcome of the deal. The article also provides insight into the startup's founder, his motivations, and the lessons he learned from the experience. It provides an interesting case study into what it takes to make a successful acquisition and how the process can be unpredictable.

A display created by Misapplied Sciences and partially funded by Delta is able to produce multiple displays at different angles, meaning that multiple people viewing the same screen are able to see different images. This is done by using a combination of LCD technology and software-based processing to provide a unique viewing experience for each user. The display can be used in applications such as entertainment, gaming, virtual reality, or medical imaging. It can also be used in educational settings where multiple students can view different parts of an image at the same time. The display is designed to be compatible with existing technologies so that it can be easily integrated into existing systems.

This article discusses tips and tricks for using SSH more effectively. It covers how to add a second factor to your SSH login, use agent forwarding safely, exit from stuck SSH sessions, and use key-based authentication for added security. It also provides helpful advice for troubleshooting issues with SSH connections. Finally, it covers some best practices for managing SSH keys, such as using a password manager to store them securely and regularly changing their passwords.

Eric Schmidt, former Google CEO and former Alphabet executive chairman, has announced his decision to step down as a board member of Alphabet. He will be retained in the company as a technical advisor. Schmidt has been part of Alphabet since its inception in 2015 and was one of the original members of the board. During his time on the board, he helped guide Alphabet through its transformation into a technology giant. Schmidt's contributions to the development of Google have been immense and he will be leaving with the company in a much better place than when he started. He has been an integral part of Google's success, helping to create products and services that are used by billions of people around the world. With Schmidt stepping down, Alphabet will be looking for someone to fill his shoes. While no official announcement has been made yet, it is likely that Alphabet will look for someone with experience in the tech industry and a deep understanding of how technology can be used to drive innovation.

Apple has been criticized for placing its own apps at the top of the App Store search results. While Apple denies the accusations, an analysis of search terms showed that their own products were more likely to appear at the top of the list than other apps. This practice has led some critics to suggest that Apple is unfairly promoting its own products over competitors.

Apple announced updates to iOS, iPadOS, MacOS, TV OS, and WatchOS in the opening keynote for WWDC2020. Public betas will start next month. iOS 14 will introduce new capabilities for users including home screen widgets, a new app library, picture-in-picture mode, and App Clips. iPadOS 14 will include improvements to multitasking, Apple Pencil support, and a new sidebar feature for apps. MacOS Big Sur will bring a redesigned interface, the ability to use Apple silicon, and improved security features. TVOS 14 includes Picture in Picture, multi-user support, and expanded audio options. Finally, WatchOS 7 will add new health and fitness tracking options, a sleep tracking app, and handwashing detection.

Soft Serve is a self-hosted Git server for the command line. It allows users to browse repos with an SSH-accessible TUI. Soft Serve features easy access controls and the ability to create and manage users, groups, and repositories. It is written in Go and can be used on any platform that supports Go.

Matt Dupree recently wrapped up a job search after around 65 days. During that time, Dupree applied for 16 jobs, attended seven interviews, and received two offers. Many companies required Dupree to submit a resume and cover letter, as well as complete online assessments or attend phone screenings. He also participated in several informational interviews and networking events to build his professional connections. Ultimately, Dupree accepted one of the two offers he received.

Research on psychedelic compounds has boomed in the last few years. Many companies are now springing up in the psychedelic sector with the aim of creating new analogs of drugs such as LSD and psilocybin, as well as researching the potential therapeutic benefits of these drugs. There is also a growing body of research into how psychedelics might be used to treat mental health conditions such as depression and anxiety disorders. The potential to develop new treatments for mental health issues has led to intense interest in the sector, with many companies looking to capitalize on the potential of psychedelics. However, further research is needed to understand the long-term effects of taking psychedelic compounds, and to ensure that they are used safely and effectively.

Foxconn CEO Terry Gou has announced that Foxconn will start manufacturing iPhones in India and that the company is currently in talks with the Indian government regarding investment terms. It is also reported that Foxconn plans to open three factories in India, with the first one set to open in the second half of 2019. Foxconn is the world's largest electronics contract manufacturer and has been a major supplier to Apple for years. The move to manufacture iPhones in India is part of Foxconn's plan to diversify its production base and expand into new markets. Manufacturing iPhones in India would help Apple reduce costs by avoiding high import taxes on foreign-made products and help it better serve the growing Indian market. It will also create jobs and spur economic growth in India.

Spaces is a startup with a team that specializes in virtual reality technologies. It was created in 2016 by DreamWorks Animation veterans. Spaces discontinued all of its services last week , citing financial issues. The company had been struggling to gain traction in the market and had recently laid off a number of employees. Spaces was focused on creating virtual reality experiences for consumers, including gaming, entertainment, education, and training applications. It launched several products, including an app that allowed users to explore virtual environments, and an SDK for developers. However, its services were not widely adopted by consumers or businesses. The company also faced competition from other startups in the space, such as Oculus, HTC Vive, and Sony PlayStation VR. With limited resources, Spaces was unable to compete with larger companies that had more funding and marketing budgets. Despite these challenges, Spaces is remembered for its passionate team and its commitment to creating immersive virtual reality experiences. Its legacy will live on as a reminder of the potential of this technology.

GlaxoSmithKline has invested 300 million into Home-DNA-test provider 23andMe. As part of the deal, the pharmaceutical giant will have access to the genetic information of 23andMe's five million customers. 23andMe will use the funds to accelerate its research and drug discovery efforts, as well as expanding its presence in international markets. GlaxoSmithKline will have exclusive access to 23andMe's data for the purpose of developing new drugs and therapeutics. The deal also gives 23andMe a stake in any potential products that are created with their data. In addition, 23andMe will receive royalties from any resulting products.

Earthly is a build automation tool that executes builds in containers, making them self-contained, repeatable, portable, and parallel. It uses the same technology as Docker, but Earthly is designed to be used specifically for build automation. It makes it easy to define and execute builds in a consistent and reproducible manner, while also providing the flexibility to run builds in parallel, on any system or cloud. Earthly allows developers to easily create complex builds that can be shared with anyone who needs them, without worrying about dependencies or environment differences.

Solid is a new decentralized internet designed by Sir Tim Berners-Lee, who is credited with inventing the original internet. As far as I can tell (I am very dumb, so please correct me if I'm wrong), Solid is an open source platform that allows users to create, share, and store their personal data. It also provides a way for developers to build applications on top of the platform. The goal of Solid is to give users more control over how their data is used, shared, and stored. With Solid, users can choose who has access to their data, what type of data they share, and how it is stored. This could provide greater privacy and security for users online.

Waymo has begun to ramp up its operations by offering an early rider program to selected customers. These customers are selected based on ZIP code and are required to sign a non-disclosure agreement. The program offers free rides to these customers in Waymo's self-driving cars to help refine the technology. In addition, Waymo has opened up a public trial of its driverless ride-hailing service in Phoenix, Arizona. Customers can use the Waymo app to hail a self-driving car for their transportation needs.

The FCC has approved Amazon's application for 3,236 low-Earth orbit satellites for its Project Kuiper broadband service. Project Kuiper aims to deliver high-speed, low-latency broadband to areas without good internet access. The FCC has granted Amazon a license to operate the satellites for 15 years, and the service must be operational within six years. The satellites will orbit between 590 and 630 kilometers above Earth's surface. Amazon must also adhere to conditions set by the FCC to protect other operators from interference, including reporting on its progress and coordination with other satellite operators.

A network of radio telescopes in the Netherlands made detailed recordings of a lightning bolt during a summer storm in 2018. The recordings, which were processed only recently, show lightning bolts may be more complex than previously thought. The recordings show that the lightning bolt had multiple branches, which were not seen before. The data also showed that the branches seemed to move in different directions at the same time, suggesting that lightning could be more dynamic than previously believed. The research team believes that this new insight could help scientists better understand how lightning behaves and how it can be predicted and even controlled in the future. This could lead to improved safety measures in areas prone to thunderstorms, such as airports or high-rise buildings. The network of radio telescopes used is part of a larger project called the LOFAR (Low Frequency Array). It consists of thousands of small antennas that are spread across the Netherlands and Germany. By combining the signals from all the antennas, researchers can create detailed images of the sky.

Facebook recently launched a new virtual reality remote work app where users can hold meetings as avatar versions of themselves. Workrooms is an early step by Facebook towards building the next generation of remote work tools. The app is designed to make it easier for people to stay connected with colleagues, customers and partners from a distance.
