Users can join virtual meetings, collaborate on projects, share files, and more. It also features an avatar customization feature, allowing users to create custom avatars that represent themselves. Additionally, Workrooms supports multiple platforms, including Oculus Rift, HTC Vive, Windows Mixed Reality, and Samsung Gear VR.

Crime-tracking app Citizen is launching its own emergency response service for 19.99 per month. Citizen Protect will give users access to Protect Agents through video, audio, or text. The agent's job is to assess the user's safety and provide them with resources such as 911 dispatchers or emergency contacts. The service also includes a panic button that can be used to alert agents if the user feels unsafe. Citizen Protect is an innovative way to keep people safe in emergency situations. It provides a level of protection and peace of mind not available through traditional emergency services. In addition, the subscription-based model may make it more affordable for those who have limited access to traditional emergency response services.

While Google shut down Project Loon earlier this year, some of the technology remained in development. Free Space Optical Communication (FSOC) links can create a 20Gbps broadband link from two points, up to 10km away. This technology is being used by the Loon team to create an internet network that can reach remote locations in a cost-effective way. The team is also working on creating low-cost balloons that can access the stratosphere and provide internet access to rural areas. Additionally, the team has developed beamforming antennas that can direct the signal from the balloons down to the ground. This technology can be used to deliver internet access to people in difficult-to-reach places that would otherwise not have access to the internet.

Nvidia's Perlmutter supercomputer is the fastest in the world for AI workloads. Its first task will be to build a 3D map of the universe. The map will help scientists understand the structure and evolution of the universe over time. The Perlmutter supercomputer is powered by Nvidia's DGX A100 AI system, which uses thousands of Nvidia GPUs to process data quickly and accurately. It can perform up to 10 times faster than traditional CPUs, allowing it to make complex calculations in just a fraction of the time. The Perlmutter supercomputer will be used for a variety of applications, including simulating physical phenomena, analyzing astronomical data, and developing artificial intelligence models. It will be used to support research in cosmology, astrophysics, and particle physics. Scientists will use it to develop new theories about the universe and test them against existing ones. They will also use it to create simulations that help them better understand how galaxies form, evolve, and interact with each other.

Facebook Gaming is launching on Android today. It is Facebook's attempt to take on the streaming community. The app will be available on iOS once it is approved on the App Store. Facebook Gaming is a streaming platform that allows people to stream their games, watch other players' streams, and join gaming groups. It will also feature interactive features like chat, tournaments, and live-streaming tools. This app is free to use and will offer gamers access to exclusive content from top creators and publishers. Facebook Gaming will allow gamers to monetize their streams with in-app purchases and virtual goods.

Oracle is buying electronic healthcare records company Cerner in a deal valued at 28.3 billion. It is the biggest deal in Oracle's long history of acquiring companies. The deal allows Oracle to expand its healthcare technology offerings, as the company has been looking to move into the healthcare sector. The acquisition provides Oracle with access to Cerner's large customer base and will allow Oracle to provide a comprehensive suite of healthcare IT solutions, including cloud-based services. Oracle expects the acquisition to help it capture a larger portion of the healthcare IT market, which is expected to reach 50 billion in 2022. Oracle plans to leverage Cerner's existing healthcare expertise and technology to develop new products and services, including predictive analytics, artificial intelligence (AI), and blockchain technologies. Oracle also plans to use Cerner's platform to integrate its existing healthcare applications and databases, allowing for better data sharing between providers and patients.

Blue Origin launched the fourteenth test flight of its New Shepard rocket booster and capsule on January 14. There were no passengers on board, but the capsule can carry up to six people in the future. The mission included tests of the capsule's automated landing system, as well as additional tests of its flight computers and avionics systems. After an approximately 10-minute flight, the booster successfully landed at Blue Origin's west Texas launch site while the capsule touched down with a parachute. This was the first time that the New Shepard rocket booster has flown four consecutive missions. The reusable rocket booster is powered by a single BE-3 liquid oxygen and liquid hydrogen engine, which produces 110,000 pounds of thrust. The capsule is equipped with large windows for passengers to take in the view of space. Following the completion of the test flight, Blue Origin plans to begin flights with human passengers sometime this year.

South Korea will soon see a drop in their military personnel due to a decline in birth rate and recent laws that make it easier to avoid mandatory national service. The South Korean military has already started to downsize their forces, with the army reducing its personnel by 35,000 over the past three years. This trend is expected to continue as more people opt out of military service and fewer generations are of age to serve. The government has also been investing in non-traditional security measures such as cyber defense and civilian-based emergency response networks, which will help reduce the need for a large, standing military force.

A team of researchers has found a new mineral about 900 kilometers below the Earth's surface. Davemaoite is made of calcium, silicon, and oxygen. Its existence has been long hypothesized, but this is the first time it has been confirmed. The researchers were able to confirm its existence by studying seismic waves in Earth's mantle. Davemaoite is believed to be the most abundant mineral in the Earth's mantle, and it could be a major contributor to the planet's chemical makeup. The discovery of Davemaoite could help scientists better understand the composition of Earth's interior. It could also provide insight into how the planet formed and evolved over time. Additionally, the presence of this mineral could have implications for the study of other planets and their formation processes.

A new book from a long-time Android engineer offers a behind-the-scenes look at early Android development. This article features two chapters from the book that covers the startup's search for an appropriate programming language and the adoption of Java as the official language for Android. The book also offers readers insight into the challenges faced by the Android team during its development process, as well as some of the successes it achieved. It also provides a comprehensive overview of the Android platform, from its inception to today's widespread use.

LineClipper is a Chrome Extension that optimizes a developer's flow between the browser and the IDE when executing file retrieval. It copies files paths with their respective line numbers to the clipboard. The extension is currently in development and can be found on Chrome Web Store. It is available for free and works with popular code editors such as Visual Studio Code, Sublime Text and Atom. The extension allows developers to quickly select a file path and its line number from the browser and paste it into the IDE. This saves time and ensures accuracy when navigating between the browser and the IDE while debugging or developing.

TikTok is testing a dedicated Shop feed that lets users browse and purchase products. The tab will serve as a hub for products sold in TikTok Shop. TikTok Shop is an in-app shopping feature that allows users to browse and purchase products from their favorite influencers, brands, and creators. The feature was launched in March 2021 and has since seen a surge in popularity as more creators and brands have started using it to promote their products. With the addition of the Shop feed, TikTok is hoping to make it easier for users to discover new products and shop directly within the app.

GitHub Actions is an API for cause and effect on GitHub. Developers can orchestrate any workflow, based on any event, and GitHub will manage the execution and provide rich feedback . GitHub Actions allows developers to create custom software development life cycle (SDLC) workflows directly in their GitHub repository. These workflows are triggered by specific events, such as code commits, pull requests, and releases. Each workflow can contain multiple steps that can be used to build, test, package, release, or deploy code. GitHub Actions makes it easy for developers to automate common tasks, such as running tests, linting code, and deploying applications. By automating these tasks, developers can save time and reduce errors. Additionally, GitHub Actions allows teams to collaborate better by setting up automated reviews and enforcing coding standards.

A good friend of mine recently started an ecommerce business called Drunk Shrub, it sells shrub, a tangy syrup that you can mix with alcoholic beverages or carbonated water to make drinks. They have a wide variety of flavors and their website is easy to use, with detailed descriptions of each product. They also offer free shipping on orders over 50 and a rewards program for customers who sign up. My friend has done an amazing job in setting up the business, from finding suppliers to creating marketing materials and hiring a fulfillment center. I'm confident that Drunk Shrub will be successful, and I'm excited to see where it goes in the future.

A technically advanced indoor vertical farm is growing a range of crops inside the basement of a former sugar factor in Liverpool. Farm Urban was founded in 2014, growing salads , herbs and other leafy greens with the use of LED lighting and hydroponic systems. The farm is designed to reduce food miles and provide year-round production in any weather conditions. Crops are grown in a stacked system, making it more efficient than traditional farming methods. Nutrient-rich water is recirculated throughout the system, reducing water wastage and increasing sustainability. The company also uses data from sensors to monitor crop growth, allowing for timely harvesting and minimal food waste. In addition, Farm Urban works with local restaurants, schools and charities to provide fresh produce to their customers.

Insulin is essential for a diabetic, and it can be expensive, especially for those without good insurance. A growing movement of biohackers is trying to build a distributed system of insulin production, where individuals can make their own insulin at home in a safe and cost-efficient manner. They are developing methods to use yeast and bacteria to produce insulin from sugar, as well as ways to purify the insulin for safe use. This could potentially reduce the cost of insulin and make it more accessible to those who need it.
